[She]89-elinor knew [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister ’s temper . Opposition on so tender a subject would only attach [her]89-elinor the more to [her]89-elinor own opinion . But by an appeal to [her]89-elinor affection for [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother , by representing the inconveniences which [that indulgent mother]830-that indulgent mother must draw on [herself]830-that indulgent mother , if ( as would probably be the case ) [she]830-that indulgent mother consented to this increase of establishment , [Marianne]90-marianne was shortly subdued ; and [she]90-marianne promised not to tempt [[her]90-marianne mother]332-her mother to such imprudent kindness by mentioning the offer , and to tell [Willoughby]107-willoughby when [she]90-marianne saw [him]107-willoughby next , that it must be declined . [She]90-marianne was faithful to [her]90-marianne word ; and when [Willoughby]107-willoughby called at [the cottage]507-the cottage , the same day , [Elinor]89-elinor heard [her]90-marianne express [her]90-marianne disappointment to [him]107-willoughby in a low voice , on being obliged to forego the acceptance of [his]107-willoughby present . The reasons for this alteration were at the same time related , and they were such as to make further entreaty on [his]107-willoughby side impossible . [His]107-willoughby concern however was very apparent ; and after expressing it with earnestness , [he]107-willoughby added , in the same low voice,—“But , [Marianne]90-marianne , the horse is still [yours]90-marianne , though [you]90-marianne can not use it now . [I]107-willoughby shall keep it only till [you]90-marianne can claim it . When [you]90-marianne leave [Barton]8-barton to form [[your]90-marianne own establishment]2964-your own establishment in [a more lasting home]2965-a more lasting home , [Queen Mab]112-queen mab shall receive [you]90-marianne . ”[107-willoughby] This was all overheard by [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood ; and in the whole of the sentence , in [his]107-willoughby manner of pronouncing it , and in [his]107-willoughby addressing [[her]84-miss dashwood sister]336-her sister by [her]336-her sister Christian name alone , [she]84-miss dashwood instantly saw an intimacy so decided , a meaning so direct , as marked a perfect agreement between [them]834-they . From that moment [she]84-miss dashwood doubted not of [their]834-they being engaged to [each other]338-each other ; and the belief of it created no other surprise than that [she]84-miss dashwood , or any of [[their]834-they friends]836-their friends , should be left by tempers so frank , to discover it by accident . [Margaret]91-margaret related something to [her]91-margaret the next day , which placed this matter in a still clearer light . [Willoughby]107-willoughby had spent the preceding evening with [them]834-they , and [Margaret]91-margaret , by being left some time in [the parlour]726-the parlour with only [him]107-willoughby and [Marianne]90-marianne , had had opportunity for observations , which , with a most important face , [she]91-margaret communicated to [[her]91-margaret eldest sister]838-her eldest sister , when [they]834-they were next by [themselves]834-they . “ Oh , [Elinor]89-elinor ! ”[84-miss dashwood] [she]84-miss dashwood cried , “ [I]84-miss dashwood have such a secret to tell [you]89-elinor about [Marianne]90-marianne . [I]84-miss dashwood am sure [she]90-marianne will be married to [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby very soon . ”[84-miss dashwood] “ [You]89-elinor have said so , ”[89-elinor] replied [Elinor]89-elinor , “ almost every day since [they]834-they first met on [High - church Down]2966-high - church down ; and [they]834-they had not known [each other]338-each other a week , [I]89-elinor believe , before [you]89-elinor were certain that [Marianne]90-marianne wore [his]107-willoughby picture round [her]90-marianne neck ; but it turned out to be only the miniature of [[our]834-they great uncle]2968-our great uncle . ”[89-elinor] “ But indeed this is quite another thing . [I]84-miss dashwood am sure [they]834-they will be married very soon , for [he]107-willoughby has got a lock of [her]90-marianne hair . ”[84-miss dashwood] “ Take care , [Margaret]91-margaret . It may be only the hair of [some great uncle of _ [his]107-willoughby _]2969-some great uncle of _ his _ . ”[84-miss dashwood] “ But , indeed , [Elinor]89-elinor , it is [Marianne]90-marianne ’s . [I]84-miss dashwood am almost sure it is , for [I]84-miss dashwood saw [him]107-willoughby cut it off . Last night after tea , when [you]89-elinor and [mama]2826-mama went out of [the room]2842-the room , [they]834-they were whispering and talking together as fast as could be , and [he]107-willoughby seemed to be begging something of [her]90-marianne , and presently [he]107-willoughby took up [her]90-marianne scissors and cut off a long lock of [her]90-marianne hair , for it was all tumbled down [her]90-marianne back ; and [he]107-willoughby kissed it , and folded it up in a piece of white paper ; and put it into [his]107-willoughby pocket - book . ”[84-miss dashwood] For such particulars , stated on such authority , [Elinor]89-elinor could not withhold [her]89-elinor credit ; nor was [she]89-elinor disposed to it , for the circumstance was in perfect unison with what [she]89-elinor had heard and seen [herself]89-elinor . [Margaret]91-margaret ’s sagacity was not always displayed in a way so satisfactory to [[her]91-margaret sister]336-her sister . When [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings attacked [her]91-margaret one evening at [the park]566-the park , to give the name of [the young man who was [Elinor]89-elinor ’s particular favourite , which had been long a matter of great curiosity to [her]91-margaret]841-the young man who was elinor ’s particular favourite , which had been long a matter of great curiosity to her , [Margaret]91-margaret answered by looking at [[her]91-margaret sister]336-her sister , and saying , “ [I]91-margaret must not tell , may [I]91-margaret , [Elinor]89-elinor ? ”[91-margaret] This of course made [every body]581-every body laugh ; and [Elinor]89-elinor tried to laugh too . But the effort was painful . [She]91-margaret was convinced that [Margaret]91-margaret had fixed on [a person whose name [she]91-margaret could not bear with composure to become a standing joke with [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings]844-a person whose name she could not bear with composure to become a standing joke with mrs. jennings . [Marianne]90-marianne felt for [her]91-margaret most sincerely ; but [she]90-marianne did more harm than good to the cause , by turning very red and saying in an angry manner to [Margaret]91-margaret , “ Remember that whatever [your]91-margaret conjectures may be , [you]91-margaret have no right to repeat them . ”[90-marianne] “ [I]91-margaret never had any conjectures about it , ”[91-margaret] replied [Margaret]91-margaret ; “ it was [you]91-margaret who told [me]91-margaret of it [yourself]91-margaret . ”[91-margaret] This increased the mirth of [the company]845-the company , and [Margaret]91-margaret was eagerly pressed to say something more . “ Oh ! pray , [Miss Margaret]91-margaret , let [us]2972-us know all about it , ”[103-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings . “ What is [the gentleman]722-the gentleman ’s name ? ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ [I]91-margaret must not tell , [ma’am]2974-ma’am . But [I]91-margaret know very well what it is ; and [I]91-margaret know where [he]722-the gentleman is too . ”[91-margaret] “ Yes , yes , [we]2972-us can guess where [he]722-the gentleman is ; at [[his]722-the gentleman own house]561-his own house at [Norland]3-norland to be sure . [He]722-the gentleman is [the curate of [the parish]2977-the parish]2976-the curate of the parish [I]103-mrs. jennings dare say . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ No , _ that _ [he]722-the gentleman is not . [He]722-the gentleman is of no profession at all . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ [Margaret]91-margaret , ”[90-marianne] said [Marianne]90-marianne with great warmth , “ [you]91-margaret know that all this is an invention of [your]91-margaret own , and that there is [no such person in existence]2978-no such person in existence . ”[90-marianne] “ Well , then , [he]722-the gentleman is lately dead , [Marianne]90-marianne , for [I]103-mrs. jennings am sure there was [such a man]2979-such a man once , and [his]722-the gentleman name begins with an F. ”[103-mrs. jennings] Most grateful did [Elinor]89-elinor feel to [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton for observing , at this moment , “ that it rained very hard , ”[89-elinor] though [she]89-elinor believed the interruption to proceed less from any attention to [her]100-lady middleton , than from [[her]89-elinor ladyship]567-her ladyship ’s great dislike of [all such inelegant subjects of raillery]847-all such inelegant subjects of raillery as delighted [[her]89-elinor husband]319-her husband and [mother]2803-mother . The idea however started by [her]89-elinor , was immediately pursued by [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon , who was on every occasion mindful of the feelings of [others]2961-others ; and much was said on the subject of rain by [both of [them]851-both of them]851-both of them . [Willoughby]107-willoughby opened the piano - forte , and asked [Marianne]90-marianne to sit down to it ; and thus amidst the various endeavours of [different people]852-different people to quit the topic , it fell to the ground . But not so easily did [Elinor]89-elinor recover from the alarm into which it had thrown [her]89-elinor . [A party]853-a party was formed this evening for going on the following day to see [a very fine place about twelve miles from [Barton]8-barton]854-a very fine place about twelve miles from barton , belonging to [a brother - in - law of [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon]855-a brother - in - law of colonel brandon , without whose interest it could not be seen , as [the proprietor]856-the proprietor , who was then abroad , had left strict orders on that head . [The grounds]857-the grounds were declared to be highly beautiful , and [Sir John]99-sir john , who was particularly warm in [their]851-both of them praise , might be allowed to be [a tolerable judge]858-a tolerable judge , for [he]99-sir john had formed parties to visit [them]857-the grounds , at least , twice every summer for the last ten years . [They]857-the grounds contained a noble piece of water ; a sail on which was to form a great part of the morning ’s amusement ; cold provisions were to be taken , open carriages only to be employed , and every thing conducted in the usual style of a complete party of pleasure . To [some few of [the company]845-the company]859-some few of the company it appeared rather a bold undertaking , considering the time of year , and that it had rained every day for the last fortnight;—and [Mrs. Dashwood , who had already a cold]88-mrs. dashwood , was persuaded by [Elinor]89-elinor to stay at [home]565-home . [CHAPTER XIII]113-chapter xiii . [Their]851-both of them intended excursion to [Whitwell]18-whitwell turned out very different from what [Elinor]89-elinor had expected . [She]89-elinor was prepared to be wet through , fatigued , and frightened ; but the event was still more unfortunate , for [they]851-both of them did not go at all . By ten o’clock [the whole party]862-the whole party was assembled at [the park]566-the park , where [they]851-both of them were to breakfast . The morning was rather favourable , though it had rained all night , as the clouds were then dispersing across the sky , and the sun frequently appeared . [They]851-both of them were all in high spirits and good humour , eager to be happy , and determined to submit to the greatest inconveniences and hardships rather than be otherwise . While [they]851-both of them were at breakfast the letters were brought in . Among [the rest]864-the rest there was one for [Colonel Brandon;—he]114-colonel brandon;—he took it , looked at the direction , changed colour , and immediately left [the room]2842-the room . “ What is the matter with [Brandon]104-colonel brandon ? ”[99-sir john] said [Sir John]99-sir john . [Nobody]2922-nobody could tell . “ [I]100-lady middleton hope [he]104-colonel brandon has had no bad news , ”[100-lady middleton] said [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton . “ It must be something extraordinary that could make [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon leave [my]100-lady middleton breakfast table so suddenly . ”[100-lady middleton] In about five minutes [he]114-colonel brandon;—he returned . “ No bad news , [Colonel]2980-colonel , [I]103-mrs. jennings hope ; ”[103-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , as soon as [he]114-colonel brandon;—he entered [the room]2842-the room . “ None at all , [ma’am]2974-ma’am , [I]103-mrs. jennings thank [you]114-colonel brandon;—he . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ Was it from [Avignon]19-avignon ? It came from [town]2984-town , and is merely a letter of business . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ But how came the hand to discompose [you]114-colonel brandon;—he so much , if it was only a letter of business ? Come , come , this wo n’t do , [Colonel]2980-colonel ; so let [us]2986-us hear the truth of it . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ [[My]100-lady middleton dear madam]2987-my dear madam , ”[100-lady middleton] said [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton , “ recollect what [you]114-colonel brandon;—he are saying . ”[100-lady middleton] “ Perhaps it is to tell [you]114-colonel brandon;—he that [[your]114-colonel brandon;—he cousin]2988-your cousin [Fanny]93-fanny is married ? ”[103-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , without attending to [[her]103-mrs. jennings daughter]404-her daughter ’s reproof . “ No , indeed , it is not . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ Well , then , [I]100-lady middleton know who it is from , [Colonel]104-colonel brandon . And [I]100-lady middleton hope [she]93-fanny is well . ”[100-lady middleton] “ Whom do [you]100-lady middleton mean , [ma’am]2974-ma’am ? ”[869-you] said [he]869-you , colouring a little . “ Oh ! [you]100-lady middleton know who [I]869-you mean . ”[869-you] “ [I]869-you am particularly sorry , [ma’am]2974-ma’am , ”[869-you] said [he]869-you , addressing [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton , “ that [I]869-you should receive this letter today , for it is on business which requires [my]869-you immediate attendance in [town]2984-town . ”[869-you] “ In [town]2984-town ! ”[103-mrs. jennings] cried [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings . “ What can [you]869-you have to do in [town]2984-town at this time of year ? ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ [My]869-you own loss is great , ”[869-you] [he]869-you continued , “ in being obliged to leave so agreeable a party ; but [I]869-you am the more concerned , as [I]869-you fear [my]869-you presence is necessary to gain [your]2974-ma’am admittance at [Whitwell]18-whitwell . ”[869-you] What a blow upon [them]870-we all was this ! “ But if [you]869-you write a note to [the housekeeper]2994-the housekeeper , [Mr. Brandon]115-mr. brandon , ”[90-marianne] said [Marianne]90-marianne , eagerly , “ will it not be sufficient ? ”[90-marianne] [He]869-you shook [his]869-you head . “ [We]870-we must go , ”[116-sir john.—“it] said [Sir John.—“It]116-sir john.—“it shall not be put off when [we]870-we are so near [it]18-whitwell . [He]104-colonel brandon was afraid of catching cold [I]107-willoughby dare say , and invented this trick for getting out of it . [I]107-willoughby would lay fifty guineas the letter was of [his]104-colonel brandon own writing . ”[107-willoughby] “ [I]90-marianne have no doubt of it , ”[90-marianne] replied [Marianne]90-marianne . “ There is no persuading [you]104-colonel brandon to change [your]104-colonel brandon mind , [Brandon]104-colonel brandon , [I]99-sir john know of old , ”[99-sir john] said [Sir John]99-sir john , “ when once [you]104-colonel brandon are determined on anything . Consider , here are the two [Miss Careys]117-the careys come over from [Newton]20-newton , the three [Miss Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods walked up from [the cottage]507-the cottage , and [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby got up two hours before [his]107-willoughby usual time , on purpose to go to [Whitwell]18-whitwell . ”[99-sir john] [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon again repeated [his]104-colonel brandon sorrow at being the cause of disappointing [the party]577-the party ; but at the same time declared it to be unavoidable . “ Well , then , when will [you]104-colonel brandon come back again ? ”[104-colonel brandon] “ [I]567-her ladyship hope [we]2999-we shall see [you]104-colonel brandon at [Barton]8-barton , ”[567-her ladyship] added [[her]872-her ladyship]567-her ladyship , “ as soon as [you]104-colonel brandon can conveniently leave [town]2984-town ; and [we]2999-we must put off the party to [Whitwell]18-whitwell till [you]104-colonel brandon return . ”[567-her ladyship] “ [You]104-colonel brandon are very obliging . But it is so uncertain , when [I]104-colonel brandon may have it in [my]104-colonel brandon power to return , that [I]104-colonel brandon dare not engage for it at all . ”[104-colonel brandon] “ Oh ! [he]104-colonel brandon must and shall come back , ”[99-sir john] cried [Sir John]99-sir john . “ If [he]104-colonel brandon is not [here]2861-here by the end of the week , [I]99-sir john shall go after [him]104-colonel brandon . ”[99-sir john] “ Ay , so do , [Sir John]99-sir john , ”[103-mrs. jennings] cried [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , “ and then perhaps [you]99-sir john may find out what [his]104-colonel brandon business is . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ [I]104-colonel brandon do not want to pry into [other men]3002-other men ’s concerns . [I]104-colonel brandon suppose it is something [he]104-colonel brandon is ashamed of . ”[104-colonel brandon] [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon ’s horses were announced . “ [You]99-sir john do not go to [town]2984-town on horseback , do [you]99-sir john ? ”[99-sir john] added [Sir John]99-sir john . “ No . Only to [Honiton]21-honiton . [I]99-sir john shall then go post . ”[99-sir john] “ Well , as [you]99-sir john are resolved to go , [I]103-mrs. jennings wish [you]99-sir john a good journey . But [you]99-sir john had better change [your]99-sir john mind . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ [I]104-colonel brandon assure [you]99-sir john it is not in [my]104-colonel brandon power . ”[104-colonel brandon] [He]104-colonel brandon then took leave of [the whole party]862-the whole party . “ Is there no chance of [my]104-colonel brandon seeing [you]99-sir john and [[your]99-sir john sisters]2753-your sisters in [town]2984-town this winter , [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood ? ”[104-colonel brandon] “ [I]103-mrs. jennings am afraid , none at all . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ Then [I]104-colonel brandon must bid [you]99-sir john farewell for a longer time than [I]104-colonel brandon should wish to do . ”[104-colonel brandon] To [Marianne]90-marianne , [he]104-colonel brandon merely bowed and said nothing . “ Come [Colonel]104-colonel brandon , ”[103-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , “ before [you]104-colonel brandon go , do let [us]3006-us know what [you]104-colonel brandon are going about . ”[103-mrs. jennings] [He]104-colonel brandon wished [her]103-mrs. jennings a good morning , and , attended by [Sir John]99-sir john , left [the room]2842-the room . The complaints and lamentations which politeness had hitherto restrained , now burst forth universally ; and [they]876-they all agreed again and again how provoking it was to be so disappointed . “ [I]103-mrs. jennings can guess what [his]104-colonel brandon business is , however , ”[103-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings exultingly . “ Can [you]99-sir john , [ma’am]2974-ma’am ? ”[877-almost every body] said [almost every body]877-almost every body . “ Yes ; it is about [Miss Williams]118-miss williams , [I]877-almost every body am sure . ”[877-almost every body] “ And who is [Miss Williams]118-miss williams ? ”[90-marianne] asked [Marianne]90-marianne . “ What ! do not [you]104-colonel brandon know who [Miss Williams]118-miss williams is ? [I]90-marianne am sure [you]104-colonel brandon must have heard of [her]118-miss williams before . [She]118-miss williams is [a relation of [the Colonel]664-the colonel ’s , [[my]90-marianne dear]2750-my dear]3008-a relation of the colonel ’s , my dear ; [a very near relation]3011-a very near relation . [We]3012-we will not say how near , for fear of shocking [the young ladies]628-the young ladies . ”[90-marianne] Then , lowering [her]90-marianne voice a little , [she]90-marianne said to [Elinor]89-elinor , “ [She]118-miss williams is [[his]664-the colonel natural daughter]3014-his natural daughter . ”[90-marianne] “ Indeed ! ”[90-marianne] “ Oh , yes ; and as like [him]664-the colonel as [she]118-miss williams can stare . [I]90-marianne dare say [the Colonel]664-the colonel will leave [her]118-miss williams all [his]664-the colonel fortune . ”[90-marianne] When [Sir John]99-sir john returned , [he]99-sir john joined most heartily in the general regret on so unfortunate an event ; concluding however by observing , that as [they]878-they were all got together , [they]878-they must do something by way of being happy ; and after some consultation it was agreed , that although happiness could only be enjoyed at [Whitwell]18-whitwell , [they]878-they might procure a tolerable composure of mind by driving about [the country]612-the country . [The carriages]880-the carriages were then ordered ; [Willoughby]107-willoughby ’s was first , and [Marianne]90-marianne never looked happier than when [she]90-marianne got into [it]881-it . [He]99-sir john drove through [the park]566-the park very fast , and [they]878-they were soon out of sight ; and nothing more of [them]878-they was seen till [their]878-they return , which did not happen till after the return of [all the rest]883-all the rest . [They]878-they both seemed delighted with [their]878-they drive ; but said only in general terms that [they]878-they had kept in [the lanes]884-the lanes , while [the others]539-the others went on [the downs]715-the downs . It was settled that there should be a dance in the evening , and that every body should be extremely merry all day long . [Some more of [the Careys]117-the careys]887-some more of the careys came to dinner , and [they]887-some more of the careys had the pleasure of sitting down nearly twenty to table , which [Sir John]99-sir john observed with great contentment . [Willoughby]107-willoughby took [his]107-willoughby usual place between [the two elder [Miss Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods]888-the two elder miss dashwoods . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings sat on [Elinor]89-elinor ’s right hand ; and [they]878-they had not been long seated , before [she]103-mrs. jennings leant behind [her]103-mrs. jennings and [Willoughby]107-willoughby , and said to [Marianne]90-marianne , loud enough for [them]878-they both to hear , “ [I]90-marianne have found [you]90-marianne out in spite of all [your]90-marianne tricks . [I]90-marianne know where [you]90-marianne spent the morning . ”[90-marianne] [Marianne]90-marianne coloured , and replied very hastily , “ Where , pray ? ”[90-marianne] “ Did not [you]90-marianne know , ”[107-willoughby] said [Willoughby]107-willoughby , “ that [we]878-they had been out in [[my]107-willoughby curricle]3016-my curricle ? ”[107-willoughby] “ Yes , yes , [Mr. Impudence]119-mr. impudence , [I]90-marianne know that very well , and [I]90-marianne was determined to find out _ where _ [you]90-marianne had been to . [I]90-marianne hope [you]90-marianne like [[your]90-marianne house]3017-your house , [Miss Marianne]90-marianne . [It]3017-your house is a very large one , [I]90-marianne know ; and when [I]90-marianne come to see [you]90-marianne , [I]90-marianne hope [you]90-marianne will have new - furnished [it]3017-your house , for [it]3017-your house wanted [it]3017-your house very much when [I]90-marianne was [there]354-there six years ago . ”[90-marianne] [Marianne]90-marianne turned away in great confusion . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings laughed heartily ; and [Elinor]89-elinor found that in [her]89-elinor resolution to know where [they]889-they had been , [she]89-elinor had actually made [[her]89-elinor own woman]890-her own woman enquire of [[Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby ’s groom]891-mr. willoughby ’s groom ; and that [she]89-elinor had by that method been informed that [they]889-they had gone to [Allenham]12-allenham , and spent a considerable time there in walking about [the garden]532-the garden and going all over [the house]318-the house . [Elinor]89-elinor could hardly believe this to be true , as it seemed very unlikely that [Willoughby]107-willoughby should propose , or [Marianne]90-marianne consent , to enter [the house]318-the house while [Mrs. Smith]120-mrs. smith was in [it]318-the house , with whom [Marianne]90-marianne had not the smallest acquaintance . As soon as [they]889-they left [the dining - room]895-the dining - room , [Elinor]89-elinor enquired of [her]90-marianne about it ; and great was [her]89-elinor surprise when [she]89-elinor found that every circumstance related by [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings was perfectly true . [Marianne]90-marianne was quite angry with [her]89-elinor for doubting it . “ Why should [you]89-elinor imagine , [Elinor]89-elinor , that [we]889-they did not go [there]354-there , or that [we]889-they did not see [the house]318-the house ? Is not it what [you]89-elinor have often wished to do [yourself]89-elinor ? ”[90-marianne] “ Yes , [Marianne]90-marianne , but [I]89-elinor would not go while [Mrs. Smith]120-mrs. smith was [there]354-there , and with [no other companion than [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby]3022-no other companion than mr. willoughby . ”[89-elinor] “ [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby however is [the only person who can have a right]3023-the only person who can have a right to show [that house]3024-that house ; and as [he]107-willoughby went in [an open carriage]3025-an open carriage , it was impossible to have [any other companion]3026-any other companion . [I]90-marianne never spent a pleasanter morning in [my]90-marianne life . ”[90-marianne] “ [I]89-elinor am afraid , ”[89-elinor] replied [Elinor]89-elinor , “ that the pleasantness of an employment does not always evince its propriety . ”[89-elinor] “ On the contrary , nothing can be a stronger proof of it , [Elinor]89-elinor ; for if there had been any real impropriety in what [I]89-elinor did , [I]89-elinor should have been sensible of it at the time , for [we]3027-we always know when [we]3027-we are acting wrong , and with such a conviction [I]89-elinor could have had no pleasure . ”[89-elinor] “ But , [[my]90-marianne dear]2750-my dear [Marianne]90-marianne , as it has already exposed [you]90-marianne to some very impertinent remarks , do [you]90-marianne not now begin to doubt the discretion of [your]90-marianne own conduct ? ”[90-marianne] “ If the impertinent remarks of [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings are to be the proof of impropriety in conduct , [we]3027-we are all offending every moment of [our]3027-we lives . [I]89-elinor value not [her]103-mrs. jennings censure any more than [I]89-elinor should do [her]103-mrs. jennings commendation . [I]89-elinor am not sensible of having done anything wrong in walking over [[Mrs. Smith]120-mrs. smith ’s grounds]3029-mrs. smith ’s grounds , or in seeing [[her]103-mrs. jennings house]2805-her house . [They]2805-her house will one day be [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby ’s , and — ”[89-elinor] “ If [they]2805-her house were one day to be [your]896-you own , [Marianne]90-marianne , [you]896-you would not be justified in what [you]896-you have done . ”[896-you] [She]896-you blushed at this hint ; but it was even visibly gratifying to [her]896-you ; and after a ten minutes ’ interval of earnest thought , [she]896-you came to [[her]896-you sister]336-her sister again , and said with great good humour , “ Perhaps , [Elinor]89-elinor , it _ was _ rather ill - judged in [me]896-you to go to [Allenham]12-allenham ; but [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby wanted particularly to show [me]896-you [the place]464-the place ; and [it]464-the place is [a charming house]3032-a charming house , [I]896-you assure you.—There is [one remarkably pretty sitting room up stairs]3033-one remarkably pretty sitting room up stairs ; of a nice comfortable size for constant use , and with modern furniture [it]464-the place would be delightful . [It]464-the place is [a corner room]3034-a corner room , and has windows on two sides . On one side [you]896-you look across [the bowling - green]3035-the bowling - green , behind [the house]318-the house , to a beautiful hanging wood , and on the other [you]896-you have a view of [the church]3037-the church and [village]3038-village , and , beyond [them]3039-them , of [those fine bold hills that [we]3041-we have so often admired]3040-those fine bold hills that we have so often admired . [I]896-you did not see it to advantage , for nothing could be more forlorn than the furniture,—but if [it]464-the place were newly fitted up — a couple of hundred pounds , [Willoughby]107-willoughby says , would make it [one of the pleasantest summer - rooms in [England]14-england]3042-one of the pleasantest summer - rooms in england . ”[896-you] Could [Elinor]89-elinor have listened to [her]89-elinor without interruption from [the others]539-the others , [she]89-elinor would have described [every room in [the house]318-the house]899-every room in the house with equal delight . CHAPTER XIV . The sudden termination of [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon ’s visit at [the park]566-the park , with [his]104-colonel brandon steadiness in concealing its cause , filled the mind , and raised the wonder of [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings for two or three days ; [she]103-mrs. jennings was [a great wonderer]902-a great wonderer , as [every one]903-every one must be who takes a very lively interest in all the comings and goings of all [their]903-every one acquaintance . [She]103-mrs. jennings wondered , with little intermission what could be the reason of it ; was sure there must be some bad news , and thought over every kind of distress that could have befallen [him]104-colonel brandon , with a fixed determination that [he]104-colonel brandon should not escape [them]903-every one all . “ Something very melancholy must be the matter , [I]103-mrs. jennings am sure , ”[103-mrs. jennings] said [she]103-mrs. jennings . “ [I]103-mrs. jennings could see it in [his]104-colonel brandon face . [Poor man]3043-poor man ! [I]103-mrs. jennings am afraid [his]104-colonel brandon circumstances may be bad . [The estate at [Delaford]22-delaford]3044-the estate at delaford was never reckoned more than two thousand a year , and [[his]104-colonel brandon brother]3045-his brother left everything sadly involved . [I]103-mrs. jennings do think [he]104-colonel brandon must have been sent for about money matters , for what else can it be ? [I]103-mrs. jennings wonder whether it is so . [I]103-mrs. jennings would give anything to know the truth of it . Perhaps it is about [Miss Williams]118-miss williams and , by the bye , [I]103-mrs. jennings dare say it is , because [he]104-colonel brandon looked so conscious when [I]103-mrs. jennings mentioned [her]118-miss williams . May be [she]118-miss williams is ill in [town]2984-town ; nothing in [the world]2778-the world more likely , for [I]103-mrs. jennings have a notion [she]118-miss williams is always rather sickly . [I]103-mrs. jennings would lay any wager it is about [Miss Williams]118-miss williams . It is not so very likely [he]104-colonel brandon should be distressed in [his]104-colonel brandon circumstances _ now _ , for [he]104-colonel brandon is [a very prudent man]3048-a very prudent man , and to be sure must have cleared [the estate]288-the estate by this time . [I]103-mrs. jennings wonder what it can be ! May be [[his]104-colonel brandon sister]251-his sister is worse at [Avignon]19-avignon , and has sent for [him]104-colonel brandon over . [His]104-colonel brandon setting off in such a hurry seems very like it . Well , [I]103-mrs. jennings wish [him]104-colonel brandon out of all [his]104-colonel brandon trouble with all [my]103-mrs. jennings heart , and [a good wife]3051-a good wife into the bargain . ”[103-mrs. jennings] So wondered , so talked [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings . [Her]103-mrs. jennings opinion varying with every fresh conjecture , and all seeming equally probable as they arose . [Elinor]89-elinor , though [she]89-elinor felt really interested in the welfare of [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon , could not bestow all the wonder on [his]104-colonel brandon going so suddenly away , which [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings was desirous of [her]103-mrs. jennings feeling ; for besides that the circumstance did not in [her]103-mrs. jennings opinion justify such lasting amazement or variety of speculation , [her]103-mrs. jennings wonder was otherwise disposed of . It was engrossed by the extraordinary silence of [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister and [Willoughby]107-willoughby on the subject , which [they]905-their must know to be peculiarly interesting to [them]905-their all . As this silence continued , every day made it appear more strange and more incompatible with the disposition of both . Why [they]905-their should not openly acknowledge to [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother and [herself]89-elinor , what [their]905-their constant behaviour to [each other]338-each other declared to have taken place , [Elinor]89-elinor could not imagine . [She]89-elinor could easily conceive that marriage might not be immediately in [their]905-their power ; for though [Willoughby]107-willoughby was independent , there was no reason to believe [him]107-willoughby rich . [[His]107-willoughby estate]908-his estate had been rated by [Sir John]99-sir john at about six or seven hundred a year ; but [he]107-willoughby lived at an expense to which that income could hardly be equal , and [he]107-willoughby had [himself]107-willoughby often complained of [his]107-willoughby poverty . But for this strange kind of secrecy maintained by [them]905-their relative to [their]905-their engagement , which in fact concealed nothing at all , [she]89-elinor could not account ; and it was so wholly contradictory to [their]905-their general opinions and practice , that a doubt sometimes entered [her]89-elinor mind of [their]905-their being really engaged , and this doubt was enough to prevent [her]89-elinor making any inquiry of [Marianne]90-marianne . Nothing could be more expressive of attachment to [them]905-their all , than [Willoughby]107-willoughby ’s behaviour . To [Marianne]90-marianne it had all the distinguishing tenderness which [a lover]2821-a lover ’s heart could give , and to the rest of [the family]303-the family it was the affectionate attention of [a son]911-a son and [a brother]2813-a brother . [The cottage]507-the cottage seemed to be considered and loved by [him]107-willoughby as [[his]107-willoughby home]252-his home ; many more of [his]107-willoughby hours were spent [there]354-there than at [Allenham]12-allenham ; and if no general engagement collected them at [the park]566-the park , the exercise which called [him]107-willoughby out in the morning was almost certain of ending there , where the rest of the day was spent by [himself]107-willoughby at the side of [Marianne]90-marianne , and by [his]107-willoughby favourite pointer at [her]90-marianne feet . One evening in particular , about a week after [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon left [the country]612-the country , [his]107-willoughby heart seemed more than usually open to every feeling of attachment to the objects around [him]107-willoughby ; and on [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood ’s happening to mention [her]88-mrs. dashwood design of improving [the cottage]507-the cottage in the spring , [he]107-willoughby warmly opposed every alteration of [a place which affection had established as perfect with [him]107-willoughby]919-a place which affection had established as perfect with him . “ What ! ”[107-willoughby] [he]107-willoughby exclaimed—“Improve [this dear cottage]3052-this dear cottage ! No . _ That _ [I]107-willoughby will never consent to . Not a stone must be added to [its]3052-this dear cottage walls , not an inch to its size , if [my]107-willoughby feelings are regarded . ”[107-willoughby] “ Do not be alarmed , ”[84-miss dashwood] said [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood , “ nothing of the kind will be done ; for [[my]84-miss dashwood mother]2771-my mother will never have money enough to attempt it . ”[84-miss dashwood] “ [I]107-willoughby am heartily glad of it , ”[107-willoughby] [he]107-willoughby cried . “ May [she]2771-my mother always be poor , if [she]2771-my mother can employ [her]2771-my mother riches no better . ”[107-willoughby] “ Thank [you]107-willoughby , [Willoughby]107-willoughby . But [you]107-willoughby may be assured that [I]107-willoughby would not sacrifice one sentiment of local attachment of [yours]107-willoughby , or of [any one whom [I]107-willoughby loved]3054-any one whom i loved , for all the improvements in [the world]2778-the world . Depend upon it that whatever unemployed sum may remain , when [I]107-willoughby make up [my]107-willoughby accounts in the spring , [I]107-willoughby would even rather lay it uselessly by than dispose of it in a manner so painful to [you]107-willoughby . But are [you]107-willoughby really so attached to [this place]3056-this place as to see no defect in [it]3056-this place ? ”[107-willoughby] “ [I]107-willoughby am , ”[107-willoughby] said [he]107-willoughby . “ To [me]107-willoughby it is faultless . Nay , more , [I]107-willoughby consider it as the only form of building in which happiness is attainable , and were [I]107-willoughby rich enough [I]107-willoughby would instantly pull Combe down , and build [it]3056-this place up again in the exact plan of [this cottage]3057-this cottage . ”[107-willoughby] “ With dark narrow stairs and [a kitchen that smokes]3058-a kitchen that smokes , [I]89-elinor suppose , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor . “ Yes , ”[107-willoughby] cried [he]107-willoughby in the same eager tone , “ with all and every thing belonging to it;—in [no one]317-no one convenience or inconvenience about it , should the least variation be perceptible . Then , and then only , under such a roof , [I]107-willoughby might perhaps be as happy at [Combe]135-combe as [I]107-willoughby have been at [Barton]8-barton . ”[107-willoughby] “ [I]89-elinor flatter [myself]89-elinor , ”[89-elinor] replied [Elinor]89-elinor , “ that even under the disadvantage of [better rooms]3060-better rooms and a broader staircase , [you]89-elinor will hereafter find [[your]89-elinor own house]3061-your own house as faultless as [you]89-elinor now do this . ”[89-elinor] “ There certainly are circumstances , ”[107-willoughby] said [Willoughby]107-willoughby , “ which might greatly endear it to [me]107-willoughby ; but [this place]3056-this place will always have one claim of [my]107-willoughby affection , which [no other]3063-no other can possibly share . ”[107-willoughby] [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood looked with pleasure at [Marianne]90-marianne , whose fine eyes were fixed so expressively on [Willoughby]107-willoughby , as plainly denoted how well [she]90-marianne understood [him]107-willoughby . “ How often did [I]107-willoughby wish , ”[107-willoughby] added [he]107-willoughby , “ when [I]107-willoughby was at [Allenham]12-allenham this time twelvemonth , that [Barton cottage]3064-barton cottage were inhabited ! [I]107-willoughby never passed within view of [it]3064-barton cottage without admiring [its]3064-barton cottage situation , and grieving that [no one]317-no one should live in [it]3064-barton cottage . How little did [I]107-willoughby then think that the very first news [I]107-willoughby should hear from [Mrs. Smith]120-mrs. smith , when [I]107-willoughby next came into [the country]612-the country , would be that [Barton cottage]3064-barton cottage was taken : and [I]107-willoughby felt an immediate satisfaction and interest in the event , which nothing but a kind of prescience of what happiness [I]107-willoughby should experience from it , can account for . Must it not have been so , [Marianne]90-marianne ? ”[107-willoughby] speaking to [her]920-you in a lowered voice . Then continuing [his]107-willoughby former tone , [he]107-willoughby said , “ And yet [this house [you]920-you would spoil]3068-this house you would spoil , [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood ? [You]920-you would rob [it]3068-this house you would spoil of [its]3068-this house you would spoil simplicity by imaginary improvement ! and [this dear parlour in which [our]3070-our acquaintance first began , and in which so many happy hours have been since spent by [us]3070-our together]3069-this dear parlour in which our acquaintance first began , and in which so many happy hours have been since spent by us together , [you]920-you would degrade to the condition of a common entrance , and [every body]581-every body would be eager to pass through [the room which has hitherto contained within [itself]3068-this house you would spoil more real accommodation and comfort than any other apartment of the handsomest dimensions in [the world]2778-the world]3072-the room which has hitherto contained within itself more real accommodation and comfort than any other apartment of the handsomest dimensions in the world could possibly afford . ”[107-willoughby] [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood again assured [him]107-willoughby that no alteration of the kind should be attempted . “ [You]920-you are [a good woman]3074-a good woman , ”[107-willoughby] [he]107-willoughby warmly replied . “ [Your]920-you promise makes [me]107-willoughby easy . Extend it a little farther , and it will make [me]107-willoughby happy . Tell [me]107-willoughby that not only [[your]920-you house]3017-your house will remain the same , but that [I]107-willoughby shall ever find [you]920-you and [yours]920-you as unchanged as [[your]920-you dwelling]3076-your dwelling ; and that [you]920-you will always consider [me]107-willoughby with the kindness which has made everything belonging to [you]920-you so dear to [me]107-willoughby . ”[107-willoughby] The promise was readily given , and [Willoughby]107-willoughby ’s behaviour during the whole of the evening declared at once [his]107-willoughby affection and happiness . “ Shall [we]921-they see [you]107-willoughby tomorrow to dinner ? ”[88-mrs. dashwood] said [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood , when [he]107-willoughby was leaving [them]921-they . “ [I]88-mrs. dashwood do not ask [you]107-willoughby to come in the morning , for [we]921-they must walk to [the park]566-the park , to call on [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton . ”[88-mrs. dashwood] [He]107-willoughby engaged to be with [them]921-they by four o’clock . CHAPTER XV . [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood ’s visit to [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton took place the next day , and [two of [[her]88-mrs. dashwood daughters]294-her daughters]922-two of her daughters went with [her]88-mrs. dashwood ; but [Marianne]90-marianne excused [herself]90-marianne from being of the party , under some trifling pretext of employment ; and [[her]90-marianne mother]332-her mother , who concluded that a promise had been made by [Willoughby]107-willoughby the night before of calling on [her]332-her mother while [they]921-they were absent , was perfectly satisfied with [her]332-her mother remaining at [home]565-home . On [their]921-they return from [the park]566-the park [they]921-they found [[Willoughby]107-willoughby ’s curricle]927-willoughby ’s curricle and [servant]928-servant in waiting at [the cottage]507-the cottage , and [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood was convinced that [her]88-mrs. dashwood conjecture had been just . So far it was all as [she]88-mrs. dashwood had foreseen ; but on entering [the house]318-the house [she]88-mrs. dashwood beheld what no foresight had taught [her]88-mrs. dashwood to expect . [They]921-they were no sooner in [the passage]2862-the passage than [Marianne]90-marianne came hastily out of [the parlour]726-the parlour apparently in violent affliction , with [her]90-marianne handkerchief at [her]90-marianne eyes ; and without noticing [them]921-they ran up [stairs]933-stairs . Surprised and alarmed [they]921-they proceeded directly into [the room]2842-the room [she]88-mrs. dashwood had just quitted , where [they]921-they found only [Willoughby]107-willoughby , who was leaning against the mantel - piece with [his]107-willoughby back towards [them]921-they . [He]107-willoughby turned round on [their]921-they coming in , and [his]107-willoughby countenance showed that [he]107-willoughby strongly partook of the emotion which over - powered [Marianne]90-marianne . “ Is anything the matter with [her]88-mrs. dashwood ? ”[88-mrs. dashwood] cried [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood as [she]88-mrs. dashwood entered—“is [she]88-mrs. dashwood ill ? ”[88-mrs. dashwood] “ [I]107-willoughby hope not , ”[107-willoughby] [he]107-willoughby replied , trying to look cheerful ; and with a forced smile presently added , “ It is [I]107-willoughby who may rather expect to be ill — for [I]107-willoughby am now suffering under a very heavy disappointment ! ”[107-willoughby] “ Disappointment ? ”[88-mrs. dashwood] “ Yes , for [I]88-mrs. dashwood am unable to keep [my]88-mrs. dashwood engagement with [you]107-willoughby . [Mrs. Smith]120-mrs. smith has this morning exercised the privilege of riches upon [a poor dependent cousin]3078-a poor dependent cousin , by sending [me]88-mrs. dashwood on business to [London]24-london . [I]88-mrs. dashwood have just received [my]88-mrs. dashwood dispatches , and taken [my]88-mrs. dashwood farewell of [Allenham]12-allenham ; and by way of exhilaration [I]88-mrs. dashwood am now come to take [my]88-mrs. dashwood farewell of [you]107-willoughby . ”[88-mrs. dashwood] “ To [London!—and]25-london!—and are [you]107-willoughby going this morning ? ”[107-willoughby] “ Almost this moment . ”[88-mrs. dashwood] “ This is very unfortunate . But [Mrs. Smith]120-mrs. smith must be obliged;—and [her]120-mrs. smith business will not detain [you]107-willoughby from [us]3079-us long [I]935-he hope . ”[935-he] [He]935-he coloured as [he]935-he replied , “ [You]107-willoughby are very kind , but [I]935-he have no idea of returning into [Devonshire]5-devonshire immediately . [My]935-he visits to [Mrs. Smith]120-mrs. smith are never repeated within the twelvemonth . ”[935-he] “ And is [Mrs. Smith]120-mrs. smith [[your]107-willoughby only friend]3080-your only friend ? Is [Allenham]12-allenham [the only house in [the neighbourhood]356-the neighbourhood to which [you]107-willoughby will be welcome]3081-the only house in the neighbourhood to which you will be welcome ? For shame , [Willoughby]107-willoughby , can [you]107-willoughby wait for an invitation here ? ”[935-he] [His]935-he colour increased ; and with [his]935-he eyes fixed on the ground [he]935-he only replied , “ [You]88-mrs. dashwood are too good . ”[935-he] [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood looked at [Elinor]89-elinor with surprise . [Elinor]89-elinor felt equal amazement . For a few moments [every one]903-every one was silent . [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood first spoke . “ [I]88-mrs. dashwood have only to add , [[my]88-mrs. dashwood dear]2750-my dear [Willoughby]107-willoughby , that at [[Barton]8-barton cottage]3064-barton cottage [you]107-willoughby will always be welcome ; for [I]88-mrs. dashwood will not press [you]107-willoughby to return [here]2861-here immediately , because [you]107-willoughby only can judge how far _ that _ might be pleasing to [Mrs. Smith]120-mrs. smith ; and on this head [I]88-mrs. dashwood shall be no more disposed to question [your]107-willoughby judgment than to doubt [your]107-willoughby inclination . ”[88-mrs. dashwood] “ [My]107-willoughby engagements at present , ”[107-willoughby] replied [Willoughby]107-willoughby , confusedly , “ are of such a nature — that — [I]107-willoughby dare not flatter [myself]107-willoughby — ”[107-willoughby] [He]107-willoughby stopped . [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood was too much astonished to speak , and another pause succeeded . This was broken by [Willoughby]107-willoughby , who said with a faint smile , “ It is folly to linger in this manner . [I]107-willoughby will not torment [myself]107-willoughby any longer by remaining among friends whose society it is impossible for [me]107-willoughby now to enjoy . ”[107-willoughby] [He]107-willoughby then hastily took leave of [them]937-them all and left [the room]2842-the room . [They]937-them saw [him]107-willoughby step into [[his]107-willoughby carriage]694-his carriage , and in a minute it was out of sight . [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood felt too much for speech , and instantly quitted [the parlour]726-the parlour to give way in solitude to the concern and alarm which this sudden departure occasioned . [Elinor]89-elinor ’s uneasiness was at least equal to [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother ’s . [She]89-elinor thought of what had just passed with anxiety and distrust . [Willoughby]107-willoughby ’s behaviour in taking leave of [them]937-them , [his]107-willoughby embarrassment , and affectation of cheerfulness , and , above all , [his]107-willoughby unwillingness to accept [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother ’s invitation , a backwardness so unlike [a lover]2821-a lover , so unlike [himself]107-willoughby , greatly disturbed [her]89-elinor . One moment [she]89-elinor feared that no serious design had ever been formed on [his]107-willoughby side ; and the next that some unfortunate quarrel had taken place between [him]107-willoughby and [her]89-elinor sister;—the distress in which [Marianne]90-marianne had quitted [the room]2842-the room was such as a serious quarrel could most reasonably account for , though when [she]89-elinor considered what [Marianne]90-marianne ’s love for [him]107-willoughby was , a quarrel seemed almost impossible . But whatever might be the particulars of [their]937-them separation , [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister ’s affliction was indubitable ; and [she]89-elinor thought with the tenderest compassion of that violent sorrow which [Marianne]90-marianne was in all probability not merely giving way to as a relief , but feeding and encouraging as a duty . In about half an hour [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother returned , and though [her]332-her mother eyes were red , [her]332-her mother countenance was not uncheerful . “ [[Our]937-them dear]3086-our dear [Willoughby]107-willoughby is now some miles from [Barton]8-barton , [Elinor]89-elinor , ”[332-her mother] said [she]332-her mother , as [she]332-her mother sat down to work , “ and with how heavy a heart does [he]107-willoughby travel ? ”[332-her mother] “ It is all very strange . So suddenly to be gone ! It seems but the work of a moment . And last night [he]107-willoughby was with [us]937-them so happy , so cheerful , so affectionate ? And now , after only ten minutes notice — Gone too without intending to return!—Something more than what [he]107-willoughby owned to [us]937-them must have happened . [He]107-willoughby did not speak , [he]107-willoughby did not behave like [himself]107-willoughby . _ [You]89-elinor _ must have seen the difference as well as [I.]89-elinor What can it be ? Can [they]3087-they have quarrelled ? Why else should [he]107-willoughby have shown such unwillingness to accept [your]89-elinor invitation here ? ”[332-her mother] “ It was not inclination that [he]107-willoughby wanted , [Elinor]89-elinor ; [I]332-her mother could plainly see _ that _ . [He]107-willoughby had not the power of accepting it . [I]332-her mother have thought it all over [I]332-her mother assure [you]89-elinor , and [I]332-her mother can perfectly account for every thing that at first seemed strange to [me]332-her mother as well as to [you]89-elinor . ”[332-her mother] “ Can [you]89-elinor , indeed ! ”[332-her mother] “ Yes . [I]332-her mother have explained it to [myself]332-her mother in the most satisfactory way;—but [you]89-elinor , [Elinor]89-elinor , who love to doubt where [you]89-elinor can — it will not satisfy _ [you]89-elinor _ , [I]332-her mother know ; but [you]89-elinor shall not talk _ [me]332-her mother _ out of [my]332-her mother trust in it . [I]332-her mother am persuaded that [Mrs. Smith]120-mrs. smith suspects [his]107-willoughby regard for [Marianne]90-marianne , disapproves of it , ( perhaps because [she]120-mrs. smith has other views for [him]107-willoughby , ) and on that account is eager to get [him]107-willoughby away;—and that the business which [she]120-mrs. smith sends [him]107-willoughby off to transact is invented as an excuse to dismiss [him]107-willoughby . This is what [I]332-her mother believe to have happened . [He]107-willoughby is , moreover , aware that [she]120-mrs. smith _ does _ disapprove the connection , [he]107-willoughby dares not therefore at present confess to [her]120-mrs. smith [his]107-willoughby engagement with [Marianne]90-marianne , and [he]107-willoughby feels [himself]107-willoughby obliged , from [his]107-willoughby dependent situation , to give into [her]120-mrs. smith schemes , and absent [himself]107-willoughby from [Devonshire]5-devonshire for a while . [You]332-her mother will tell [me]332-her mother , [I]332-her mother know , that this may or may _ not _ have happened ; but [I]332-her mother will listen to no cavil , unless [you]332-her mother can point out any other method of understanding the affair as satisfactory at this . And now , [Elinor]89-elinor , what have [you]332-her mother to say ? ”[332-her mother] “ Nothing , for [you]332-her mother have anticipated [my]332-her mother answer . ”[332-her mother] “ Then [you]332-her mother would have told [me]332-her mother , that it might or might not have happened . Oh , [Elinor]89-elinor , how incomprehensible are [your]332-her mother feelings ! [You]332-her mother had rather take evil upon credit than good . [You]332-her mother had rather look out for misery for [Marianne]90-marianne , and guilt for poor [Willoughby]107-willoughby , than an apology for the latter . [You]332-her mother are resolved to think [him]107-willoughby blameable , because [he]107-willoughby took leave of [us]3088-we with less affection than [his]107-willoughby usual behaviour has shown . And is no allowance to be made for inadvertence , or for spirits depressed by recent disappointment ? Are no probabilities to be accepted , merely because they are not certainties ? Is nothing due to [the man whom [we]3088-we have all such reason to love , and no reason in [the world]2778-the world to think ill of]3089-the man whom we have all such reason to love , and no reason in the world to think ill of ? To the possibility of motives unanswerable in themselves , though unavoidably secret for a while ? And , after all , what is it [you]332-her mother suspect [him]107-willoughby of ? ”[332-her mother] “ [I]332-her mother can hardly tell [myself]332-her mother . But suspicion of something unpleasant is the inevitable consequence of such an alteration as [we]3088-we just witnessed in [him]107-willoughby . There is great truth , however , in what [you]332-her mother have now urged of the allowances which ought to be made for [him]107-willoughby , and it is [my]332-her mother wish to be candid in [my]332-her mother judgment of every body . [Willoughby]107-willoughby may undoubtedly have very sufficient reasons for [his]107-willoughby conduct , and [I]332-her mother will hope that [he]107-willoughby has . But it would have been more like [Willoughby]107-willoughby to acknowledge [them]3091-their at once . Secrecy may be advisable ; but still [I]332-her mother can not help wondering at its being practiced by [him]107-willoughby . ”[332-her mother] “ Do not blame [him]107-willoughby , however , for departing from [his]107-willoughby character , where the deviation is necessary . But [you]332-her mother really do admit the justice of what [I]332-her mother have said in [his]107-willoughby defence?—I am happy — and [he]107-willoughby is acquitted . ”[332-her mother] “ Not entirely . It may be proper to conceal [their]3091-their engagement ( if [they]3091-their _ are _ engaged ) from [Mrs. Smith]120-mrs. smith — and if that is the case , it must be highly expedient for [Willoughby]107-willoughby to be but little in [Devonshire]5-devonshire at present . But this is no excuse for [their]3091-their concealing it from [us]3092-us . ”[332-her mother] “ Concealing it from [us]3092-us ! [[my]332-her mother dear child]3093-my dear child , do [you]332-her mother accuse [Willoughby]107-willoughby and [Marianne]90-marianne of concealment ? This is strange indeed , when [your]332-her mother eyes have been reproaching [them]3091-their every day for incautiousness . ”[332-her mother] “ [I]89-elinor want no proof of [their]3091-their affection , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor ; “ but of [their]3091-their engagement [I]89-elinor do . ”[89-elinor] “ [I]332-her mother am perfectly satisfied of both . ”[332-her mother] “ Yet not a syllable has been said to [you]332-her mother on the subject , by either of [them]3091-their . ”[332-her mother] “ [I]332-her mother have not wanted syllables where actions have spoken so plainly . Has not [his]107-willoughby behaviour to [Marianne]90-marianne and to [all of [us]3092-us]3094-all of us , for at least the last fortnight , declared that [he]107-willoughby loved and considered [her]90-marianne as [[his]107-willoughby future wife]3095-his future wife , and that [he]107-willoughby felt for [us]3092-us the attachment of [the nearest relation]3096-the nearest relation ? Have [we]3092-us not perfectly understood [each other]338-each other ? Has not [my]332-her mother consent been daily asked by [his]107-willoughby looks , [his]107-willoughby manner , [his]107-willoughby attentive and affectionate respect ? [[My]332-her mother [Elinor]89-elinor]3098-my elinor , is it possible to doubt [their]3099-their engagement ? How could such a thought occur to [you]89-elinor ? How is it to be supposed that [Willoughby]107-willoughby , persuaded as [he]107-willoughby must be of [[your]89-elinor sister]2815-your sister ’s love , should leave [her]2815-your sister , and leave [her]2815-your sister perhaps for months , without telling [her]2815-your sister of [his]107-willoughby affection;—that [they]3099-their should part without a mutual exchange of confidence ? ”[332-her mother] “ [I]89-elinor confess , ”[89-elinor] replied [Elinor]89-elinor , “ that every circumstance except _ one _ is in favour of [their]3099-their engagement ; but that _ one _ is the total silence of [both on the subject]3101-both on the subject , and with [me]89-elinor it almost outweighs every other . ”[89-elinor] “ How strange this is ! [You]89-elinor must think wretchedly indeed of [Willoughby]107-willoughby , if , after all that has openly passed between [them]3099-their , [you]89-elinor can doubt the nature of the terms on which [they]3099-their are together . Has [he]107-willoughby been acting a part in [his]107-willoughby behaviour to [[your]89-elinor sister]2815-your sister all this time ? Do [you]89-elinor suppose [him]107-willoughby really indifferent to [her]2815-your sister ? ”[332-her mother] “ No , [I]332-her mother can not think that . [He]107-willoughby must and does love [her]2815-your sister [I]332-her mother am sure . ”[332-her mother] “ But with a strange kind of tenderness , if [he]107-willoughby can leave [her]2815-your sister with such indifference , such carelessness of the future , as [you]89-elinor attribute to [him]107-willoughby . ”[89-elinor] “ [You]89-elinor must remember , [[my]332-her mother dear mother]3103-my dear mother , that [I]332-her mother have never considered this matter as certain . [I]332-her mother have had [my]332-her mother doubts , [I]332-her mother confess ; but they are fainter than they were , and they may soon be entirely done away . If [we]3104-we find [they]3105-they correspond , every fear of [mine]332-her mother will be removed . ”[332-her mother] “ A mighty concession indeed ! If [you]89-elinor were to see [them]3105-they at the altar , [you]89-elinor would suppose [they]3105-they were going to be married . [Ungracious girl]3106-ungracious girl ! But _ [I]332-her mother _ require no such proof . Nothing in [my]332-her mother opinion has ever passed to justify doubt ; no secrecy has been attempted ; all has been uniformly open and unreserved . [You]89-elinor can not doubt [[your]89-elinor sister]2815-your sister ’s wishes . It must be [Willoughby]107-willoughby therefore whom [you]89-elinor suspect . But why ? Is [he]107-willoughby not [a man of honour and feeling]3108-a man of honour and feeling ? Has there been any inconsistency on [his]107-willoughby side to create alarm ? can [he]107-willoughby be deceitful ? ”[332-her mother] “ [I]89-elinor hope not , [I]89-elinor believe not , ”[89-elinor] cried [Elinor]89-elinor . “ [I]89-elinor love [Willoughby]107-willoughby , sincerely love [him]107-willoughby ; and suspicion of [his]107-willoughby integrity can not be more painful to [yourself]89-elinor than to [me]89-elinor . It has been involuntary , and [I]89-elinor will not encourage it . [I]89-elinor was startled , [I]89-elinor confess , by the alteration in [his]107-willoughby manners this morning;—he did not speak like [himself]107-willoughby , and did not return [your]89-elinor kindness with any cordiality . But all this may be explained by such a situation of [his]107-willoughby affairs as [you]89-elinor have supposed . [He]107-willoughby had just parted from [[my]89-elinor sister]2818-my sister , had seen [her]2818-my sister leave [him]107-willoughby in the greatest affliction ; and if [he]107-willoughby felt obliged , from a fear of offending [Mrs. Smith]120-mrs. smith , to resist the temptation of returning [here]2861-here soon , and yet aware that by declining [your]89-elinor invitation , by saying that [he]107-willoughby was going away for some time , [he]107-willoughby should seem to act an ungenerous , a suspicious part by [[our]3111-our family]2858-our family , [he]107-willoughby might well be embarrassed and disturbed . In such a case , a plain and open avowal of [his]107-willoughby difficulties would have been more to [his]107-willoughby honour [I]89-elinor think , as well as more consistent with [his]107-willoughby general character;—but [I]89-elinor will not raise objections against [any one]659-any one ’s conduct on so illiberal a foundation , as a difference in judgment from [myself]89-elinor , or a deviation from what [I]89-elinor may think right and consistent . ”[89-elinor] “ [You]89-elinor speak very properly . [Willoughby]107-willoughby certainly does not deserve to be suspected . Though _ [we]3111-our _ have not known [him]107-willoughby long , [he]107-willoughby is no stranger in [this part of [the world]2778-the world]3114-this part of the world ; and who has ever spoken to [his]107-willoughby disadvantage ? Had [he]107-willoughby been in a situation to act independently and marry immediately , it might have been odd that [he]107-willoughby should leave [us]3111-our without acknowledging everything to [me]947-they at once : but this is not the case . It is an engagement in some respects not prosperously begun , for [their]947-they marriage must be at a very uncertain distance ; and even secrecy , as far as it can be observed , may now be very advisable . ”[947-they] [They]947-they were interrupted by the entrance of [Margaret]91-margaret ; and [Elinor]89-elinor was then at liberty to think over the representations of [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother , to acknowledge the probability of [many]949-many , and hope for the justice of all . [They]947-they saw nothing of [Marianne]90-marianne till dinner time , when [she]90-marianne entered [the room]2842-the room and took [her]90-marianne place at the table without saying a word . [Her]90-marianne eyes were red and swollen ; and it seemed as if [her]90-marianne tears were even then restrained with difficulty . [She]90-marianne avoided the looks of [them]947-they all , could neither eat nor speak , and after some time , on [[her]90-marianne mother]332-her mother ’s silently pressing [her]90-marianne hand with tender compassion , [her]90-marianne small degree of fortitude was quite overcome , [she]90-marianne burst into tears and left [the room]2842-the room . This violent oppression of spirits continued the whole evening . [She]90-marianne was without any power , because [she]90-marianne was without any desire of command over [herself]90-marianne . The slightest mention of anything relative to [Willoughby]107-willoughby overpowered [her]90-marianne in an instant ; and though [[her]90-marianne family]391-her family were most anxiously attentive to [her]90-marianne comfort , it was impossible for [them]391-her family , if [they]391-her family spoke at all , to keep clear of every subject which [her]90-marianne feelings connected with [him]107-willoughby . CHAPTER XVI . [Marianne]90-marianne would have thought [herself]90-marianne very inexcusable had [she]90-marianne been able to sleep at all the first night after parting from [Willoughby]107-willoughby . [She]90-marianne would have been ashamed to look [[her]90-marianne family]391-her family in the face the next morning , had [she]90-marianne not risen from [her]90-marianne bed in more need of repose than when [she]90-marianne lay down in it . But the feelings which made such composure a disgrace , left [her]90-marianne in no danger of incurring it . [She]90-marianne was awake the whole night , and [she]90-marianne wept the greatest part of it . [She]90-marianne got up with a headache , was unable to talk , and unwilling to take any nourishment ; giving pain every moment to [[her]90-marianne mother]332-her mother and [sisters]301-sisters , and forbidding all attempt at consolation from either . [Her]90-marianne sensibility was potent enough ! When breakfast was over [she]90-marianne walked out by [herself]90-marianne , and wandered about [the village of]957-the village of [Allenham]12-allenham , indulging the recollection of past enjoyment and crying over the present reverse for [the chief of the morning]958-the chief of the morning . The evening passed off in the equal indulgence of feeling . [She]90-marianne played over every favourite song that [she]90-marianne had been used to play to [Willoughby]107-willoughby , every air in which [their]959-their voices had been oftenest joined , and sat at the instrument gazing on every line of music that [he]107-willoughby had written out for [her]90-marianne , till [her]90-marianne heart was so heavy that no farther sadness could be gained ; and this nourishment of grief was every day applied . [She]90-marianne spent whole hours at the pianoforte alternately singing and crying ; [her]90-marianne voice often totally suspended by [her]90-marianne tears . In books too , as well as in music , [she]90-marianne courted the misery which a contrast between the past and present was certain of giving . [She]90-marianne read nothing but what [they]959-their had been used to read together . Such violence of affliction indeed could not be supported for ever ; it sunk within a few days into a calmer melancholy ; but these employments , to which [she]90-marianne daily recurred , [her]90-marianne solitary walks and silent meditations , still produced occasional effusions of sorrow as lively as ever . No letter from [Willoughby]107-willoughby came ; and none seemed expected by [Marianne]90-marianne . [[Her]90-marianne mother]332-her mother was surprised , and [Elinor]89-elinor again became uneasy . But [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood could find explanations whenever [she]88-mrs. dashwood wanted them , which at least satisfied [herself]88-mrs. dashwood . “ Remember , [Elinor]89-elinor , ”[88-mrs. dashwood] said [she]88-mrs. dashwood , “ how very often [Sir John]99-sir john fetches [our]961-we letters [himself]99-sir john from the post , and carries them to it . [We]961-we have already agreed that secrecy may be necessary , and [we]961-we must acknowledge that it could not be maintained if [their]961-we correspondence were to pass through [Sir John]99-sir john ’s hands . ”[88-mrs. dashwood] [Elinor]89-elinor could not deny the truth of this , and [she]89-elinor tried to find in it a motive sufficient for [their]961-we silence . But there was one method so direct , so simple , and in [her]89-elinor opinion so eligible of knowing the real state of the affair , and of instantly removing all mystery , that [she]89-elinor could not help suggesting it to [[her]90-marianne mother]332-her mother . “ Why do [you]89-elinor not ask [Marianne]90-marianne at once , ”[89-elinor] said [she]89-elinor , “ whether [she]90-marianne is or [she]90-marianne is not engaged to [Willoughby]107-willoughby ? From [you]89-elinor , [[her]90-marianne mother]332-her mother , and so kind , so indulgent [a mother]600-a mother , the question could not give offence . It would be the natural result of [your]89-elinor affection for [her]90-marianne . [She]90-marianne used to be all unreserve , and to [you]89-elinor more especially . ”[89-elinor] “ [I]89-elinor would not ask such a question for [the world]2778-the world . Supposing it possible that [they]3119-they are not engaged , what distress would not such an enquiry inflict ! At any rate it would be most ungenerous . [I]89-elinor should never deserve [her]90-marianne confidence again , after forcing from [her]90-marianne a confession of what is meant at present to be unacknowledged to [any one]659-any one . [I]89-elinor know [Marianne]90-marianne ’s heart : [I]89-elinor know that [she]90-marianne dearly loves [me]89-elinor , and that [I]89-elinor shall not be the last to whom the affair is made known , when circumstances make the revealment of it eligible . [I]89-elinor would not attempt to force the confidence of [any one]659-any one ; of [a child]576-a child much less ; because a sense of duty would prevent the denial which [her]90-marianne wishes might direct . ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor thought this generosity overstrained , considering [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister ’s youth , and urged the matter farther , but in vain ; common sense , common care , common prudence , were all sunk in [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood ’s romantic delicacy . It was several days before [Willoughby]107-willoughby ’s name was mentioned before [Marianne]90-marianne by [any of [[her]90-marianne family]391-her family]964-any of her family ; [Sir John]99-sir john and [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , indeed , were not so nice ; [their]966-their witticisms added pain to many a painful hour;—but one evening , [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood , accidentally taking up a volume of Shakespeare , exclaimed , “ [We]3123-we have never finished [Hamlet]122-hamlet , [Marianne]90-marianne ; [[our]3123-we dear]3086-our dear [Willoughby]107-willoughby went away before [we]3123-we could get through it . [We]3123-we will put it by , that when [he]107-willoughby comes again ... But it may be months , perhaps , before _ that _ happens . ”[88-mrs. dashwood] “ Months ! ”[90-marianne] cried [Marianne]90-marianne , with strong surprise . “ No — nor many weeks . ”[90-marianne] [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood was sorry for what [she]88-mrs. dashwood had said ; but it gave [Elinor]89-elinor pleasure , as it produced a reply from [Marianne]90-marianne so expressive of confidence in [Willoughby]107-willoughby and knowledge of [his]107-willoughby intentions . One morning , about a week after [his]107-willoughby leaving [the country]612-the country , [Marianne]90-marianne was prevailed on to join [[her]90-marianne sisters]334-her sisters in [their]334-her sisters usual walk , instead of wandering away by [herself]90-marianne . Hitherto [she]90-marianne had carefully avoided [every companion in [her]90-marianne rambles]969-every companion in her rambles . If [[her]90-marianne sisters]334-her sisters intended to walk on [the downs]715-the downs , [she]90-marianne directly stole away towards [the lanes]884-the lanes ; if [they]334-her sisters talked of [the valley]547-the valley , [she]90-marianne was as speedy in climbing [the hills]974-the hills , and could never be found when [the others]539-the others set off . But at length [she]90-marianne was secured by the exertions of [Elinor]89-elinor , who greatly disapproved such continual seclusion . [They]334-her sisters walked along [the road]976-the road through [the valley]547-the valley , and chiefly in silence , for [Marianne]90-marianne ’s _ mind _ could not be controlled , and [Elinor]89-elinor , satisfied with gaining one point , would not then attempt more . Beyond the entrance of [the valley]547-the valley , where [the country]612-the country , though still rich , was less wild and more open , a long stretch of [the road which [they]334-her sisters had travelled on first coming to [Barton]8-barton]980-the road which they had travelled on first coming to barton , lay before [them]334-her sisters ; and on reaching that point , [they]334-her sisters stopped to look around [them]334-her sisters , and examine a prospect which formed the distance of [their]334-her sisters view from [the cottage]507-the cottage , from [a spot which [they]334-her sisters had never happened to reach in any of [their]334-her sisters walks before]982-a spot which they had never happened to reach in any of their walks before . Amongst the objects in the scene , [they]334-her sisters soon discovered [an animated one]983-an animated one ; it was [a man on horseback]984-a man on horseback riding towards [them]334-her sisters . In a few minutes [they]334-her sisters could distinguish [him]984-a man on horseback to be [a gentleman]985-a gentleman ; and in a moment afterwards [Marianne]90-marianne rapturously exclaimed , “ It is [he]984-a man on horseback ; it is [indeed;—I]89-elinor know it is!”—and[90-marianne] was hastening to meet [him]984-a man on horseback , when [Elinor]89-elinor cried out , “ Indeed , [Marianne]90-marianne , [I]89-elinor think [you]90-marianne are mistaken . It is not [Willoughby]107-willoughby . [The person]3125-the person is not tall enough for [him]3125-the person , and has not [his]3125-the person air . ”[89-elinor] “ [He]3125-the person has , [he]3125-the person has , ”[90-marianne] cried [Marianne]90-marianne , “ [I]90-marianne am sure [he]3125-the person has . [His]3125-the person air , [his]3125-the person coat , [his]3125-the person horse . [I]90-marianne knew how soon [he]3125-the person would come . ”[90-marianne] [She]90-marianne walked eagerly on as [she]90-marianne spoke ; and [Elinor]89-elinor , to screen [Marianne]90-marianne from particularity , as [she]89-elinor felt almost certain of its not being [Willoughby]107-willoughby , quickened [her]89-elinor pace and kept up with [her]90-marianne . [They]986-them were soon within thirty yards of [the gentleman]722-the gentleman . [Marianne]90-marianne looked again ; [her]90-marianne heart sunk within [her]90-marianne ; and abruptly turning round , [she]90-marianne was hurrying back , when the voices of both [[her]90-marianne sisters]334-her sisters were raised to detain [her]90-marianne ; [a third , almost as well known as [[Willoughby]107-willoughby ’s]990-willoughby ’s]989-a third , almost as well known as willoughby ’s , joined [them]986-them in begging [her]90-marianne to stop , and [she]90-marianne turned round with surprise to see and welcome [Edward Ferrars]98-edward . [He]722-the gentleman was [the only person in [the world]2778-the world who could at that moment be forgiven for not being [Willoughby]107-willoughby]991-the only person in the world who could at that moment be forgiven for not being willoughby ; [the only one who could have gained a smile from [her]90-marianne]993-the only one who could have gained a smile from her ; but [she]90-marianne dispersed [her]90-marianne tears to smile on _ [him]722-the gentleman _ , and in [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister ’s happiness forgot for a time [her]90-marianne own disappointment . [He]722-the gentleman dismounted , and giving [his]722-the gentleman horse to [[his]722-the gentleman servant]995-his servant , walked back with [them]986-them to [Barton]8-barton , whither [he]722-the gentleman was purposely coming to visit [them]986-them . [He]722-the gentleman was welcomed by [them]986-them all with great cordiality , but especially by [Marianne]90-marianne , who showed more warmth of regard in [her]90-marianne reception of [him]722-the gentleman than even [Elinor]89-elinor [herself]89-elinor . To [Marianne]90-marianne , indeed , the meeting between [Edward]98-edward and [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister was but a continuation of that unaccountable coldness which [she]90-marianne had often observed at [Norland]3-norland in [their]997-their mutual behaviour . On [Edward]98-edward ’s side , more particularly , there was a deficiency of all that [a lover]2821-a lover ought to look and say on such an occasion . [He]722-the gentleman was confused , seemed scarcely sensible of pleasure in seeing [them]986-them , looked neither rapturous nor gay , said little but what was forced from [him]722-the gentleman by questions , and distinguished [Elinor]89-elinor by no mark of affection . [Marianne]90-marianne saw and listened with increasing surprise . [She]90-marianne began almost to feel a dislike of [Edward]98-edward ; and it ended , as every feeling must end with [her]90-marianne , by carrying back [her]90-marianne thoughts to [Willoughby]107-willoughby , whose manners formed a contrast sufficiently striking to those of [[his]107-willoughby brother]3045-his brother elect . After a short silence which succeeded the first surprise and enquiries of meeting , [Marianne]90-marianne asked [Edward]98-edward if [he]722-the gentleman came directly from [London]24-london . No , [he]722-the gentleman had been in [Devonshire]5-devonshire a fortnight . “ A fortnight ! ”[90-marianne] [she]90-marianne repeated , surprised at [his]722-the gentleman being so long in [the same county]1000-the same county with [Elinor]89-elinor without seeing [her]90-marianne before . [He]722-the gentleman looked rather distressed as [he]722-the gentleman added , that [he]722-the gentleman had been staying with [some friends]594-some friends near [Plymouth]26-plymouth . “ Have [you]90-marianne been lately in [Sussex]1-sussex ? ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor . “ [I]89-elinor was at [Norland]3-norland about a month ago . ”[89-elinor] “ And how does dear , dear [Norland]3-norland look ? ”[90-marianne] cried [Marianne]90-marianne . “ Dear , [dear Norland]3-norland , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor , “ probably looks much as it always does at this time of the year . [The woods]3126-the woods and walks thickly covered with dead leaves . ”[89-elinor] “ Oh , ”[90-marianne] cried [Marianne]90-marianne , “ with what transporting sensation have [I]90-marianne formerly seen them fall ! How have [I]90-marianne delighted , as [I]90-marianne walked , to see [them]3127-them driven in showers about [me]90-marianne by the wind ! What feelings have they , the season , the air altogether inspired ! Now there is [no one]317-no one to regard [them]3127-them .
