[They]3127-them are seen only as a nuisance , swept hastily off , and driven as much as possible from the sight . ”[90-marianne] “ It is not [every one]903-every one , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor , “ who has [your]90-marianne passion for dead leaves . ”[89-elinor] “ No ; [my]90-marianne feelings are not often shared , not often understood . But _ sometimes _ they are . ”—As[90-marianne] [she]90-marianne said this , [she]90-marianne sunk into a reverie for a few moments;—but rousing [herself]90-marianne again , “ Now , [Edward]98-edward , ”[90-marianne] said [she]90-marianne , calling [his]1002-you attention to the prospect , “ here is [[Barton]8-barton [valley]3131-valley]3130-barton valley . Look up to [it]3131-valley , and be tranquil if [you]90-marianne can . Look at [those hills]3132-those hills ! Did [you]90-marianne ever see [[their]3127-them equals]3133-their equals ? To the left is [Barton park]6-barton park , amongst [those woods]3134-those woods and plantations . [You]90-marianne may see the end of [the house]318-the house . And there , beneath [that farthest hill]3136-that farthest hill , which rises with such grandeur , is [[our]3137-we cottage]3138-our cottage . ”[90-marianne] “ [It]3131-valley is [a beautiful country]3139-a beautiful country , ”[1002-you] [he]1002-you replied ; “ but these bottoms must be dirty in winter . ”[1002-you] “ How can [you]1002-you think of dirt , with such objects before [you]1002-you ? ”[90-marianne] “ Because , ”[1002-you] replied [he]1002-you , smiling , “ among the rest of the objects before [me]1002-you , [I]1002-you see [a very dirty lane]3140-a very dirty lane . ”[1002-you] “ How strange ! ”[90-marianne] said [Marianne]90-marianne to [herself]90-marianne as [she]90-marianne walked on . “ Have [you]1002-you [an agreeable neighbourhood here]3141-an agreeable neighbourhood here ? Are [the Middletons pleasant people]3142-the middletons pleasant people ? ”[90-marianne] “ No , not all , ”[90-marianne] answered [Marianne]90-marianne ; “ [we]3137-we could not be more unfortunately situated . ”[90-marianne] “ [Marianne]90-marianne , ”[336-her sister] cried [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister , “ how can [you]90-marianne say so ? How can [you]90-marianne be so unjust ? [They]3142-the middletons pleasant people are [a very respectable family]3143-a very respectable family , [Mr. Ferrars]94-edward ; and towards [us]3137-we have behaved in the friendliest manner . Have [you]90-marianne forgot , [Marianne]90-marianne , how many pleasant days [we]3137-we have owed to [them]3142-the middletons pleasant people ? ”[336-her sister] “ No , ”[90-marianne] said [Marianne]90-marianne , in a low voice , “ nor how many painful moments . ”[90-marianne] [Elinor]89-elinor took no notice of this ; and directing [her]89-elinor attention to [[their]1004-their visitor]1005-their visitor , endeavoured to support something like discourse with [him]1005-their visitor , by talking of [[their]1004-their present residence]1006-their present residence , its conveniences , & c. extorting from [him]1005-their visitor occasional questions and remarks . [His]1005-their visitor coldness and reserve mortified [her]89-elinor severely ; [she]89-elinor was vexed and half angry ; but resolving to regulate [her]89-elinor behaviour to [him]1005-their visitor by the past rather than the present , [she]89-elinor avoided every appearance of resentment or displeasure , and treated [him]1005-their visitor as [she]89-elinor thought [he]1005-their visitor ought to be treated from the family connection . CHAPTER XVII . [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood was surprised only for a moment at seeing [him]1005-their visitor ; for [his]1005-their visitor coming to [Barton]8-barton was , in [her]88-mrs. dashwood opinion , of all things the most natural . [Her]88-mrs. dashwood joy and expression of regard long outlived [her]88-mrs. dashwood wonder . [He]1005-their visitor received the kindest welcome from [her]88-mrs. dashwood ; and shyness , coldness , reserve could not stand against such a reception . [They]1007-they had begun to fail [him]1005-their visitor before [he]1005-their visitor entered [the house]318-the house , and [they]1007-they were quite overcome by the captivating manners of [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood . Indeed [a man]499-a man could not very well be in love with [either of [[her]88-mrs. dashwood daughters]294-her daughters]1010-either of her daughters , without extending the passion to [her]88-mrs. dashwood ; and [Elinor]89-elinor had the satisfaction of seeing [him]1005-their visitor soon become more like [himself]1005-their visitor . [His]1005-their visitor affections seemed to reanimate towards [them]1007-they all , and [his]1005-their visitor interest in [their]1007-they welfare again became perceptible . [He]1005-their visitor was not in spirits , however ; [he]1005-their visitor praised [[their]1007-they house]1012-their house , admired [its]1012-their house prospect , was attentive , and kind ; but still [he]1005-their visitor was not in spirits . [The whole family]1013-the whole family perceived it , and [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood , attributing it to some want of liberality in [[his]1005-their visitor mother]270-his mother , sat down to table indignant against [all selfish parents]1015-all selfish parents . “ What are [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward ’s views for [you]1005-their visitor at present , [Edward]98-edward ? ”[88-mrs. dashwood] said [she]88-mrs. dashwood , when dinner was over and [they]1007-they had drawn round the fire ; “ are [you]1005-their visitor still to be [a great orator]3144-a great orator in spite of [yourself]1005-their visitor ? ”[88-mrs. dashwood] “ No . [I]90-marianne hope [[my]90-marianne mother]2771-my mother is now convinced that [I]90-marianne have no more talents than inclination for a public life ! ”[90-marianne] “ But how is [your]1005-their visitor fame to be established ? for famous [you]1005-their visitor must be to satisfy all [[your]1005-their visitor family]3146-your family ; and with no inclination for expense , no affection for [strangers]3147-strangers , no profession , and no assurance , [you]1005-their visitor may find it a difficult matter . ”[88-mrs. dashwood] “ [I]88-mrs. dashwood shall not attempt it . [I]88-mrs. dashwood have no wish to be distinguished ; and have every reason to hope [I]88-mrs. dashwood never shall . Thank Heaven ! [I]88-mrs. dashwood can not be forced into genius and eloquence . ”[88-mrs. dashwood] “ [You]88-mrs. dashwood have no ambition , [I]90-marianne well know . [Your]88-mrs. dashwood wishes are all moderate . ”[90-marianne] “ As moderate as those of [the rest of [the world]2778-the world]667-the rest of the world , [I]88-mrs. dashwood believe . [I]88-mrs. dashwood wish as well as [every body else]3150-every body else to be perfectly happy ; but , like every body else it must be in [my]88-mrs. dashwood own way . Greatness will not make [me]88-mrs. dashwood so . ”[88-mrs. dashwood] “ Strange that it would ! ”[90-marianne] cried [Marianne]90-marianne . “ What have wealth or grandeur to do with happiness ? ”[90-marianne] “ Grandeur has but little , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor , “ but wealth has much to do with it . ”[89-elinor] “ [Elinor]89-elinor , for shame ! ”[90-marianne] said [Marianne]90-marianne , “ money can only give happiness where there is nothing else to give it . Beyond a competence , it can afford no real satisfaction , as far as [mere self]3151-mere self is concerned . ”[90-marianne] “ Perhaps , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor , smiling , “ [we]3152-we may come to the same point . _ [Your]88-mrs. dashwood _ competence and _ [my]89-elinor _ wealth are very much alike , [I]89-elinor dare say ; and without [them]3153-them , as [the world]2778-the world goes now , [we]3152-we shall both agree that every kind of external comfort must be wanting . [Your]88-mrs. dashwood ideas are only more noble than [mine]89-elinor . Come , what is [your]88-mrs. dashwood competence ? ”[89-elinor] “ About eighteen hundred or two thousand a year ; not more than _ that _ . ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor laughed . “ _ two _ thousand a year ! _ one _ is [my]89-elinor wealth ! [I]89-elinor guessed how it would end . ”[89-elinor] “ And yet two thousand a - year is a very moderate income , ”[90-marianne] said [Marianne]90-marianne . “ [A family]3155-a family can not well be maintained on a smaller . [I]90-marianne am sure [I]90-marianne am not extravagant in [my]90-marianne demands . A proper establishment of [servants]2798-servants , [a carriage]3157-a carriage , perhaps two , and [hunters]3158-hunters , can not be supported on less . ”[90-marianne] [Elinor]89-elinor smiled again , to hear [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister describing so accurately [their]1017-their future expenses at [Combe Magna]35-combe magna . “ [Hunters]123-hunters ! ”[89-elinor] repeated [Edward—“but]124-edward—“but why must [you]90-marianne have [hunters]3158-hunters ? [Every body]581-every body does not hunt . ”[90-marianne] [Marianne]90-marianne coloured as [she]90-marianne replied , “ But [most people]3161-most people do . ”[90-marianne] “ [I]91-margaret wish , ”[91-margaret] said [Margaret]91-margaret , striking out a novel thought , “ that [somebody]3162-somebody would give [us]1017-their all a large fortune apiece ! ”[91-margaret] “ Oh that [they]3162-somebody would ! ”[90-marianne] cried [Marianne]90-marianne , [her]90-marianne eyes sparkling with animation , and [her]90-marianne cheeks glowing with the delight of such imaginary happiness . “ [We]1017-their are all unanimous in that wish , [I]89-elinor suppose , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor , “ in spite of the insufficiency of wealth . ”[89-elinor] “ Oh dear ! ”[91-margaret] cried [Margaret]91-margaret , “ how happy [I]91-margaret should be ! [I]91-margaret wonder what [I]91-margaret should do with it ! ”[91-margaret] [Marianne]90-marianne looked as if [she]90-marianne had no doubt on that point . “ [I]90-marianne should be puzzled to spend so large a fortune [myself]90-marianne , ”[90-marianne] said [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood , “ if [[my]88-mrs. dashwood children]3163-my children were all to be rich without [my]88-mrs. dashwood help . ”[88-mrs. dashwood] “ [You]90-marianne must begin [your]90-marianne improvements on [this house]2807-this house , ”[89-elinor] observed [Elinor]89-elinor , “ and [your]90-marianne difficulties will soon vanish . ”[89-elinor] “ What magnificent orders would travel from [this family]3165-this family to [London]24-london , ”[98-edward] said [Edward]98-edward , “ in such an event ! What a happy day for [booksellers]3166-booksellers , [music - sellers]3167-music - sellers , and [print - shops]3168-print - shops ! [You]90-marianne , [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood , would give a general commission for every new print of merit to be sent [you]90-marianne — and as for [Marianne]90-marianne , [I]98-edward know [her]90-marianne greatness of soul , there would not be music enough in [London]24-london to content [her]90-marianne . And books!—Thomson , [Cowper]97-cowper , [Scott]109-scott — [she]90-marianne would buy them all over and over again : [she]90-marianne would buy up every copy , [I]98-edward believe , to prevent [their]3169-their falling into unworthy hands ; and [she]90-marianne would have every book that tells [her]90-marianne how to admire an old twisted tree . Should not [you]90-marianne , [Marianne]90-marianne ? Forgive [me]98-edward , if [I]98-edward am very saucy . But [I]98-edward was willing to show [you]90-marianne that [I]98-edward had not forgot [our]3170-our old disputes . ”[98-edward] “ [I]89-elinor love to be reminded of the past , [Edward]98-edward — whether it be melancholy or gay , [I]89-elinor love to recall it — and [you]90-marianne will never offend [me]89-elinor by talking of former times . [You]90-marianne are very right in supposing how [my]89-elinor money would be spent — some of it , at least — [my]89-elinor loose cash would certainly be employed in improving [my]89-elinor collection of music and books . ”[89-elinor] “ And the bulk of [your]90-marianne fortune would be laid out in annuities on [the authors]3171-the authors or [[their]3171-the authors heirs]3172-their heirs . ”[89-elinor] “ No , [Edward]98-edward , [I]98-edward should have something else to do with it . ”[98-edward] “ Perhaps , then , [you]90-marianne would bestow it as a reward on [that person who wrote the ablest defence of [your]90-marianne favourite maxim , that [no one]317-no one can ever be in love more than once in [their]317-no one life]3173-that person who wrote the ablest defence of your favourite maxim , that no one can ever be in love more than once in their life — [your]90-marianne opinion on that point is unchanged , [I]89-elinor presume ? ”[89-elinor] “ Undoubtedly . At [my]89-elinor time of life opinions are tolerably fixed . It is not likely that [I]89-elinor should now see or hear any thing to change them . ”[89-elinor] “ [Marianne]90-marianne is as steadfast as ever , [you]98-edward see , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor , “ [she]90-marianne is not at all altered . ”[89-elinor] “ [She]90-marianne is only grown a little more grave than [she]90-marianne was . ”[89-elinor] “ Nay , [Edward]98-edward , ”[90-marianne] said [Marianne]90-marianne , “ _ [you]98-edward _ need not reproach [me]90-marianne . [You]98-edward are not very gay [yourself]98-edward . ”[90-marianne] “ Why should [you]90-marianne think so ! ”[1018-he] replied [he]1018-he , with a sigh . “ But gaiety never was a part of _ [my]1018-he _ character . ”[1018-he] “ Nor do [I]89-elinor think it a part of [Marianne]90-marianne ’s , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor ; “ [I]89-elinor should hardly call [her]90-marianne [a lively girl]3175-a lively girl — [she]90-marianne is very earnest , very eager in all [she]90-marianne does — sometimes talks a great deal and always with animation — but [she]90-marianne is not often really merry . ”[89-elinor] “ [I]1018-he believe [you]89-elinor are right , ”[1018-he] [he]1018-he replied , “ and yet [I]1018-he have always set [her]90-marianne down as [a lively girl]3175-a lively girl . ”[1018-he] “ [I]89-elinor have frequently detected [myself]89-elinor in such kind of mistakes , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor , “ in a total misapprehension of character in some point or other : fancying [people so much more gay or grave]3177-people so much more gay or grave , or ingenious or stupid than [they]3177-people so much more gay or grave really are , and [I]89-elinor can hardly tell why or in what the deception originated . Sometimes [one]2761-one is guided by what [they]3177-people so much more gay or grave say of [themselves]3177-people so much more gay or grave , and very frequently by what [other people]2834-other people say of [them]3177-people so much more gay or grave , without giving [oneself]2761-one time to deliberate and judge . ”[89-elinor] “ But [I]90-marianne thought it was right , [Elinor]89-elinor , ”[90-marianne] said [Marianne]90-marianne , “ to be guided wholly by the opinion of [other people]2834-other people . [I]90-marianne thought [our]3181-our judgments were given [us]3181-our merely to be subservient to those of [neighbours]3182-neighbours . This has always been [your]89-elinor doctrine , [I]90-marianne am sure . ”[90-marianne] “ No , [Marianne]90-marianne , never . [My]89-elinor doctrine has never aimed at the subjection of the understanding . All [I]89-elinor have ever attempted to influence has been the behaviour . [You]90-marianne must not confound [my]89-elinor meaning . [I]89-elinor am guilty , [I]89-elinor confess , of having often wished [you]90-marianne to treat [our]3181-our acquaintance in general with greater attention ; but when have [I]89-elinor advised [you]90-marianne to adopt [their]3183-their sentiments or to conform to [their]3183-their judgment in serious matters ? ”[89-elinor] “ [You]89-elinor have not been able to bring [[your]89-elinor sister]2815-your sister over to [your]89-elinor plan of general civility , ”[98-edward] said [Edward]98-edward to [Elinor]89-elinor , “ Do [you]89-elinor gain no ground ? ”[98-edward] “ Quite the contrary , ”[89-elinor] replied [Elinor]89-elinor , looking expressively at [Marianne]90-marianne . “ [My]1019-i judgment , ”[1019-i] [he]1019-i returned , “ is all on [your]90-marianne side of the question ; but [I]1019-i am afraid [my]1019-i practice is much more on [[your]89-elinor sister]2815-your sister ’s . [I]1019-i never wish to offend , but [I]1019-i am so foolishly shy , that [I]1019-i often seem negligent , when [I]1019-i am only kept back by [my]1019-i natural awkwardness . [I]1019-i have frequently thought that [I]1019-i must have been intended by nature to be fond of [low company]3186-low company , [I]1019-i am so little at [my]1019-i ease among [strangers of gentility]3187-strangers of gentility ! ”[1019-i] “ [Marianne]90-marianne has not shyness to excuse any inattention of [hers]90-marianne , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor . “ [She]90-marianne knows [her]90-marianne own worth too well for false shame , ”[98-edward] replied [Edward]98-edward . “ Shyness is only the effect of a sense of inferiority in some way or other . If [I]98-edward could persuade [myself]98-edward that [my]98-edward manners were perfectly easy and graceful , [I]98-edward should not be shy . ”[98-edward] “ But [you]98-edward would still be reserved , ”[90-marianne] said [Marianne]90-marianne , “ and that is worse . ”[98-edward] [Edward]98-edward started—“Reserved ! Am [I]89-elinor reserved , [Marianne]90-marianne ? ”[89-elinor] “ Yes , very . ”[89-elinor] “ [I]1020-he do not understand [you]89-elinor , ”[1020-he] replied [he]1020-he , colouring . “ Reserved!—how , in what manner ? What am [I]1020-he to tell [you]1020-he ? What can [you]1020-he suppose ? ”[1020-he] [Elinor]89-elinor looked surprised at [his]1020-he emotion ; but trying to laugh off the subject , [she]89-elinor said to [him]1020-he , “ Do not [you]1020-he know [[my]89-elinor sister]2818-my sister well enough to understand what [she]2818-my sister means ? Do not [you]1020-he know [she]2818-my sister calls [every one reserved who does not talk as fast , and admire what [she]2818-my sister admires as rapturously as [herself]2818-my sister]3189-every one reserved who does not talk as fast , and admire what she admires as rapturously as herself ? ”[89-elinor] [Edward]98-edward made no answer . [His]1020-he gravity and thoughtfulness returned on [him]1020-he in their fullest extent — and [he]1020-he sat for some time silent and dull . CHAPTER XVIII . [Elinor]89-elinor saw , with great uneasiness the low spirits of [[her]89-elinor friend]1021-her friend . [His]1020-he visit afforded [her]89-elinor but a very partial satisfaction , while [his]1020-he own enjoyment in it appeared so imperfect . It was evident that [he]1020-he was unhappy ; [she]89-elinor wished it were equally evident that [he]1020-he still distinguished [her]89-elinor by the same affection which once [she]89-elinor had felt no doubt of inspiring ; but hitherto the continuance of [his]1020-he preference seemed very uncertain ; and the reservedness of [his]1020-he manner towards [her]89-elinor contradicted one moment what a more animated look had intimated the preceding one . [He]1020-he joined [her]89-elinor and [Marianne]90-marianne in [the breakfast - room]1022-the breakfast - room the next morning before [the others]539-the others were down ; and [Marianne]90-marianne , who was always eager to promote [their]1024-them happiness as far as [she]90-marianne could , soon left [them]1024-them to [themselves]1024-them . But before [she]90-marianne was half way [upstairs]1025-upstairs [she]90-marianne heard the parlour door open , and , turning round , was astonished to see [Edward]98-edward [himself]98-edward come out . “ [I]1020-he am going into [the village]3190-the village to see [[my]1020-he horses]3191-my horses , ”[1020-he] said [he]1020-he , “ as [you]90-marianne are not yet ready for breakfast ; [I]1020-he shall be back again presently . ”[1020-he] [Edward]98-edward returned to [them]1024-them with fresh admiration of [the surrounding country]1026-the surrounding country ; in [his]1020-he walk to [the village]3190-the village , [he]1020-he had seen [many parts of [the valley]547-the valley]1028-many parts of the valley to advantage ; and [the village]3190-the village itself , in a much higher situation than [the cottage]507-the cottage , afforded a general view of [the whole]1032-the whole , which had exceedingly pleased [him]1020-he . This was a subject which ensured [Marianne]90-marianne ’s attention , and [she]90-marianne was beginning to describe [her]90-marianne own admiration of these scenes , and to question [him]1020-he more minutely on the objects that had particularly struck [him]1020-he , when [Edward]98-edward interrupted [her]90-marianne by saying , “ [You]90-marianne must not enquire too far , [Marianne]90-marianne — remember [I]98-edward have no knowledge in the picturesque , and [I]98-edward shall offend [you]90-marianne by [my]98-edward ignorance and want of taste if [we]3192-we come to particulars . [I]98-edward shall call hills steep , which ought to be bold ; surfaces strange and uncouth , which ought to be irregular and rugged ; and distant objects out of sight , which ought only to be indistinct through the soft medium of a hazy atmosphere . [You]90-marianne must be satisfied with such admiration as [I]98-edward can honestly give . [I]98-edward call [it]3193-it [a very fine country]3194-a very fine country — [the hills]974-the hills are steep , [the woods]3126-the woods seem full of fine timber , and [the valley]547-the valley looks comfortable and snug — with rich meadows and [several neat farm houses scattered here and there]3198-several neat farm houses scattered here and there . It exactly answers [my]98-edward idea of [a fine country]3199-a fine country , because it unites beauty with utility — and [I]98-edward dare say it is a picturesque one too , because [you]90-marianne admire it ; [I]98-edward can easily believe it to be full of rocks and promontories , grey moss and brush wood , but these are all lost on [me]98-edward . [I]98-edward know nothing of the picturesque . ”[98-edward] “ [I]90-marianne am afraid it is but too true , ”[90-marianne] said [Marianne]90-marianne ; “ but why should [you]98-edward boast of it ? ”[98-edward] “ [I]89-elinor suspect , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor , “ that to avoid one kind of affectation , [Edward]98-edward here falls into another . Because [he]3200-he believes [many people]3201-many people pretend to more admiration of the beauties of nature than [they]3201-many people really feel , and is disgusted with such pretensions , [he]3200-he affects greater indifference and less discrimination in viewing them [himself]3200-he than [he]3200-he possesses . [He]3200-he is fastidious and will have an affectation of [his]3200-he own . ”[89-elinor] “ It is very true , ”[90-marianne] said [Marianne]90-marianne , “ that admiration of landscape scenery is become a mere jargon . [Every body]581-every body pretends to feel and tries to describe with the taste and elegance of [him]3200-he who first defined what picturesque beauty was . [I]90-marianne detest jargon of every kind , and sometimes [I]90-marianne have kept [my]90-marianne feelings to [myself]90-marianne , because [I]90-marianne could find no language to describe them in but what was worn and hackneyed out of all sense and meaning . ”[90-marianne] “ [I]98-edward am convinced , ”[98-edward] said [Edward]98-edward , “ that [you]90-marianne really feel all the delight in a fine prospect which [you]90-marianne profess to feel . But , in return , [[your]90-marianne sister]2815-your sister must allow [me]98-edward to feel no more than [I]98-edward profess . [I]98-edward like a fine prospect , but not on picturesque principles . [I]98-edward do not like crooked , twisted , blasted trees . [I]98-edward admire them much more if they are tall , straight , and flourishing . [I]98-edward do not like ruined , [tattered cottages]3204-tattered cottages . [I]98-edward am not fond of nettles or thistles , or heath blossoms . [I]98-edward have more pleasure in [a snug farm - house]3205-a snug farm - house than [a watch - tower]3206-a watch - tower — and a troop of [tidy , happy villagers]3207-tidy , happy villagers please [me]98-edward better than the finest banditti in [the world]2778-the world . ”[98-edward] [Marianne]90-marianne looked with amazement at [Edward]98-edward , with compassion at [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister . [Elinor]89-elinor only laughed . The subject was continued no farther ; and [Marianne]90-marianne remained thoughtfully silent , till a new object suddenly engaged [her]90-marianne attention . [She]90-marianne was sitting by [Edward]98-edward , and in taking [his]1034-his tea from [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood , [his]1034-his hand passed so directly before [her]90-marianne , as to make a ring , with a plait of hair in the centre , very conspicuous on one of [his]1034-his fingers . “ [I]90-marianne never saw [you]98-edward wear a ring before , [Edward]98-edward , ”[90-marianne] [she]90-marianne cried . “ Is that [Fanny]93-fanny ’s hair ? [I]90-marianne remember [her]93-fanny promising to give [you]98-edward some . But [I]90-marianne should have thought [her]93-fanny hair had been darker . ”[90-marianne] [Marianne]90-marianne spoke inconsiderately what [she]90-marianne really felt — but when [she]90-marianne saw how much [she]90-marianne had pained [Edward]98-edward , [her]90-marianne own vexation at [her]90-marianne want of thought could not be surpassed by [his]1034-his . [He]1034-his coloured very deeply , and giving a momentary glance at [Elinor]89-elinor , replied , “ Yes ; it is [[my]1034-his sister]2818-my sister ’s hair . The setting always casts a different shade on it , [you]90-marianne know . ”[1034-his] [Elinor]89-elinor had met [his]1034-his eye , and looked conscious likewise . That the hair was [her]89-elinor own , [she]89-elinor instantaneously felt as well satisfied as [Marianne]90-marianne ; the only difference in [their]1035-their conclusions was , that what [Marianne]90-marianne considered as a free gift from [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister , [Elinor]89-elinor was conscious must have been procured by some theft or contrivance unknown to [herself]89-elinor . [She]90-marianne was not in a humour , however , to regard it as an affront , and affecting to take no notice of what passed , by instantly talking of something else , [she]90-marianne internally resolved henceforward to catch every opportunity of eyeing the hair and of satisfying [herself]90-marianne , beyond all doubt , that it was exactly the shade of [her]90-marianne own . [Edward]98-edward ’s embarrassment lasted some time , and it ended in an absence of mind still more settled . [He]1034-his was particularly grave the whole morning . [Marianne]90-marianne severely censured [herself]90-marianne for what [she]90-marianne had said ; but [her]90-marianne own forgiveness might have been more speedy , had [she]90-marianne known how little offence it had given [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister . Before the middle of the day , [they]1035-their were visited by [Sir John]99-sir john and [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , who , having heard of the arrival of [a gentleman]985-a gentleman at [the cottage]507-the cottage , came to take a survey of [the guest]1040-the guest . With the assistance of [[his]99-sir john mother - in - law]300-his mother - in - law , [Sir John]99-sir john was not long in discovering that the name of [Ferrars]98-edward began with an F. and this prepared a future mine of raillery against [the devoted Elinor]89-elinor , which nothing but the newness of [their]1035-their acquaintance with [Edward]98-edward could have prevented from being immediately sprung . But , as it was , [she]90-marianne only learned , from some very significant looks , how far [their]1035-their penetration , founded on [Margaret]91-margaret ’s instructions , extended . [Sir John]99-sir john never came to [the Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods without either inviting [them]1035-their to dine at [the park]566-the park the next day , or to drink tea with [them]1035-their that evening . On the present occasion , for the better entertainment of [[their]1035-their visitor]1005-their visitor , towards whose amusement [he]99-sir john felt [himself]99-sir john bound to contribute , [he]99-sir john wished to engage [them]1035-their for both . “ [You]103-mrs. jennings _ must _ drink tea with [us]1035-their to night , ”[99-sir john] said [he]99-sir john , “ for [we]1035-their shall be quite alone — and tomorrow [you]103-mrs. jennings must absolutely dine with [us]1035-their , for [we]1035-their shall be [a large party]3210-a large party . ”[99-sir john] [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings enforced the necessity . “ And who knows but [you]99-sir john may raise a dance , ”[103-mrs. jennings] said [she]103-mrs. jennings . “ And that will tempt _ [you]99-sir john _ , [Miss Marianne]90-marianne . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ A dance ! ”[90-marianne] cried [Marianne]90-marianne . “ Impossible ! Who is to dance ? ”[90-marianne] “ Who ! why [yourselves]99-sir john , and [the Careys]117-the careys , and [Whitakers]125-whitakers to be sure.—What ! [you]99-sir john thought [nobody]2922-nobody could dance because [a certain person that shall be nameless]3212-a certain person that shall be nameless is gone ! ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ [I]99-sir john wish with all [my]99-sir john soul , ”[99-sir john] cried [Sir John]99-sir john , “ that [Willoughby]107-willoughby were among [us]3213-us again . ”[99-sir john] This , and [Marianne]90-marianne ’s blushing , gave new suspicions to [Edward]98-edward . “ And who is [Willoughby]107-willoughby ? ”[99-sir john] said [he]99-sir john , in a low voice , to [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood , by whom [he]99-sir john was sitting . [She]84-miss dashwood gave [him]99-sir john a brief reply . [Marianne]90-marianne ’s countenance was more communicative . [Edward]98-edward saw enough to comprehend , not only the meaning of others , but such of [Marianne]90-marianne ’s expressions as had puzzled [him]99-sir john before ; and when [[their]1044-their visitors]691-their visitors left [them]1044-their , [he]99-sir john went immediately round [her]90-marianne , and said , in a whisper , “ [I]99-sir john have been guessing . Shall [I]99-sir john tell [you]90-marianne [my]99-sir john guess ? ”[99-sir john] “ What do [you]99-sir john mean ? ”[99-sir john] “ Shall [I]99-sir john tell [you]99-sir john ? ”[99-sir john] “ Certainly . ”[99-sir john] “ Well then ; [I]90-marianne guess that [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby hunts . ”[90-marianne] [Marianne]90-marianne was surprised and confused , yet [she]90-marianne could not help smiling at the quiet archness of [his]99-sir john manner , and after a moment ’s silence , said , “ Oh , [Edward]98-edward ! How can you?—But the time will come [I]90-marianne hope ... [I]90-marianne am sure [you]98-edward will like [him]107-willoughby . ”[90-marianne] “ [I]99-sir john do not doubt it , ”[99-sir john] replied [he]99-sir john , rather astonished at [her]90-marianne earnestness and warmth ; for had [he]99-sir john not imagined it to be a joke for the good of [her]90-marianne acquaintance in general , founded only on a something or a nothing between [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby and [herself]90-marianne , [he]99-sir john would not have ventured to mention it . CHAPTER XIX . [Edward]98-edward remained a week at [the cottage]507-the cottage ; [he]99-sir john was earnestly pressed by [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood to stay longer ; but , as if [he]99-sir john were bent only on self - mortification , [he]99-sir john seemed resolved to be gone when [his]99-sir john enjoyment among [[his]99-sir john friends]2872-his friends was at the height . [His]99-sir john spirits , during the last two or three days , though still very unequal , were greatly improved — [he]99-sir john grew more and more partial to [the house]318-the house and environs — never spoke of going away without a sigh — declared [his]99-sir john time to be wholly disengaged — even doubted to what place [he]99-sir john should go when [he]99-sir john left [them]1049-them — but still , go [he]99-sir john must . Never had any week passed so quickly — [he]99-sir john could hardly believe it to be gone . [He]99-sir john said so repeatedly ; other things [he]99-sir john said too , which marked the turn of [his]99-sir john feelings and gave the lie to [his]99-sir john actions . [He]99-sir john had no pleasure at [Norland]3-norland ; [he]99-sir john detested being in [town]2984-town ; but either to [Norland]3-norland or [London]24-london , [he]99-sir john must go . [He]99-sir john valued [their]1051-their kindness beyond any thing , and [his]99-sir john greatest happiness was in being with [them]1051-their . Yet , [he]99-sir john must leave [them]1051-their at the end of a week , in spite of [their]1051-their wishes and [his]99-sir john own , and without any restraint on [his]99-sir john time . [Elinor]89-elinor placed all that was astonishing in this way of acting to [[his]99-sir john mother]270-his mother ’s account ; and it was happy for [her]89-elinor that [he]99-sir john had [a mother whose character was so imperfectly known to [her]89-elinor , as to be the general excuse for every thing strange on the part of [[her]270-his mother son]1054-her son]1053-a mother whose character was so imperfectly known to her , as to be the general excuse for every thing strange on the part of her son . Disappointed , however , and vexed as [she]89-elinor was , and sometimes displeased with [his]99-sir john uncertain behaviour to [herself]89-elinor , [she]89-elinor was very well disposed on the whole to regard [his]99-sir john actions with all the candid allowances and generous qualifications , which had been rather more painfully extorted from [her]89-elinor , for [Willoughby]107-willoughby ’s service , by [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother . [His]99-sir john want of spirits , of openness , and of consistency , were most usually attributed to [his]99-sir john want of independence , and [his]99-sir john better knowledge of [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward ’s disposition and designs . The shortness of [his]99-sir john visit , the steadiness of [his]99-sir john purpose in leaving [them]1056-them , originated in the same fettered inclination , the same inevitable necessity of temporizing with [[his]99-sir john mother]270-his mother . The old well - established grievance of duty against will , [parent]1058-parent against [child]1059-child , was the cause of all . [She]332-her mother would have been glad to know when these difficulties were to cease , this opposition was to yield,—when [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward would be reformed , and [[her]98-edward son]1054-her son be at liberty to be happy . But from such vain wishes [she]332-her mother was forced to turn for comfort to the renewal of [her]332-her mother confidence in [Edward]98-edward ’s affection , to the remembrance of every mark of regard in look or word which fell from [him]99-sir john while at [Barton]8-barton , and above all to that flattering proof of it which [he]99-sir john constantly wore round [his]99-sir john finger . “ [I]88-mrs. dashwood think , [Edward]98-edward , ”[88-mrs. dashwood] said [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood , as [they]1061-they were at breakfast the last morning , “ [you]98-edward would be [a happier man]3214-a happier man if [you]98-edward had any profession to engage [your]98-edward time and give an interest to [your]98-edward plans and actions . Some inconvenience to [[your]98-edward friends]3215-your friends , indeed , might result from it — [you]98-edward would not be able to give [them]3215-your friends so much of [your]98-edward time . But ( with a smile ) [you]98-edward would be materially benefited in one particular at least — [you]98-edward would know where to go when [you]98-edward left [them]3215-your friends . ”[88-mrs. dashwood] “ [I]1062-i do assure [you]88-mrs. dashwood , ”[1062-i] [he]1062-i replied , “ that [I]1062-i have long thought on this point , as [you]88-mrs. dashwood think now . It has been , and is , and probably will always be a heavy misfortune to [me]1062-i , that [I]1062-i have had no necessary business to engage [me]1062-i , no profession to give [me]1062-i employment , or afford [me]1062-i any thing like independence . But unfortunately [my]1062-i own nicety , and the nicety of [[my]1062-i friends]2850-my friends , have made [me]1062-i what [I]1062-i am , [an idle , helpless being]3217-an idle , helpless being . [We]3218-we never could agree in [our]3218-we choice of a profession . [I]1062-i always preferred [the church]3037-the church , as [I]1062-i still do . But that was not smart enough for [[my]1062-i family]3220-my family . [They]3220-my family recommended [the army]3221-the army . That was a great deal too smart for [me]1062-i . The law was allowed to be genteel enough ; [many young men]3222-many young men , who had chambers in [the Temple]3223-the temple , made a very good appearance in the first circles , and drove about [town]2984-town in very knowing gigs . But [I]1062-i had no inclination for the law , even in this less abstruse study of it , which [[my]1062-i family]3220-my family approved . As for [the navy]3226-the navy , it had fashion on [its]3226-the navy side , but [I]1062-i was too old when the subject was first started to enter it — and , at length , as there was no necessity for [my]1062-i having any profession at all , as [I]1062-i might be as dashing and expensive without a red coat on [my]1062-i back as with one , idleness was pronounced on the whole to be most advantageous and honourable , and [a young man of eighteen]3227-a young man of eighteen is not in general so earnestly bent on being busy as to resist the solicitations of [[his]3227-a young man of eighteen friends]2872-his friends to do nothing . [I]1062-i was therefore entered at [Oxford]29-oxford and have been properly idle ever since . ”[1062-i] “ The consequence of which , [I]88-mrs. dashwood suppose , will be , ”[88-mrs. dashwood] said [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood , “ since leisure has not promoted [your]1063-your own happiness , that [[your]1063-your sons]3229-your sons will be brought up to as many pursuits , employments , professions , and trades as Columella ’s . ”[88-mrs. dashwood] “ [They]3229-your sons will be brought up , ”[1063-your] said [he]1063-your , in a serious accent , “ to be as unlike [myself]1063-your as is possible . In feeling , in action , in condition , in every thing . ”[1063-your] “ Come , come ; this is all an effusion of immediate want of spirits , [Edward]98-edward . [You]98-edward are in a melancholy humour , and fancy that [any one unlike [yourself]98-edward]3230-any one unlike yourself must be happy . But remember that the pain of parting from [friends]3231-friends will be felt by every body at times , whatever be [their]3231-friends education or state . Know [your]98-edward own happiness . [You]98-edward want nothing but patience — or give it a more fascinating name , call it hope . [[Your]98-edward mother]2781-your mother will secure to [you]98-edward , in time , that independence [you]98-edward are so anxious for ; it is [her]2781-your mother duty , and it will , it must ere long become [her]2781-your mother happiness to prevent [[your]98-edward whole youth]3233-your whole youth from being wasted in discontent . How much may not a few months do ? ”[88-mrs. dashwood] “ [I]98-edward think , ”[98-edward] replied [Edward]98-edward , “ that [I]98-edward may defy many months to produce any good to [me]98-edward . ”[98-edward] This desponding turn of mind , though it could not be communicated to [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood , gave additional pain to [them]1064-them all in the parting , which shortly took place , and left an uncomfortable impression on [Elinor]89-elinor ’s feelings especially , which required some trouble and time to subdue . But as it was [her]89-elinor determination to subdue it , and to prevent [herself]89-elinor from appearing to suffer more than what all [[her]89-elinor family]391-her family suffered on [his]1066-his going away , [she]89-elinor did not adopt the method so judiciously employed by [Marianne]90-marianne , on a similar occasion , to augment and fix [her]89-elinor sorrow , by seeking silence , solitude and idleness . [Their]1067-their means were as different as [their]1067-their objects , and equally suited to the advancement of each . [Elinor]89-elinor sat down to [her]89-elinor drawing - table as soon as [he]1066-his was out of [the house]318-the house , busily employed [herself]89-elinor the whole day , neither sought nor avoided the mention of [his]1066-his name , appeared to interest [herself]89-elinor almost as much as ever in the general concerns of [the family]303-the family , and if , by this conduct , [she]89-elinor did not lessen [her]89-elinor own grief , it was at least prevented from unnecessary increase , and [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother and [sisters]301-sisters were spared much solicitude on [her]89-elinor account . Such behaviour as this , so exactly the reverse of [her]89-elinor own , appeared no more meritorious to [Marianne]90-marianne , than [her]89-elinor own had seemed faulty to [her]89-elinor . The business of self - command [she]89-elinor settled very easily;—with strong affections it was impossible , with calm ones it could have no merit . That [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister ’s affections _ were _ calm , [she]89-elinor dared not deny , though [she]89-elinor blushed to acknowledge it ; and of the strength of [her]89-elinor own , [she]89-elinor gave a very striking proof , by still loving and respecting [that sister]1073-that sister , in spite of this mortifying conviction . Without shutting [herself]89-elinor up from [[her]89-elinor family]391-her family , or leaving [the house]318-the house in determined solitude to avoid [them]391-her family , or lying awake the whole night to indulge meditation , [Elinor]89-elinor found every day afforded [her]89-elinor leisure enough to think of [Edward]98-edward , and of [Edward]98-edward ’s behaviour , in every possible variety which the different state of [her]89-elinor spirits at different times could produce,—with tenderness , pity , approbation , censure , and doubt . There were moments in abundance , when , if not by the absence of [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother and [sisters]301-sisters , at least by the nature of [their]391-her family employments , conversation was forbidden among [them]391-her family , and every effect of solitude was produced . [Her]89-elinor mind was inevitably at liberty ; [her]89-elinor thoughts could not be chained elsewhere ; and the past and the future , on a subject so interesting , must be before [her]89-elinor , must force [her]89-elinor attention , and engross [her]89-elinor memory , [her]89-elinor reflection , and [her]89-elinor fancy . From a reverie of this kind , as [she]89-elinor sat at [her]89-elinor drawing - table , [she]89-elinor was roused one morning , soon after [Edward]98-edward ’s leaving [them]391-her family , by the arrival of [company]1078-company . [She]89-elinor happened to be quite alone . The closing of the little gate , at the entrance of [the green court in front of [the house]318-the house]1079-the green court in front of the house , drew [her]89-elinor eyes to the window , and [she]89-elinor saw a large party walking up to the door . Amongst [them]391-her family were [Sir John]99-sir john and [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton and [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , but there were [two others]1081-two others , [a gentleman]985-a gentleman and [lady]1083-lady , who were quite unknown to [her]89-elinor . [She]89-elinor was sitting near the window , and as soon as [Sir John]99-sir john perceived [her]89-elinor , [he]99-sir john left the rest of [the party]577-the party to the ceremony of knocking at the door , and stepping across the turf , obliged [her]89-elinor to open the casement to speak to [him]99-sir john , though the space was so short between the door and the window , as to make it hardly possible to speak at one without being heard at the other . “ Well , ”[99-sir john] said [he]99-sir john , “ [we]3234-we have brought [you]89-elinor [some strangers]3235-some strangers . How do [you]89-elinor like [them]3235-some strangers ? ”[99-sir john] “ Hush ! [they]3235-some strangers will hear [you]89-elinor . ”[89-elinor] “ Never mind if [they]3235-some strangers do . It is only [the Palmers]126-the palmers . [Charlotte]127-charlotte is very pretty , [I]89-elinor can tell [you]89-elinor . [You]89-elinor may see [her]127-charlotte if [you]89-elinor look this way . ”[89-elinor] As [Elinor]89-elinor was certain of seeing [her]89-elinor in a couple of minutes , without taking that liberty , [she]89-elinor begged to be excused . “ Where is [Marianne]90-marianne ? Has [she]90-marianne run away because [we]1085-we are come ? [I]89-elinor see [her]90-marianne instrument is open . ”[89-elinor] “ [She]90-marianne is walking , [I]1085-we believe . ”[1085-we] [They]1085-we were now joined by [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , who had not patience enough to wait till the door was opened before [she]103-mrs. jennings told _ [her]103-mrs. jennings _ story . [She]103-mrs. jennings came hallooing to the window , “ How do [you]89-elinor do , [[my]103-mrs. jennings dear]2750-my dear ? How does [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood do ? And where are [[your]89-elinor sisters]2753-your sisters ? What ! all alone ! [you]89-elinor will be glad of [a little company]3238-a little company to sit with [you]89-elinor . [I]103-mrs. jennings have brought [[my]103-mrs. jennings other son]3239-my other son and [daughter]3240-daughter to see [you]89-elinor . Only think of [their]1085-we coming so suddenly ! [I]103-mrs. jennings thought [I]103-mrs. jennings heard [a carriage]3157-a carriage last night , while [we]3242-we were drinking [our]3242-we tea , but it never entered [my]103-mrs. jennings head that it could be [them]1085-we . [I]103-mrs. jennings thought of nothing but whether it might not be [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon come back again ; so [I]103-mrs. jennings said to [Sir John]99-sir john , [I]103-mrs. jennings do think [I]103-mrs. jennings hear [a carriage]3157-a carriage ; perhaps it is [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon come back again — ”[103-mrs. jennings] [Elinor]89-elinor was obliged to turn from [her]89-elinor , in the middle of [her]89-elinor story , to receive the rest of [the party]577-the party ; [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton introduced [the two strangers]1087-the two strangers ; [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood and [Margaret]91-margaret came down [stairs]933-stairs at the same time , and [they]1087-the two strangers all sat down to look at [one another]1089-one another , while [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings continued [her]103-mrs. jennings story as [she]103-mrs. jennings walked through [the passage]2862-the passage into [the parlour]726-the parlour , attended by [Sir John]99-sir john . [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer was several years younger than [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton , and totally unlike [her]100-lady middleton in every respect . [She]128-mrs. palmer was short and plump , had a very pretty face , and the finest expression of good humour in it that could possibly be . [Her]128-mrs. palmer manners were by no means so elegant as [[her]128-mrs. palmer sister]336-her sister ’s , but they were much more prepossessing . [She]128-mrs. palmer came in with a smile , smiled all the time of [her]128-mrs. palmer visit , except when [she]128-mrs. palmer laughed , and smiled when [she]128-mrs. palmer went away . [[Her]128-mrs. palmer husband]319-her husband was [a grave looking young man of five or six and twenty]1094-a grave looking young man of five or six and twenty , with an air of more fashion and sense than [[his]319-her husband wife]280-his wife , but of less willingness to please or be pleased . [He]319-her husband entered [the room]2842-the room with a look of self - consequence , slightly bowed to [the ladies]572-the ladies , without speaking a word , and , after briefly surveying [them]572-the ladies and [[their]572-the ladies apartments]1098-their apartments , took up a newspaper from the table , and continued to read it as long as [he]319-her husband staid . [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer , on the contrary , who was strongly endowed by nature with a turn for being uniformly civil and happy , was hardly seated before [her]128-mrs. palmer admiration of [the parlour]726-the parlour and every thing in [it]726-the parlour burst forth . “ Well ! what [a delightful room]3244-a delightful room this is ! [I]129-mr. palmer never saw anything so charming ! Only think , [Mama]95-mama , how it is improved since [I]129-mr. palmer was [here]2861-here last ! [I]129-mr. palmer always thought it such a sweet place , [ma’am]2974-ma’am ! ( turning to [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood ) but [you]88-mrs. dashwood have made it so charming ! Only look , [sister]438-sister , how delightful every thing is ! How [I]129-mr. palmer should like such [a house]479-a house for [myself]129-mr. palmer ! Should not [you]88-mrs. dashwood , [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer ? ”[129-mr. palmer] [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer made [her]128-mrs. palmer no answer , and did not even raise [his]129-mr. palmer eyes from the newspaper . “ [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer does not hear [me]128-mrs. palmer , ”[128-mrs. palmer] said [she]128-mrs. palmer , laughing ; “ [he]129-mr. palmer never does sometimes . It is so ridiculous ! ”[128-mrs. palmer] This was quite a new idea to [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood ; [she]88-mrs. dashwood had never been used to find wit in the inattention of [any one]659-any one , and could not help looking with surprise at [them]1101-their both . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , in the meantime , talked on as loud as [she]103-mrs. jennings could , and continued [her]103-mrs. jennings account of [their]1101-their surprise , the evening before , on seeing [[their]1101-their friends]836-their friends , without ceasing till every thing was told . [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer laughed heartily at the recollection of [their]1101-their astonishment , and [every body]581-every body agreed , two or three times over , that it had been quite an agreeable surprise . “ [You]128-mrs. palmer may believe how glad [we]1101-their all were to see [them]1101-their , ”[103-mrs. jennings] added [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , leaning forward towards [Elinor]89-elinor , and speaking in a low voice as if [she]103-mrs. jennings meant to be heard by [no one else]1104-no one else , though [they]1101-their were seated on different sides of [the room]2842-the room ; “ but , however , [I]103-mrs. jennings ca n’t help wishing [they]1101-their had not travelled quite so fast , nor made such a long journey of it , for [they]1101-their came all round by [London]24-london upon account of some business , for [you]128-mrs. palmer know ( nodding significantly and pointing to [[her]103-mrs. jennings daughter]404-her daughter ) it was wrong in [her]103-mrs. jennings situation . [I]103-mrs. jennings wanted [her]103-mrs. jennings to stay at [home]565-home and rest this morning , but [she]103-mrs. jennings would come with [us]1101-their ; [she]103-mrs. jennings longed so much to see [you]128-mrs. palmer all ! ”[103-mrs. jennings] [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer laughed , and said it would not do [her]128-mrs. palmer any harm . “ [She]103-mrs. jennings expects to be confined in [February]30-february , ”[103-mrs. jennings] continued [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings . [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton could no longer endure such a conversation , and therefore exerted [herself]100-lady middleton to ask [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer if there was any news in the paper . “ No , none at all , ”[129-mr. palmer] [he]129-mr. palmer replied , and read on . “ Here comes [Marianne]90-marianne , ”[99-sir john] cried [Sir John]99-sir john . “ Now , [Palmer]129-mr. palmer , [you]129-mr. palmer shall see [a monstrous pretty girl]3251-a monstrous pretty girl . ”[129-mr. palmer] [He]129-mr. palmer immediately went into [the passage]2862-the passage , opened the front door , and ushered [her]100-lady middleton in [himself]129-mr. palmer . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings asked [her]100-lady middleton , as soon as [she]100-lady middleton appeared , if [she]100-lady middleton had not been to [Allenham]12-allenham ; and [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer laughed so heartily at the question , as to show [she]128-mrs. palmer understood it . [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer looked up on [her]100-lady middleton entering [the room]2842-the room , stared at [her]100-lady middleton some minutes , and then returned to [his]129-mr. palmer newspaper . [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer ’s eye was now caught by the drawings which hung round [the room]2842-the room . [She]128-mrs. palmer got up to examine them . “ Oh ! dear , how beautiful these are ! Well ! how delightful ! Do but look , [mama]2826-mama , how sweet ! [I]128-mrs. palmer declare they are quite charming ; [I]128-mrs. palmer could look at them for ever . ”[128-mrs. palmer] And then sitting down again , [she]128-mrs. palmer very soon forgot that there were any such things in [the room]2842-the room . When [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton rose to go away , [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer rose also , laid down the newspaper , stretched [himself]129-mr. palmer and looked at [them]1110-them all around . “ [[My]280-his wife love]2785-my love , have [you]2785-my love been asleep ? ”[280-his wife] said [[his]129-mr. palmer wife]280-his wife , laughing . [He]129-mr. palmer made [her]100-lady middleton no answer ; and only observed , after again examining [the room]2842-the room , that [it]2842-the room was very low pitched , and that the ceiling was crooked . [He]129-mr. palmer then made [his]129-mr. palmer bow , and departed with [the rest]864-the rest . [Sir John]99-sir john had been very urgent with [them]1110-them all to spend the next day at [the park]566-the park . [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood , who did not chuse to dine with [them]1110-them oftener than [they]1110-them dined at [the cottage]507-the cottage , absolutely refused on [her]88-mrs. dashwood own account ; [[her]88-mrs. dashwood daughters]294-her daughters might do as [they]294-her daughters pleased . But [they]1110-them had no curiosity to see how [Mr.]1117-mr. and [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer ate [their]1110-them dinner , and no expectation of pleasure from [them]1110-them in any other way . [They]1110-them attempted , therefore , likewise , to excuse [themselves]1110-them ; the weather was uncertain , and not likely to be good . But [Sir John]99-sir john would not be satisfied — [the carriage]1118-the carriage should be sent for [them]1110-them and [they]1110-them must come . [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton too , though [she]100-lady middleton did not press [[their]1110-them mother]274-their mother , pressed [them]1110-them . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings and [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer joined [their]1110-them entreaties , [all]1120-all seemed equally anxious to avoid a family party ; and [the young ladies]628-the young ladies were obliged to yield . “ Why should [they]1110-them ask [us]628-the young ladies ? ”[90-marianne] said [Marianne]90-marianne , as soon as [they]1110-them were gone . “ The rent of [this cottage]3057-this cottage is said to be low ; but [we]628-the young ladies have it on very hard terms , if [we]628-the young ladies are to dine at [the park]566-the park whenever [any one]659-any one is staying either with [them]1110-them , or with [us]628-the young ladies . ”[90-marianne] “ [They]1110-them mean no less to be civil and kind to [us]628-the young ladies now , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor , “ by these frequent invitations , than by those which [we]628-the young ladies received from [them]1110-them a few weeks ago . The alteration is not in [them]1110-them , if [their]1110-them parties are grown tedious and dull . [We]628-the young ladies must look for the change elsewhere . ”[89-elinor] [CHAPTER XX]130-chapter xx . As [the Miss Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods entered [the drawing - room of [the park]566-the park]1122-the drawing - room of the park the next day , at one door , [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer came running in at the other , looking as good humoured and merry as before . [She]128-mrs. palmer took [them]1124-you all most affectionately by the hand , and expressed great delight in seeing [them]1124-you again . “ [I]128-mrs. palmer am so glad to see [you]1124-you ! ”[128-mrs. palmer] said [she]128-mrs. palmer , seating [herself]128-mrs. palmer between [Elinor]89-elinor and [Marianne]90-marianne , “ for it is so bad a day [I]128-mrs. palmer was afraid [you]1124-you might not come , which would be a shocking thing , as [we]628-the young ladies go away again tomorrow . [We]628-the young ladies must go , for [the Westons]131-the westons come to [us]628-the young ladies next week [you]1124-you know . It was quite a sudden thing [our]628-the young ladies coming at all , and [I]128-mrs. palmer knew nothing of it till [the carriage]1118-the carriage was coming to the door , and then [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer asked [me]128-mrs. palmer if [I]128-mrs. palmer would go with [him]129-mr. palmer to [Barton]8-barton . [He]129-mr. palmer is so droll ! [He]129-mr. palmer never tells [me]128-mrs. palmer any thing ! [I]128-mrs. palmer am so sorry [we]628-the young ladies can not stay longer ; however [we]628-the young ladies shall meet again in [town]2984-town very soon , [I]128-mrs. palmer hope . ”[128-mrs. palmer] [They]1125-you were obliged to put an end to such an expectation . “ Not go to [town]2984-town ! ”[128-mrs. palmer] cried [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer , with a laugh , “ [I]128-mrs. palmer shall be quite disappointed if [you]1125-you do not . [I]128-mrs. palmer could get [the nicest house in [the world]2778-the world]3260-the nicest house in the world for [you]1125-you , next door to [ours]628-the young ladies , in [Hanover - square]31-hanover - square . [You]1125-you must come , indeed . [I]128-mrs. palmer am sure [I]128-mrs. palmer shall be very happy to chaperon [you]1125-you at any time till [I]128-mrs. palmer am confined , if [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood should not like to go into public . ”[128-mrs. palmer] [They]1125-you thanked [her]128-mrs. palmer ; but were obliged to resist all [her]128-mrs. palmer entreaties . “ Oh , [[my]128-mrs. palmer love]2785-my love , ”[128-mrs. palmer] cried [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer to [[her]128-mrs. palmer husband]319-her husband , who just then entered the room—“you must help [me]128-mrs. palmer to persuade [the Miss Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods to go to [town]2984-town this winter . ”[128-mrs. palmer] [Her]128-mrs. palmer love made no answer ; and after slightly bowing to [the ladies]572-the ladies , began complaining of the weather . “ How horrid all this is ! ”[319-her husband] said [he]319-her husband . “ Such weather makes every thing and every body disgusting . Dullness is as much produced within doors as without , by rain . It makes [one detest all one]3264-one detest all one ’s acquaintance . What the devil does [Sir John]99-sir john mean by not having [a billiard room]3265-a billiard room in [[his]99-sir john house]515-his house ? How [few people]3267-few people know what comfort is ! [Sir John]99-sir john is as stupid as the weather . ”[319-her husband] [The rest of [the company]845-the company]1128-the rest of the company soon dropt in . “ [I]99-sir john am afraid , [Miss Marianne]90-marianne , ”[99-sir john] said [Sir John]99-sir john , “ [you]90-marianne have not been able to take [your]90-marianne usual walk to [Allenham]12-allenham today . ”[99-sir john] [Marianne]90-marianne looked very grave and said nothing . “ Oh , do n’t be so sly before [us]3268-we , ”[128-mrs. palmer] said [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer ; “ for [we]3268-we know all about it , [I]128-mrs. palmer assure [you]90-marianne ; and [I]128-mrs. palmer admire [your]90-marianne taste very much , for [I]128-mrs. palmer think [he]99-sir john is extremely handsome . [We]3268-we do not live a great way from [him]99-sir john in [the country]612-the country , [you]90-marianne know . Not above ten miles , [I]128-mrs. palmer dare say . ”[128-mrs. palmer] “ Much nearer thirty , ”[319-her husband] said [[her]128-mrs. palmer husband]319-her husband . “ Ah , well ! there is not much difference . [I]319-her husband never was at [[his]99-sir john house]515-his house ; but [they]3271-they say it is a sweet pretty place . ”[319-her husband] “ As vile a spot as [I]129-mr. palmer ever saw in [my]129-mr. palmer life , ”[129-mr. palmer] said [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer . [Marianne]90-marianne remained perfectly silent , though [her]90-marianne countenance betrayed [her]90-marianne interest in what was said . “ Is it very ugly ? ”[132-mrs. palmer—“then] continued [Mrs. Palmer—“then]132-mrs. palmer—“then it must be some other place that is so pretty [I]132-mrs. palmer—“then suppose . ”[132-mrs. palmer—“then] When [they]1131-they were seated in [the dining room]1132-the dining room , [Sir John]99-sir john observed with regret that [they]1131-they were only eight all together . “ [[My]99-sir john dear]2750-my dear , ”[99-sir john] said [he]99-sir john to [[his]99-sir john lady]593-his lady , “ it is very provoking that [we]1131-they should be so few . Why did not [you]99-sir john ask [the Gilberts]133-the gilberts to come to [us]1131-they today ? ”[99-sir john] “ Did not [I]99-sir john tell [you]99-sir john , [Sir John]99-sir john , when [you]99-sir john spoke to [me]99-sir john about it before , that it could not be done ? [They]1131-they dined with [us]1131-they last . ”[99-sir john] “ [You]129-mr. palmer and [I]103-mrs. jennings , [Sir John]99-sir john , ”[103-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , “ should not stand upon such ceremony . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ Then [you]129-mr. palmer would be very ill - bred , ”[129-mr. palmer] cried [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer . “ [My]280-his wife love [you]129-mr. palmer contradict every body , ”[280-his wife] said [[his]129-mr. palmer wife]280-his wife with [her]280-his wife usual laugh . “ Do [you]129-mr. palmer know that [you]129-mr. palmer are quite rude ? ”[280-his wife] “ [I]103-mrs. jennings did not know [I]103-mrs. jennings contradicted any body in calling [[your]129-mr. palmer mother]2781-your mother ill - bred . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ Ay , [you]129-mr. palmer may abuse [me]1135-the good - natured old lady as [you]129-mr. palmer please , ”[1135-the good - natured old lady] said [the good - natured old lady]1135-the good - natured old lady , “ [you]129-mr. palmer have taken [Charlotte]127-charlotte off [my]1135-the good - natured old lady hands , and can not give [her]127-charlotte back again . So there [I]1135-the good - natured old lady have the whip hand of [you]129-mr. palmer . ”[1135-the good - natured old lady] [Charlotte]127-charlotte laughed heartily to think that [[her]127-charlotte husband]319-her husband could not get rid of [her]127-charlotte ; and exultingly said , [she]127-charlotte did not care how cross [he]319-her husband was to [her]127-charlotte , as [they]1137-they must live together . It was impossible for [any one]659-any one to be more thoroughly good - natured , or more determined to be happy than [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer . The studied indifference , insolence , and discontent of [[her]127-charlotte husband]319-her husband gave [her]127-charlotte no pain ; and when [he]319-her husband scolded or abused [her]127-charlotte , [she]127-charlotte was highly diverted . “ [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer is so droll ! ”[127-charlotte] said [she]127-charlotte , in a whisper , to [Elinor]89-elinor . “ [He]319-her husband is always out of humour . ”[127-charlotte] [Elinor]89-elinor was not inclined , after a little observation , to give [him]319-her husband credit for being so genuinely and unaffectedly ill - natured or ill - bred as [he]319-her husband wished to appear . [His]319-her husband temper might perhaps be a little soured by finding , like many others of [his]319-her husband sex , that through some unaccountable bias in favour of beauty , [he]319-her husband was [the husband of [a very silly woman]1141-a very silly woman]1140-the husband of a very silly woman — but [she]89-elinor knew that this kind of blunder was too common for [any sensible man]1142-any sensible man to be lastingly hurt by it . It was rather a wish of distinction , [she]89-elinor believed , which produced [his]319-her husband contemptuous treatment of every body , and [his]319-her husband general abuse of every thing before [him]319-her husband . It was the desire of appearing superior to [other people]2834-other people . The motive was too common to be wondered at ; but the means , however [they]1144-they might succeed by establishing [his]319-her husband superiority in ill - breeding , were not likely to attach any one to [him]319-her husband except [[his]319-her husband wife]280-his wife . “ Oh , [[my]128-mrs. palmer dear]2750-my dear [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood , ”[128-mrs. palmer] said [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer soon afterwards , “ [I]128-mrs. palmer have got such a favour to ask of [you]84-miss dashwood and [[your]84-miss dashwood sister]2815-your sister . Will [you]84-miss dashwood come and spend some time at [Cleveland]32-cleveland this Christmas ? Now , pray do,—and come while [the Westons]131-the westons are with [us]3276-us . [You]84-miss dashwood can not think how happy [I]128-mrs. palmer shall be ! It will be quite delightful!—My love , ”[128-mrs. palmer] applying to [[her]280-his wife husband]319-her husband , “ do n’t [you]319-her husband long to have [the Miss Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods come to [Cleveland]32-cleveland ? ”[128-mrs. palmer] “ Certainly , ”[319-her husband] [he]319-her husband replied , with a sneer—“I came into [Devonshire]5-devonshire with no other view . ”[128-mrs. palmer] “ There now,”—said[128-mrs. palmer] [[his]319-her husband lady]593-his lady , “ [you]84-miss dashwood see [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer expects [you]84-miss dashwood ; so [you]84-miss dashwood can not refuse to come . ”[319-her husband] [They]1148-us both eagerly and resolutely declined [her]280-his wife invitation . “ But indeed [you]84-miss dashwood must and shall come . [I]89-elinor am sure [you]84-miss dashwood will like it of all things . [The Westons]131-the westons will be with [us]1148-us , and it will be quite delightful . [You]84-miss dashwood can not think what [a sweet place]3277-a sweet place [Cleveland]32-cleveland is ; and [we]1148-us are so gay now , for [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer is always going about [the country]612-the country canvassing against the election ; and [so many people]3279-so many people came to dine with [us]1148-us that [I]89-elinor never saw before , it is quite charming ! But , [poor fellow]3280-poor fellow ! it is very fatiguing to [him]129-mr. palmer ! for [he]129-mr. palmer is forced to make every body like [him]129-mr. palmer . ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor could hardly keep [her]89-elinor countenance as [she]89-elinor assented to the hardship of such an obligation . “ How charming it will be , ”[127-charlotte] said [Charlotte]127-charlotte , “ when [he]129-mr. palmer is in Parliament!—won’t it ? This is always the way with [him]129-mr. palmer ! Sometimes [he]129-mr. palmer wo n’t speak to [me]127-charlotte for half a day together , and then [he]129-mr. palmer comes out with something so droll — all about any thing in [the world]2778-the world . ”[127-charlotte] [She]127-charlotte surprised [Elinor]89-elinor very much as [they]1149-they returned into [the drawing - room]1150-the drawing - room , by asking [her]89-elinor whether [she]89-elinor did not like [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer excessively . “ Certainly , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor ; “ [he]129-mr. palmer seems very agreeable . ”[89-elinor] “ Well — [I]89-elinor am so glad [you]89-elinor do . [She]89-elinor thought it probable that as [they]1151-they lived in [the same county]1000-the same county , [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer might be able to give some more particular account of [Willoughby]107-willoughby ’s general character , than could be gathered from [the Middletons]102-the middletons ’ partial acquaintance with [him]107-willoughby ; and [she]89-elinor was eager to gain from any one , such a confirmation of [his]107-willoughby merits as might remove the possibility of fear from [Marianne]90-marianne . [She]89-elinor began by inquiring if [they]1151-they saw much of [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby at [Cleveland]32-cleveland , and whether [they]1151-they were intimately acquainted with [him]107-willoughby . “ Oh dear , yes ; [I]128-mrs. palmer know [him]107-willoughby extremely well , ”[134-mrs. palmer;—“not] replied [Mrs. Palmer;—“Not]134-mrs. palmer;—“not that [I]134-mrs. palmer;—“not ever spoke to [him]107-willoughby , indeed ; but [I]134-mrs. palmer;—“not have seen [him]107-willoughby for ever in [town]2984-town . [He]107-willoughby is very little at [Combe]135-combe , [I]134-mrs. palmer;—“not believe ; but if [he]107-willoughby were ever so much there , [I]134-mrs. palmer;—“not do not think [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer would visit [him]107-willoughby , for [he]107-willoughby is in [the opposition]3288-the opposition , [you]3289-you know , and besides it is such a way off . [Nobody]2922-nobody is more liked than [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby wherever [he]107-willoughby goes , and so [you]134-mrs. palmer;—“not may tell [[your]134-mrs. palmer;—“not sister]2815-your sister . [She]2815-your sister is [a monstrous lucky girl]3312-a monstrous lucky girl to get [him]107-willoughby , upon [my]89-elinor honour ; not but that [he]107-willoughby is much more lucky in getting [her]2815-your sister , because [she]2815-your sister is so very handsome and agreeable , that nothing can be good enough for [her]2815-your sister . However , [I]89-elinor do n’t think [her]2815-your sister hardly at all handsomer than [you]134-mrs. palmer;—“not , [I]89-elinor assure [you]134-mrs. palmer;—“not ; for [I]89-elinor think [you]134-mrs. palmer;—“not both excessively pretty , and so does [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer too [I]89-elinor am sure , though [we]3313-we could not get [him]129-mr. palmer to own [it]3314-it last night . ”[89-elinor] [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer ’s information respecting [Willoughby]107-willoughby was not very material ; but any testimony in [his]107-willoughby favour , however small , was pleasing to [her]128-mrs. palmer . “ [I]134-mrs. palmer;—“not am so glad [we]3313-we are got acquainted at last , ”[134-mrs. palmer;—“not] continued [Charlotte.—“And]136-charlotte.—“and now [I]89-elinor hope [we]3313-we shall always be [great friends]3315-great friends . [You]134-mrs. palmer;—“not ca n’t think how much [I]89-elinor longed to see [you]134-mrs. palmer;—“not ! It is so delightful that [you]134-mrs. palmer;—“not should live at [the cottage]507-the cottage ! Nothing can be like it , to be sure ! And [I]89-elinor am so glad [[your]134-mrs. palmer;—“not sister]2815-your sister is going to be well married ! [I]89-elinor hope [you]134-mrs. palmer;—“not will be a great deal at [Combe Magna]35-combe magna . [It]35-combe magna is [a sweet place]3277-a sweet place , by all accounts . ”[89-elinor] “ [You]1153-i have been long acquainted with [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon , have not [you]1153-i ? ”[89-elinor] “ Yes , a great while ; ever since [[my]1153-i sister]2818-my sister married . [He]104-colonel brandon was [a particular friend of [Sir John]99-sir john ’s]3320-a particular friend of sir john ’s . [Sir John]99-sir john and [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton wished it very much . But [mama]3321-mama did not think the match good enough for [me]1153-i , otherwise [Sir John]99-sir john would have mentioned it to [the Colonel]664-the colonel , and [we]3323-we should have been married immediately . ”[1153-i] “ Did not [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon know of [Sir John]99-sir john ’s proposal to [[your]1153-i mother]2781-your mother before it was made ? Had [he]104-colonel brandon never owned [his]104-colonel brandon affection to [yourself]1153-i ? ”[89-elinor] “ Oh , no ; but if [mama]2826-mama had not objected to it , [I]1153-i dare say [he]104-colonel brandon would have liked it of all things . [He]104-colonel brandon had not seen [me]1153-i then above twice , for it was before [I]1153-i left [school]3326-school . However , [I]1153-i am much happier as [I]1153-i am . [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer is [the kind of man [I]1153-i like]3327-the kind of man i like . ”[1153-i] CHAPTER XXI . [The Palmers]126-the palmers returned to [Cleveland]32-cleveland the next day , and [the two families]1154-the two families at [Barton]8-barton were again left to entertain [each other]338-each other . But this did not last long ; [Elinor]89-elinor had hardly got [their]1154-the two families last visitors out of [her]89-elinor head , had hardly done wondering at [Charlotte]127-charlotte ’s being so happy without a cause , at [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer ’s acting so simply , with good abilities , and at the strange unsuitableness which often existed between [husband]1156-husband and [wife]1157-wife , before [Sir John]99-sir john ’s and [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s active zeal in the cause of society , procured [her]89-elinor [some other new acquaintance to see and observe]1158-some other new acquaintance to see and observe . In a morning ’s excursion to [Exeter]10-exeter , [they]1154-the two families had met with [two young ladies , whom [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings had the satisfaction of discovering to be [[her]103-mrs. jennings relations]1160-her relations]1159-two young ladies , whom mrs. jennings had the satisfaction of discovering to be her relations , and this was enough for [Sir John]99-sir john to invite [them]1154-the two families directly to [the park]566-the park , as soon as [their]1154-the two families present engagements at [Exeter]10-exeter were over . [Their]1154-the two families engagements at [Exeter]10-exeter instantly gave way before such an invitation , and [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton was thrown into no little alarm on the return of [Sir John]99-sir john , by hearing that [she]100-lady middleton was very soon to receive a visit from [two girls whom [she]100-lady middleton had never seen in [her]100-lady middleton life]1162-two girls whom she had never seen in her life , and of whose elegance,—whose tolerable gentility even , [she]100-lady middleton could have no proof ; for the assurances of [[her]100-lady middleton husband]319-her husband and [mother]2803-mother on that subject went for nothing at all . [Their]1154-the two families being [[her]100-lady middleton relations]1160-her relations too made it so much the worse ; and [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s attempts at consolation were therefore unfortunately founded , when [she]103-mrs. jennings advised [[her]103-mrs. jennings daughter]404-her daughter not to care about [their]1154-the two families being so fashionable ; because [they]1154-the two families were [all cousins]1167-all cousins and must put up with [one another]1089-one another . As it was impossible , however , now to prevent [their]1154-the two families coming , [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton resigned [herself]100-lady middleton to the idea of it , with all the philosophy of [a well - bred woman]1169-a well - bred woman , contenting [herself]100-lady middleton with merely giving [[her]100-lady middleton husband]319-her husband a gentle reprimand on the subject five or six times every day . [The young ladies]628-the young ladies arrived : [their]628-the young ladies appearance was by no means ungenteel or unfashionable . [Their]628-the young ladies dress was very smart , [their]628-the young ladies manners very civil , [they]628-the young ladies were delighted with [the house]318-the house , and in raptures with the furniture , and [they]628-the young ladies happened to be so doatingly fond of [children]1173-children that [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton ’s good opinion was engaged in [their]628-the young ladies favour before [they]628-the young ladies had been an hour at [the Park]566-the park . [She]100-lady middleton declared [them]628-the young ladies to be [very agreeable girls]1175-very agreeable girls indeed , which for [her]100-lady middleton ladyship was enthusiastic admiration . [Sir John]99-sir john ’s confidence in [his]99-sir john own judgment rose with this animated praise , and [he]99-sir john set off directly for [the cottage]507-the cottage to tell [the Miss Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods of [the Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles ’ arrival , and to assure [them]628-the young ladies of [their]628-the young ladies being [the sweetest girls in [the world]2778-the world]1177-the sweetest girls in the world . From such commendation as this , however , there was not much to be learned ; [Elinor]89-elinor well knew that [the sweetest girls in [the world]2778-the world]1177-the sweetest girls in the world were to be met with in [every part of [England]14-england]1181-every part of england , under every possible variation of form , face , temper and understanding . [Sir John]99-sir john wanted [the whole family]1013-the whole family to walk to [the Park]566-the park directly and look at [[his]99-sir john guests]1184-his guests . Benevolent , [philanthropic man]1185-philanthropic man ! It was painful to [him]99-sir john even to keep [a third cousin]1186-a third cousin to [himself]99-sir john . “ Do come now , ”[1185-philanthropic man] said [he—“pray]99-sir john come — [you]99-sir john must come — [I]1185-philanthropic man declare [you]99-sir john shall come — [You]99-sir john ca n’t think how [you]99-sir john will like [them]1177-the sweetest girls in the world . [Lucy]138-lucy is monstrous pretty , and so good humoured and agreeable ! [The children]264-the children are all hanging about [her]138-lucy already , as if [she]138-lucy was [an old acquaintance]3329-an old acquaintance . And [they]264-the children both long to see [you]99-sir john of all things , for [they]264-the children have heard at [Exeter]10-exeter that [you]99-sir john are the most beautiful creatures in [the world]2778-the world ; and [I]1185-philanthropic man have told [them]264-the children it is all very true , and a great deal more . [You]99-sir john will be delighted with [them]264-the children [I]1185-philanthropic man am sure . [They]264-the children have brought the whole coach full of playthings for [the children]264-the children . How can [you]99-sir john be so cross as not to come ? Why [they]264-the children are [[your]99-sir john cousins]3332-your cousins , [you]99-sir john know , after a fashion . _ [You]99-sir john _ are [[my]1185-philanthropic man cousins]3333-my cousins , and [they]264-the children are [[my]1185-philanthropic man wife]3334-my wife ’s , so [you]99-sir john must be related . ”[1185-philanthropic man] But [Sir John]99-sir john could not prevail .
