[He]99-sir john could only obtain a promise of [their]1187-their calling at [the Park]566-the park within a day or two , and then left [them]1187-their in amazement at [their]1187-their indifference , to walk [home]565-home and boast anew of [their]1187-their attractions to [the Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles , as [he]99-sir john had been already boasting of [the Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles to [them]1187-their . When [their]1187-their promised visit to [the Park]566-the park and consequent introduction to [these young ladies]1191-these young ladies took place , [they]1187-their found in the appearance of [the eldest]1192-the eldest , who was nearly thirty , with a very plain and not a sensible face , nothing to admire ; but in the other , who was not more than two or three and twenty , [they]1187-their acknowledged considerable beauty ; [her]1193-her features were pretty , and [she]1193-her had a sharp quick eye , and a smartness of air , which though it did not give actual elegance or grace , gave distinction to [her]1193-her person . [Their]1187-their manners were particularly civil , and [Elinor]89-elinor soon allowed [them]1187-their credit for some kind of sense , when [she]89-elinor saw with what constant and judicious attention [they]1187-their were making [themselves]1187-their agreeable to [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton . With [[her]100-lady middleton children]495-her children [they]1187-their were in continual raptures , extolling [their]1187-their beauty , courting [their]1187-their notice , and humouring [their]1187-their whims ; and such of [their]1187-their time as could be spared from the importunate demands which this politeness made on it , was spent in admiration of whatever [[her]100-lady middleton ladyship]567-her ladyship was doing , if [she]567-her ladyship happened to be doing any thing , or in taking patterns of some elegant new dress , in which [her]567-her ladyship appearance the day before had thrown [them]1187-their into unceasing delight . Fortunately for those who pay [their]1187-their court through such foibles , [a fond mother]1196-a fond mother , though , in pursuit of praise for [[her]100-lady middleton children]495-her children , the most rapacious of [human beings]1198-human beings , is likewise the most credulous ; [her]100-lady middleton demands are exorbitant ; but [she]100-lady middleton will swallow any thing ; and the excessive affection and endurance of [the Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles towards [[her]100-lady middleton offspring]1199-her offspring were viewed therefore by [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton without the smallest surprise or distrust . [She]100-lady middleton saw with maternal complacency all the impertinent encroachments and mischievous tricks to which [[her]100-lady middleton cousins]1200-her cousins submitted . [She]100-lady middleton saw [their]1200-her cousins sashes untied , [their]1200-her cousins hair pulled about [their]1200-her cousins ears , [their]1200-her cousins work - bags searched , and [their]1200-her cousins knives and scissors stolen away , and felt no doubt of its being a reciprocal enjoyment . It suggested no other surprise than that [Elinor]89-elinor and [Marianne]90-marianne should sit so composedly by , without claiming a share in what was passing . “ [John]99-sir john is in such spirits today ! ”[100-lady middleton] said [she]100-lady middleton , on [his]1201-his taking [Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles ’s pocket handkerchief , and throwing it out of window—“He is full of monkey tricks . ”[100-lady middleton] And soon afterwards , on [the second boy]1202-the second boy ’s violently pinching one of [the same lady]1203-the same lady ’s fingers , [she]100-lady middleton fondly observed , “ How playful [William]139-william is ! ”[100-lady middleton] “ And here is [my]100-lady middleton sweet little [Annamaria]140-annamaria , ”[100-lady middleton] [she]100-lady middleton added , tenderly caressing [a little girl of three years old , who had not made a noise for the last two minutes]1204-a little girl of three years old , who had not made a noise for the last two minutes ; “ And [she]140-annamaria is always so gentle and quiet — Never was there such a quiet little thing ! ”[100-lady middleton] But unfortunately in bestowing these embraces , a pin in [her]100-lady middleton ladyship ’s head dress slightly scratching [the child]1205-the child ’s neck , produced from this pattern of gentleness such violent screams , as could hardly be outdone by any creature professedly noisy . [The mother]1206-the mother ’s consternation was excessive ; but it could not surpass the alarm of [the Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles , and every thing was done by all three , in so critical an emergency , which affection could suggest as likely to assuage the agonies of [the little sufferer]1207-the little sufferer . [She]1205-the child was seated in [[her]1205-the child mother]332-her mother ’s lap , covered with kisses , [her]1205-the child wound bathed with lavender - water , by one of [the Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles , who was on [her]1205-the child knees to attend [her]1205-the child , and [her]1205-the child mouth stuffed with sugar plums by [the other]772-the other . With such a reward for [her]1205-the child tears , [the child]1205-the child was too wise to cease crying . [She]1205-the child still screamed and sobbed lustily , kicked [[her]1205-the child two brothers]1211-her two brothers for offering to touch [her]1205-the child , and all [their]1211-her two brothers united soothings were ineffectual till [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton luckily remembering that in a scene of similar distress last week , some apricot marmalade had been successfully applied for a bruised temple , the same remedy was eagerly proposed for this unfortunate scratch , and a slight intermission of screams in [the young lady on hearing it]1212-the young lady on hearing it , gave [them]1211-her two brothers reason to hope that it would not be rejected . [She]1205-the child was carried out of [the room]2842-the room therefore in [[her]1205-the child mother]332-her mother ’s arms , in quest of this medicine , and as [the two boys]1215-the two boys chose to follow , though earnestly entreated by [[their]1215-the two boys mother]274-their mother to stay behind , [the four young ladies]1217-the four young ladies were left in a quietness which [the room]2842-the room had not known for many hours . “ [Poor little creatures]3335-poor little creatures ! ”[138-lucy] said [Miss Steele]138-lucy , as soon as [they]1217-the four young ladies were gone . “ It might have been a very sad accident . ”[138-lucy] “ Yet [I]90-marianne hardly know how , ”[90-marianne] cried [Marianne]90-marianne , “ unless it had been under totally different circumstances . But this is the usual way of heightening alarm , where there is nothing to be alarmed at in reality . ”[90-marianne] “ What [a sweet woman]3336-a sweet woman [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton is ! ”[138-lucy] said [Lucy Steele]138-lucy . [Marianne]90-marianne was silent ; it was impossible for [her]90-marianne to say what [she]90-marianne did not feel , however trivial the occasion ; and upon [Elinor]89-elinor therefore the whole task of telling lies when politeness required it , always fell . [She]89-elinor did [her]89-elinor best when thus called on , by speaking of [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton with more warmth than [she]89-elinor felt , though with far less than [Miss Lucy]138-lucy . “ And [Sir John]99-sir john too , ”[1219-the elder sister] cried [the elder sister]1219-the elder sister , “ what [a charming man]3306-a charming man [he]1220-he is ! ”[1219-the elder sister] Here too , [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood ’s commendation , being only simple and just , came in without any eclat . [She]1219-the elder sister merely observed that [he]1220-he was perfectly good humoured and friendly . “ And what [a charming little family]3338-a charming little family [they]3338-a charming little family have ! [I]1219-the elder sister never saw [such fine children]3339-such fine children in [[my]1219-the elder sister life.—I]3340-my life.—i declare [I]1219-the elder sister quite doat upon [them]3338-a charming little family already , and indeed [I]1219-the elder sister am always distractedly fond of [children]1173-children . ”[1219-the elder sister] “ [I]89-elinor should guess so , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor , with a smile , “ from what [I]89-elinor have witnessed this morning . ”[89-elinor] “ [I]138-lucy have a notion , ”[138-lucy] said [Lucy]138-lucy , “ [you]89-elinor think [the little Middletons]3342-the little middletons rather too much indulged ; perhaps [they]3342-the little middletons may be the outside of enough ; but it is so natural in [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton ; and for [my]138-lucy part , [I]138-lucy love to see [children full of life and spirits]3343-children full of life and spirits ; [I]138-lucy can not bear [them]3343-children full of life and spirits if [they]3343-children full of life and spirits are tame and quiet . ”[138-lucy] “ [I]89-elinor confess , ”[89-elinor] replied [Elinor]89-elinor , “ that while [I]89-elinor am at [Barton Park]6-barton park , [I]89-elinor never think of [tame and quiet children with any abhorrence]3344-tame and quiet children with any abhorrence . ”[89-elinor] A short pause succeeded this speech , which was first broken by [Miss Steele]138-lucy , who seemed very much disposed for conversation , and who now said rather abruptly , “ And how do [you]89-elinor like [Devonshire]5-devonshire , [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood ? [I]138-lucy suppose [you]89-elinor were very sorry to leave [Sussex]1-sussex . ”[138-lucy] In some surprise at the familiarity of this question , or at least of the manner in which it was spoken , [Elinor]89-elinor replied that [she]89-elinor was . “ [Norland]3-norland is [a prodigious beautiful place]3345-a prodigious beautiful place , is not it ? ”[138-lucy] added [Miss Steele]138-lucy . “ [We]3346-we have heard [Sir John]99-sir john admire [it]3-norland excessively , ”[138-lucy] said [Lucy]138-lucy , who seemed to think some apology necessary for the freedom of [[her]138-lucy sister]336-her sister . “ [I]89-elinor think [every one _]3347-every one _ must _ admire it , ”[89-elinor] replied [Elinor]89-elinor , “ who ever saw [the place]464-the place ; though it is not to be supposed that [any one]659-any one can estimate [its]3-norland beauties as [we]3346-we do . ”[89-elinor] “ And had [you]138-lucy [a great many smart beaux]3350-a great many smart beaux [there]354-there ? [I]138-lucy suppose [you]138-lucy have not so many in [this part of [the world]2778-the world]3114-this part of the world ; for [my]138-lucy part , [I]138-lucy think they are a vast addition always . ”[138-lucy] “ But why should [you]138-lucy think , ”[138-lucy] said [Lucy]138-lucy , looking ashamed of [[her]138-lucy sister]336-her sister , “ that there are not as many [genteel young men in [Devonshire]5-devonshire]3354-genteel young men in devonshire as [Sussex]1-sussex ? ”[138-lucy] “ Nay , [[my]138-lucy dear]2750-my dear , [I]138-lucy ’m sure [I]138-lucy do n’t pretend to say that there an’t . [I]138-lucy ’m sure there ’s [a vast many smart beaux]3356-a vast many smart beaux in [Exeter]10-exeter ; but [you]138-lucy know , how could [I]138-lucy tell what [smart beaux]3357-smart beaux there might be about [Norland]3-norland ; and [I]138-lucy was only afraid [the Miss Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods might find it dull at [Barton]8-barton , if [they]3358-they had not so many as [they]3358-they used to have . But perhaps [[you]138-lucy [young ladies]3360-young ladies]3359-you young ladies may not care about [the beaux]3361-the beaux , and had as lief be without [them]3361-the beaux as with [them]3361-the beaux . For [my]138-lucy part , [I]138-lucy think [they]3361-the beaux are vastly agreeable , provided [they]3361-the beaux dress smart and behave civil . But [I]138-lucy ca n’t bear to see [them]3361-the beaux dirty and nasty . Now there ’s [Mr. Rose]141-mr. rose at [Exeter]10-exeter , [a prodigious smart young man]3362-a prodigious smart young man , quite [a beau]3363-a beau , clerk to [Mr. Simpson]142-mr. simpson , [you]138-lucy know , and yet if [you]138-lucy do but meet [him]3362-a prodigious smart young man of a morning , [he]3362-a prodigious smart young man is not fit to be seen . [I]138-lucy suppose [[your]138-lucy brother]3364-your brother was quite [a beau]3363-a beau , [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood , before [he]3364-your brother married , as [he]3364-your brother was so rich ? ”[138-lucy] “ Upon [my]89-elinor word , ”[89-elinor] replied [Elinor]89-elinor , “ [I]89-elinor can not tell [you]138-lucy , for [I]89-elinor do not perfectly comprehend the meaning of the word . But this [I]89-elinor can say , that if [he]3364-your brother ever was [a beau]3363-a beau before [he]3364-your brother married , [he]3364-your brother is one still for there is not the smallest alteration in [him]3364-your brother . ”[89-elinor] “ Oh ! [dear]3367-dear ! [one]2761-one never thinks of [married men]3369-married men ’s being [beaux]3370-beaux — [they]3369-married men have something else to do . ”[138-lucy] “ [Lord]3371-lord ! [Anne]143-nancy , ”[336-her sister] cried [[her]1223-her sister]336-her sister , “ [you]143-nancy can talk of nothing but beaux;—you will make [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood believe [you]143-nancy think of nothing else . ”[336-her sister] And then to turn the discourse , [she]336-her sister began admiring [the house]318-the house and the furniture . This specimen of [the Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles was enough . The vulgar freedom and folly of [the eldest]1192-the eldest left [her]336-her sister no recommendation , and as [Elinor]89-elinor was not blinded by the beauty , or the shrewd look of [the youngest]1227-the youngest , to [her]336-her sister want of real elegance and artlessness , [she]336-her sister left [the house]318-the house without any wish of knowing [them]1229-their better . Not so [the Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles . [They]1229-their came from [Exeter]10-exeter , well provided with admiration for the use of [Sir John Middleton]99-sir john , [[his]99-sir john family]564-his family , and all [[his]99-sir john relations]1231-his relations , and no niggardly proportion was now dealt out to [[his]99-sir john fair cousins]1232-his fair cousins , whom [they]1229-their declared to be [the most beautiful , elegant , accomplished , and agreeable girls [they]1229-their had ever beheld , and with whom [they]1229-their were particularly anxious to be better acquainted]1233-the most beautiful , elegant , accomplished , and agreeable girls they had ever beheld , and with whom they were particularly anxious to be better acquainted . And to be better acquainted therefore , [Elinor]89-elinor soon found was [their]1229-their inevitable lot , for as [Sir John]99-sir john was entirely on the side of [the Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles , [[their]1229-their party]1234-their party would be too strong for opposition , and that kind of intimacy must be submitted to , which consists of sitting an hour or two together in [the same room]1235-the same room almost every day . [Sir John]99-sir john could do no more ; but [he]99-sir john did not know that any more was required : to be together was , in [his]99-sir john opinion , to be intimate , and while [his]99-sir john continual schemes for [their]1229-their meeting were effectual , [he]99-sir john had not a doubt of [their]1229-their being [established friends]1236-established friends . To do [him]99-sir john justice , [he]99-sir john did every thing in [his]99-sir john power to promote [their]1229-their unreserve , by making [the Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles acquainted with whatever [he]99-sir john knew or supposed of [[his]99-sir john cousins]617-his cousins ’ situations in the most delicate particulars ; and [Elinor]89-elinor had not seen [them]1229-their more than twice , before [the eldest of [them]1229-their]1238-the eldest of them wished [her]89-elinor joy on [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister ’s having been so lucky as to make a conquest of [a very smart beau]1240-a very smart beau since [she]89-elinor came to [Barton]8-barton . “ ’ Twill be a fine thing to have [her]336-her sister married so young to be sure , ”[89-elinor] said [she]89-elinor , “ and [I]89-elinor hear [he]1240-a very smart beau is quite [a beau , and prodigious handsome]3372-a beau , and prodigious handsome . And [I]89-elinor hope [you]3373-you may have as good luck [yourself]3373-you soon,—but perhaps [you]3373-you may have [a friend in the corner]3374-a friend in the corner already . ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor could not suppose that [Sir John]99-sir john would be more nice in proclaiming [his]99-sir john suspicions of [her]89-elinor regard for [Edward]98-edward , than [he]99-sir john had been with respect to [Marianne]90-marianne ; indeed it was rather [his]99-sir john favourite joke of [the two]1241-the two , as being somewhat newer and more conjectural ; and since [Edward]98-edward ’s visit , [they]1241-the two had never dined together without [his]99-sir john drinking to [her]89-elinor best affections with so much significancy and so many nods and winks , as to excite general attention . The letter F — had been likewise invariably brought forward , and found productive of such countless jokes , that its character as the wittiest letter in the alphabet had been long established with [Elinor]89-elinor . [The Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles , as [she]89-elinor expected , had now all the benefit of these jokes , and in the eldest of them [they]1241-the two raised a curiosity to know the name of [the gentleman alluded to]1242-the gentleman alluded to , which , though often impertinently expressed , was perfectly of a piece with [her]89-elinor general inquisitiveness into the concerns of [[their]1241-the two family]1243-their family . But [Sir John]99-sir john did not sport long with the curiosity which [he]99-sir john delighted to raise , for [he]99-sir john had at least as much pleasure in telling the name , as [Miss Steele]138-lucy had in hearing it . “ [His]99-sir john name is [Ferrars]98-edward , ”[99-sir john] said [he]99-sir john , in a very audible whisper ; “ but pray do not tell it , for it ’s a great secret . ”[99-sir john] “ [Ferrars]98-edward ! ”[138-lucy] repeated [Miss Steele]138-lucy ; “ [Mr. Ferrars]94-edward is [the happy man]3375-the happy man , is [he]94-edward ? What ! [[your]138-lucy sister - in - law ’s brother]3376-your sister - in - law ’s brother , [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood ? [a very agreeable young man]3377-a very agreeable young man to be sure ; [I]138-lucy know [him]99-sir john very well . ”[138-lucy] “ How can [you]138-lucy say so , [Anne]143-nancy ? ”[138-lucy] cried [Lucy]138-lucy , who generally made an amendment to all [[her]138-lucy sister]336-her sister ’s assertions . “ Though [we]3378-we have seen [him]99-sir john once or twice at [[my]138-lucy uncle]3285-my uncle ’s , it is rather too much to pretend to know [him]99-sir john very well . ”[138-lucy] [Elinor]89-elinor heard all this with attention and surprise . “ And who was [this uncle]3380-this uncle ? Where did [he]99-sir john live ? How came [they]3378-we acquainted ? ”[138-lucy] [She]89-elinor wished very much to have the subject continued , though [she]89-elinor did not chuse to join in it [herself]89-elinor ; but nothing more of it was said , and for the first time in [her]89-elinor life , [she]89-elinor thought [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings deficient either in curiosity after petty information , or in a disposition to communicate it . The manner in which [Miss Steele]138-lucy had spoken of [Edward]94-edward , increased [her]89-elinor curiosity ; for it struck [her]89-elinor as being rather ill - natured , and suggested the suspicion of [that lady]1245-that lady ’s knowing , or fancying [herself]89-elinor to know something to [his]94-edward disadvantage.—But [her]89-elinor curiosity was unavailing , for no farther notice was taken of [Mr. Ferrars]94-edward ’s name by [Miss Steele]138-lucy when alluded to , or even openly mentioned by [Sir John]99-sir john . CHAPTER XXII . [Marianne]90-marianne , who had never much toleration for any thing like impertinence , vulgarity , inferiority of parts , or even difference of taste from [herself]90-marianne , was at this time particularly ill - disposed , from the state of [her]90-marianne spirits , to be pleased with [the Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles , or to encourage [their]1246-their advances ; and to the invariable coldness of [her]90-marianne behaviour towards [them]1246-their , which checked every endeavour at intimacy on [their]1246-their side , [Elinor]89-elinor principally attributed that preference of [herself]90-marianne which soon became evident in the manners of both , but especially of [Lucy]138-lucy , who missed no opportunity of engaging [her]90-marianne in conversation , or of striving to improve [their]1246-their acquaintance by an easy and frank communication of [her]90-marianne sentiments . [Lucy]138-lucy was naturally clever ; [her]138-lucy remarks were often just and amusing ; and as [a companion]805-a companion for half an hour [Elinor]89-elinor frequently found [her]138-lucy agreeable ; but [her]138-lucy powers had received no aid from education : [she]138-lucy was ignorant and illiterate ; and [her]138-lucy deficiency of all mental improvement , [her]138-lucy want of information in the most common particulars , could not be concealed from [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood , in spite of [her]138-lucy constant endeavour to appear to advantage . [Elinor]89-elinor saw , and pitied [her]90-marianne for , the neglect of abilities which education might have rendered so respectable ; but [she]89-elinor saw , with less tenderness of feeling , the thorough want of delicacy , of rectitude , and integrity of mind , which [her]138-lucy attentions , [her]138-lucy assiduities , [her]138-lucy flatteries at [the Park]566-the park betrayed ; and [she]89-elinor could have no lasting satisfaction in the company of [a person who joined insincerity with ignorance]1249-a person who joined insincerity with ignorance ; whose want of instruction prevented [their]1250-their meeting in conversation on terms of equality , and whose conduct toward [others]2961-others made every show of attention and deference towards [herself]138-lucy perfectly valueless . “ [You]89-elinor will think [my]138-lucy question an odd one , [I]138-lucy dare say , ”[138-lucy] said [Lucy]138-lucy to [her]89-elinor one day , as [they]1250-their were walking together from [the park]566-the park to [the cottage—“but pray]3381-the cottage—“but pray , are [you]89-elinor personally acquainted with [[[your]89-elinor sister]2815-your sister - in - law ’s mother]3383-your sister - in - law ’s mother , [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward ? ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor _ did _ think the question a very odd one , and [her]89-elinor countenance expressed it , as [she]89-elinor answered that [she]89-elinor had never seen [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward . “ Indeed ! ”[138-lucy] replied [Lucy]138-lucy ; “ [I]138-lucy wonder at that , for [I]138-lucy thought [you]89-elinor must have seen [her]98-edward at [Norland]3-norland sometimes . Then , perhaps , [you]89-elinor can not tell [me]138-lucy what sort of [a woman]816-a woman [she]98-edward is ? ”[138-lucy] “ No , ”[89-elinor] returned [Elinor]89-elinor , cautious of giving [her]89-elinor real opinion of [[Edward]98-edward ’s mother]1253-edward ’s mother , and not very desirous of satisfying what seemed impertinent curiosity ; “ [I]89-elinor know nothing of [her]98-edward . ”[89-elinor] “ [I]138-lucy am sure [you]89-elinor think [me]138-lucy very strange , for enquiring about [her]98-edward in such a way , ”[138-lucy] said [Lucy]138-lucy , eyeing [Elinor]89-elinor attentively as [she]89-elinor spoke ; “ but perhaps there may be reasons — [I]89-elinor wish [I]89-elinor might venture ; but however [I]89-elinor hope [you]89-elinor will do [me]89-elinor the justice of believing that [I]89-elinor do not mean to be impertinent . ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor made [her]89-elinor a civil reply , and [they]1254-they walked on for a few minutes in silence . It was broken by [Lucy]138-lucy , who renewed the subject again by saying , with some hesitation , “ [I]138-lucy can not bear to have [you]89-elinor think [me]138-lucy impertinently curious . [I]138-lucy am sure [I]138-lucy would rather do any thing in [the world]2778-the world than be thought so by [a person whose good opinion is so well worth having as [yours]89-elinor]3386-a person whose good opinion is so well worth having as yours . And [I]138-lucy am sure [I]138-lucy should not have the smallest fear of trusting _ [you]89-elinor ; _ indeed , [I]138-lucy should be very glad of [your]89-elinor advice how to manage in such an uncomfortable situation as [I]138-lucy am ; but , however , there is no occasion to trouble _ [you]89-elinor _ . [I]138-lucy am sorry [you]89-elinor do not happen to know [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward . ”[138-lucy] “ [I]89-elinor am sorry [I]89-elinor do _ not _ , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor , in great astonishment , “ if it could be of any use to [YOU]89-elinor to know [my]89-elinor opinion of [her]98-edward . But really [I]89-elinor never understood that [you]89-elinor were at all connected with [that family]3387-that family , and therefore [I]89-elinor am a little surprised , [I]89-elinor confess , at so serious an inquiry into [her]98-edward character . ”[89-elinor] “ [I]1255-i dare say [you]89-elinor are , and [I]1255-i am sure [I]1255-i do not at all wonder at it . But if [I]1255-i dared tell [you]89-elinor all , [you]89-elinor would not be so much surprised . [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward is certainly nothing to [me]1255-i at present — but the time _ may _ come — how soon it will come must depend upon [herself]98-edward — when [we]3388-we may be very intimately connected . ”[1255-i] [She]1255-i looked down as [she]1255-i said this , amiably bashful , with only one side glance at [[her]1255-i companion]1256-her companion to observe its effect on [her]1255-i . “ Good heavens ! ”[89-elinor] cried [Elinor]89-elinor , “ what do [you]138-lucy mean ? Are [you]138-lucy acquainted with [Mr. Robert Ferrars]144-robert ? Can [you]138-lucy be ? ”[89-elinor] And [she]89-elinor did not feel much delighted with the idea of [such a sister - in - law]1257-such a sister - in - law . “ No , ”[138-lucy] replied [Lucy]138-lucy , “ not to [Mr. _ Robert _ Ferrars]144-robert — [I]138-lucy never saw [him]144-robert in [my]138-lucy life ; but , ”[138-lucy] fixing [her]138-lucy eyes upon [Elinor]89-elinor , “ to [[his]144-robert eldest brother]3389-his eldest brother . ”[138-lucy] What felt [Elinor]89-elinor at that moment ? Astonishment , that would have been as painful as it was strong , had not an immediate disbelief of the assertion attended it . [She]89-elinor turned towards [Lucy]138-lucy in silent amazement , unable to divine the reason or object of such a declaration ; and though [her]89-elinor complexion varied , [she]89-elinor stood firm in incredulity , and felt in no danger of an hysterical fit , or a swoon . “ [You]89-elinor may well be surprised , ”[138-lucy] continued [Lucy]138-lucy ; “ for to be sure [you]89-elinor could have had no idea of it before ; for [I]138-lucy dare say [he]144-robert never dropped the smallest hint of it to [you]89-elinor or [any of [[your]89-elinor family]3146-your family]3390-any of your family ; because it was always meant to be a great secret , and [I]138-lucy am sure has been faithfully kept so by [me]138-lucy to this hour . [Not a soul of all [[my]138-lucy relations]3393-my relations]3392-not a soul of all my relations know of it but [Anne]143-nancy , and [I]138-lucy never should have mentioned it to [you]89-elinor , if [I]138-lucy had not felt the greatest dependence in [the world]2778-the world upon [your]89-elinor secrecy ; and [I]138-lucy really thought [my]138-lucy behaviour in asking so many questions about [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward must seem so odd , that it ought to be explained . And [I]138-lucy do not think [Mr. Ferrars]144-robert can be displeased , when [he]144-robert knows [I]138-lucy have trusted [you]89-elinor , because [I]138-lucy know [he]144-robert has the highest opinion in [the world]2778-the world of all [[your]89-elinor family]3146-your family , and looks upon [yourself]89-elinor and the other [Miss Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods quite as [[his]144-robert own sisters]3397-his own sisters . ”—She[138-lucy] paused . [Elinor]89-elinor for a few moments remained silent . [Her]89-elinor astonishment at what [she]89-elinor heard was at first too great for words ; but at length forcing [herself]89-elinor to speak , and to speak cautiously , [she]89-elinor said , with calmness of manner , which tolerably well concealed [her]89-elinor surprise and solicitude—“May [I]89-elinor ask if [your]89-elinor engagement is of long standing ? ”[89-elinor] “ [We]3398-we have been engaged these four years . ”[89-elinor] “ Four years ! ”[89-elinor] “ Yes . ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor , though greatly shocked , still felt unable to believe it . “ [I]89-elinor did not know , ”[89-elinor] said [she]89-elinor , “ that [you]89-elinor were even acquainted till the other day . ”[89-elinor] “ [[Our]3398-we acquaintance]3399-our acquaintance , however , is of many years date . [He]144-robert was under [[my]89-elinor uncle]3285-my uncle ’s care , [you]89-elinor know , a considerable while . ”[89-elinor] “ [[Your]89-elinor uncle]3401-your uncle ! ”[89-elinor] “ Yes ; [Mr. Pratt]145-mr. pratt . Did [you]89-elinor never hear [him]144-robert talk of [Mr. Pratt]145-mr. pratt ? ”[89-elinor] “ [I]89-elinor think [I]89-elinor have , ”[89-elinor] replied [Elinor]89-elinor , with an exertion of spirits , which increased with [her]89-elinor increase of emotion . “ [He]144-robert was four years with [[my]89-elinor uncle]3285-my uncle , who lives at [Longstaple]36-longstaple , near [Plymouth]26-plymouth . It was there [our]3403-our acquaintance begun , for [[my]89-elinor sister]2818-my sister and [me]89-elinor was often staying with [[my]89-elinor uncle]3285-my uncle , and it was there [our]3403-our engagement was formed , though not till a year after [he]144-robert had quitted as [a pupil]3406-a pupil ; but [he]144-robert was almost always with [us]3403-our afterwards . [I]89-elinor was very unwilling to enter into it , as [you]3407-you may imagine , without the knowledge and approbation of [[his]144-robert mother]270-his mother ; but [I]89-elinor was too young , and loved [him]144-robert too well , to be so prudent as [I]89-elinor ought to have been . Though [you]3407-you do not know [him]144-robert so well as [me]89-elinor , [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood , [you]3407-you must have seen enough of [him]144-robert to be sensible [he]144-robert is very capable of making [a woman]816-a woman sincerely attached to [him]144-robert . ”[89-elinor] “ Certainly , ”[89-elinor] answered [Elinor]89-elinor , without knowing what [she]89-elinor said ; but after a moment ’s reflection , [she]89-elinor added , with revived security of [Edward]98-edward ’s honour and love , and [[her]89-elinor companion]1256-her companion ’s falsehood—“Engaged to [Mr. Edward Ferrars!—I]94-edward confess [myself]89-elinor so totally surprised at what [you]3407-you tell [me]89-elinor , that really — [I]89-elinor beg [your]3407-you pardon ; but surely there must be some mistake of [person]3410-person or name . [We]3411-we can not mean the same [Mr. Ferrars]94-edward . ”[89-elinor] “ [We]3411-we can mean [no other]3063-no other , ”[138-lucy] cried [Lucy]138-lucy , smiling . “ [Mr. Edward Ferrars]94-edward , [the eldest son of [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward]3413-the eldest son of mrs. ferrars , of [Park Street]37-park street , and [brother of [[your]3407-you sister - in - law]3415-your sister - in - law]3414-brother of your sister - in - law , [Mrs. John Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood , is [the person [I]138-lucy mean]3416-the person i mean ; [you]3407-you must allow that [I]138-lucy am not likely to be deceived as to the name of [the man on who all [my]138-lucy happiness depends]3417-the man on who all my happiness depends . ”[138-lucy] “ It is strange , ”[89-elinor] replied [Elinor]89-elinor , in a most painful perplexity , “ that [I]89-elinor should never have heard [him]94-edward even mention [your]3407-you name . ”[89-elinor] “ No ; considering [our]3418-our situation , it was not strange . [Our]3418-our first care has been to keep the matter secret . [You]3407-you knew nothing of [me]1259-she , or [[my]1259-she family]3220-my family , and , therefore , there could be no _ occasion _ for ever mentioning [my]1259-she name to [you]3407-you ; and , as [he]94-edward was always particularly afraid of [[his]94-edward sister]251-his sister ’s suspecting any thing , _ that _ was reason enough for [his]94-edward not mentioning it . ”[1259-she] [She]1259-she was [silent.—Elinor]146-silent.—elinor ’s security sunk ; but [her]1259-she self - command did not sink with it . “ Four years [you]3407-you have been engaged , ”[1259-she] said [she]1259-she with a firm voice . “ Yes ; and heaven knows how much longer [we]3418-our may have to wait . [Poor Edward]147-edward ! It puts [him]94-edward quite out of heart . ”[1259-she] Then taking a small miniature from [her]1259-she pocket , [she]1259-she added , “ To prevent the possibility of mistake , be so good as to look at this face . It does not do [him]94-edward justice , to be sure , but yet [I]1259-she think [you]3407-you can not be deceived as to [the person it was drew]3421-the person it was drew for.—I have had it above these three years . ”[1259-she] [She]1259-she put it into [her]1259-she hands as [she]1259-she spoke ; and when [Elinor]89-elinor saw the painting , whatever other doubts [her]89-elinor fear of a too hasty decision , or [her]89-elinor wish of detecting falsehood might suffer to linger in [her]89-elinor mind , [she]89-elinor could have none of its being [Edward]147-edward ’s face . [She]89-elinor returned it almost instantly , acknowledging the likeness . “ [I]138-lucy have never been able , ”[138-lucy] continued [Lucy]138-lucy , “ to give [him]94-edward [my]138-lucy picture in return , which [I]138-lucy am very much vexed at , for [he]94-edward has been always so anxious to get it ! But [I]138-lucy am determined to set for it the very first opportunity . ”[138-lucy] “ [You]89-elinor are quite in the right , ”[89-elinor] replied [Elinor]89-elinor calmly . [They]1260-they then proceeded a few paces in silence . [Lucy]138-lucy spoke first . “ [I]89-elinor am sure , ”[89-elinor] said [she]89-elinor , “ [I]89-elinor have no doubt in the world of [your]89-elinor faithfully keeping this secret , because [you]89-elinor must know of what importance it is to [us]1260-they , not to have it reach [[his]94-edward mother]270-his mother ; for [she]270-his mother would never approve of it , [I]89-elinor dare say . [I]89-elinor shall have no fortune , and [I]89-elinor fancy [she]270-his mother is [an exceeding proud woman]3423-an exceeding proud woman . ”[89-elinor] “ [I]89-elinor certainly did not seek [your]89-elinor confidence , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor ; “ but [you]89-elinor do [me]89-elinor no more than justice in imagining that [I]89-elinor may be depended on . [Your]89-elinor secret is safe with [me]89-elinor ; but pardon [me]89-elinor if [I]89-elinor express some surprise at so unnecessary a communication . [You]89-elinor must at least have felt that [my]89-elinor being acquainted with it could not add to its safety . ”[89-elinor] As [she]89-elinor said this , [she]89-elinor looked earnestly at [Lucy]138-lucy , hoping to discover something in [her]138-lucy countenance ; perhaps the falsehood of the greatest part of what [she]89-elinor had been saying ; but [Lucy]138-lucy ’s countenance suffered no change . “ [I]89-elinor was afraid [you]89-elinor would think [I]89-elinor was taking a great liberty with [you]89-elinor , ”[89-elinor] said [she]89-elinor , “ in telling [you]89-elinor all this . [I]89-elinor have not known [you]89-elinor long to be sure , personally at least , but [I]89-elinor have known [you]89-elinor and all [[your]89-elinor family]3146-your family by description a great while ; and as soon as [I]89-elinor saw [you]89-elinor , [I]89-elinor felt almost as if [you]89-elinor was [an old acquaintance]3329-an old acquaintance . Besides in the present case , [I]89-elinor really thought some explanation was due to [you]89-elinor after [my]89-elinor making such particular inquiries about [[Edward]147-edward ’s mother]1253-edward ’s mother ; and [I]89-elinor am so unfortunate , that [I]89-elinor have not a creature whose advice [I]89-elinor can ask . [Anne]143-nancy is [the only person that knows of it]3427-the only person that knows of it , and [she]143-nancy has no judgment at all ; indeed , [she]143-nancy does [me]89-elinor a great deal more harm than good , for [I]89-elinor am in constant fear of [her]143-nancy betraying [me]89-elinor . [She]143-nancy does not know how to hold [her]143-nancy tongue , as [you]89-elinor must perceive , and [I]89-elinor am sure [I]89-elinor was in the greatest fright in [the world]2778-the world t’other day , when [Edward]147-edward ’s name was mentioned by [Sir John]99-sir john , lest [she]143-nancy should out with it all . [You]89-elinor ca n’t think how much [I]89-elinor go through in [my]89-elinor mind from it altogether . [I]89-elinor only wonder that [I]89-elinor am alive after what [I]89-elinor have suffered for [Edward]147-edward ’s sake these last four years . Every thing in such suspense and uncertainty ; and seeing [him]147-edward so seldom — [we]3429-we can hardly meet above twice a - year . [I]89-elinor am sure [I]89-elinor wonder [my]89-elinor heart is not quite broke . ”[89-elinor] Here [she]1261-i took out [her]1261-i handkerchief ; but [Elinor]89-elinor did not feel very compassionate . “ Sometimes . ”[138-lucy] continued [Lucy]138-lucy , after wiping [her]138-lucy eyes , “ [I]1261-i think whether it would not be better for [us]3429-we both to break off the matter entirely . ”[1261-i] As [she]1261-i said this , [she]1261-i looked directly at [[her]1261-i companion]1256-her companion . “ But then at other times [I]1261-i have not resolution enough for it . [I]1261-i can not bear the thoughts of making [him]147-edward so miserable , as [I]1261-i know the very mention of such a thing would do . And on [my]1261-i own account too — so dear as [he]147-edward is to [me]1261-i — [I]1261-i do n’t think [I]1261-i could be equal to it . What would [you]138-lucy advise [me]1261-i to do in such a case , [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood ? What would [you]138-lucy do [yourself]138-lucy ? ”[1261-i] “ Pardon [me]89-elinor , ”[89-elinor] replied [Elinor]89-elinor , startled by the question ; “ but [I]89-elinor can give [you]138-lucy no advice under such circumstances . [Your]138-lucy own judgment must direct [you]138-lucy . ”[89-elinor] “ To be sure , ”[138-lucy] continued [Lucy]138-lucy , after a few minutes silence on both sides , “ [[his]147-edward mother]270-his mother must provide for [him]147-edward sometime or other ; but poor [Edward]147-edward is so cast down by it ! Did [you]138-lucy not think [him]147-edward dreadful low - spirited when [he]147-edward was at [Barton]8-barton ? [He]147-edward was so miserable when [he]147-edward left [us]3431-us at [Longstaple]36-longstaple , to go to [you]138-lucy , that [I]138-lucy was afraid [you]138-lucy would think [him]147-edward quite ill . ”[138-lucy] “ Did [he]147-edward come from [[your]138-lucy uncle]3401-your uncle ’s , then , when [he]147-edward visited [us]3431-us ? ”[89-elinor] “ Oh , yes ; [he]147-edward had been staying a fortnight with [us]3431-us . Did [you]138-lucy think [he]147-edward came directly from [town]2984-town ? ”[138-lucy] “ No , ”[89-elinor] replied [Elinor]89-elinor , most feelingly sensible of every fresh circumstance in favour of [Lucy]138-lucy ’s veracity ; “ [I]89-elinor remember [he]147-edward told [us]3431-us , that [he]147-edward had been staying a fortnight with [some friends near [Plymouth]26-plymouth]3434-some friends near plymouth . ”[89-elinor] [She]138-lucy remembered too , [her]138-lucy own surprise at the time , at [his]1263-i mentioning nothing farther of [those friends]1264-those friends , at [his]1263-i total silence with respect even to [their]1264-those friends names . “ Did not [you]138-lucy think [him]147-edward sadly out of spirits ? ”[138-lucy] repeated [Lucy]138-lucy . “ [We]3431-us did , indeed , particularly so when [he]147-edward first arrived . ”[138-lucy] “ [I]1263-i begged [him]147-edward to exert [himself]147-edward for fear [you]138-lucy should suspect what was the matter ; but it made [him]147-edward so melancholy , not being able to stay more than a fortnight with [us]3431-us , and seeing [me]1263-i so much affected . [Poor fellow]3280-poor fellow ! [I]1263-i am afraid it is just the same with [him]147-edward now ; for [he]147-edward writes in wretched spirits . [I]1263-i heard from [him]147-edward just before [I]1263-i left [Exeter]10-exeter ; ”[1263-i] taking a letter from [her]138-lucy pocket and carelessly showing the direction to [Elinor]89-elinor . “ [You]138-lucy know [his]147-edward hand , [I]89-elinor dare say,—a charming one it is ; but that is not written so well as usual . [He]147-edward was tired , [I]89-elinor dare say , for [he]147-edward had just filled the sheet to [me]89-elinor as full as possible . ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor saw that it _ was _ [his]1265-he hand , and [she]89-elinor could doubt no longer . This picture , [she]138-lucy had allowed [herself]138-lucy to believe , might have been accidentally obtained ; it might not have been [Edward]147-edward ’s gift ; but a correspondence between [them]1266-them by letter , could subsist only under a positive engagement , could be authorised by nothing else ; for a few moments , [she]138-lucy was almost overcome — [her]138-lucy heart sunk within [her]138-lucy , and [she]138-lucy could hardly stand ; but exertion was indispensably necessary ; and [she]138-lucy struggled so resolutely against the oppression of [her]138-lucy feelings , that [her]138-lucy success was speedy , and for the time complete . “ Writing to [each other]338-each other , ”[138-lucy] said [Lucy]138-lucy , returning the letter into [her]138-lucy pocket , “ is the only comfort [we]1266-them have in such long separations . Yes , _ [I]138-lucy _ have one other comfort in [his]1265-he picture , but [poor [Edward]147-edward]3437-poor edward has not even _ that _ . If [he]1265-he had but [my]138-lucy picture , [he]1265-he says [he]1265-he should be easy . [I]138-lucy gave [him]1265-he a lock of [my]138-lucy hair set in a ring when [he]1265-he was at Longstaple last , and that was some comfort to [him]1265-he , [he]1265-he said , but not equal to a picture . Perhaps [you]138-lucy might notice the ring when [you]138-lucy saw [him]1265-he ? ”[138-lucy] “ [I]89-elinor did , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor , with a composure of voice , under which was concealed an emotion and distress beyond any thing [she]89-elinor had ever felt before . [She]89-elinor was mortified , shocked , confounded . Fortunately for [her]89-elinor , [they]1267-their had now reached [the cottage]507-the cottage , and the conversation could be continued no farther . After sitting with [them]1267-their a few minutes , [the Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles returned to [the Park]566-the park , and [Elinor]89-elinor was then at liberty to think and be wretched . END OF THE FIRST VOLUME CHAPTER XXIII . However small [Elinor]89-elinor ’s general dependence on [Lucy]138-lucy ’s veracity might be , it was impossible for [her]89-elinor on serious reflection to suspect it in the present case , where no temptation could be answerable to the folly of inventing a falsehood of such a description . What [Lucy]138-lucy had asserted to be true , therefore , [Elinor]89-elinor could not , dared not longer doubt ; supported as it was too on every side by such probabilities and proofs , and contradicted by nothing but [her]89-elinor own wishes . [Their]1267-their opportunity of acquaintance in [the house of [Mr. Pratt]145-mr. pratt]1270-the house of mr. pratt was a foundation for the rest , at once indisputable and alarming ; and [Edward]147-edward ’s visit near [Plymouth]26-plymouth , [his]147-edward melancholy state of mind , [his]147-edward dissatisfaction at [his]147-edward own prospects , [his]147-edward uncertain behaviour towards [herself]138-lucy , the intimate knowledge of [the Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles as to [Norland]3-norland and [[their]1267-their family]1243-their family connections , which had often surprised [her]138-lucy , the picture , the letter , the ring , formed altogether such a body of evidence , as overcame every fear of condemning [him]147-edward unfairly , and established as a fact , which no partiality could set aside , [his]147-edward ill - treatment of herself.—Her resentment of such behaviour , [her]138-lucy indignation at having been its dupe , for a short time made [her]138-lucy feel only for [herself]138-lucy ; but other ideas , other considerations , soon arose . Had [Edward]147-edward been intentionally deceiving [her]138-lucy ? Had [he]147-edward feigned a regard for [her]138-lucy which [he]147-edward did not feel ? Was [his]147-edward engagement to [Lucy]138-lucy an engagement of the heart ? No ; whatever it might once have been , [she]138-lucy could not believe it such at present . [His]147-edward affection was all [her]138-lucy own . [She]138-lucy could not be deceived in that . [[Her]138-lucy mother]332-her mother , [sisters]301-sisters , [Fanny]93-fanny , all had been conscious of [his]147-edward regard for [her]138-lucy at [Norland]3-norland ; it was not an illusion of [her]138-lucy own vanity . [He]147-edward certainly loved [her]138-lucy . What a softener of the heart was this persuasion ! How much could it not tempt [her]138-lucy to forgive ! [He]147-edward had been blamable , highly blamable , in remaining at [Norland]3-norland after [he]147-edward first felt [her]138-lucy influence over [him]147-edward to be more than it ought to be . In that , [he]147-edward could not be defended ; but if [he]147-edward had injured [her]138-lucy , how much more had [he]147-edward injured [himself]147-edward ; if [her]138-lucy case were pitiable , [his]147-edward was hopeless . [His]147-edward imprudence had made [her]138-lucy miserable for a while ; but it seemed to have deprived [himself]147-edward of all chance of ever being otherwise . [She]138-lucy might in time regain tranquillity ; but _ [he]147-edward _ , what had [he]147-edward to look forward to ? Could [he]147-edward ever be tolerably happy with [Lucy Steele]138-lucy ; could [he]147-edward , were [his]147-edward affection for [herself]138-lucy out of the question , with [his]147-edward integrity , [his]147-edward delicacy , and well - informed mind , be satisfied with [a wife like [her]138-lucy]1274-a wife like her — illiterate , artful , and selfish ? The youthful infatuation of nineteen would naturally blind [him]147-edward to every thing but [her]138-lucy beauty and good nature ; but the four succeeding years — years , which if rationally spent , give such improvement to the understanding , must have opened [his]147-edward eyes to [her]138-lucy defects of education , while the same period of time , spent on [her]138-lucy side in inferior society and more frivolous pursuits , had perhaps robbed [her]138-lucy of that simplicity which might once have given an interesting character to [her]138-lucy beauty . If in the supposition of [his]147-edward seeking to marry [herself]138-lucy , [his]147-edward difficulties from [[his]147-edward mother]270-his mother had seemed great , how much greater were [they]1276-they now likely to be , when the object of [his]147-edward engagement was undoubtedly inferior in connections , and probably inferior in fortune to [herself]138-lucy . These difficulties , indeed , with a heart so alienated from [Lucy]138-lucy , might not press very hard upon [his]147-edward patience ; but melancholy was the state of [the person by whom the expectation of family opposition and unkindness]1277-the person by whom the expectation of family opposition and unkindness , could be felt as a relief ! As these considerations occurred to [her]138-lucy in painful succession , [she]138-lucy wept for [him]147-edward , more than for [herself]138-lucy . Supported by the conviction of having done nothing to merit [her]138-lucy present unhappiness , and consoled by the belief that [Edward]147-edward had done nothing to forfeit [her]138-lucy esteem , [she]138-lucy thought [she]138-lucy could even now , under the first smart of the heavy blow , command [herself]138-lucy enough to guard every suspicion of the truth from [[her]138-lucy mother]332-her mother and [sisters]301-sisters . And so well was [she]138-lucy able to answer [her]138-lucy own expectations , that when [she]138-lucy joined [them]1280-their at dinner only two hours after [she]138-lucy had first suffered the extinction of all [her]138-lucy dearest hopes , [no one]317-no one would have supposed from the appearance of [the sisters]1282-the sisters , that [Elinor]89-elinor was mourning in secret over obstacles which must divide [her]138-lucy for ever from the object of [her]138-lucy love , and that [Marianne]90-marianne was internally dwelling on the perfections of [a man]499-a man , of whose whole heart [she]138-lucy felt thoroughly possessed , and whom [she]138-lucy expected to see in every carriage which drove near [[their]1280-their house]1012-their house . The necessity of concealing from [[her]138-lucy mother]332-her mother and [Marianne]90-marianne , what had been entrusted in confidence to [herself]138-lucy , though it obliged [her]138-lucy to unceasing exertion , was no aggravation of [Elinor]89-elinor ’s distress . On the contrary it was a relief to [her]138-lucy , to be spared the communication of what would give such affliction to [them]1280-their , and to be saved likewise from hearing that condemnation of [Edward]147-edward , which would probably flow from the excess of [their]1280-their partial affection for [herself]138-lucy , and which was more than [she]138-lucy felt equal to support . From [their]1280-their counsel , or [their]1280-their conversation , [she]138-lucy knew [she]138-lucy could receive no assistance , [their]1280-their tenderness and sorrow must add to [her]138-lucy distress , while [her]138-lucy self - command would neither receive encouragement from [their]1280-their example nor from [their]1280-their praise . [She]138-lucy was stronger alone , and [her]138-lucy own good sense so well supported [her]138-lucy , that [her]138-lucy firmness was as unshaken , [her]138-lucy appearance of cheerfulness as invariable , as with regrets so poignant and so fresh , it was possible for [them]1280-their to be . Much as [she]138-lucy had suffered from [her]138-lucy first conversation with [Lucy]138-lucy on the subject , [she]138-lucy soon felt an earnest wish of renewing it ; and this for more reasons than one . [She]138-lucy wanted to hear many particulars of [their]1280-their engagement repeated again , [she]138-lucy wanted more clearly to understand what [Lucy]138-lucy really felt for [Edward]147-edward , whether there were any sincerity in [her]138-lucy declaration of tender regard for [him]147-edward , and [she]138-lucy particularly wanted to convince [Lucy]138-lucy , by [her]138-lucy readiness to enter on the matter again , and [her]138-lucy calmness in conversing on it , that [she]138-lucy was no otherwise interested in it than as [a friend]1286-a friend , which [she]138-lucy very much feared [her]138-lucy involuntary agitation , in [their]1280-their morning discourse , must have left at least doubtful . That [Lucy]138-lucy was disposed to be jealous of [her]138-lucy appeared very probable : it was plain that [Edward]147-edward had always spoken highly in [her]138-lucy praise , not merely from [Lucy]138-lucy ’s assertion , but from [her]138-lucy venturing to trust [her]138-lucy on so short a personal acquaintance , with a secret so confessedly and evidently important . And even [Sir John]99-sir john ’s joking intelligence must have had some weight . But indeed , while [Elinor]89-elinor remained so well assured within [herself]89-elinor of being really beloved by [Edward]147-edward , it required no other consideration of probabilities to make it natural that [Lucy]138-lucy should be jealous ; and that [she]138-lucy was so , [her]138-lucy very confidence was a proof . What other reason for the disclosure of the affair could there be , but that [Elinor]89-elinor might be informed by it of [Lucy]138-lucy ’s superior claims on [Edward]147-edward , and be taught to avoid [him]147-edward in future ? [She]138-lucy had little difficulty in understanding thus much of [[her]138-lucy rival]1287-her rival ’s intentions , and while [she]138-lucy was firmly resolved to act by [her]138-lucy as every principle of honour and honesty directed , to combat [her]138-lucy own affection for [Edward]147-edward and to see [him]147-edward as little as possible ; [she]138-lucy could not deny [herself]138-lucy the comfort of endeavouring to convince [Lucy]138-lucy that [her]138-lucy heart was unwounded . And as [she]138-lucy could now have nothing more painful to hear on the subject than had already been told , [she]138-lucy did not mistrust [her]138-lucy own ability of going through a repetition of particulars with composure . But it was not immediately that an opportunity of doing so could be commanded , though [Lucy]138-lucy was as well disposed as [herself]138-lucy to take advantage of any that occurred ; for the weather was not often fine enough to allow of [their]1288-they joining in a walk , where [they]1288-they might most easily separate [themselves]1288-they from [the others]539-the others ; and though [they]1288-they met at least every other evening either at [the park or cottage]1290-the park or cottage , and chiefly at the former , [they]1288-they could not be supposed to meet for the sake of conversation . Such a thought would never enter either [Sir John]99-sir john or [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton ’s head ; and therefore very little leisure was ever given for a general chat , and none at all for particular discourse . [They]1288-they met for the sake of eating , drinking , and laughing together , playing at cards , or consequences , or any other game that was sufficiently noisy . One or two meetings of this kind had taken place , without affording [Elinor]89-elinor any chance of engaging [Lucy]138-lucy in private , when [Sir John]99-sir john called at [the cottage]507-the cottage one morning , to beg , in the name of charity , that [they]1288-they would all dine with [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton that day , as [he]99-sir john was obliged to attend the club at [Exeter]10-exeter , and [she]138-lucy would otherwise be quite alone , except [[her]138-lucy mother]332-her mother and [the two Miss Steeles]1293-the two miss steeles . [Elinor]89-elinor , who foresaw a fairer opening for the point [she]89-elinor had in view , in such a party as this was likely to be , more at liberty among [themselves]1288-they under the tranquil and well - bred direction of [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton than when [[her]100-lady middleton husband]319-her husband united [them]1288-they together in one noisy purpose , immediately accepted the invitation ; [Margaret]91-margaret , with [[her]91-margaret mother]332-her mother ’s permission , was equally compliant , and [Marianne]90-marianne , though always unwilling to join any of [their]1288-they parties , was persuaded by [[her]90-marianne mother]332-her mother , who could not bear to have [her]90-marianne seclude [herself]90-marianne from any chance of amusement , to go likewise . [The young ladies]628-the young ladies went , and [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton was happily preserved from the frightful solitude which had threatened [her]100-lady middleton . The insipidity of the meeting was exactly such as [Elinor]89-elinor had expected ; it produced not one novelty of thought or expression , and nothing could be less interesting than the whole of [their]628-the young ladies discourse both in [the dining parlour and drawing room]1298-the dining parlour and drawing room : to the latter , [the children]264-the children accompanied [them]628-the young ladies , and while [they]628-the young ladies remained [there]354-there , [she]89-elinor was too well convinced of the impossibility of engaging [Lucy]138-lucy ’s attention to attempt it . [They]628-the young ladies quitted it only with the removal of the tea - things . The card - table was then placed , and [Elinor]89-elinor began to wonder at [herself]89-elinor for having ever entertained a hope of finding time for conversation at [the park]566-the park . [They]628-the young ladies all rose up in preparation for a round game . “ [I]100-lady middleton am glad , ”[100-lady middleton] said [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton to [Lucy]138-lucy , “ [you]138-lucy are not going to finish poor little [Annamaria]140-annamaria ’s basket this evening ; for [I]100-lady middleton am sure it must hurt [your]138-lucy eyes to work filigree by candlelight . And [we]628-the young ladies will make [the dear little love]3438-the dear little love some amends for [her]3438-the dear little love disappointment to - morrow , and then [I]100-lady middleton hope [she]3438-the dear little love will not much mind it . ”[100-lady middleton] This hint was enough , [Lucy]138-lucy recollected [herself]138-lucy instantly and replied , “ Indeed [you]100-lady middleton are very much mistaken , [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton ; [I]138-lucy am only waiting to know whether [you]100-lady middleton can make [your]100-lady middleton party without [me]138-lucy , or [I]138-lucy should have been at [my]138-lucy filigree already . [I]138-lucy would not disappoint [the little angel]3439-the little angel for [all the world]3440-all the world : and if [you]100-lady middleton want [me]138-lucy at the card - table now , [I]138-lucy am resolved to finish the basket after supper . ”[138-lucy] “ [You]100-lady middleton are very good , [I]138-lucy hope it wo n’t hurt [your]100-lady middleton eyes — will [you]100-lady middleton ring the bell for some working candles ? [[My]138-lucy poor little girl]3441-my poor little girl would be sadly disappointed , [I]138-lucy know , if the basket was not finished tomorrow , for though [I]138-lucy told [her]3441-my poor little girl it certainly would not , [I]138-lucy am sure [she]3441-my poor little girl depends upon having it done . ”[138-lucy] [Lucy]138-lucy directly drew [her]138-lucy work table near [her]138-lucy and reseated [herself]138-lucy with an alacrity and cheerfulness which seemed to infer that [she]138-lucy could taste no greater delight than in making a filigree basket for [a spoilt child]1302-a spoilt child . [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton proposed a rubber of Casino to [the others]539-the others . [No one]317-no one made any objection but [Marianne]90-marianne , who with [her]90-marianne usual inattention to the forms of general civility , exclaimed , “ [[Your]100-lady middleton Ladyship]3442-your ladyship will have the goodness to excuse _ [me_—you]100-lady middleton know [I]90-marianne detest cards . [I]90-marianne shall go to the piano - forte ; [I]90-marianne have not touched it since it was tuned . ”[90-marianne] And without farther ceremony , [she]90-marianne turned away and walked to the instrument . [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton looked as if [she]100-lady middleton thanked heaven that _ [she]100-lady middleton _ had never made so rude a speech . “ [Marianne]90-marianne can never keep long from that instrument [you]100-lady middleton know , [ma’am]2974-ma’am , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor , endeavouring to smooth away the offence ; “ and [I]89-elinor do not much wonder at it ; for it is the very best toned piano - forte [I]89-elinor ever heard . ”[89-elinor] [The remaining five]1305-the remaining five were now to draw [their]1305-the remaining five cards . “ Perhaps , ”[89-elinor] continued [Elinor]89-elinor , “ if [I]89-elinor should happen to cut out , [I]89-elinor may be of some use to [Miss Lucy Steele]138-lucy , in rolling [her]138-lucy papers for [her]138-lucy ; and there is so much still to be done to the basket , that it must be impossible [I]89-elinor think for [her]138-lucy labour singly , to finish it this evening . [I]89-elinor should like the work exceedingly , if [she]138-lucy would allow [me]89-elinor a share in it . ”[89-elinor] “ Indeed [I]138-lucy shall be very much obliged to [you]138-lucy for [your]138-lucy help , ”[138-lucy] cried [Lucy]138-lucy , “ for [I]138-lucy find there is more to be done to it than [I]138-lucy thought there was ; and it would be a shocking thing to disappoint [dear Annamaria]140-annamaria after all . ”[138-lucy] “ Oh ! that would be terrible , indeed , ”[138-lucy] said [Miss Steele]138-lucy . “ [Dear little soul]3444-dear little soul , how [I]138-lucy do love [her]90-marianne ! ”[138-lucy] “ [You]89-elinor are very kind , ”[100-lady middleton] said [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton to [Elinor]89-elinor ; “ and as [you]89-elinor really like the work , perhaps [you]89-elinor will be as well pleased not to cut in till another rubber , or will [you]89-elinor take [your]89-elinor chance now ? ”[100-lady middleton] [Elinor]89-elinor joyfully profited by the first of these proposals , and thus by a little of that address which [Marianne]90-marianne could never condescend to practise , gained [her]89-elinor own end , and pleased [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton at the same time . [Lucy]138-lucy made room for [her]138-lucy with ready attention , and [the two fair rivals]1306-the two fair rivals were thus seated side by side at the same table , and , with the utmost harmony , engaged in forwarding the same work . The pianoforte at which [Marianne]90-marianne , wrapped up in [her]90-marianne own music and [her]90-marianne own thoughts , had by this time forgotten that any body was in [the room]2842-the room besides [herself]90-marianne , was luckily so near [them]1306-the two fair rivals that [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood now judged [she]84-miss dashwood might safely , under the shelter of its noise , introduce the interesting subject , without any risk of being heard at the card - table . CHAPTER XXIV . In a firm , though cautious tone , [Elinor]89-elinor thus began . “ [I]89-elinor should be undeserving of the confidence [you]138-lucy have honoured [me]89-elinor with , if [I]89-elinor felt no desire for its continuance , or no farther curiosity on its subject . [I]89-elinor will not apologize therefore for bringing it forward again . ”[89-elinor] “ Thank [you]138-lucy , ”[138-lucy] cried [Lucy]138-lucy warmly , “ for breaking the ice ; [you]138-lucy have set [my]138-lucy heart at ease by it ; for [I]138-lucy was somehow or other afraid [I]138-lucy had offended [you]138-lucy by what [I]138-lucy told [you]138-lucy that Monday . ”[138-lucy] “ Offended [me]89-elinor ! How could [you]138-lucy suppose so ? Believe [me]89-elinor , ”[89-elinor] and [Elinor]89-elinor spoke it with the truest sincerity , “ nothing could be farther from [my]89-elinor intention than to give [you]138-lucy such an idea . Could [you]138-lucy have a motive for the trust , that was not honourable and flattering to [me]89-elinor ? ”[89-elinor] “ And yet [I]138-lucy do assure [you]138-lucy , ”[138-lucy] replied [Lucy]138-lucy , [her]138-lucy little sharp eyes full of meaning , “ there seemed to [me]138-lucy to be a coldness and displeasure in [your]138-lucy manner that made [me]138-lucy quite uncomfortable . [I]138-lucy felt sure that [you]138-lucy was angry with [me]138-lucy ; and have been quarrelling with [myself]138-lucy ever since , for having took such a liberty as to trouble [you]138-lucy with [my]138-lucy affairs . But [I]138-lucy am very glad to find it was only [my]138-lucy own fancy , and that [you]138-lucy really do not blame [me]138-lucy . If [you]138-lucy knew what a consolation it was to [me]138-lucy to relieve [my]138-lucy heart speaking to [you]138-lucy of what [I]138-lucy am always thinking of every moment of [my]138-lucy life , [your]138-lucy compassion would make [you]138-lucy overlook every thing else [I]138-lucy am sure . ”[138-lucy] “ Indeed , [I]89-elinor can easily believe that it was a very great relief to [you]138-lucy , to acknowledge [your]138-lucy situation to [me]89-elinor , and be assured that [you]138-lucy shall never have reason to repent it . [Your]138-lucy case is a very unfortunate one ; [you]138-lucy seem to [me]89-elinor to be surrounded with difficulties , and [you]138-lucy will have need of all [your]138-lucy mutual affection to support [you]138-lucy under [them]3445-them . [Mr. Ferrars]94-edward , [I]89-elinor believe , is entirely dependent on [[his]94-edward mother]270-his mother . ”[89-elinor] “ [He]94-edward has only two thousand pounds of [his]94-edward own ; it would be madness to marry upon that , though for [my]138-lucy own part , [I]138-lucy could give up every prospect of more without a sigh . [I]138-lucy have been always used to a very small income , and could struggle with any poverty for [him]94-edward ; but [I]138-lucy love [him]94-edward too well to be the selfish means of robbing [him]94-edward , perhaps , of all that [[his]94-edward mother]270-his mother might give [him]94-edward if [he]94-edward married to please [her]270-his mother . [We]3448-we must wait , it may be for many years . With [almost every other man in [the world]2778-the world]3449-almost every other man in the world , it would be an alarming prospect ; but [Edward]94-edward ’s affection and constancy nothing can deprive [me]138-lucy of [I]138-lucy know . ”[138-lucy] “ That conviction must be every thing to [you]138-lucy ; and [he]94-edward is undoubtedly supported by the same trust in [your]138-lucy ’s . If the strength of [your]138-lucy reciprocal attachment had failed , as between [many people]3201-many people , and under many circumstances it naturally would during a four years ’ engagement , [your]138-lucy situation would have been pitiable , indeed . ”[138-lucy] [Lucy]138-lucy here looked up ; but [Elinor]89-elinor was careful in guarding [her]89-elinor countenance from every expression that could give [her]89-elinor words a suspicious tendency . “ [Edward]94-edward ’s love for [me]138-lucy , ”[138-lucy] said [Lucy]138-lucy , “ has been pretty well put to the test , by [our]3452-our long , very long absence since [we]3452-our were first engaged , and it has stood the trial so well , that [I]138-lucy should be unpardonable to doubt it now . [I]138-lucy can safely say that [he]94-edward has never gave [me]138-lucy one moment ’s alarm on that account from the first . ”[138-lucy] [Elinor]89-elinor hardly knew whether to smile or sigh at this assertion . [Lucy]138-lucy went on . “ [I]138-lucy am rather of a jealous temper too by nature , and from [our]3452-our different situations in life , from [his]94-edward being so much more in [the world]2778-the world than [me]138-lucy , and [our]3452-our continual separation , [I]138-lucy was enough inclined for suspicion , to have found out the truth in an instant , if there had been the slightest alteration in [his]94-edward behaviour to [me]138-lucy when [we]3452-our met , or any lowness of spirits that [I]138-lucy could not account for , or if [he]94-edward had talked more of [one lady]3454-one lady than another , or seemed in any respect less happy at [Longstaple]36-longstaple than [he]94-edward used to be . [I]138-lucy do not mean to say that [I]138-lucy am particularly observant or quick - sighted in general , but in such a case [I]138-lucy am sure [I]138-lucy could not be deceived . ”[138-lucy] “ All this , ”[89-elinor] thought [Elinor]89-elinor , “ is very pretty ; but it can impose upon neither of [us]3452-our . ”[89-elinor] “ But what , ”[89-elinor] said [she]89-elinor after a short silence , “ are [your]89-elinor views ? or have [you]89-elinor none but that of waiting for [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward ’s death , which is a melancholy and shocking extremity?—Is [[her]98-edward son]1054-her son determined to submit to this , and to all the tediousness of the many years of suspense in which it may involve [you]89-elinor , rather than run the risk of [her]98-edward displeasure for a while by owning the truth ? ”[89-elinor] “ If [we]3452-our could be certain that it would be only for a while ! But [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward is [a very headstrong proud woman]3456-a very headstrong proud woman , and in [her]98-edward first fit of anger upon hearing it , would very likely secure every thing to [Robert]144-robert , and the idea of that , for [Edward]98-edward ’s sake , frightens away all [my]89-elinor inclination for hasty measures . ”[89-elinor] “ And for [your]89-elinor own sake too , or [you]89-elinor are carrying [your]89-elinor disinterestedness beyond reason . ”[138-lucy] [Lucy]138-lucy looked at [Elinor]89-elinor again , and was silent . “ Do [you]89-elinor know [Mr. Robert Ferrars]144-robert ? ”[89-elinor] asked [Elinor]89-elinor . “ Not at all — [I]89-elinor never saw [him]144-robert ; but [I]89-elinor fancy [he]144-robert is very unlike [[his]144-robert brother]3045-his brother — silly and [a great coxcomb]3458-a great coxcomb . ”[89-elinor] “ [A great coxcomb]3458-a great coxcomb ! ”[138-lucy] repeated [Miss Steele]138-lucy , whose ear had caught those words by a sudden pause in [Marianne]90-marianne ’s music . “ Oh , [they]3460-they are talking of [[their]3460-they favourite beaux]3461-their favourite beaux , [I]138-lucy dare say . ”[138-lucy] “ [No sister]3462-no sister , ”[138-lucy] cried [Lucy]138-lucy , “ [you]3462-no sister are mistaken there , [[our]3463-our favourite beaux]3464-our favourite beaux are _ not _ great coxcombs . ”[138-lucy] “ [I]103-mrs. jennings can answer for it that [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood ’s is not , ”[103-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , laughing heartily ; “ for [he]144-robert is [one of [the modestest , prettiest behaved young men [I]103-mrs. jennings ever saw]3466-the modestest , prettiest behaved young men i ever saw]3465-one of the modestest , prettiest behaved young men i ever saw ; but as for [Lucy]138-lucy , [she]138-lucy is such [a sly little creature]3467-a sly little creature , there is no finding out who _ [she]138-lucy _ likes . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ Oh , ”[138-lucy] cried [Miss Steele]138-lucy , looking significantly round at [them]1308-them , “ [I]138-lucy dare say [[Lucy]138-lucy ’s beau]3468-lucy ’s beau is quite as modest and pretty behaved as [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood ’s . ”[138-lucy] [Elinor]89-elinor blushed in spite of [herself]89-elinor . [Lucy]138-lucy bit [her]138-lucy lip , and looked angrily at [[her]138-lucy sister]336-her sister . A mutual silence took place for some time . [Lucy]138-lucy first put an end to it by saying in a lower tone , though [Marianne]90-marianne was then giving [them]1308-them the powerful protection of [a very magnificent concerto]1310-a very magnificent concerto , — “ [I]90-marianne will honestly tell [you]336-her sister of one scheme which has lately come into [my]90-marianne head , for bringing matters to bear ; indeed [I]90-marianne am bound to let [you]336-her sister into the secret , for [you]336-her sister are [a party concerned]3469-a party concerned . [I]90-marianne dare say [you]336-her sister have seen enough of [Edward]98-edward to know that [he]3470-he would prefer the church to every other profession ; now [my]90-marianne plan is that [he]3470-he should take orders as soon as [he]3470-he can , and then through [your]336-her sister interest , which [I]90-marianne am sure [you]336-her sister would be kind enough to use out of friendship for [him]3470-he , and [I]90-marianne hope out of some regard to [me]90-marianne , [[your]336-her sister brother]3364-your brother might be persuaded to give [him]3470-he [Norland]3-norland living ; which [I]90-marianne understand is a very good one , and [the present]3472-the present incumbent not likely to live a great while . That would be enough for [us]3473-we to marry upon , and [we]3473-we might trust to time and chance for the rest . ”[90-marianne] “ [I]89-elinor should always be happy , ”[89-elinor] replied [Elinor]89-elinor , “ to show any mark of [my]89-elinor esteem and friendship for [Mr. Ferrars]144-robert ; but do [you]336-her sister not perceive that [my]89-elinor interest on such an occasion would be perfectly unnecessary ? [He]144-robert is brother to [Mrs. John Dashwood—_that]88-mrs. dashwood _ must be recommendation enough to [[her]88-mrs. dashwood husband]319-her husband . ”[89-elinor] “ But [Mrs. John Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood would not much approve of [Edward]98-edward ’s going into orders . ”[90-marianne] “ Then [I]1311-i rather suspect that [my]1311-i interest would do very little . ”[1311-i] [They]1311-i were again silent for many minutes . At length [Lucy]138-lucy exclaimed with a deep sigh , “ [I]138-lucy believe it would be the wisest way to put an end to the business at once by dissolving the engagement . [We]3473-we seem so beset with difficulties on every side , that though it would make [us]3473-we miserable for a time , [we]3473-we should be happier perhaps in the end . But [you]336-her sister will not give [me]138-lucy [your]336-her sister advice , [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood ? ”[138-lucy] “ No , ”[89-elinor] answered [Elinor]89-elinor , with a smile , which concealed very agitated feelings , “ on such a subject [I]89-elinor certainly will not . [You]336-her sister know very well that [my]89-elinor opinion would have no weight with [you]336-her sister , unless it were on the side of [your]336-her sister wishes . ”[89-elinor] “ Indeed [you]336-her sister wrong [me]138-lucy , ”[138-lucy] replied [Lucy]138-lucy , with great solemnity ; “ [I]138-lucy know nobody of whose judgment [I]138-lucy think so highly as [I]138-lucy do of [yours]336-her sister ; and [I]138-lucy do really believe , that if [you]336-her sister was to say to [me]138-lucy , ‘ [I]138-lucy advise [you]336-her sister by all means to put an end to [your]336-her sister engagement with [Edward Ferrars]98-edward , it will be more for the happiness of both of [you]336-her sister , ’ [I]138-lucy should resolve upon doing it immediately . ”[138-lucy] [Elinor]89-elinor blushed for the insincerity of [[Edward]98-edward ’s future wife]1312-edward ’s future wife , and replied , “ This compliment would effectually frighten [me]89-elinor from giving any opinion on the subject had [I]89-elinor formed one . It raises [my]89-elinor influence much too high ; the power of dividing [two people]3475-two people so tenderly attached is too much for [an indifferent person]3476-an indifferent person . ”[89-elinor] “ ’ Tis because [you]336-her sister are [an indifferent person]3476-an indifferent person , ”[138-lucy] said [Lucy]138-lucy , with some pique , and laying a particular stress on those words , “ that [your]336-her sister judgment might justly have such weight with [me]138-lucy . If [you]336-her sister could be supposed to be biased in any respect by [your]336-her sister own feelings , [your]336-her sister opinion would not be worth having . ”[138-lucy] [Elinor]89-elinor thought it wisest to make no answer to this , lest [they]1313-they might provoke [each other]338-each other to an unsuitable increase of ease and unreserve ; and was even partly determined never to mention the subject again . Another pause therefore of many minutes ’ duration , succeeded this speech , and [Lucy]138-lucy was still the first to end it . “ Shall [you]336-her sister be in [town]2984-town this winter , [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood ? ”[138-lucy] said [she]138-lucy with all [her]138-lucy accustomary complacency . “ Certainly not . ”[138-lucy] “ [I]772-the other am sorry for that , ”[772-the other] returned [the other]772-the other , while [her]772-the other eyes brightened at the information , “ it would have gave [me]772-the other such pleasure to meet [you]336-her sister [there]354-there ! But [I]772-the other dare say [you]336-her sister will go for all that . To be sure , [[your]336-her sister brother]3364-your brother and [sister]438-sister will ask [you]336-her sister to come to [them]354-there . ”[772-the other] “ It will not be in [my]138-lucy power to accept [their]354-there invitation if [they]354-there do . ”[138-lucy] “ How unlucky that is ! [I]772-the other had quite depended upon meeting [you]336-her sister [there]354-there . [Anne]143-nancy and [me]772-the other are to go the latter end of January to [some relations who have been wanting [us]393-the two ladies to visit [them]354-there these several years]3483-some relations who have been wanting us to visit them these several years ! But [I]772-the other only go for the sake of seeing [Edward]98-edward . [He]3484-he will be there in February , otherwise [London]24-london would have no charms for [me]772-the other ; [I]772-the other have not spirits for it . ”[772-the other] [Elinor]89-elinor was soon called to the card - table by the conclusion of the first rubber , and the confidential discourse of [the two ladies]393-the two ladies was therefore at an end , to which [both of [them]393-the two ladies]851-both of them submitted without any reluctance , for nothing had been said on either side to make [them]393-the two ladies dislike [each other]338-each other less than [they]393-the two ladies had done before ; and [Elinor]89-elinor sat down to the card table with the melancholy persuasion that [Edward]98-edward was not only without affection for [the person who was to be [[his]1320-he wife]280-his wife]1319-the person who was to be his wife ; but that [he]1320-he had not even the chance of being tolerably happy in marriage , which sincere affection on _ [her]89-elinor _ side would have given , for self - interest alone could induce [a woman]816-a woman to keep [a man]499-a man to an engagement , of which [she]89-elinor seemed so thoroughly aware that [he]1320-he was weary . From this time the subject was never revived by [Elinor]89-elinor , and when entered on by [Lucy]138-lucy , who seldom missed an opportunity of introducing it , and was particularly careful to inform [[her]138-lucy confidante]1324-her confidante , of [her]138-lucy happiness whenever [she]138-lucy received a letter from [Edward]98-edward , it was treated by [the former]392-the former with calmness and caution , and dismissed as soon as civility would allow ; for [she]138-lucy felt such conversations to be an indulgence which [Lucy]138-lucy did not deserve , and which were dangerous to [herself]138-lucy . The visit of [the Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles at [Barton Park]6-barton park was lengthened far beyond what the first invitation implied .
