[Their]1326-their favour increased ; [they]1326-their could not be spared ; [Sir John]99-sir john would not hear of [their]1326-their going ; and in spite of [their]1326-their numerous and long arranged engagements in [Exeter]10-exeter , in spite of the absolute necessity of returning to fulfill [them]1326-their immediately , which was in full force at the end of every week , [they]1326-their were prevailed on to stay nearly two months at [the park]566-the park , and to assist in the due celebration of that festival which requires a more than ordinary share of private balls and large dinners to proclaim its importance . CHAPTER XXV . Though [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings was in the habit of spending a large portion of the year at [the houses of [[her]103-mrs. jennings children]495-her children and [friends]3231-friends]1328-the houses of her children and friends , [she]103-mrs. jennings was not without [a settled habitation of [her]103-mrs. jennings own]1331-a settled habitation of her own . Since the death of [[her]103-mrs. jennings husband]319-her husband , who had traded with success in [a less elegant part of [the town]1334-the town]1333-a less elegant part of the town , [she]103-mrs. jennings had resided every winter in [a house in one of [the streets near [Portman Square]38-portman square]1336-the streets near portman square]1335-a house in one of the streets near portman square . Towards [this home]1337-this home , [she]103-mrs. jennings began on the approach of [January]148-january to turn [her]103-mrs. jennings thoughts , and thither [she]103-mrs. jennings one day abruptly , and very unexpectedly by [them]1338-them , asked [the elder Misses Dashwood]149-the elder misses dashwood to accompany [her]103-mrs. jennings . [Elinor]89-elinor , without observing the varying complexion of [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister , and the animated look which spoke no indifference to the plan , immediately gave a grateful but absolute denial for both , in which [she]89-elinor believed [herself]89-elinor to be speaking [their]1340-their united inclinations . The reason alleged was [their]1340-their determined resolution of not leaving [[their]1340-their mother]274-their mother at that time of the year . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings received the refusal with some surprise , and repeated [her]103-mrs. jennings invitation immediately . “ Oh , [Lord]3485-lord ! [I]103-mrs. jennings am sure [[your]3485-lord mother]2781-your mother can spare [you]3485-lord very well , and [I]103-mrs. jennings _ do _ beg [you]3485-lord will favour [me]103-mrs. jennings with [[your]3485-lord company]3487-your company , for [I]103-mrs. jennings ’ve quite set [my]103-mrs. jennings heart upon it . Do n’t fancy that [you]3485-lord will be any inconvenience to [me]103-mrs. jennings , for [I]103-mrs. jennings sha n’t put [myself]103-mrs. jennings at all out of [my]103-mrs. jennings way for [you]3485-lord . It will only be sending [Betty]150-eliza by [the coach]3488-the coach , and [I]103-mrs. jennings hope [I]103-mrs. jennings can afford _ that _ . [We]3489-we three shall be able to go very well in [my]103-mrs. jennings chaise ; and when [we]3489-we are in [town]2984-town , if [you]3485-lord do not like to go wherever [I]103-mrs. jennings do , well and good , [you]3485-lord may always go with [one of [[my]103-mrs. jennings daughters]3492-my daughters]3491-one of my daughters . [I]103-mrs. jennings am sure [[your]3485-lord mother]2781-your mother will not object to it ; for [I]103-mrs. jennings have had such good luck in getting [[my]103-mrs. jennings own children]3494-my own children off [my]103-mrs. jennings hands that [she]2781-your mother will think [me]103-mrs. jennings [a very fit person]3495-a very fit person to have the charge of [you]3485-lord ; and if [I]103-mrs. jennings do n’t get one of [you]3485-lord at least well married before [I]103-mrs. jennings have done with [you]3485-lord , it shall not be [my]103-mrs. jennings fault . [I]103-mrs. jennings shall speak a good word for [you]3485-lord to [all the young men]3496-all the young men , [you]3485-lord may depend upon it . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ [I]99-sir john have a notion , ”[99-sir john] said [Sir John]99-sir john , “ that [Miss Marianne]90-marianne would not object to such a scheme , if [[her]90-marianne elder sister]3497-her elder sister would come into it . It is very hard indeed that [she]90-marianne should not have a little pleasure , because [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood does not wish it . So [I]99-sir john would advise [you]3485-lord two , to set off for [town]2984-town , when [you]3485-lord are tired of [Barton]6-barton park , without saying a word to [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood about it . ”[99-sir john] “ Nay , ”[103-mrs. jennings] cried [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , “ [I]103-mrs. jennings am sure [I]103-mrs. jennings shall be monstrous glad of [[Miss Marianne]90-marianne ’s company]3499-miss marianne ’s company , whether [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood will go or not , only the more the merrier say [I]103-mrs. jennings , and [I]103-mrs. jennings thought it would be more comfortable for [them]3485-lord to be together ; because , if [they]3485-lord got tired of [me]103-mrs. jennings , [they]3485-lord might talk to [one another]1089-one another , and laugh at [my]103-mrs. jennings odd ways behind [my]103-mrs. jennings back . But [one or the other]3501-one or the other , if not both of [them]3485-lord , [I]103-mrs. jennings must have . [Lord]3502-lord bless [me]103-mrs. jennings ! how do [you]3503-you think [I]103-mrs. jennings can live poking by [myself]103-mrs. jennings , [I]103-mrs. jennings who have been always used till this winter to have [Charlotte]127-charlotte with [me]103-mrs. jennings . Come , [Miss Marianne]90-marianne , let [us]3504-us strike hands upon the bargain , and if [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood will change [her]84-miss dashwood mind by and bye , why so much the better . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ [I]90-marianne thank [you]3503-you , [ma’am]2974-ma’am , sincerely thank [you]3503-you , ”[90-marianne] said [Marianne]90-marianne , with warmth : “ [your]3503-you invitation has insured [my]90-marianne gratitude for ever , and it would give [me]90-marianne such happiness , yes , almost the greatest happiness [I]90-marianne am capable of , to be able to accept it . But [[my]90-marianne mother]2771-my mother , [[my]90-marianne dearest]3507-my dearest , kindest mother,—I feel the justice of what [Elinor]89-elinor has urged , and if [she]89-elinor were to be made less happy , less comfortable by [our]1342-our absence — Oh ! no , nothing should tempt [me]90-marianne to leave [her]89-elinor . It should not , must not be a struggle . ”[90-marianne] [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings repeated [her]103-mrs. jennings assurance that [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood could spare [them]1342-our perfectly well ; and [Elinor]89-elinor , who now understood [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister , and saw to what indifference to almost every thing else [she]89-elinor was carried by [her]89-elinor eagerness to be with [Willoughby]107-willoughby again , made no farther direct opposition to the plan , and merely referred it to [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother ’s decision , from whom however [she]89-elinor scarcely expected to receive any support in [her]89-elinor endeavour to prevent a visit , which [she]89-elinor could not approve of for [Marianne]90-marianne , and which on [her]89-elinor own account [she]89-elinor had particular reasons to avoid . Whatever [Marianne]90-marianne was desirous of , [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother would be eager to promote — [she]332-her mother could not expect to influence [the latter]325-the latter to cautiousness of conduct in an affair respecting which [she]332-her mother had never been able to inspire [her]332-her mother with distrust ; and [she]332-her mother dared not explain the motive of [her]332-her mother own disinclination for going to [London]24-london . That [Marianne]90-marianne , fastidious as [she]90-marianne was , thoroughly acquainted with [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’ manners , and invariably disgusted by [them]1347-them , should overlook every inconvenience of that kind , should disregard whatever must be most wounding to [her]90-marianne irritable feelings , in [her]90-marianne pursuit of one object , was such a proof , so strong , so full , of the importance of that object to [her]90-marianne , as [Elinor]89-elinor , in spite of all that had passed , was not prepared to witness . On being informed of the invitation , [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood , persuaded that such an excursion would be productive of much amusement to both [[her]88-mrs. dashwood daughters]294-her daughters , and perceiving through all [her]88-mrs. dashwood affectionate attention to [herself]88-mrs. dashwood , how much the heart of [Marianne]90-marianne was in it , would not hear of [their]294-her daughters declining the offer upon _ [her]88-mrs. dashwood _ account ; insisted on [[their]294-her daughters both]1349-their both accepting it directly ; and then began to foresee , with [her]88-mrs. dashwood usual cheerfulness , a variety of advantages that would accrue to [them]294-her daughters all , from this separation . “ [I]88-mrs. dashwood am delighted with the plan , ”[88-mrs. dashwood] [she]88-mrs. dashwood cried , “ it is exactly what [I]88-mrs. dashwood could wish . [Margaret]91-margaret and [I]88-mrs. dashwood shall be as much benefited by it as [yourselves]294-her daughters . When [you]294-her daughters and [the Middletons]102-the middletons are gone , [we]294-her daughters shall go on so quietly and happily together with [our]294-her daughters books and [our]294-her daughters music ! [You]294-her daughters will find [Margaret]91-margaret so improved when [you]294-her daughters come back again ! [I]88-mrs. dashwood have a little plan of alteration for [[your]294-her daughters bedrooms]3508-your bedrooms too , which may now be performed without any inconvenience to [any one]659-any one . It is very right that [you]294-her daughters _ should _ go to [town]2984-town ; [I]88-mrs. dashwood would have [every young woman of [your]294-her daughters condition in life acquainted with the manners and amusements of [London]24-london]3511-every young woman of your condition in life acquainted with the manners and amusements of london . [You]294-her daughters will be under the care of [a motherly good sort of woman]3512-a motherly good sort of woman , of whose kindness to [you]294-her daughters [I]88-mrs. dashwood can have no doubt . And in all probability [you]294-her daughters will see [[your]294-her daughters brother]3364-your brother , and whatever may be [his]3364-your brother faults , or the faults of [[his]3364-your brother wife]280-his wife , when [I]88-mrs. dashwood consider whose son [he]3364-your brother is , [I]88-mrs. dashwood can not bear to have [you]294-her daughters so wholly estranged from [each other]338-each other . ”[88-mrs. dashwood] “ Though with [your]294-her daughters usual anxiety for [our]3516-us happiness , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor , “ [you]294-her daughters have been obviating every impediment to the present scheme which occurred to [you]294-her daughters , there is still one objection which , in [my]89-elinor opinion , can not be so easily removed . ”[89-elinor] [Marianne]90-marianne ’s countenance sunk . “ And what , ”[88-mrs. dashwood] said [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood , “ is [[my]88-mrs. dashwood dear]2750-my dear prudent [Elinor]89-elinor going to suggest ? What formidable obstacle is [she]90-marianne now to bring forward ? Do not let [me]88-mrs. dashwood hear a word about the expense of it . ”[88-mrs. dashwood] “ [My]332-her mother objection is this ; though [I]332-her mother think very well of [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s heart , [she]90-marianne is [not a woman whose society can afford [us]3516-us pleasure , or whose protection will give [us]3516-us consequence]3518-not a woman whose society can afford us pleasure , or whose protection will give us consequence . ”[332-her mother] “ That is very true , ”[332-her mother] replied [[her]90-marianne mother]332-her mother , “ but of [[her]103-mrs. jennings society]3519-her society , separately from that of [other people]2834-other people , [you]90-marianne will scarcely have any thing at all , and [you]90-marianne will almost always appear in public with [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton . ”[332-her mother] “ If [Elinor]89-elinor is frightened away by [her]89-elinor dislike of [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , ”[90-marianne] said [Marianne]90-marianne , “ at least it need not prevent [MY]90-marianne accepting [her]103-mrs. jennings invitation . [I]90-marianne have no such scruples , and [I]90-marianne am sure [I]90-marianne could put up with every unpleasantness of that kind with very little effort . ”[90-marianne] [Elinor]89-elinor could not help smiling at this display of indifference towards the manners of [a person]1351-a person , to whom [she]89-elinor had often had difficulty in persuading [Marianne]90-marianne to behave with tolerable politeness ; and resolved within [herself]89-elinor , that if [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister persisted in going , [she]89-elinor would go likewise , as [she]89-elinor did not think it proper that [Marianne]90-marianne should be left to the sole guidance of [her]90-marianne own judgment , or that [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings should be abandoned to the mercy of [Marianne]90-marianne for all the comfort of [her]90-marianne domestic hours . To this determination [she]89-elinor was the more easily reconciled , by recollecting that [Edward Ferrars]98-edward , by [Lucy]138-lucy ’s account , was not to be in [town]2984-town before February ; and that [their]1354-their visit , without any unreasonable abridgement , might be previously finished . “ [I]88-mrs. dashwood will have [you]3521-you _ both _ go , ”[88-mrs. dashwood] said [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood ; “ these objections are nonsensical . [You]3521-you will have much pleasure in being in [London]24-london , and especially in being together ; and if [Elinor]89-elinor would ever condescend to anticipate enjoyment , [she]89-elinor would foresee it there from a variety of sources ; [she]89-elinor would , perhaps , expect some from improving [her]89-elinor acquaintance with [[her]89-elinor sister - in - law ’s family]3522-her sister - in - law ’s family . ”[88-mrs. dashwood] [Elinor]89-elinor had often wished for an opportunity of attempting to weaken [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother ’s dependence on the attachment of [Edward]98-edward and [herself]89-elinor , that the shock might be less when the whole truth were revealed , and now on this attack , though almost hopeless of success , [she]89-elinor forced [herself]89-elinor to begin [her]89-elinor design by saying , as calmly as [she]89-elinor could , “ [I]89-elinor like [Edward Ferrars]98-edward very much , and shall always be glad to see [him]3523-him ; but as to [the rest of [the family]303-the family]302-the rest of the family , it is a matter of perfect indifference to [me]89-elinor , whether [I]89-elinor am ever known to [them]302-the rest of the family or not . ”[89-elinor] [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood smiled , and said nothing . [Marianne]90-marianne lifted up [her]90-marianne eyes in astonishment , and [Elinor]89-elinor conjectured that [she]89-elinor might as well have held [her]89-elinor tongue . After very little farther discourse , it was finally settled that the invitation should be fully accepted . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings received the information with a great deal of joy , and many assurances of kindness and care ; nor was it a matter of pleasure merely to [her]103-mrs. jennings . [Sir John]99-sir john was delighted ; for to [a man , whose prevailing anxiety was the dread of being alone]1356-a man , whose prevailing anxiety was the dread of being alone , the acquisition of two , to [the number of inhabitants in [London]24-london]1357-the number of inhabitants in london , was something . Even [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton took the trouble of being delighted , which was putting [herself]100-lady middleton rather out of [her]100-lady middleton way ; and as for [the Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles , especially [Lucy]138-lucy , [they]1358-they had never been so happy in [their]1358-they lives as this intelligence made [them]1358-they . [Elinor]89-elinor submitted to the arrangement which counteracted [her]89-elinor wishes with less reluctance than [she]89-elinor had expected to feel . With regard to [herself]89-elinor , it was now a matter of unconcern whether [she]89-elinor went to [town]2984-town or not , and when [she]89-elinor saw [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother so thoroughly pleased with the plan , and [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister exhilarated by it in look , voice , and manner , restored to all [her]89-elinor usual animation , and elevated to more than [her]89-elinor usual gaiety , [she]89-elinor could not be dissatisfied with the cause , and would hardly allow [herself]89-elinor to distrust the consequence . [Marianne]90-marianne ’s joy was almost a degree beyond happiness , so great was the perturbation of [her]90-marianne spirits and [her]90-marianne impatience to be gone . [Her]90-marianne unwillingness to quit [[her]90-marianne mother]332-her mother was [her]90-marianne only restorative to calmness ; and at the moment of parting [her]90-marianne grief on that score was excessive . [[Her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother ’s affliction was hardly less , and [Elinor]89-elinor was the only one of [the three , who seemed to consider the separation as any thing short of eternal]1364-the three , who seemed to consider the separation as any thing short of eternal . [Their]1365-their departure took place in the first week in January . [The Middletons]102-the middletons were to follow in about a week . [The Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles kept [their]1365-their station at [the park]566-the park , and were to quit it only with [the rest of [the family]303-the family]302-the rest of the family . CHAPTER XXVI . [Elinor]89-elinor could not find [herself]89-elinor in [the carriage]1118-the carriage with [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , and beginning a journey to [London]24-london under [her]103-mrs. jennings protection , and as [[her]103-mrs. jennings guest]1370-her guest , without wondering at [her]89-elinor own situation , so short had [their]1365-their acquaintance with [that lady]1245-that lady been , so wholly unsuited were [they]1365-their in age and disposition , and so many had been [her]103-mrs. jennings objections against such a measure only a few days before ! But these objections had all , with that happy ardour of youth which [Marianne]90-marianne and [[her]90-marianne mother]332-her mother equally shared , been overcome or overlooked ; and [Elinor]89-elinor , in spite of every occasional doubt of [Willoughby]107-willoughby ’s constancy , could not witness the rapture of delightful expectation which filled the whole soul and beamed in the eyes of [Marianne]90-marianne , without feeling how blank was [her]89-elinor own prospect , how cheerless [her]89-elinor own state of mind in the comparison , and how gladly [she]89-elinor would engage in the solicitude of [Marianne]90-marianne ’s situation to have the same animating object in view , the same possibility of hope . A short , a very short time however must now decide what [Willoughby]107-willoughby ’s intentions were ; in all probability [he]107-willoughby was already in [town]2984-town . [Marianne]90-marianne ’s eagerness to be gone declared [her]90-marianne dependence on finding [him]107-willoughby [there]354-there ; and [Elinor]89-elinor was resolved not only upon gaining every new light as to [his]107-willoughby character which [her]89-elinor own observation or the intelligence of [others]2961-others could give [her]89-elinor , but likewise upon watching [his]107-willoughby behaviour to [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister with such zealous attention , as to ascertain what [he]107-willoughby was and what [he]107-willoughby meant , before many meetings had taken place . Should the result of [her]89-elinor observations be unfavourable , [she]89-elinor was determined at all events to open the eyes of [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister ; should it be otherwise , [her]89-elinor exertions would be of a different nature — [she]89-elinor must then learn to avoid every selfish comparison , and banish every regret which might lessen [her]89-elinor satisfaction in the happiness of [Marianne]90-marianne . [They]1378-their were three days on [their]1378-their journey , and [Marianne]90-marianne ’s behaviour as [they]1378-their travelled was a happy specimen of what future complaisance and companionableness to [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings might be expected to be . [She]90-marianne sat in silence almost all the way , wrapt in [her]90-marianne own meditations , and scarcely ever voluntarily speaking , except when any object of picturesque beauty within [their]1378-their view drew from [her]90-marianne an exclamation of delight exclusively addressed to [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister . To atone for this conduct therefore , [Elinor]89-elinor took immediate possession of the post of civility which [she]89-elinor had assigned [herself]89-elinor , behaved with the greatest attention to [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , talked with [her]103-mrs. jennings , laughed with [her]103-mrs. jennings , and listened to [her]103-mrs. jennings whenever [she]89-elinor could ; and [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings on [her]103-mrs. jennings side treated [them]1378-their both with all possible kindness , was solicitous on every occasion for [their]1378-their ease and enjoyment , and only disturbed that [she]103-mrs. jennings could not make [them]1378-their choose [their]1378-their own dinners at [the inn]1380-the inn , nor extort a confession of [their]1378-their preferring salmon to cod , or boiled fowls to veal cutlets . [They]1378-their reached [town]2984-town by three o’clock the third day , glad to be released , after such a journey , from the confinement of [a carriage]3157-a carriage , and ready to enjoy all the luxury of a good fire . [The house]318-the house was handsome , and handsomely fitted up , and [the young ladies]628-the young ladies were immediately put in possession of [a very comfortable apartment]1385-a very comfortable apartment . It had formerly been [[Charlotte]127-charlotte ’s]1386-charlotte ’s , and over the mantelpiece still hung a landscape in coloured silks of [her]127-charlotte performance , in proof of [her]127-charlotte having spent seven years at [a great school in [town]2984-town]1387-a great school in town to some effect . As dinner was not to be ready in less than two hours from [their]1378-their arrival , [Elinor]89-elinor determined to employ the interval in writing to [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother , and sat down for that purpose . In a few moments [Marianne]90-marianne did the same . “ _ [I]89-elinor _ am writing [home]565-home , [Marianne]90-marianne , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor ; “ had not [you]90-marianne better defer [your]90-marianne letter for a day or two ? ”[89-elinor] “ [I]90-marianne am _ not _ going to write to [[my]90-marianne mother]2771-my mother , ”[90-marianne] replied [Marianne]90-marianne , hastily , and as if wishing to avoid any farther inquiry . [Elinor]89-elinor said no more ; it immediately struck [her]89-elinor that [she]89-elinor must then be writing to [Willoughby]107-willoughby ; and the conclusion which as instantly followed was , that , however mysteriously [they]1378-their might wish to conduct the affair , [they]1378-their must be engaged . This conviction , though not entirely satisfactory , gave [her]89-elinor pleasure , and [she]89-elinor continued [her]89-elinor letter with greater alacrity . [Marianne]90-marianne ’s was finished in a very few minutes ; in length it could be no more than a note ; it was then folded up , sealed , and directed with eager rapidity . [Elinor]89-elinor thought [she]89-elinor could distinguish a large W in the direction ; and no sooner was it complete than [Marianne]90-marianne , ringing the bell , requested [the footman who answered it]1390-the footman who answered it to get that letter conveyed for [her]89-elinor to the two - penny post . This decided the matter at once . [Her]89-elinor spirits still continued very high ; but there was a flutter in them which prevented [their]1378-their giving much pleasure to [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister , and this agitation increased as the evening drew on . [She]89-elinor could scarcely eat any dinner , and when [they]1378-their afterwards returned to [the drawing room]627-the drawing room , seemed anxiously listening to the sound of [every carriage]1393-every carriage . It was a great satisfaction to [Elinor]89-elinor that [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , by being much engaged in [[her]103-mrs. jennings own room]1394-her own room , could see little of what was passing . The tea things were brought in , and already had [Marianne]90-marianne been disappointed more than once by a rap at a neighbouring door , when a loud one was suddenly heard which could not be mistaken for one at [any other house]1395-any other house , [Elinor]89-elinor felt secure of [its]1396-its announcing [Willoughby]107-willoughby ’s approach , and [Marianne]90-marianne , starting up , moved towards the door . Every thing was silent ; this could not be borne many seconds ; [she]90-marianne opened the door , advanced a few steps towards the stairs , and after listening half a minute , returned into [the room]2842-the room in all the agitation which a conviction of having heard [him]107-willoughby would naturally produce ; in the ecstasy of [her]90-marianne feelings at that instant [she]90-marianne could not help exclaiming , “ Oh , [Elinor]89-elinor , it is [Willoughby]107-willoughby , indeed it is ! ”[90-marianne] and seemed almost ready to throw [herself]90-marianne into [his]107-willoughby arms , when [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon appeared . It was too great a shock to be borne with calmness , and [she]90-marianne immediately left [the room]2842-the room . [Elinor]89-elinor was disappointed too ; but at the same time [her]89-elinor regard for [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon ensured [his]107-willoughby welcome with [her]89-elinor ; and [she]89-elinor felt particularly hurt that [a man so partial to [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister]1399-a man so partial to her sister should perceive that [she]89-elinor experienced nothing but grief and disappointment in seeing [him]107-willoughby . [She]89-elinor instantly saw that it was not unnoticed by [him]107-willoughby , that [he]107-willoughby even observed [Marianne]90-marianne as [she]90-marianne quitted [the room]2842-the room , with such astonishment and concern , as hardly left [him]107-willoughby the recollection of what civility demanded towards [herself]90-marianne . “ Is [[your]89-elinor sister]2815-your sister ill ? ”[107-willoughby] said [he]107-willoughby . [Elinor]89-elinor answered in some distress that [she]89-elinor was , and then talked of head - aches , low spirits , and over fatigues ; and of every thing to which [she]89-elinor could decently attribute [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister ’s behaviour . [He]107-willoughby heard [her]89-elinor with the most earnest attention , but seeming to recollect [himself]107-willoughby , said no more on the subject , and began directly to speak of [his]107-willoughby pleasure at seeing [them]1403-them in [London]24-london , making the usual inquiries about [their]1403-them journey , and [the friends [they]1403-them had left behind]1404-the friends they had left behind . In this calm kind of way , with very little interest on either side , [they]1403-them continued to talk , both of [them]1403-them out of spirits , and the thoughts of [both engaged elsewhere]1405-both engaged elsewhere . [Elinor]89-elinor wished very much to ask whether [Willoughby]107-willoughby were then in [town]2984-town , but [she]89-elinor was afraid of giving [him]107-willoughby pain by any enquiry after [[his]107-willoughby rival]1407-his rival ; and at length , by way of saying something , [she]89-elinor asked if [he]107-willoughby had been in [London]24-london ever since [she]89-elinor had seen [him]107-willoughby last . “ Yes , ”[107-willoughby] [he]107-willoughby replied , with some embarrassment , “ almost ever since ; [I]107-willoughby have been once or twice at [Delaford]22-delaford for a few days , but it has never been in [my]107-willoughby power to return to [Barton]8-barton . ”[107-willoughby] This , and the manner in which it was said , immediately brought back to [her]89-elinor remembrance all the circumstances of [his]107-willoughby quitting [that place]1408-that place , with the uneasiness and suspicions [they]1409-they had caused to [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , and [she]89-elinor was fearful that [her]89-elinor question had implied much more curiosity on the subject than [she]89-elinor had ever felt . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings soon came in . “ Oh ! [Colonel]2980-colonel , ”[103-mrs. jennings] said [she]103-mrs. jennings , with [her]103-mrs. jennings usual noisy cheerfulness , “ [I]103-mrs. jennings am monstrous glad to see [you]2980-colonel — sorry [I]103-mrs. jennings could not come before — beg [your]2980-colonel pardon , but [I]103-mrs. jennings have been forced to look about [me]103-mrs. jennings a little , and settle [my]103-mrs. jennings matters ; for it is a long while since [I]103-mrs. jennings have been at [home]565-home , and [you]2980-colonel know one has always a world of little odd things to do after one has been away for any time ; and then [I]103-mrs. jennings have had [Cartwright]152-cartwright to settle with . [Lord]3531-lord , [I]103-mrs. jennings have been as busy as a bee ever since dinner ! But pray , [Colonel]104-colonel brandon , how came [you]2980-colonel to conjure out that [I]103-mrs. jennings should be in [town]2984-town today ? ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ [I]103-mrs. jennings had the pleasure of hearing it at [[Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer ’s]3533-mr. palmer ’s , where [I]103-mrs. jennings have been dining . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ Oh , [you]2980-colonel did ; well , and how do [they]3534-they all do at [[their]3534-they house]1012-their house ? How does [Charlotte]127-charlotte do ? [I]103-mrs. jennings warrant [you]2980-colonel [she]127-charlotte is a fine size by this time . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer appeared quite well , and [I]103-mrs. jennings am commissioned to tell [you]2980-colonel , that [you]2980-colonel will certainly see [her]127-charlotte to - morrow . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ Ay , to be sure , [I]1410-i thought as much . Well , [Colonel]104-colonel brandon , [I]1410-i have brought [two young ladies]3536-two young ladies with [me]1410-i , [you]2980-colonel see — that is , [you]2980-colonel see but one of [them]3536-two young ladies now , but there is another somewhere . [[Your]2980-colonel friend]3537-your friend , [Miss Marianne]90-marianne , too — which [you]2980-colonel will not be sorry to hear . [I]1410-i do not know what [you]2980-colonel and [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby will do between [you]2980-colonel about [her]90-marianne . [Ay]153-ay , it is a fine thing to be young and handsome . Well ! [I]1410-i was young once , but [I]1410-i never was very handsome — worse luck for [me]1410-i . However , [I]1410-i got [a very good husband]3538-a very good husband , and [I]1410-i do n’t know what [the greatest beauty]3539-the greatest beauty can do more . Ah ! [poor man]3043-poor man ! [he]3043-poor man has been dead these eight years and better . But [Colonel]104-colonel brandon , where have [you]104-colonel brandon been to since [we]3541-we parted ? And how does [your]104-colonel brandon business go on ? Come , come , let ’s have no secrets among [friends]3231-friends . ”[1410-i] [He]1410-i replied with [his]1410-i accustomary mildness to all [her]1411-her inquiries , but without satisfying [her]1411-her in any . [Elinor]89-elinor now began to make the tea , and [Marianne]90-marianne was obliged to appear again . After [her]90-marianne entrance , [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon became more thoughtful and silent than [he]104-colonel brandon had been before , and [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings could not prevail on [him]104-colonel brandon to stay long . [No other visitor]1412-no other visitor appeared that evening , and [the ladies]572-the ladies were unanimous in agreeing to go early to bed . [Marianne]90-marianne rose the next morning with recovered spirits and happy looks . The disappointment of the evening before seemed forgotten in the expectation of what was to happen that day . [They]572-the ladies had not long finished [their]572-the ladies breakfast before [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer ’s barouche stopped at the door , and in a few minutes [she]128-mrs. palmer came laughing into [the room]2842-the room : so delighted to see [them]572-the ladies all , that it was hard to say whether [she]128-mrs. palmer received most pleasure from meeting [[her]128-mrs. palmer mother]332-her mother or [the Miss Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods again . So surprised at [their]572-the ladies coming to [town]2984-town , though it was what [she]128-mrs. palmer had rather expected all along ; so angry at [their]572-the ladies accepting [[her]128-mrs. palmer mother]332-her mother ’s invitation after having declined [her]128-mrs. palmer own , though at the same time [she]128-mrs. palmer would never have forgiven [them]572-the ladies if [they]572-the ladies had not come ! “ [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer will be so happy to see [you]129-mr. palmer , ”[128-mrs. palmer] said [she]128-mrs. palmer ; “ What do [you]129-mr. palmer think [he]129-mr. palmer said when [he]129-mr. palmer heard of [your]129-mr. palmer coming with [Mama]95-mama ? [I]128-mrs. palmer forget what it was now , but it was something so droll ! ”[128-mrs. palmer] After an hour or two spent in what [[her]128-mrs. palmer mother]332-her mother called comfortable chat , or in other words , in every variety of inquiry concerning all [their]572-the ladies acquaintance on [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s side , and in laughter without cause on [[Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer ’s]1419-mrs. palmer ’s , it was proposed by [the latter]325-the latter that [they]572-the ladies should all accompany [her]128-mrs. palmer to [some shops]1421-some shops where [she]128-mrs. palmer had business that morning , to which [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings and [Elinor]89-elinor readily consented , as having likewise some purchases to make [themselves]572-the ladies ; and [Marianne]90-marianne , though declining it at first was induced to go likewise . Wherever [they]572-the ladies went , [she]90-marianne was evidently always on the watch . In [Bond Street]39-bond street especially , where much of [their]572-the ladies business lay , [her]90-marianne eyes were in constant inquiry ; and in whatever [shop]1422-shop [the party]577-the party were engaged , [her]90-marianne mind was equally abstracted from every thing actually before [them]572-the ladies , from all that interested and occupied [the others]539-the others . Restless and dissatisfied every where , [[her]128-mrs. palmer sister]336-her sister could never obtain [her]336-her sister opinion of any article of purchase , however it might equally concern [them]572-the ladies both : [she]336-her sister received no pleasure from anything ; was only impatient to be at [home]565-home again , and could with difficulty govern [her]336-her sister vexation at the tediousness of [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer , whose eye was caught by every thing pretty , expensive , or new ; who was wild to buy all , could determine on none , and dawdled away [her]336-her sister time in rapture and indecision . It was late in the morning before [they]572-the ladies returned [home]565-home ; and no sooner had [they]572-the ladies entered [the house]318-the house than [Marianne]90-marianne flew eagerly up [stairs]933-stairs , and when [Elinor]89-elinor followed , [she]89-elinor found [her]90-marianne turning from the table with a sorrowful countenance , which declared that [no Willoughby]1430-no willoughby had been [there]354-there . “ Has no letter been left [here]2861-here for [me]89-elinor since [we]572-the ladies went out ? ”[89-elinor] said [she]89-elinor to [the footman who then entered with the parcels]1432-the footman who then entered with the parcels . [She]89-elinor was answered in the negative . “ Are [you]502-the man quite sure of it ? ”[89-elinor] [she]89-elinor replied . “ Are [you]502-the man certain that [no servant]3544-no servant , [no porter]3545-no porter has left any letter or note ? ”[502-the man] [The man]502-the man replied that none had . “ How very odd ! ”[89-elinor] said [she]89-elinor , in a low and disappointed voice , as [she]89-elinor turned away to the window . “ How odd , indeed ! ”[89-elinor] repeated [Elinor]89-elinor within [herself]89-elinor , regarding [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister with uneasiness . “ If [she]89-elinor had not known [him]502-the man to be in [town]2984-town [she]89-elinor would not have written to [him]502-the man , as [she]89-elinor did ; [she]89-elinor would have written to [Combe Magna]135-combe ; and if [he]502-the man is in [town]2984-town , how odd that [he]502-the man should neither come nor write ! Oh ! [[my]89-elinor dear mother]3103-my dear mother , [you]3103-my dear mother must be wrong in permitting an engagement between a daughter so young , [a man so little known]3549-a man so little known , to be carried on in so doubtful , so mysterious a manner ! _ [I]89-elinor _ long to inquire ; and how will _ [my]89-elinor _ interference be borne . ”[89-elinor] [She]89-elinor determined , after some consideration , that if appearances continued many days longer as unpleasant as they now were , [she]89-elinor would represent in the strongest manner to [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother the necessity of some serious enquiry into the affair . [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer and [two elderly ladies of [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s intimate acquaintance , whom [she]89-elinor had met and invited in the morning]1436-two elderly ladies of mrs. jennings ’s intimate acquaintance , whom she had met and invited in the morning , dined with [them]1436-two elderly ladies of mrs. jennings ’s intimate acquaintance , whom she had met and invited in the morning . [The former]392-the former left [them]1436-two elderly ladies of mrs. jennings ’s intimate acquaintance , whom she had met and invited in the morning soon after tea to fulfill [her]89-elinor evening engagements ; and [Elinor]89-elinor was obliged to assist in making a whist table for [the others]539-the others . [Marianne]90-marianne was of no use on these occasions , as [she]90-marianne would never learn the game ; but though [her]90-marianne time was therefore at [her]90-marianne own disposal , the evening was by no means more productive of pleasure to [her]90-marianne than to [Elinor]89-elinor , for it was spent in all the anxiety of expectation and the pain of disappointment . [She]90-marianne sometimes endeavoured for a few minutes to read ; but the book was soon thrown aside , and [she]90-marianne returned to the more interesting employment of walking backwards and forwards across [the room]2842-the room , pausing for a moment whenever [she]90-marianne came to the window , in hopes of distinguishing the long - expected rap . CHAPTER XXVII . “ If this open weather holds much longer , ”[103-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , when [they]1440-they met at breakfast the following morning , “ [Sir John]99-sir john will not like leaving [Barton]8-barton next week ; ’ tis a sad thing for [sportsmen]622-sportsmen to lose a day ’s pleasure . [Poor souls]3551-poor souls ! [I]103-mrs. jennings always pity [them]3551-poor souls when [they]3551-poor souls do ; [they]3551-poor souls seem to take it so much to heart . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ That is true , ”[90-marianne] cried [Marianne]90-marianne , in a cheerful voice , and walking to the window as [she]90-marianne spoke , to examine the day . “ [I]90-marianne had not thought of _ that _ . This weather will keep [many sportsmen in [the country]612-the country]3552-many sportsmen in the country . ”[90-marianne] It was a lucky recollection , all [her]90-marianne good spirits were restored by it . “ It is charming weather for _ [them]3551-poor souls _ indeed , ”[90-marianne] [she]90-marianne continued , as [she]90-marianne sat down to the breakfast table with a happy countenance . “ How much [they]3551-poor souls must enjoy it ! But ”[90-marianne] ( with a little return of anxiety ) “ it can not be expected to last long . At this time of the year , and after such a series of rain , [we]3554-we shall certainly have very little more of it . Frosts will soon set in , and in all probability with severity . In another day or two perhaps ; this extreme mildness can hardly last longer — nay , perhaps it may freeze tonight ! ”[90-marianne] “ At any rate , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor , wishing to prevent [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings from seeing [[her]103-mrs. jennings sister]336-her sister ’s thoughts as clearly as [she]103-mrs. jennings did , “ [I]103-mrs. jennings dare say [we]3554-we shall have [Sir John]99-sir john and [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton in [town]2984-town by the end of next week . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ Ay , [[my]89-elinor dear]2750-my dear , [I]89-elinor ’ll warrant [you]2750-my dear [we]3554-we do . [Mary]90-marianne always has [her]90-marianne own way . ”[89-elinor] “ And now , ”[89-elinor] silently conjectured [Elinor]89-elinor , “ [she]90-marianne will write to [Combe]135-combe by this day ’s post . ”[89-elinor] But if [she]103-mrs. jennings _ did _ , the letter was written and sent away with a privacy which eluded all [her]103-mrs. jennings watchfulness to ascertain the fact . Whatever the truth of it might be , and far as [Elinor]89-elinor was from feeling thorough contentment about it , yet while [she]89-elinor saw [Marianne]90-marianne in spirits , [she]89-elinor could not be very uncomfortable [herself]89-elinor . And [Marianne]90-marianne was in spirits ; happy in the mildness of the weather , and still happier in [her]90-marianne expectation of a frost . The morning was chiefly spent in leaving cards at [the houses of [[Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s acquaintance]1443-mrs. jennings ’s acquaintance]1442-the houses of mrs. jennings ’s acquaintance to inform [them]1443-mrs. jennings ’s acquaintance of [her]103-mrs. jennings being in [town]2984-town ; and [Marianne]90-marianne was all the time busy in observing the direction of the wind , watching the variations of the sky and imagining an alteration in the air . “ Do n’t [you]89-elinor find it colder than it was in the morning , [Elinor]89-elinor ? There seems to [me]89-elinor a very decided difference . [I]89-elinor can hardly keep [my]89-elinor hands warm even in [my]89-elinor muff . It was not so yesterday , [I]89-elinor think . The clouds seem parting too , the sun will be out in a moment , and [we]3557-we shall have a clear afternoon . ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor was alternately diverted and pained ; but [Marianne]90-marianne persevered , and saw every night in the brightness of the fire , and every morning in the appearance of the atmosphere , the certain symptoms of approaching frost . [The Miss Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods had no greater reason to be dissatisfied with [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s style of living , and set of acquaintance , than with [her]103-mrs. jennings behaviour to [themselves]1443-mrs. jennings ’s acquaintance , which was invariably kind . Every thing in [[her]103-mrs. jennings household]1445-her household arrangements was conducted on the most liberal plan , and excepting [a few old city friends]1446-a few old city friends , whom , to [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton ’s regret , [she]103-mrs. jennings had never dropped , [she]103-mrs. jennings visited [no one to whom an introduction]1447-no one to whom an introduction could at all discompose the feelings of [[her]103-mrs. jennings young companions]1448-her young companions . Pleased to find [herself]103-mrs. jennings more comfortably situated in that particular than [she]103-mrs. jennings had expected , [Elinor]89-elinor was very willing to compound for the want of much real enjoyment from any of [their]1443-mrs. jennings ’s acquaintance evening parties , which , whether at [home]565-home or abroad , formed only for cards , could have little to amuse [her]103-mrs. jennings . [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon , who had a general invitation to [the house]318-the house , was with [them]1443-mrs. jennings ’s acquaintance almost every day ; [he]104-colonel brandon came to look at [Marianne]90-marianne and talk to [Elinor]89-elinor , who often derived more satisfaction from conversing with [him]104-colonel brandon than from any other daily occurrence , but who saw at the same time with much concern [his]104-colonel brandon continued regard for [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister . [She]89-elinor feared it was a strengthening regard . It grieved [her]89-elinor to see the earnestness with which [he]104-colonel brandon often watched [Marianne]90-marianne , and [his]104-colonel brandon spirits were certainly worse than when at [Barton]8-barton . About a week after [their]1443-mrs. jennings ’s acquaintance arrival , it became certain that [Willoughby]107-willoughby was also arrived . [His]107-willoughby card was on the table when [they]1443-mrs. jennings ’s acquaintance came in from the morning ’s drive . “ Good [God]154-god ! ”[90-marianne] cried [Marianne]90-marianne , “ [he]107-willoughby has been here while [we]1443-mrs. jennings ’s acquaintance were out . ”[90-marianne] [Elinor]89-elinor , rejoiced to be assured of [his]104-colonel brandon being in [London]24-london , now ventured to say , “ Depend upon it , [he]107-willoughby will call again tomorrow . ”[89-elinor] But [Marianne]90-marianne seemed hardly to hear [her]89-elinor , and on [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s entrance , escaped with the precious card . This event , while it raised the spirits of [Elinor]89-elinor , restored to those of [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister all , and more than all , [their]1443-mrs. jennings ’s acquaintance former agitation . From this moment [her]89-elinor mind was never quiet ; the expectation of seeing [him]107-willoughby every hour of the day , made [her]89-elinor unfit for any thing . [She]89-elinor insisted on being left behind , the next morning , when [the others]539-the others went out . [Elinor]89-elinor ’s thoughts were full of what might be passing in [Berkeley Street]40-berkeley street during [their]1454-their absence ; but a moment ’s glance at [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister when [they]1454-their returned was enough to inform [her]89-elinor , that [Willoughby]107-willoughby had paid no second visit there . A note was just then brought in , and laid on the table . “ For [me]90-marianne ! ”[90-marianne] cried [Marianne]90-marianne , stepping hastily forward . “ No , [ma’am]2974-ma’am , for [[my]90-marianne mistress]3559-my mistress . ”[90-marianne] But [Marianne]90-marianne , not convinced , took it instantly up . “ It is indeed for [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ; how provoking ! ”[90-marianne] “ [You]89-elinor are expecting a letter , then ? ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor , unable to be longer silent . “ Yes , a little — not much . ”[89-elinor] After a short pause . “ [You]89-elinor have no confidence in [me]89-elinor , [Marianne]90-marianne . ”[89-elinor] “ Nay , [Elinor]89-elinor , this reproach from _ [you_—you]89-elinor who have confidence in [no one]317-no one ! ”[90-marianne] “ [Me]89-elinor ! ”[89-elinor] returned [Elinor]89-elinor in some confusion ; “ indeed , [Marianne]90-marianne , [I]89-elinor have nothing to tell . ”[89-elinor] “ Nor [I]90-marianne , ”[90-marianne] answered [Marianne]90-marianne with energy , “ [our]3561-our situations then are alike . [We]3561-our have neither of [us]3561-our any thing to tell ; [you]89-elinor , because [you]89-elinor do not communicate , and [I]90-marianne , because [I]90-marianne conceal nothing . ”[90-marianne] [Elinor]89-elinor , distressed by this charge of reserve in [herself]89-elinor , which [she]89-elinor was not at liberty to do away , knew not how , under such circumstances , to press for greater openness in [Marianne]90-marianne . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings soon appeared , and the note being given [her]89-elinor , [she]89-elinor read it aloud . It was from [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton , announcing [their]1456-their arrival in [Conduit Street]41-conduit street the night before , and requesting the company of [[her]100-lady middleton mother]332-her mother and [cousins]1458-cousins the following evening . Business on [Sir John]99-sir john ’s part , and a violent cold on [her]89-elinor own , prevented [their]1456-their calling in [Berkeley Street]40-berkeley street . The invitation was accepted ; but when the hour of appointment drew near , necessary as it was in common civility to [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , that [they]1456-their should both attend [her]103-mrs. jennings on such a visit , [Elinor]89-elinor had some difficulty in persuading [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister to go , for still [she]89-elinor had seen nothing of [Willoughby]107-willoughby ; and therefore was not more indisposed for amusement abroad , than unwilling to run the risk of [his]99-sir john calling again in [her]103-mrs. jennings absence . [Elinor]89-elinor found , when the evening was over , that disposition is not materially altered by a change of abode , for although scarcely settled in [town]2984-town , [Sir John]99-sir john had contrived to collect around [him]99-sir john , [nearly twenty young people]1461-nearly twenty young people , and to amuse [them]1461-nearly twenty young people with a ball . This was an affair , however , of which [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton did not approve . In [the country]612-the country , an unpremeditated dance was very allowable ; but in [London]24-london , where the reputation of elegance was more important and less easily attained , it was risking too much for the gratification of [a few girls]1463-a few girls , to have it known that [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton had given a small dance of eight or [nine couple]1464-nine couple , with two violins , and a mere side - board collation . [Mr.]1465-mr. and [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer were of the party ; from [the former , whom [they]1467-they had not seen before since [their]1467-they arrival in [town]2984-town]1466-the former , whom they had not seen before since their arrival in town , as [he]99-sir john was careful to avoid the appearance of any attention to [[his]99-sir john mother - in - law]300-his mother - in - law , and therefore never came near [her]100-lady middleton , [they]1467-they received no mark of recognition on [their]1467-they entrance . [He]99-sir john looked at [them]1467-they slightly , without seeming to know who [they]1467-they were , and merely nodded to [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings from the other side of [the room]2842-the room . [Marianne]90-marianne gave one glance round [the apartment]1471-the apartment as [she]90-marianne entered : it was enough—_he _ was not there — and [she]90-marianne sat down , equally ill - disposed to receive or communicate pleasure . After [they]1467-they had been assembled about an hour , [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer sauntered towards [the Miss Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods to express [his]129-mr. palmer surprise on seeing [them]1467-they in [town]2984-town , though [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon had been first informed of [their]1467-they arrival at [[his]104-colonel brandon house]515-his house , and [he]104-colonel brandon had [himself]104-colonel brandon said something very droll on hearing that [they]1467-they were to come . “ [I]129-mr. palmer thought [you]1467-they were both in [Devonshire]5-devonshire , ”[129-mr. palmer] said [he]129-mr. palmer . “ Did [you]129-mr. palmer ? ”[89-elinor] replied [Elinor]89-elinor . “ When do [you]129-mr. palmer go back again ? ”[89-elinor] “ [I]90-marianne do not know . ”[90-marianne] And thus ended [their]1467-they discourse . Never had [Marianne]90-marianne been so unwilling to dance in [her]90-marianne life , as [she]90-marianne was that evening , and never so much fatigued by the exercise . [She]90-marianne complained of it as [they]1467-they returned to [Berkeley Street]40-berkeley street . “ Aye , aye , ”[103-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , “ [we]1467-they know the reason of all that very well ; if [a certain person who shall be nameless]3562-a certain person who shall be nameless , had been [there]354-there , [you]90-marianne would not have been a bit tired : and to say the truth it was not very pretty of [him]3562-a certain person who shall be nameless not to give [you]90-marianne the meeting when [he]3562-a certain person who shall be nameless was invited . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ Invited ! ”[90-marianne] cried [Marianne]90-marianne . “ So [[my]90-marianne daughter]3564-my daughter [Middleton]100-lady middleton told [me]90-marianne , for it seems [Sir John]99-sir john met [him]3562-a certain person who shall be nameless somewhere in [the street]3565-the street this morning . ”[90-marianne] [Marianne]90-marianne said no more , but looked exceedingly hurt . Impatient in this situation to be doing something that might lead to [[her]1474-her sister]336-her sister ’s relief , [Elinor]89-elinor resolved to write the next morning to [[her]1474-her mother]332-her mother , and hoped by awakening [her]89-elinor fears for the health of [Marianne]90-marianne , to procure those inquiries which had been so long delayed ; and [she]89-elinor was still more eagerly bent on this measure by perceiving after breakfast on the morrow , that [Marianne]90-marianne was again writing to [Willoughby]107-willoughby , for [she]89-elinor could not suppose it to be to [any other person]1477-any other person . About the middle of the day , [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings went out by [herself]103-mrs. jennings on business , and [Elinor]89-elinor began [her]89-elinor letter directly , while [Marianne]90-marianne , too restless for employment , too anxious for conversation , walked from one window to the other , or sat down by the fire in melancholy meditation . [Elinor]89-elinor was very earnest in [her]89-elinor application to [[her]1474-her mother]332-her mother , relating all that had passed , [her]89-elinor suspicions of [Willoughby]107-willoughby ’s inconstancy , urging [her]89-elinor by every plea of duty and affection to demand from [Marianne]90-marianne an account of [her]89-elinor real situation with respect to [him]107-willoughby . [Her]89-elinor letter was scarcely finished , when [a rap]1479-a rap foretold [a visitor]1480-a visitor , and [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon was announced . [Marianne]90-marianne , who had seen [him]107-willoughby from the window , and who hated [company of any kind]1481-company of any kind , left [the room]2842-the room before [he]107-willoughby entered [it]2842-the room . [He]107-willoughby looked more than usually grave , and though expressing satisfaction at finding [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood alone , as if [he]107-willoughby had somewhat in particular to tell [her]90-marianne , sat for some time without saying a word . [Elinor]89-elinor , persuaded that [he]107-willoughby had some communication to make in which [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister was concerned , impatiently expected its opening . It was not the first time of [her]89-elinor feeling the same kind of conviction ; for , more than once before , beginning with the observation of “ [[your]89-elinor sister]2815-your sister looks unwell to - day , ”[107-willoughby] or “ [[your]89-elinor sister]2815-your sister seems out of spirits , ”[107-willoughby] [he]107-willoughby had appeared on the point , either of disclosing , or of inquiring , something particular about [her]89-elinor . After a pause of several minutes , [their]1484-their silence was broken , by [his]107-willoughby asking [her]89-elinor in a voice of some agitation , when [he]107-willoughby was to congratulate [her]89-elinor on the acquisition of [a brother]2813-a brother ? [Elinor]89-elinor was not prepared for such a question , and having no answer ready , was obliged to adopt the simple and common expedient , of asking what [he]107-willoughby meant ? [He]107-willoughby tried to smile as [he]107-willoughby replied , “ [[your]89-elinor sister]2815-your sister ’s engagement to [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby is very generally known . ”[107-willoughby] “ It can not be generally known , ”[89-elinor] returned [Elinor]89-elinor , “ for [[her]2815-your sister own family]3569-her own family do not know it . ”[107-willoughby] [He]107-willoughby looked surprised and said , “ [I]107-willoughby beg [your]89-elinor pardon , [I]107-willoughby am afraid [my]107-willoughby inquiry has been impertinent ; but [I]107-willoughby had not supposed any secrecy intended , as [they]3569-her own family openly correspond , and [their]3569-her own family marriage is universally talked of . ”[107-willoughby] “ How can that be ? By whom can [you]89-elinor have heard it mentioned ? ”[107-willoughby] “ By [many]949-many — by [some of whom [you]89-elinor know nothing]3571-some of whom you know nothing , by [others with whom [you]89-elinor are most intimate]3572-others with whom you are most intimate , [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer , and [the Middletons]102-the middletons . But still [I]1486-i might not have believed it , for where the mind is perhaps rather unwilling to be convinced , it will always find something to support [its]3573-its doubts , if [I]1486-i had not , when [the servant]818-the servant let [me]1486-i in today , accidentally seen a letter in [his]818-the servant hand , directed to [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby in [[your]89-elinor sister]2815-your sister ’s writing . [I]1486-i came to inquire , but [I]1486-i was convinced before [I]1486-i could ask the question . Is every thing finally settled ? Is it impossible to — ? But [I]1486-i have no right , and [I]1486-i could have no chance of succeeding . Excuse [me]1486-i , [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood . [I]1486-i believe [I]1486-i have been wrong in saying so much , but [I]1486-i hardly know what to do , and on [your]89-elinor prudence [I]1486-i have the strongest dependence . Tell [me]1486-i that it is all absolutely resolved on , that any attempt , that in short concealment , if concealment be possible , is all that remains . ”[1486-i] These words , which conveyed to [Elinor]89-elinor a direct avowal of [his]1486-i love for [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister , affected [her]89-elinor very much . [She]89-elinor was not immediately able to say anything , and even when [her]89-elinor spirits were recovered , [she]89-elinor debated for a short time , on the answer it would be most proper to give . The real state of things between [Willoughby]107-willoughby and [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister was so little known to [herself]89-elinor , that in endeavouring to explain it , [she]89-elinor might be as liable to say too much as too little . Yet as [she]89-elinor was convinced that [Marianne]90-marianne ’s affection for [Willoughby]107-willoughby , could leave no hope of [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon ’s success , whatever the event of that affection might be , and at the same time wished to shield [her]89-elinor conduct from censure , [she]89-elinor thought it most prudent and kind , after some consideration , to say more than [she]89-elinor really knew or believed . [She]89-elinor acknowledged , therefore , that though [she]89-elinor had never been informed by [themselves]1489-their of the terms on which [they]1489-their stood with [each other]338-each other , of [their]1489-their mutual affection [she]89-elinor had no doubt , and of [their]1489-their correspondence [she]89-elinor was not astonished to hear . [He]107-willoughby listened to [her]89-elinor with silent attention , and on [her]89-elinor ceasing to speak , rose directly from [his]107-willoughby seat , and after saying in a voice of emotion , “ to [[your]89-elinor sister]2815-your sister [I]107-willoughby wish all imaginable happiness ; to [Willoughby]107-willoughby that [he]107-willoughby may endeavour to deserve her,”—took[107-willoughby] leave , and went away . [Elinor]89-elinor derived no comfortable feelings from this conversation , to lessen the uneasiness of [her]89-elinor mind on other points ; [she]89-elinor was left , on the contrary , with a melancholy impression of [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon ’s unhappiness , and was prevented even from wishing it removed , by [her]89-elinor anxiety for the very event that must confirm it . CHAPTER XXVIII . Nothing occurred during the next three or four days , to make [Elinor]89-elinor regret what [she]89-elinor had done , in applying to [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother ; for [Willoughby]107-willoughby neither came nor wrote . [They]1492-they were engaged about the end of that time to attend [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton to a party , from which [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings was kept away by the indisposition of [[her]103-mrs. jennings youngest daughter]1493-her youngest daughter ; and for this party , [Marianne]90-marianne , wholly dispirited , careless of [her]90-marianne appearance , and seeming equally indifferent whether [she]90-marianne went or staid , prepared , without one look of hope or one expression of pleasure . [She]90-marianne sat by the drawing - room fire after tea , till the moment of [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton ’s arrival , without once stirring from [her]90-marianne seat , or altering [her]90-marianne attitude , lost in [her]90-marianne own thoughts , and insensible of [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister ’s presence ; and when at last [they]1492-they were told that [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton waited for [them]1492-they at the door , [she]100-lady middleton started as if [she]100-lady middleton had forgotten that [any one]659-any one was expected . [They]1492-they arrived in due time at [the place of destination]1496-the place of destination , and as soon as the string of carriages before [them]1492-they would allow , alighted , ascended the stairs , heard [their]1492-they names announced from [one landing - place]1497-one landing - place to another in an audible voice , and entered [a room]1498-a room splendidly lit up , quite full of company , and insufferably hot . When [they]1492-they had paid [their]1492-they tribute of politeness by curtsying to [the lady of [the house]318-the house]1499-the lady of the house , [they]1492-they were permitted to mingle in [the crowd]1501-the crowd , and take [their]1492-they share of the heat and inconvenience , to which [their]1492-they arrival must necessarily add . After some time spent in saying little or doing less , [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton sat down to [Cassino]155-cassino , and as [Marianne]90-marianne was not in spirits for moving about , [she]100-lady middleton and [Elinor]89-elinor luckily succeeding to chairs , placed [themselves]1492-they at no great distance from the table . [They]1492-they had not remained in this manner long , before [Elinor]89-elinor perceived [Willoughby]107-willoughby , standing within a few yards of [them]1492-they , in earnest conversation with [a very fashionable looking young woman]1502-a very fashionable looking young woman . [She]1502-a very fashionable looking young woman soon caught [his]107-willoughby eye , and [he]107-willoughby immediately bowed , but without attempting to speak to [her]1502-a very fashionable looking young woman , or to approach [Marianne]90-marianne , though [he]107-willoughby could not but see [her]1502-a very fashionable looking young woman ; and then continued [his]107-willoughby discourse with [the same lady]1203-the same lady . [Elinor]89-elinor turned involuntarily to [Marianne]90-marianne , to see whether it could be unobserved by [her]1502-a very fashionable looking young woman . At that moment [she]89-elinor first perceived [him]107-willoughby , and [her]89-elinor whole countenance glowing with sudden delight , [she]89-elinor would have moved towards [him]107-willoughby instantly , had not [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister caught hold of [her]89-elinor . “ Good heavens ! ”[89-elinor] [she]89-elinor exclaimed , “ [he]107-willoughby is there — [he]107-willoughby is there — Oh ! why does [he]107-willoughby not look at [me]89-elinor ? why can not [I]89-elinor speak to [him]107-willoughby ? ”[89-elinor] “ Pray , pray be composed , ”[89-elinor] cried [Elinor]89-elinor , “ and do not betray what [you]90-marianne feel to every body present . Perhaps [he]107-willoughby has not observed [you]90-marianne yet . ”[89-elinor] This however was more than [she]89-elinor could believe [herself]89-elinor ; and to be composed at such a moment was not only beyond the reach of [Marianne]90-marianne , it was beyond [her]89-elinor wish . [She]89-elinor sat in an agony of impatience which affected every feature . At last [he]107-willoughby turned round again , and regarded [them]1505-them both ; [she]89-elinor started up , and pronouncing [his]107-willoughby name in a tone of affection , held out [her]89-elinor hand to [him]107-willoughby . [He]107-willoughby approached , and addressing [himself]107-willoughby rather to [Elinor]89-elinor than [Marianne]90-marianne , as if wishing to avoid [her]89-elinor eye , and determined not to observe [her]89-elinor attitude , inquired in a hurried manner after [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood , and asked how long [they]1505-them had been in [town]2984-town . [Elinor]89-elinor was robbed of all presence of mind by such an address , and was unable to say a word . But the feelings of [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister were instantly expressed . [Her]89-elinor face was crimsoned over , and [she]89-elinor exclaimed , in a voice of the greatest emotion , “ Good [God]154-god ! [Willoughby]107-willoughby , what is the meaning of this ? Have [you]107-willoughby not received [my]89-elinor letters ? Will [you]107-willoughby not shake hands with [me]89-elinor ? ”[89-elinor] [He]107-willoughby could not then avoid it , but [her]89-elinor touch seemed painful to [him]107-willoughby , and [he]107-willoughby held [her]89-elinor hand only for a moment . During all this time [he]107-willoughby was evidently struggling for composure . [Elinor]89-elinor watched [his]107-willoughby countenance and saw [its]107-willoughby expression becoming more tranquil . After a moment ’s pause , [he]107-willoughby spoke with calmness . “ [I]107-willoughby did [myself]107-willoughby the honour of calling in [Berkeley Street]40-berkeley street last Tuesday , and very much regretted that [I]107-willoughby was not fortunate enough to find [yourselves]107-willoughby and [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings at [home]565-home . [My]107-willoughby card was not lost , [I]107-willoughby hope . ”[107-willoughby] “ But have [you]107-willoughby not received [my]90-marianne notes ? ”[90-marianne] cried [Marianne]90-marianne in the wildest anxiety . “ Here is some mistake [I]90-marianne am sure — some dreadful mistake . What can be the meaning of it ? Tell [me]90-marianne , [Willoughby]107-willoughby ; for heaven ’s sake tell [me]90-marianne , what is the matter ? ”[90-marianne] [He]107-willoughby made no reply ; [his]107-willoughby complexion changed and all [his]107-willoughby embarrassment returned ; but as if , on catching the eye of [the young lady with whom [he]107-willoughby had been previously talking]1508-the young lady with whom he had been previously talking , [he]107-willoughby felt the necessity of instant exertion , [he]107-willoughby recovered [himself]107-willoughby again , and after saying , “ Yes , [I]107-willoughby had the pleasure of receiving the information of [your]90-marianne arrival in [town]2984-town , which [you]90-marianne were so good as to send [me]107-willoughby , ”[107-willoughby] turned hastily away with a slight bow and joined [[his]107-willoughby friend]647-his friend . [Marianne]90-marianne , now looking dreadfully white , and unable to stand , sunk into [her]90-marianne chair , and [Elinor]89-elinor , expecting every moment to see [her]90-marianne faint , tried to screen [her]90-marianne from the observation of [others]2961-others , while reviving [her]90-marianne with lavender water . “ Go to [him]107-willoughby , [Elinor]89-elinor , ”[90-marianne] [she]90-marianne cried , as soon as [she]90-marianne could speak , “ and force [him]107-willoughby to come to [me]90-marianne . Tell [him]107-willoughby [I]90-marianne must see [him]107-willoughby again — must speak to [him]107-willoughby [instantly.—I]90-marianne can not rest — [I]90-marianne shall not have a moment ’s peace till this is explained — some dreadful misapprehension or other . Oh , go to [him]107-willoughby this moment . ”[90-marianne] “ How can that be done ? No , [[my]90-marianne dearest]3507-my dearest [Marianne]90-marianne , [you]90-marianne must wait . This is not the place for explanations . Wait only till tomorrow . ”[90-marianne] With difficulty however could [she]90-marianne prevent [her]90-marianne from following [him]1511-him [herself]90-marianne ; and to persuade [her]90-marianne to check [her]90-marianne agitation , to wait , at least , with the appearance of composure , till [she]90-marianne might speak to [him]1511-him with more privacy and more effect , was impossible ; for [Marianne]90-marianne continued incessantly to give way in a low voice to the misery of [her]90-marianne feelings , by exclamations of wretchedness . In a short time [Elinor]89-elinor saw [Willoughby]107-willoughby quit [the room]2842-the room by the door towards the staircase , and telling [Marianne]90-marianne that [he]107-willoughby was gone , urged the impossibility of speaking to [him]1511-him again that evening , as a fresh argument for [her]90-marianne to be calm . [She]90-marianne instantly begged [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister would entreat [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton to take [them]1514-they [home]565-home , as [she]100-lady middleton was too miserable to stay a minute longer . [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton , though in the middle of a rubber , on being informed that [Marianne]90-marianne was unwell , was too polite to object for a moment to [her]100-lady middleton wish of going away , and making over [her]100-lady middleton cards to [a friend]1286-a friend , [they]1514-they departed as soon as [the carriage]1118-the carriage could be found . Scarcely a word was spoken during [their]1514-they return to [Berkeley Street]40-berkeley street . [Marianne]90-marianne was in a silent agony , too much oppressed even for tears ; but as [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings was luckily not come [home]565-home , [they]1514-they could go directly to [[their]1514-they own room]1519-their own room , where [hartshorn]156-hartshorn restored [her]90-marianne a little to [herself]90-marianne . [She]90-marianne was soon undressed and in bed , and as [she]90-marianne seemed desirous of being alone , [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister then left [her]90-marianne , and while [she]90-marianne waited the return of [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , had leisure enough for thinking over the past . That some kind of engagement had subsisted between [Willoughby]107-willoughby and [Marianne]90-marianne [she]90-marianne could not doubt , and that [Willoughby]107-willoughby was weary of it , seemed equally clear ; for however [Marianne]90-marianne might still feed [her]90-marianne own wishes , _ [she]90-marianne _ could not attribute such behaviour to mistake or misapprehension of any kind . Nothing but a thorough change of sentiment could account for it . [Her]90-marianne indignation would have been still stronger than it was , had [she]90-marianne not witnessed that embarrassment which seemed to speak a consciousness of [his]107-willoughby own misconduct , and prevented [her]90-marianne from believing [him]107-willoughby so unprincipled as to have been sporting with the affections of [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister from the first , without any design that would bear investigation . Absence might have weakened [his]107-willoughby regard , and convenience might have determined [him]107-willoughby to overcome it , but that such a regard had formerly existed [she]90-marianne could not bring [herself]90-marianne to doubt . As for [Marianne]90-marianne , on the pangs which so unhappy a meeting must already have given [her]90-marianne , and on those still more severe which might await [her]90-marianne in its probable consequence , [she]90-marianne could not reflect without the deepest concern . [Her]90-marianne own situation gained in the comparison ; for while [she]90-marianne could _ esteem [_ Edward]98-edward as much as ever , however [they]1522-they might be divided in future , [her]90-marianne mind might be always supported . But every circumstance that could embitter such an evil seemed uniting to heighten the misery of [Marianne]90-marianne in a final separation from [Willoughby]107-willoughby — in an immediate and irreconcilable rupture with [him]107-willoughby . CHAPTER XXIX . Before [the housemaid]1523-the housemaid had lit [their]1523-the housemaid fire the next day , or the sun gained any power over a cold , gloomy morning in January , [Marianne]90-marianne , only half dressed , was kneeling against one of the window - seats for the sake of all the little light [she]90-marianne could command from it , and writing as fast as a continual flow of tears would permit [her]90-marianne . In this situation , [Elinor]89-elinor , roused from sleep by [her]90-marianne agitation and sobs , first perceived [her]90-marianne ; and after observing [her]90-marianne for a few moments with silent anxiety , said , in a tone of the most considerate gentleness , “ [Marianne]90-marianne , may [I]89-elinor ask — ? ”[89-elinor] “ No , [Elinor]89-elinor , ”[89-elinor] [she]89-elinor replied , “ ask nothing ; [you]89-elinor will soon know all . ”[89-elinor] The sort of desperate calmness with which this was said , lasted no longer than while [she]90-marianne spoke , and was immediately followed by a return of the same excessive affliction . It was some minutes before [she]90-marianne could go on with [her]90-marianne letter , and the frequent bursts of grief which still obliged [her]90-marianne , at intervals , to withhold [her]90-marianne pen , were proofs enough of [her]90-marianne feeling how more than probable it was that [she]90-marianne was writing for the last time to [Willoughby]107-willoughby . [Elinor]89-elinor paid [her]90-marianne every quiet and unobtrusive attention in [her]89-elinor power ; and [she]89-elinor would have tried to sooth and tranquilize [her]90-marianne still more , had not [Marianne]90-marianne entreated [her]90-marianne , with all the eagerness of the most nervous irritability , not to speak to [her]90-marianne for [the world]2778-the world . In such circumstances , it was better for both that [they]1525-they should not be long together ; and the restless state of [Marianne]90-marianne ’s mind not only prevented [her]90-marianne from remaining in [the room]2842-the room a moment after [she]90-marianne was dressed , but requiring at once solitude and continual change of place , made [her]90-marianne wander about [the house]318-the house till breakfast time , avoiding the sight of every body . At breakfast [she]90-marianne neither ate , nor attempted to eat any thing ; and [Elinor]89-elinor ’s attention was then all employed , not in urging [her]90-marianne , not in pitying [her]90-marianne , nor in appearing to regard [her]90-marianne , but in endeavouring to engage [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s notice entirely to [herself]90-marianne . As this was a favourite meal with [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , it lasted a considerable time , and [they]1525-they were just setting [themselves]1525-they , after it , round the common working table , when a letter was delivered to [Marianne]90-marianne , which [she]90-marianne eagerly caught from [the servant]818-the servant , and , turning of a death - like paleness , instantly ran out of [the room]2842-the room . [Elinor]89-elinor , who saw as plainly by this , as if [she]89-elinor had seen the direction , that it must come from [Willoughby]107-willoughby , felt immediately such a sickness at heart as made [her]89-elinor hardly able to hold up [her]89-elinor head , and sat in such a general tremour as made [her]89-elinor fear it impossible to escape [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s notice . [That good lady]1530-that good lady , however , saw only that [Marianne]90-marianne had received a letter from [Willoughby]107-willoughby , which appeared to [her]90-marianne a very good joke , and which [she]90-marianne treated accordingly , by hoping , with a laugh , that [she]90-marianne would find it to [her]90-marianne liking . Of [Elinor]89-elinor ’s distress , [she]89-elinor was too busily employed in measuring lengths of worsted for [her]89-elinor rug , to see any thing at all ; and calmly continuing [her]89-elinor talk , as soon as [Marianne]90-marianne disappeared , [she]89-elinor said , “ Upon [my]89-elinor word , [I]89-elinor never saw [a young woman]3580-a young woman so desperately in love in [my]89-elinor life ! _ [[My]89-elinor _ girls]3581-my _ girls were nothing to [her]3580-a young woman , and yet [they]3581-my _ girls used to be foolish enough ; but as for [Miss Marianne]90-marianne , [she]90-marianne is quite [an altered creature]3582-an altered creature . [I]89-elinor hope , from the bottom of [my]89-elinor heart , [he]3583-you wo n’t keep [her]90-marianne waiting much longer , for it is quite grievous to see [her]90-marianne look so ill and forlorn . Pray , when are [they]3581-my _ girls to be married ? ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor , though never less disposed to speak than at that moment , obliged [herself]89-elinor to answer such an attack as this , and , therefore , trying to smile , replied , “ And have [you]3583-you really , [Ma’am]157-ma’am , talked [yourself]3583-you into a persuasion of [[my]89-elinor sister]2818-my sister ’s being engaged to [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby ? [I]89-elinor thought it had been only a joke , but so serious a question seems to imply more ; and [I]89-elinor must beg , therefore , that [you]3583-you will not deceive [yourself]3583-you any longer . [I]89-elinor do assure [you]3583-you that nothing would surprise [me]89-elinor more than to hear of [their]3581-my _ girls being going to be married . ”[89-elinor] “ For shame , for shame , [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood ! how can [you]3583-you talk so ? Do n’t [we]3585-we all know that it must be a match , that [they]3581-my _ girls were over head and ears in love with [each other]338-each other from the first moment [they]3581-my _ girls met ?
