Did not [I]103-mrs. jennings see [them]3581-my _ girls together in [Devonshire]5-devonshire every day , and all day long ; and did not [I]103-mrs. jennings know that [[your]3583-you sister]2815-your sister came to [town]2984-town with [me]103-mrs. jennings on purpose to buy wedding clothes ? Come , come , this wo n’t do . Because [you]3583-you are so sly about it [yourself]3583-you , [you]3583-you think [nobody else]3589-nobody else has any senses ; but it is no such thing , [I]103-mrs. jennings can tell [you]3583-you , for it has been known all over [town]2984-town this ever so long . [I]103-mrs. jennings tell every body of it and so does [Charlotte]127-charlotte . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ Indeed , [Ma’am]157-ma’am , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor , very seriously , “ [you]157-ma’am are mistaken . Indeed , [you]157-ma’am are doing a very unkind thing in spreading the report , and [you]157-ma’am will find that [you]157-ma’am have though [you]157-ma’am will not believe [me]89-elinor now . ”[89-elinor] [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings laughed again , but [Elinor]89-elinor had not spirits to say more , and eager at all events to know what [Willoughby]107-willoughby had written , hurried away to [[their]1531-their room]1532-their room , where , on opening the door , [she]89-elinor saw [Marianne]90-marianne stretched on the bed , almost choked by grief , one letter in [her]90-marianne hand , and two or three others lying by [her]90-marianne . [Elinor]89-elinor drew near , but without saying a word ; and seating [herself]89-elinor on the bed , took [her]90-marianne hand , kissed [her]90-marianne affectionately several times , and then gave way to a burst of tears , which at first was scarcely less violent than [Marianne]90-marianne ’s . [The latter]325-the latter , though unable to speak , seemed to feel all the tenderness of this behaviour , and after some time thus spent in joint affliction , [she]325-the latter put all the letters into [Elinor]89-elinor ’s hands ; and then covering [her]89-elinor face with [her]325-the latter handkerchief , almost screamed with agony . [Elinor]89-elinor , who knew [that such grief , shocking as it was to witness it]1534-that such grief , shocking as it was to witness it , must have its course , watched by [her]89-elinor till this excess of suffering had somewhat spent itself , and then turning eagerly to [Willoughby]107-willoughby ’s letter , read as follows : “ [Bond Street]39-bond street , [January]148-january . [[MY]0-i DEAR]2750-my dear MADAM , “[0-i] [I]0-i have just had the honour of receiving [your]90-marianne letter , for which [I]0-i beg to return [my]0-i sincere acknowledgments . [I]0-i am much concerned to find there was anything in [my]0-i behaviour last night that did not meet [your]90-marianne approbation ; and though [I]0-i am quite at a loss to discover in what point [I]0-i could be so unfortunate as to offend [you]90-marianne , [I]0-i entreat [your]90-marianne forgiveness of what [I]0-i can assure [you]90-marianne to have been perfectly unintentional . [I]0-i shall never reflect on [my]0-i former acquaintance with [[your]90-marianne family]3146-your family in [Devonshire]5-devonshire without the most grateful pleasure , and flatter [myself]0-i it will not be broken by any mistake or misapprehension of [my]0-i actions . [My]0-i esteem for [[your]90-marianne whole family]1536-your whole family is very sincere ; but if [I]0-i have been so unfortunate as to give rise to a belief of more than [I]0-i felt , or meant to express , [I]0-i shall reproach [myself]0-i for not having been more guarded in [my]0-i professions of that esteem . That [I]0-i should ever have meant more [you]90-marianne will allow to be impossible , when [you]90-marianne understand that [my]0-i affections have been long engaged elsewhere , and it will not be many weeks , [I]0-i believe , before this engagement is fulfilled . It is with great regret that [I]0-i obey [your]90-marianne commands in returning the letters with which [I]0-i have been honoured from [you]90-marianne , and the lock of hair , which [you]90-marianne so obligingly bestowed on [me]0-i . “ [I]90-marianne am , [dear Madam]3592-dear madam , “[90-marianne] [[Your]90-marianne most obedient “ humble servant]3593-your most obedient “ humble servant , “[159-willoughby] [JOHN WILLOUGHBY]159-willoughby . ” With what indignation such a letter as this must be read by [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood , may be imagined . Though aware , before [she]84-miss dashwood began it , that it must bring a confession of [his]159-willoughby inconstancy , and confirm [their]3594-their separation for ever , [she]84-miss dashwood was not aware that such language could be suffered to announce it ; nor could [she]84-miss dashwood have supposed [Willoughby]159-willoughby capable of departing so far from the appearance of every honourable and delicate feeling — so far from the common decorum of [a gentleman]985-a gentleman , as to send a letter so impudently cruel : a letter which , instead of bringing with [his]159-willoughby desire of a release any professions of regret , acknowledged no breach of faith , denied all peculiar affection whatever — a letter of which every line was an insult , and which proclaimed [its writer]3596-its writer to be deep in hardened villainy . [She]84-miss dashwood paused over it for some time with indignant astonishment ; then read it again and again ; but every perusal only served to increase [her]84-miss dashwood abhorrence of [the man]502-the man , and so bitter were [her]84-miss dashwood feelings against [him]502-the man , that [she]84-miss dashwood dared not trust [herself]84-miss dashwood to speak , lest [she]84-miss dashwood might wound [Marianne]90-marianne still deeper by treating [their]3594-their disengagement , not as a loss to [her]84-miss dashwood of any possible good but as an escape from the worst and most irremediable of all evils , a connection , for life , with [an unprincipled man]3598-an unprincipled man , as a deliverance the most real , a blessing the most important . In [her]84-miss dashwood earnest meditations on the contents of the letter , on the depravity of that mind which could dictate it , and probably , on the very different mind of [a very different person]3599-a very different person , who had no other connection whatever with the affair than what [her]84-miss dashwood heart gave [him]159-willoughby with every thing that passed , [Elinor]89-elinor forgot the immediate distress of [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister , forgot that [she]89-elinor had three letters on [her]89-elinor lap yet unread , and so entirely forgot how long [she]89-elinor had been in [the room]2842-the room , that when on hearing [a carriage]3157-a carriage drive up to the door , [she]89-elinor went to the window to see who could be coming so unreasonably early , [she]89-elinor was all astonishment to perceive [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s chariot , which [she]89-elinor knew had not been ordered till one . Determined not to quit [Marianne]90-marianne , though hopeless of contributing , at present , to [her]90-marianne ease , [she]89-elinor hurried away to excuse [herself]89-elinor from attending [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , on account of [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister being indisposed . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , with a thoroughly good - humoured concern for its cause , admitted the excuse most readily , and [Elinor]89-elinor , after seeing [her]103-mrs. jennings safe off , returned to [Marianne]90-marianne , whom [she]89-elinor found attempting to rise from the bed , and whom [she]89-elinor reached just in time to prevent [her]90-marianne from falling on the floor , faint and giddy from a long want of proper rest and food ; for it was many days since [she]90-marianne had any appetite , and many nights since [she]90-marianne had really slept ; and now , when [her]90-marianne mind was no longer supported by the fever of suspense , the consequence of all this was felt in an aching head , a weakened stomach , and a general nervous faintness . A glass of wine , which [Elinor]89-elinor procured for [her]103-mrs. jennings directly , made [her]103-mrs. jennings more comfortable , and [she]103-mrs. jennings was at last able to express some sense of [her]103-mrs. jennings kindness , by saying , “[159-willoughby] [Poor Elinor]89-elinor ! how unhappy [I]0-i make [you]89-elinor ! ” “[0-i] [I]0-i only wish , ” replied [[her]103-mrs. jennings sister]336-her sister , “[159-willoughby] there were any thing [I]0-i _ could _ do , which might be of comfort to [you]89-elinor . ” This , as every thing else would have been , was too much for [Marianne]90-marianne , who could only exclaim , in the anguish of [her]90-marianne heart , “[89-elinor] Oh ! [Elinor]89-elinor , [I]0-i am miserable , indeed , ” before [her]90-marianne voice was entirely lost in sobs . [Elinor]89-elinor could no longer witness this torrent of unresisted grief in silence . “[89-elinor] Exert [yourself]89-elinor , dear [Marianne]90-marianne , ” [she]89-elinor cried , “[89-elinor] if [you]89-elinor would not kill [yourself]89-elinor and [all who love [you]89-elinor]1537-all who love you . Think of [[your]89-elinor mother]2781-your mother ; think of [her]2781-your mother misery while _ [you]89-elinor _ suffer : for [her]2781-your mother sake [you]89-elinor must exert [yourself]89-elinor . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i can not , [I]0-i can not , ” cried [Marianne]90-marianne ; “[0-i] leave [me]0-i , leave [me]0-i , if [I]0-i distress [you]89-elinor ; leave [me]0-i , hate [me]0-i , forget [me]0-i ! but do not torture [me]0-i so . Oh ! how easy for those , who have no sorrow of [their]1539-their own to talk of exertion ! Happy , [happy Elinor]89-elinor , _ [you]89-elinor _ can not have an idea of what [I]0-i suffer . ” “[89-elinor] Do [you]89-elinor call _ [me]0-i _ happy , [Marianne]90-marianne ? Ah ! if [you]89-elinor knew!—And can [you]89-elinor believe [me]0-i to be so , while [I]0-i see [you]89-elinor so wretched ! ” “[89-elinor] Forgive [me]0-i , forgive [me]0-i , ” throwing [her]0-i arms round [[her]0-i sister]336-her sister ’s neck ; “[0-i] [I]0-i know [you]89-elinor feel for [me]0-i ; [I]0-i know what a heart [you]89-elinor have ; but yet [you]89-elinor are — [you]89-elinor must be happy ; [Edward]98-edward loves [you]89-elinor — what , oh what , can do away such happiness as that ? ” “[98-edward] Many , many circumstances , ” said [Elinor]89-elinor , solemnly . “[98-edward] No , no , no , ” cried [Marianne]90-marianne wildly , “[1540-he] [he]1540-he loves [you]89-elinor , and only [you]89-elinor . [You]89-elinor _ can _ have no grief . ” “[89-elinor] [I]0-i can have no pleasure while [I]0-i see [you]89-elinor in this state . ” “[0-i] And [you]89-elinor will never see [me]0-i otherwise . [Mine]0-i is a misery which nothing can do away . ” “[0-i] [You]89-elinor must not talk so , [Marianne]90-marianne . Have [you]89-elinor no comforts ? [no friends]1541-no friends ? Is [your]89-elinor loss such as leaves no opening for consolation ? Much as [you]89-elinor suffer now , think of what [you]89-elinor would have suffered if the discovery of [his]1540-he character had been delayed to a later period — if [your]89-elinor engagement had been carried on for months and months , as it might have been , before [he]1540-he chose to put an end to it . Every additional day of unhappy confidence , on [your]89-elinor side , would have made the blow more dreadful . ” “[1540-he] Engagement ! ” cried [Marianne]90-marianne , “[1540-he] there has been no engagement . ” “[1540-he] No engagement ! ” “[1540-he] No , [he]1540-he is not so unworthy as [you]89-elinor believe [him]1540-he . [He]1540-he has broken no faith with [me]0-i . ” “[1540-he] But [he]1540-he told [you]89-elinor that [he]1540-he loved [you]89-elinor . ” “[1540-he] Yes — no — never absolutely . It was every day implied , but never professedly declared . Sometimes [I]0-i thought it had been , but it never was . ” “[0-i] Yet [you]89-elinor wrote to [him]1540-he ? ” “[89-elinor] Yes : could that be wrong after all that had passed ? But [I]0-i can not talk . ” [Elinor]89-elinor said no more , and turning again to the three letters which now raised a much stronger curiosity than before , directly ran over the contents of all . The first , which was what [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister had sent [him]1540-he on [their]3607-their arrival in [town]2984-town , was to this effect . [Berkeley Street]40-berkeley street , [January]148-january . “[0-i] How surprised [you]89-elinor will be , [Willoughby]159-willoughby , on receiving this ; and [I]0-i think [you]89-elinor will feel something more than surprise , when [you]89-elinor know that [I]0-i am in [town]2984-town . An opportunity of coming hither , though with [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , was a temptation [we]1543-we could not resist . [I]0-i wish [you]89-elinor may receive this in time to come here to - night , but [I]0-i will not depend on it . At any rate [I]0-i shall expect [you]89-elinor to - morrow . For the present , adieu . “ M.D. ”[103-mrs. jennings] [Her]103-mrs. jennings second note , which had been written on the morning after the dance at [the Middletons ’]1544-the middletons ’ , was in these words : — “ [I]103-mrs. jennings can not express [my]103-mrs. jennings disappointment in having missed [you]89-elinor the day before yesterday , nor [my]103-mrs. jennings astonishment at not having received any answer to a note which [I]103-mrs. jennings sent [you]89-elinor above a week ago . [I]103-mrs. jennings have been expecting to hear from [you]89-elinor , and still more to see [you]89-elinor , every hour of the day . Pray call again as soon as possible , and explain the reason of [my]103-mrs. jennings having expected this in vain . [You]89-elinor had better come earlier another time , because [we]1543-we are generally out by one . [We]1543-we were last night at [[Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton ’s]3609-lady middleton ’s , where there was a dance . [I]103-mrs. jennings have been told that [you]89-elinor were asked to be of [the party]577-the party . But could it be so ? [You]89-elinor must be very much altered indeed since [we]1543-we parted , if that could be the case , and [you]89-elinor not there . But [I]103-mrs. jennings will not suppose this possible , and [I]103-mrs. jennings hope very soon to receive [your]89-elinor personal assurance of its being otherwise . “[103-mrs. jennings] M.D. ” The contents of [her]0-i last note to [him]159-willoughby were these : — “[103-mrs. jennings] What am [I]0-i to imagine , [Willoughby]159-willoughby , by [your]159-willoughby behaviour last night ? Again [I]0-i demand an explanation of it . [I]0-i was prepared to meet [you]159-willoughby with the pleasure which [our]1545-our separation naturally produced , with the familiarity which [our]1545-our intimacy at [Barton]8-barton appeared to [me]0-i to justify . [I]0-i was repulsed indeed ! [I]0-i have passed a wretched night in endeavouring to excuse a conduct which can scarcely be called less than insulting ; but though [I]0-i have not yet been able to form any reasonable apology for [your]159-willoughby behaviour , [I]0-i am perfectly ready to hear [your]159-willoughby justification of it . [You]159-willoughby have perhaps been misinformed , or purposely deceived , in something concerning [me]0-i , which may have lowered [me]0-i in [your]159-willoughby opinion . Tell [me]0-i what it is , explain the grounds on which [you]159-willoughby acted , and [I]0-i shall be satisfied , in being able to satisfy [you]159-willoughby . It would grieve [me]0-i indeed to be obliged to think ill of [you]159-willoughby ; but if [I]0-i am to do it , if [I]0-i am to learn that [you]159-willoughby are not what [we]1546-we have hitherto believed [you]159-willoughby , that [your]159-willoughby regard for [us]1546-we all was insincere , that [your]159-willoughby behaviour to [me]0-i was intended only to deceive , let it be told as soon as possible . [My]0-i feelings are at present in a state of dreadful indecision ; [I]0-i wish to acquit [you]159-willoughby , but certainty on either side will be ease to what [I]0-i now suffer . If [your]159-willoughby sentiments are no longer what they were , [you]159-willoughby will return [my]0-i notes , and the lock of [my]0-i hair which is in [your]159-willoughby possession . “ M.D. ”[159-willoughby] That such letters , so full of affection and confidence , could have been so answered , [Elinor]89-elinor , for [Willoughby]159-willoughby ’s sake , would have been unwilling to believe . But [her]89-elinor condemnation of [him]159-willoughby did not blind [her]89-elinor to the impropriety of [their]1547-their having been written at all ; and [she]89-elinor was silently grieving over the imprudence which had hazarded such unsolicited proofs of tenderness , not warranted by anything preceding , and most severely condemned by the event , when [Marianne]90-marianne , perceiving that [she]89-elinor had finished the letters , observed to [her]89-elinor that they contained nothing but what [any one]659-any one would have written in the same situation . “ [I]89-elinor felt [myself]89-elinor , ”[89-elinor] [she]89-elinor added , “ to be as solemnly engaged to [him]159-willoughby , as if the strictest legal covenant had bound [us]3611-us to [each other]338-each other . ”[89-elinor] “ [I]89-elinor can believe it , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor ; “ but unfortunately [he]159-willoughby did not feel the same . ”[89-elinor] “ [He]159-willoughby _ did _ feel the same , [Elinor]89-elinor — for weeks and weeks [he]159-willoughby felt it . [I]1549-i know [he]159-willoughby did . Whatever may have changed [him]159-willoughby now , ( and nothing but the blackest art employed against [me]1549-i can have done it ) , [I]1549-i was once as dear to [him]159-willoughby as [my]1549-i own soul could wish . This lock of hair , which now [he]159-willoughby can so readily give up , was begged of [me]1549-i with the most earnest supplication . Had [you]89-elinor seen [his]159-willoughby look , [his]159-willoughby manner , had [you]89-elinor heard [his]159-willoughby voice at that moment ! Have [you]89-elinor forgot the last evening of [our]3613-we being together at [Barton]8-barton ? The morning that [we]3613-we parted too ! When [he]159-willoughby told [me]1549-i that it might be many weeks before [we]3613-we met again — [his]159-willoughby distress — can [I]1549-i ever forget [his]159-willoughby distress ? ”[1549-i] For a moment or two [she]1549-i could say no more ; but when this emotion had passed away , [she]1549-i added , in a firmer tone , “ [Elinor]89-elinor , [I]1549-i have been cruelly used ; but not by [Willoughby]159-willoughby . ”[1549-i] “ [Dearest Marianne]160-marianne , who but [himself]159-willoughby ? By whom can [he]159-willoughby have been instigated ? ”[1549-i] “ By all [the world]2778-the world , rather than by [his]159-willoughby own heart . [I]1549-i could rather believe [every creature of [my]1549-i acquaintance]3615-every creature of my acquaintance leagued together to ruin [me]1549-i in [his]159-willoughby opinion , than believe [his]159-willoughby nature capable of such cruelty . [This woman of whom [he]159-willoughby writes]3616-this woman of whom he writes — whoever [she]3616-this woman of whom he writes be — or any one , in short , but [[your]160-marianne own dear self]3617-your own dear self , [mama]2826-mama , and [Edward]98-edward , may have been so barbarous to bely [me]1549-i . Beyond [you]160-marianne three , is there a creature in [the world]2778-the world whom [I]1549-i would not rather suspect of evil than [Willoughby]159-willoughby , whose heart [I]1549-i know so well ? ”[1549-i] [Elinor]89-elinor would not contend , and only replied , “ Whoever may have been so detestably [[your]160-marianne enemy]3620-your enemy , let [them]3620-your enemy be cheated of [their]3620-your enemy malignant triumph , [[my]1549-i dear sister]3621-my dear sister , by seeing how nobly the consciousness of [your]160-marianne own innocence and good intentions supports [your]160-marianne spirits . It is a reasonable and laudable pride which resists such malevolence . ”[1549-i] “ No , no , ”[160-marianne] cried [Marianne]160-marianne , “ misery such as [mine]160-marianne has no pride . [I]160-marianne care not who knows that [I]160-marianne am wretched . The triumph of seeing [me]160-marianne so may be open to all [the world]2778-the world . [Elinor]89-elinor , [Elinor]89-elinor , [they]3620-your enemy who suffer little may be proud and independent as [they]3620-your enemy like — may resist insult , or return mortification — but [I]160-marianne can not . [I]160-marianne must feel — [I]160-marianne must be wretched — and [they]3620-your enemy are welcome to enjoy the consciousness of it that can . ”[160-marianne] “ But for [[my]1549-i mother]2771-my mother ’s sake and [mine]1549-i — ”[1549-i] “ [I]1549-i would do more than for [my]1549-i own . But to appear happy when [I]1549-i am so miserable — Oh ! who can require it ? ”[1549-i] Again [they]1550-they were both silent . [Elinor]89-elinor was employed in walking thoughtfully from the fire to the window , from the window to the fire , without knowing that [she]89-elinor received warmth from one , or discerning objects through the other ; and [Marianne]160-marianne , seated at the foot of the bed , with [her]160-marianne head leaning against one of its posts , again took up [Willoughby]159-willoughby ’s letter , and , after shuddering over every sentence , exclaimed , — “ It is too much ! Oh , [Willoughby]159-willoughby , [Willoughby]159-willoughby , could this be [yours]1549-i ! Cruel , cruel — nothing can acquit [you]1549-i . [Elinor]89-elinor , nothing can . Whatever [he]159-willoughby might have heard against [me]160-marianne — ought [he]159-willoughby not to have suspended [his]159-willoughby belief ? ought [he]159-willoughby not to have told [me]160-marianne of it , to have given [me]160-marianne the power of clearing [myself]160-marianne ? ‘ The lock of hair , ( repeating it from the letter , ) which [you]1549-i so obligingly bestowed on me’—That is unpardonable . [Willoughby]159-willoughby , where was [your]1549-i heart when [you]1549-i wrote those words ? Oh , barbarously insolent!—Elinor , can [he]159-willoughby be justified ? ”[160-marianne] “ No , [Marianne]160-marianne , in no possible way . ”[89-elinor] “ And yet [this woman]3624-this woman — who knows what [her]3624-this woman art may have been?—how long it may have been premeditated , and how deeply contrived by her!—Who is she?—Who can [she]3624-this woman be?—Whom did [I]89-elinor ever hear [him]159-willoughby talk of as young and attractive among [[his]159-willoughby female acquaintance?—Oh]3625-his female acquaintance?—oh ! [no one]317-no one , [no one]317-no one — [he]159-willoughby talked to [me]89-elinor only of [myself]89-elinor . ”[89-elinor] Another pause ensued ; [Marianne]160-marianne was greatly agitated , and it ended thus . “ [Elinor]89-elinor , [I]160-marianne must go [home]565-home . [I]160-marianne must go and comfort [mama]2826-mama . Can not [we]3630-we be gone to - morrow ? ”[160-marianne] “ To - morrow , [Marianne]160-marianne ! ”[89-elinor] “ Yes , why should [I]89-elinor stay [here]2861-here ? [I]89-elinor came only for [Willoughby]159-willoughby ’s sake — and now who cares for [me]89-elinor ? Who regards [me]89-elinor ? ”[89-elinor] “ It would be impossible to go to - morrow . [We]3630-we owe [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings much more than civility ; and [civility of the commonest kind]3632-civility of the commonest kind must prevent such a hasty removal as that . ”[89-elinor] “ Well then , another day or two , perhaps ; but [I]89-elinor can not stay [here]2861-here long , [I]89-elinor can not stay to endure the questions and remarks of [all these people]3634-all these people . [The Middletons]102-the middletons and [Palmers]126-the palmers — how am [I]89-elinor to bear [their]3634-all these people pity ? The pity of [such a woman as [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton]3635-such a woman as lady middleton ! Oh , what would _ [he]3636-he _ say to that ! ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor advised [her]89-elinor to lie down again , and for a moment [she]89-elinor did so ; but no attitude could give [her]89-elinor ease ; and in restless pain of mind and body [she]89-elinor moved from one posture to another , till growing more and more hysterical , [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister could with difficulty keep [her]89-elinor on the bed at all , and for some time was fearful of being constrained to call for assistance . Some lavender drops , however , which [she]89-elinor was at length persuaded to take , were of use ; and from that time till [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings returned , [she]89-elinor continued on the bed quiet and motionless . CHAPTER XXX . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings came immediately to [[their]1552-their room]1532-their room on [her]103-mrs. jennings return , and without waiting to have [her]103-mrs. jennings request of admittance answered , opened the door and walked in with a look of real concern . “ How do [you]160-marianne do [my]103-mrs. jennings dear?”—said[103-mrs. jennings] [she]103-mrs. jennings in a voice of great compassion to [Marianne]160-marianne , who turned away [her]160-marianne face without attempting to answer . “ How is [she]160-marianne , [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood ? [Poor thing]3637-poor thing ! [she]160-marianne looks very bad . No wonder . Ay , it is but too true . [He]3638-he is to be married very soon — [a good - for - nothing fellow]3639-a good - for - nothing fellow ! [I]1554-i have no patience with [him]3638-he . [Mrs. Taylor]161-mrs. taylor told [me]1554-i of it half an hour ago , and [she]161-mrs. taylor was told it by [a particular friend of [Miss Grey]162-miss grey]3640-a particular friend of miss grey [herself]161-mrs. taylor , else [I]1554-i am sure [I]1554-i should not have believed it ; and [I]1554-i was almost ready to sink as it was . Well , said [I]1554-i , all [I]1554-i can say is , that if this be true , [he]3638-he has used [a young lady of [my]1554-i acquaintance]3641-a young lady of my acquaintance abominably ill , and [I]1554-i wish with all [my]1554-i soul [[his]3638-he wife]280-his wife may plague [his]3638-he heart out . And so [I]1554-i shall always say , [[my]1554-i dear]2750-my dear , [you]2750-my dear may depend on it . [I]1554-i have no notion of [men]2910-men ’s going on in this way ; and if ever [I]1554-i meet [him]3638-he again , [I]1554-i will give [him]3638-he such a dressing as [he]3638-he has not had this many a day . But there is one comfort , [[my]1554-i dear]2750-my dear [Miss Marianne]90-marianne ; [he]3638-he is not [the only young man in [the world]2778-the world]3646-the only young man in the world worth having ; and with [your]2750-my dear pretty face [you]2750-my dear will never want [admirers]3648-admirers . Well , poor thing ! [I]1554-i wo n’t disturb [her]1554-i any longer , for [she]1554-i had better have [her]1554-i cry out at once and have done with . [The Parrys]163-the parrys and [Sandersons]164-sandersons luckily are coming tonight [you]2750-my dear know , and that will amuse [her]1554-i . ”[1554-i] [She]1554-i then went away , walking on tiptoe out of [the room]2842-the room , as if [she]1554-i supposed [[her]1554-i young friend]1556-her young friend ’s affliction could be increased by noise . [Marianne]90-marianne , to the surprise of [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister , determined on dining with [them]1558-them . [Elinor]89-elinor even advised [her]90-marianne against it . But “ no , [she]90-marianne would go down ; [she]90-marianne could bear it very well , and the bustle about [her]90-marianne would be less . ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor , pleased to have [her]90-marianne governed for a moment by such a motive , though believing it hardly possible that [she]90-marianne could sit out the dinner , said no more ; and adjusting [her]90-marianne dress for [her]90-marianne as well as [she]90-marianne could , while [Marianne]90-marianne still remained on the bed , was ready to assist [her]90-marianne into [the dining room]1132-the dining room as soon as [they]1558-them were summoned to [it]1132-the dining room . When there , though looking most wretchedly , [she]90-marianne ate more and was calmer than [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister had expected . Had [she]90-marianne tried to speak , or had [she]90-marianne been conscious of half [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s well - meant but ill - judged attentions to [her]90-marianne , this calmness could not have been maintained ; but not a syllable escaped [her]90-marianne lips ; and the abstraction of [her]90-marianne thoughts preserved [her]90-marianne in ignorance of every thing that was passing before [her]90-marianne . [Elinor]89-elinor , who did justice to [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s kindness , though its effusions were often distressing , and sometimes almost ridiculous , made [her]90-marianne those acknowledgments , and returned [her]90-marianne those civilities , which [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister could not make or return for [herself]336-her sister . [[Their]1558-them good friend]1562-their good friend saw that [Marianne]90-marianne was unhappy , and felt that every thing was due to [her]90-marianne which might make [her]90-marianne at all less so . [She]1562-their good friend treated [her]90-marianne therefore , with all the indulgent fondness of [a parent]1563-a parent towards [a favourite child]1564-a favourite child on the last day of [its]1564-a favourite child holidays . [Marianne]90-marianne was to have the best place by the fire , was to be tempted to eat by every delicacy in [the house]318-the house , and to be amused by the relation of all the news of the day . Had not [Elinor]89-elinor , in the sad countenance of [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister , seen a check to all mirth , [she]89-elinor could have been entertained by [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s endeavours to cure a disappointment in love , by a variety of sweetmeats and olives , and a good fire . As soon , however , as the consciousness of all this was forced by continual repetition on [Marianne]90-marianne , [she]89-elinor could stay no longer . With a hasty exclamation of Misery , and a sign to [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister not to follow [her]89-elinor , [she]89-elinor directly got up and hurried out of [the room]2842-the room . “ [Poor soul]3649-poor soul ! ”[103-mrs. jennings] cried [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , as soon as [she]89-elinor was gone , “ how it grieves [me]103-mrs. jennings to see [her]90-marianne ! And [I]103-mrs. jennings declare if [she]90-marianne is not gone away without finishing [her]90-marianne wine ! And the dried cherries too ! [Lord]3650-lord ! nothing seems to do [her]90-marianne any good . [I]103-mrs. jennings am sure if [I]103-mrs. jennings knew of any thing [she]90-marianne would like , [I]103-mrs. jennings would send all over [the town]1334-the town for it . Well , it is the oddest thing to [me]103-mrs. jennings , that [a man]499-a man should use such [a pretty girl]615-a pretty girl so ill ! But when there is plenty of money on one side , and next to none on the other , [Lord]3654-lord bless [you]3649-poor soul ! [they]3655-they care no more about such things ! — ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ [The lady]370-the lady then — [Miss Grey]162-miss grey [I]103-mrs. jennings think [you]103-mrs. jennings called [her]370-the lady — is very rich ? ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ Fifty thousand pounds , [[my]103-mrs. jennings dear]2750-my dear . Did [you]103-mrs. jennings ever see [her]370-the lady ? [a smart , stylish girl]3658-a smart , stylish girl [they]3655-they say , but not handsome . [I]103-mrs. jennings remember [[her]370-the lady aunt]3659-her aunt very well , [Biddy Henshawe]165-biddy henshawe ; [she]165-biddy henshawe married [a very wealthy man]3660-a very wealthy man . But [the family]303-the family are all rich together . Fifty thousand pounds ! and by all accounts , it wo n’t come before it ’s wanted ; for [they]3655-they say [he]3660-a very wealthy man is all to pieces . No wonder ! dashing about with [his]3660-a very wealthy man curricle and [hunters]3158-hunters ! Well , it do n’t signify talking ; but when [a young man]421-a young man , be who [he]421-a young man will , comes and makes love to [a pretty girl]615-a pretty girl , and promises marriage , [he]421-a young man has no business to fly off from [his]421-a young man word only because [he]421-a young man grows poor , and [a richer girl]3665-a richer girl is ready to have [him]421-a young man . Why do n’t [he]421-a young man , in such a case , sell [his]421-a young man horses , let [[his]421-a young man house]515-his house , turn off [[his]421-a young man servants]3667-his servants , and make a thorough reform at once ? [I]103-mrs. jennings warrant [you]3668-you , [Miss Marianne]90-marianne would have been ready to wait till matters came round . But that wo n’t do now - a - days ; nothing in the way of pleasure can ever be given up by [the young men of this age]3669-the young men of this age . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ Do [you]3668-you know what kind of a girl [Miss Grey]162-miss grey is ? Is [she]90-marianne said to be amiable ? ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ [I]103-mrs. jennings never heard any harm of [her]90-marianne ; indeed [I]103-mrs. jennings hardly ever heard [her]90-marianne mentioned ; except that [Mrs. Taylor]161-mrs. taylor did say this morning , that one day [Miss Walker]166-miss walker hinted to [her]161-mrs. taylor , that [she]161-mrs. taylor believed [Mr.]3670-mr. and [Mrs. Ellison]167-mrs. ellison would not be sorry to have [Miss Grey]162-miss grey married , for [she]161-mrs. taylor and [Mrs. Ellison]167-mrs. ellison could never agree . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ And who are [the Ellisons]168-the ellisons ? ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ [[Her]90-marianne guardians]3671-her guardians , [[my]103-mrs. jennings dear]2750-my dear . But now [she]90-marianne is of age and may choose for [herself]90-marianne ; and a pretty choice [she]90-marianne has made!—What now , ”[103-mrs. jennings] after pausing a [moment—“your poor sister]3673-moment—“your poor sister is gone to [[her]90-marianne own room]1394-her own room , [I]103-mrs. jennings suppose , to moan by [herself]90-marianne . Is there nothing one can get to comfort [her]90-marianne ? [Poor dear]3675-poor dear , it seems quite cruel to let [her]90-marianne be alone . Well , by - and - by [we]3676-we shall have [a few friends]3677-a few friends , and that will amuse [her]90-marianne a little . What shall [we]3676-we play at ? [She]90-marianne hates whist [I]103-mrs. jennings know ; but is there no round game [she]90-marianne cares for ? ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ [Dear ma’am]3678-dear ma’am , this kindness is quite unnecessary . [Marianne]90-marianne , [I]103-mrs. jennings dare say , will not leave [[her]90-marianne room]3679-her room again this evening . [I]103-mrs. jennings shall persuade [her]90-marianne if [I]103-mrs. jennings can to go early to bed , for [I]103-mrs. jennings am sure [she]90-marianne wants rest . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ Aye , [I]103-mrs. jennings believe that will be best for [her]90-marianne . Let [her]90-marianne name [her]90-marianne own supper , and go to bed . [Lord]3680-lord ! no wonder [she]90-marianne has been looking so bad and so cast down this last week or two , for this matter [I]103-mrs. jennings suppose has been hanging over [her]90-marianne head as long as that . And so the letter that came today finished it ! [Poor soul]3649-poor soul ! [I]103-mrs. jennings am sure if [I]103-mrs. jennings had had a notion of it , [I]103-mrs. jennings would not have joked [her]90-marianne about it for all [my]103-mrs. jennings money . But then [you]3682-you know , how should [I]103-mrs. jennings guess such a thing ? [I]103-mrs. jennings made sure of its being nothing but a common love letter , and [you]3682-you know [young people]3683-young people like to be laughed at about [them]3683-young people . [Lord]3684-lord ! how concerned [Sir John]99-sir john and [[my]103-mrs. jennings daughters]3492-my daughters will be when [they]3683-young people hear it ! If [I]103-mrs. jennings had [my]103-mrs. jennings senses about [me]103-mrs. jennings [I]103-mrs. jennings might have called in [Conduit Street]41-conduit street in [my]103-mrs. jennings way [home]565-home , and told [them]3683-young people of it . But [I]103-mrs. jennings shall see [them]3683-young people tomorrow . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ It would be unnecessary [I]103-mrs. jennings am sure , for [you]3682-you to caution [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer and [Sir John]99-sir john against ever naming [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby , or making the slightest allusion to what has passed , before [[my]103-mrs. jennings sister]2818-my sister . [Their]3683-young people own good - nature must point out to [them]3683-young people the real cruelty of appearing to know any thing about it when [she]2818-my sister is present ; and the less that may ever be said to [myself]103-mrs. jennings on the subject , the more [my]103-mrs. jennings feelings will be spared , as [you]3682-you [[my]103-mrs. jennings dear madam]2987-my dear madam will easily believe . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ Oh ! [Lord]3689-lord ! yes , that [I]103-mrs. jennings do indeed . It must be terrible for [you]3682-you to hear it talked of ; and as for [[your]3682-you sister]2815-your sister , [I]103-mrs. jennings am sure [I]103-mrs. jennings would not mention a word about it to [her]2815-your sister for [the world]2778-the world . [You]3682-you saw [I]103-mrs. jennings did not all dinner time . No more would [Sir John]99-sir john , nor [[my]103-mrs. jennings daughters]3492-my daughters , for [they]3492-my daughters are all very thoughtful and considerate ; especially if [I]103-mrs. jennings give [them]3492-my daughters a hint , as [I]103-mrs. jennings certainly will . For [my]103-mrs. jennings part , [I]103-mrs. jennings think the less that is said about such things , the better , the sooner ’ tis blown over and forgot . And what good does talking ever do [you]3682-you know ? ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ In this affair it can only do harm ; more so perhaps than in many cases of a similar kind , for it has been attended by circumstances which , for the sake of [every one concerned in it , make it unfit to become the public conversation]3693-every one concerned in it , make it unfit to become the public conversation . [I]103-mrs. jennings must do _ this _ justice to [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby — [he]107-willoughby has broken no positive engagement with [[my]103-mrs. jennings sister]2818-my sister . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ Law , [[my]103-mrs. jennings dear]2750-my dear ! Do n’t pretend to defend [him]107-willoughby . No positive engagement indeed ! after taking [her]2818-my sister all over [Allenham House]42-allenham house , and fixing on [the very rooms [they]3697-they were to live in hereafter]3696-the very rooms they were to live in hereafter ! ”[103-mrs. jennings] [Elinor]89-elinor , for [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister ’s sake , could not press the subject farther , and [she]89-elinor hoped it was not required of [her]89-elinor for [Willoughby]107-willoughby ’s ; since , though [Marianne]90-marianne might lose much , [he]107-willoughby could gain very little by the enforcement of the real truth . After a short silence on both sides , [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , with all [her]103-mrs. jennings natural hilarity , burst forth again . “ Well , [[my]103-mrs. jennings dear]2750-my dear , ’ tis a true saying about an ill - wind , for it will be all the better for [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon . [He]104-colonel brandon will have [her]2818-my sister at last ; aye , that [he]104-colonel brandon will . Mind [me]103-mrs. jennings , now , if [they]3697-they an’t married by Mid - summer . [Lord]3699-lord ! how [he]104-colonel brandon ’ll chuckle over this news ! [I]103-mrs. jennings hope [he]104-colonel brandon will come tonight . It will be all to one a better match for [[your]2750-my dear sister]2815-your sister . Two thousand a year without debt or drawback — except [the little love - child]3701-the little love - child , indeed ; aye , [I]103-mrs. jennings had forgot [her]3701-the little love - child ; but [she]3701-the little love - child may be ’ prenticed out at a small cost , and then what does it signify ? [Delaford]22-delaford is [a nice place]3702-a nice place , [I]103-mrs. jennings can tell [you]2750-my dear ; exactly what [I]103-mrs. jennings call [a nice old fashioned place , full of comforts and conveniences]3703-a nice old fashioned place , full of comforts and conveniences ; quite shut in with great garden walls that are covered with the best fruit - trees in [the country]612-the country ; and such a mulberry tree in one corner ! [Lord]3705-lord ! how [Charlotte]127-charlotte and [I]103-mrs. jennings did stuff the only time [we]3706-we were [there]354-there ! Then , there is [a dove - cote]3708-a dove - cote , [some delightful stew - ponds]3709-some delightful stew - ponds , and [a very pretty canal]3710-a very pretty canal ; and every thing , in short , that [one]2761-one could wish for ; and , moreover , [it]354-there is close to [the church]3037-the church , and only a quarter of a mile from [the turnpike - road]3713-the turnpike - road , so ’ tis never dull , for if [you]2750-my dear only go and sit up in [an old yew arbour behind [the house]318-the house]3714-an old yew arbour behind the house , [you]2750-my dear may see all the carriages that pass along . Oh ! ’ tis a nice place ! [A butcher hard by in [the village]3190-the village]3716-a butcher hard by in the village , and [the parsonage - house]3718-the parsonage - house within a stone ’s throw . To [my]103-mrs. jennings fancy , a thousand times prettier than [Barton Park]6-barton park , where [they]3719-they are forced to send three miles for [their]3719-they meat , and have not [a neighbour nearer than [[your]2750-my dear mother]2781-your mother]3720-a neighbour nearer than your mother . Well , [I]103-mrs. jennings shall spirit up [the Colonel]664-the colonel as soon as [I]103-mrs. jennings can . One shoulder of mutton , [you]2750-my dear know , drives another down . If [we]3723-we _ can _ but put [Willoughby]107-willoughby out of [her]90-marianne head ! ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ Ay , if [we]3723-we can do _ that _ , [Ma’am]157-ma’am , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor , “ [we]3723-we shall do very well with or without [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon . ”[89-elinor] And then rising , [she]89-elinor went away to join [Marianne]90-marianne , whom [she]89-elinor found , as [she]89-elinor expected , in [[her]90-marianne own room]1394-her own room , leaning , in silent misery , over the small remains of a fire , which , till [Elinor]89-elinor ’s entrance , had been [her]89-elinor only light . “ [You]336-her sister had better leave [me]336-her sister , ”[336-her sister] was all the notice that [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister received from [her]89-elinor . “ [I]89-elinor will leave [you]336-her sister , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor , “ if [you]336-her sister will go to bed . ”[89-elinor] But this , from the momentary perverseness of impatient suffering , [she]89-elinor at first refused to do . [[Her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister ’s earnest , though gentle persuasion , however , soon softened [her]89-elinor to compliance , and [Elinor]89-elinor saw [her]336-her sister lay [her]336-her sister aching head on the pillow , and as [she]89-elinor hoped , in a way to get some quiet rest before [she]336-her sister left [her]336-her sister . In [the drawing - room]1150-the drawing - room , whither [she]89-elinor then repaired , [she]89-elinor was soon joined by [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , with a wine - glass , full of something , in [her]103-mrs. jennings hand . “ [[My]103-mrs. jennings dear]2750-my dear , ”[103-mrs. jennings] said [she]103-mrs. jennings , entering , “ [I]103-mrs. jennings have just recollected that [I]103-mrs. jennings have some of the finest old Constantia wine in [the house]318-the house that ever was tasted , so [I]103-mrs. jennings have brought a glass of it for [[your]2750-my dear sister]2815-your sister . [[My]103-mrs. jennings poor husband]3727-my poor husband ! how fond [he]3727-my poor husband was of it ! Whenever [he]3727-my poor husband had a touch of [his]3727-my poor husband old colicky gout , [he]3727-my poor husband said it did [him]3727-my poor husband more good than any thing else in [the world]2778-the world . Do take it to [[your]2750-my dear sister]2815-your sister . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ [Dear Ma’am]157-ma’am , ”[89-elinor] replied [Elinor]89-elinor , smiling at the difference of the complaints for which it was recommended , “ how good [you]157-ma’am are ! But [I]103-mrs. jennings have just left [Marianne]90-marianne in bed , and , [I]103-mrs. jennings hope , almost asleep ; and as [I]103-mrs. jennings think nothing will be of so much service to [her]90-marianne as rest , if [you]103-mrs. jennings will give [me]103-mrs. jennings leave , [I]103-mrs. jennings will drink the wine [myself]103-mrs. jennings . ”[103-mrs. jennings] [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , though regretting that [she]103-mrs. jennings had not been five minutes earlier , was satisfied with the compromise ; and [Elinor]89-elinor , as [she]89-elinor swallowed the chief of it , reflected , that though its effects on a colicky gout were , at present , of little importance to [her]89-elinor , its healing powers , on a disappointed heart might be as reasonably tried on [herself]89-elinor as on [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister . [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon came in while [the party]577-the party were at tea , and by [his]104-colonel brandon manner of looking round [the room]2842-the room for [Marianne]90-marianne , [Elinor]89-elinor immediately fancied that [he]104-colonel brandon neither expected nor wished to see [her]90-marianne [there]354-there , and , in short , that [he]104-colonel brandon was already aware of what occasioned [her]90-marianne absence . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings was not struck by the same thought ; for soon after [his]104-colonel brandon entrance , [she]103-mrs. jennings walked across [the room]2842-the room to the tea - table where [Elinor]89-elinor presided , and whispered , “ [The Colonel]664-the colonel looks as grave as ever [you]89-elinor see . [He]664-the colonel knows nothing of it ; do tell [him]664-the colonel , [[my]103-mrs. jennings dear]2750-my dear . ”[103-mrs. jennings] [He]104-colonel brandon shortly afterwards drew a chair close to [hers]103-mrs. jennings , and , with a look which perfectly assured [her]103-mrs. jennings of [his]104-colonel brandon good information , inquired after [[her]103-mrs. jennings sister]336-her sister . “ [Marianne]90-marianne is not well , ”[103-mrs. jennings] said [she]103-mrs. jennings . “ [She]90-marianne has been indisposed all day , and [we]3732-we have persuaded [her]90-marianne to go to bed . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ Perhaps , then , ”[104-colonel brandon] [he]104-colonel brandon hesitatingly replied , “ what [I]104-colonel brandon heard this morning may be — there may be more truth in it than [I]104-colonel brandon could believe possible at first . ”[104-colonel brandon] “ What did [you]104-colonel brandon hear ? ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ That [a gentleman]985-a gentleman , whom [I]103-mrs. jennings had reason to think — in short , that [a man , whom [I]103-mrs. jennings _ knew _ to be engaged]3734-a man , whom i _ knew _ to be engaged — but how shall [I]103-mrs. jennings tell [you]103-mrs. jennings ? If [you]103-mrs. jennings know it already , as surely [you]103-mrs. jennings must , [I]103-mrs. jennings may be spared . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ [You]103-mrs. jennings mean , ”[89-elinor] answered [Elinor]89-elinor , with forced calmness , “ [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby ’s marriage with [Miss Grey]162-miss grey . Yes , [we]3732-we _ do _ know it all . This seems to have been a day of general elucidation , for this very morning first unfolded it to [us]3732-we . [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby is unfathomable ! Where did [you]104-colonel brandon hear it ? ”[89-elinor] “ In [[a stationer]3735-a stationer ’s shop in [Pall Mall]43-pall mall]3736-a stationer ’s shop in pall mall , where [I]103-mrs. jennings had business . [Two ladies]3737-two ladies were waiting for [[their]3737-two ladies carriage]3738-their carriage , and one of [them]3737-two ladies was giving [the other]772-the other an account of the intended match , in a voice so little attempting concealment , that it was impossible for [me]103-mrs. jennings not to hear all . The name of [Willoughby]107-willoughby , [John Willoughby]159-willoughby , frequently repeated , first caught [my]103-mrs. jennings attention ; and what followed was a positive assertion that every thing was now finally settled respecting [his]107-willoughby marriage with [Miss Grey]162-miss grey — it was no longer to be a secret — it would take place even within a few weeks , with many particulars of preparations and other matters . One thing , especially , [I]103-mrs. jennings remember , because it served to identify [the man]502-the man still more:—as soon as the ceremony was over , [they]3737-two ladies were to go to [Combe Magna]35-combe magna , [[his]107-willoughby seat in [Somersetshire]16-somersetshire]3741-his seat in somersetshire . [My]103-mrs. jennings astonishment!—but it would be impossible to describe what [I]103-mrs. jennings felt . The communicative lady [I]103-mrs. jennings learnt , on inquiry , for [I]103-mrs. jennings stayed in [the shop]3742-the shop till [they]3737-two ladies were gone , was [a Mrs. Ellison]167-mrs. ellison , and that , as [I]103-mrs. jennings have been since informed , is the name of [[Miss Grey]162-miss grey ’s guardian]3743-miss grey ’s guardian . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ It is . But have [you]103-mrs. jennings likewise heard that [Miss Grey]162-miss grey has fifty thousand pounds ? In that , if in any thing , [we]3744-we may find an explanation . ”[89-elinor] “ It may be so ; but [Willoughby]107-willoughby is capable — at least [I]89-elinor think”—he[89-elinor] stopped a moment ; then added in a voice which seemed to distrust itself , “ And [[your]103-mrs. jennings sister]2815-your sister — how did [she]2815-your sister — ”[89-elinor] “ [Her]2815-your sister sufferings have been very severe . [I]89-elinor have only to hope that they may be proportionately short . It has been , it is a most cruel affliction . Till yesterday , [I]89-elinor believe , [she]2815-your sister never doubted [his]107-willoughby regard ; and even now , perhaps — but _ [I]89-elinor _ am almost convinced that [he]107-willoughby never was really attached to [her]2815-your sister . [He]107-willoughby has been very deceitful ! and , in some points , there seems a hardness of heart about [him]107-willoughby . ”[89-elinor] “ Ah ! ”[104-colonel brandon] said [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon , “ there is , indeed ! But [[your]103-mrs. jennings sister]2815-your sister does not — [I]104-colonel brandon think [you]104-colonel brandon said so — [she]2815-your sister does not consider quite as [you]104-colonel brandon do ? ”[104-colonel brandon] “ [You]104-colonel brandon know [her]2815-your sister disposition , and may believe how eagerly [she]2815-your sister would still justify [him]107-willoughby if [she]2815-your sister could . ”[104-colonel brandon] [He]104-colonel brandon made no answer ; and soon afterwards , by the removal of the tea - things , and the arrangement of the card parties , the subject was necessarily dropped . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , who had watched [them]1580-they with pleasure while [they]1580-they were talking , and who expected to see the effect of [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood ’s communication , in such an instantaneous gaiety on [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon ’s side , as might have become [a man in the bloom of youth , of hope and happiness]1581-a man in the bloom of youth , of hope and happiness , saw [him]104-colonel brandon , with amazement , remain the whole evening more serious and thoughtful than usual . CHAPTER XXXI . From a night of more sleep than [she]1582-she had expected , [Marianne]90-marianne awoke the next morning to the same consciousness of misery in which [she]1582-she had closed [her]1582-she eyes . [Elinor]89-elinor encouraged [her]90-marianne as much as possible to talk of what [she]90-marianne felt ; and before breakfast was ready , [they]1580-they had gone through the subject again and again ; and with the same steady conviction and affectionate counsel on [Elinor]89-elinor ’s side , the same impetuous feelings and varying opinions on [Marianne]90-marianne ’s , as before . Sometimes [she]90-marianne could believe [Willoughby]107-willoughby to be as unfortunate and as innocent as [herself]90-marianne , and at others , lost every consolation in the impossibility of acquitting [him]107-willoughby . At one moment [she]90-marianne was absolutely indifferent to the observation of all [the world]2778-the world , at another [she]90-marianne would seclude [herself]90-marianne from it for ever , and at a third could resist it with energy . In one thing , however , [she]90-marianne was uniform , when it came to the point , in avoiding , where it was possible , the presence of [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , and in a determined silence when obliged to endure it . [Her]90-marianne heart was hardened against the belief of [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s entering into [her]90-marianne sorrows with any compassion . “ No , no , no , it can not be , ”[90-marianne] [she]90-marianne cried ; “ [she]90-marianne can not feel . [Her]90-marianne kindness is not sympathy ; [her]90-marianne good - nature is not tenderness . All that [she]90-marianne wants is gossip , and [she]90-marianne only likes [me]90-marianne now because [I]90-marianne supply it . ”[90-marianne] [Elinor]89-elinor had not needed this to be assured of the injustice to which [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister was often led in [her]90-marianne opinion of [others]2961-others , by the irritable refinement of [her]90-marianne own mind , and the too great importance placed by [her]90-marianne on the delicacies of a strong sensibility , and the graces of a polished manner . Like half [the rest of [the world]2778-the world]667-the rest of the world , if [more than half there be that are clever and good]1588-more than half there be that are clever and good , [Marianne]90-marianne , with excellent abilities and an excellent disposition , was neither reasonable nor candid . [She]90-marianne expected from [other people]2834-other people the same opinions and feelings as [her]90-marianne own , and [she]90-marianne judged of [their]2834-other people motives by the immediate effect of [their]2834-other people actions on [herself]90-marianne . Thus a circumstance occurred , while [the sisters]1282-the sisters were together in [[their]1282-the sisters own room]1519-their own room after breakfast , which sunk the heart of [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings still lower in [her]90-marianne estimation ; because , through [her]90-marianne own weakness , it chanced to prove a source of fresh pain to [herself]90-marianne , though [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings was governed in it by an impulse of the utmost goodwill . With a letter in [her]90-marianne outstretched hand , and countenance gaily smiling , from the persuasion of bringing comfort , [she]90-marianne entered [[their]1282-the sisters room]1532-their room , saying , “ Now , [[my]90-marianne dear]2750-my dear , [I]90-marianne bring [you]2750-my dear something that [I]90-marianne am sure will do [you]2750-my dear good . ”[90-marianne] [Marianne]90-marianne heard enough . In one moment [her]90-marianne imagination placed before [her]90-marianne a letter from [Willoughby]107-willoughby , full of tenderness and contrition , explanatory of all that had passed , satisfactory , convincing ; and instantly followed by [Willoughby]107-willoughby [himself]107-willoughby , rushing eagerly into [the room]2842-the room to inforce , at [her]90-marianne feet , by the eloquence of [his]107-willoughby eyes , the assurances of [his]107-willoughby letter . The work of one moment was destroyed by the next . The hand writing of [[her]90-marianne mother]332-her mother , never till then unwelcome , was before [her]90-marianne ; and , in the acuteness of the disappointment which followed such an ecstasy of more than hope , [she]90-marianne felt as if , till that instant , [she]90-marianne had never suffered . The cruelty of [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings no language , within [her]103-mrs. jennings reach in [her]103-mrs. jennings moments of happiest eloquence , could have expressed ; and now [she]103-mrs. jennings could reproach [her]332-her mother only by the tears which streamed from [her]103-mrs. jennings eyes with passionate violence — a reproach , however , so entirely lost on its object , that after many expressions of pity , [she]103-mrs. jennings withdrew , still referring [her]332-her mother to the letter of comfort . But the letter , when [she]90-marianne was calm enough to read it , brought little comfort . [Willoughby]107-willoughby filled every page . [[Her]90-marianne mother]332-her mother , still confident of [their]1596-their engagement , and relying as warmly as ever on [his]107-willoughby constancy , had only been roused by [Elinor]89-elinor ’s application , to intreat from [Marianne]90-marianne greater openness towards [them]1596-their both ; and this , with such tenderness towards [her]332-her mother , such affection for [Willoughby]107-willoughby , and such a conviction of [their]1596-their future happiness in each other , that [she]90-marianne wept with agony through the whole of it . All [her]90-marianne impatience to be at [home]565-home again now returned ; [[her]90-marianne mother]332-her mother was dearer to [her]90-marianne than ever ; dearer through the very excess of [her]90-marianne mistaken confidence in [Willoughby]107-willoughby , and [she]90-marianne was wildly urgent to be gone . [Elinor]89-elinor , unable [herself]89-elinor to determine whether it were better for [Marianne]90-marianne to be in [London]24-london or at [Barton]8-barton , offered no counsel of [her]89-elinor own except of patience till [[their]1596-their mother]274-their mother ’s wishes could be known ; and at length [she]89-elinor obtained [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister ’s consent to wait for that knowledge . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings left [them]1596-their earlier than usual ; for [she]103-mrs. jennings could not be easy till [the Middletons]102-the middletons and [Palmers]126-the palmers were able to grieve as much as [herself]103-mrs. jennings ; and positively refusing [Elinor]89-elinor ’s offered attendance , went out alone for the rest of the morning . [Elinor]89-elinor , with a very heavy heart , aware of the pain [she]89-elinor was going to communicate , and perceiving , by [Marianne]90-marianne ’s letter , how ill [she]89-elinor had succeeded in laying any foundation for it , then sat down to write [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother an account of what had passed , and entreat [her]332-her mother directions for the future ; while [Marianne]90-marianne , who came into [the drawing - room on [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s going away]1602-the drawing - room on mrs. jennings ’s going away , remained fixed at the table where [Elinor]89-elinor wrote , watching the advancement of [her]332-her mother pen , grieving over [her]332-her mother for the hardship of such a task , and grieving still more fondly over its effect on [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother . In this manner [they]1604-we had continued about a quarter of an hour , when [Marianne , whose nerves could not then bear any sudden noise]1605-marianne , whose nerves could not then bear any sudden noise , was startled by a rap at the door . “ Who can this be ? ”[89-elinor] cried [Elinor]89-elinor . “ So early too ! [I]90-marianne thought [we]1604-we _ had _ been safe . ”[90-marianne] [Marianne]90-marianne moved to the window . “ It is [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon ! ”[89-elinor] said [she]89-elinor , with vexation . “ [We]1604-we are never safe from _ [him]104-colonel brandon _ . ”[89-elinor] “ [He]104-colonel brandon will not come in , as [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings is from [home]565-home . ”[89-elinor] “ [I]89-elinor will not trust to _ that _ , ”[89-elinor] retreating to [[her]89-elinor own room]1394-her own room . “ [A man who has nothing to do with [his]3749-a man who has nothing to do with his own time own time]3749-a man who has nothing to do with his own time has no conscience in [his]3749-a man who has nothing to do with his own time intrusion on that of [others]2961-others . ”[89-elinor] The event proved [her]89-elinor conjecture right , though it was founded on injustice and error ; for [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon _ did _ come in ; and [Elinor]89-elinor , who was convinced that solicitude for [Marianne]90-marianne brought [him]104-colonel brandon thither , and who saw _ that _ solicitude in [his]104-colonel brandon disturbed and melancholy look , and in [his]104-colonel brandon anxious though brief inquiry after [her]89-elinor , could not forgive [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister for esteeming [him]104-colonel brandon so lightly . “ [I]104-colonel brandon met [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings in [Bond Street]39-bond street , ”[104-colonel brandon] said [he]104-colonel brandon , after the first salutation , “ and [she]103-mrs. jennings encouraged [me]1608-i to come on ; and [I]1608-i was the more easily encouraged , because [I]1608-i thought it probable that [I]1608-i might find [you]3751-you alone , which [I]1608-i was very desirous of doing . [My]1608-i object — [my]1608-i wish — [my]1608-i sole wish in desiring it — [I]1608-i hope , [I]1608-i believe it is — is to be a means of giving comfort;—no , [I]1608-i must not say comfort — not present comfort — but conviction , lasting conviction to [[your]3751-you sister]2815-your sister ’s mind . [My]1608-i regard for [her]2815-your sister , for [yourself]3751-you , for [[your]3751-you mother]2781-your mother — will [you]3751-you allow [me]1608-i to prove it , by relating some circumstances which nothing but a _ very _ sincere regard — nothing but an earnest desire of being useful — [I]1608-i think [I]1608-i am justified — though where so many hours have been spent in convincing [myself]1608-i that [I]1608-i am right , is there not some reason to fear [I]1608-i may be wrong ? ”[1608-i] [He]1608-i stopped . “ [I]89-elinor understand [you]1608-i , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor . “ [You]1608-i have something to tell [me]89-elinor of [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby , that will open [his]107-willoughby character farther . [Your]1608-i telling it will be the greatest act of friendship that can be shown [Marianne]90-marianne . _ [My]89-elinor _ gratitude will be insured immediately by any information tending to that end , and _ [hers]90-marianne _ must be gained by it in time . Pray , pray let [me]89-elinor hear it . ”[89-elinor] “ [You]3751-you shall ; and , to be brief , when [I]104-colonel brandon quitted [Barton]8-barton last October,—but this will give [you]3751-you no idea — [I]104-colonel brandon must go farther back . [You]3751-you will find [me]104-colonel brandon [a very awkward narrator]3754-a very awkward narrator , [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood ; [I]104-colonel brandon hardly know where to begin . A short account of [myself]104-colonel brandon , [I]104-colonel brandon believe , will be necessary , and it _ shall _ be a short one . On such a subject , ”[104-colonel brandon] sighing heavily , “ can [I]1609-i have little temptation to be diffuse . ”[1609-i] [He]1609-i stopt a moment for recollection , and then , with another sigh , went on . “ [You]3751-you have probably entirely forgotten a conversation—(it is not to be supposed that it could make any impression on [you)—a]3755-you)—a conversation between [us]3756-us one evening at [Barton Park]6-barton park — it was the evening of a dance — in which [I]1609-i alluded to [a lady [I]1609-i had once known]3757-a lady i had once known , as resembling , in some measure , [[your]3751-you sister]2815-your sister [Marianne]90-marianne . ”[1609-i] “ Indeed , ”[89-elinor] answered [Elinor]89-elinor , “ [I]1609-i have _ not _ forgotten it . ”[1609-i] [He]1609-i looked pleased by this remembrance , and added , “ If [I]1610-i am not deceived by the uncertainty , the partiality of tender recollection , there is a very strong resemblance between [them]3759-them , as well in mind as [person]3410-person . The same warmth of heart , the same eagerness of fancy and spirits . [This lady]3761-this lady was [one of [[my]1610-i nearest relations]3763-my nearest relations , [an orphan from [her]3761-this lady infancy]3764-an orphan from her infancy , and under the guardianship of [[my]1610-i father]2746-my father]3762-one of my nearest relations , an orphan from her infancy , and under the guardianship of my father . [Our]3766-our ages were nearly the same , and from [our]3766-our earliest years [we]3766-our were [playfellows]3767-playfellows and [friends]3231-friends . [I]1610-i can not remember the time when [I]1610-i did not love [Eliza]150-eliza ; and [my]1610-i affection for [her]150-eliza , as [we]3766-our grew up , was such , as perhaps , judging from [my]1610-i present forlorn and cheerless gravity , [you]3769-you might think [me]1610-i incapable of having ever felt . [Hers]150-eliza , for [me]1610-i , was , [I]1610-i believe , fervent as the attachment of [[your]3769-you sister]2815-your sister to [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby and it was , though from a different cause , no less unfortunate . At seventeen [she]150-eliza was lost to [me]1610-i for ever . [She]150-eliza was married — married against [her]150-eliza inclination to [[my]1610-i brother]2962-my brother . [Her]150-eliza fortune was large , and [our]3766-our family estate much encumbered . And this , [I]1610-i fear , is all that can be said for the conduct of one , who was at once [[her]150-eliza uncle]3772-her uncle and [guardian]3773-guardian . [[My]1610-i brother]2962-my brother did not deserve [her]150-eliza ; [he]2962-my brother did not even love [her]150-eliza . [I]1610-i had hoped that [her]150-eliza regard for [me]1610-i would support [her]150-eliza under any difficulty , and for some time it did ; but at last the misery of [her]150-eliza situation , for [she]150-eliza experienced great unkindness , overcame all [her]150-eliza resolution , and though [she]150-eliza had promised [me]1610-i that nothing — but how blindly [I]1610-i relate ! [I]1610-i have never told [you]3775-you how this was brought on . [We]3776-we were within a few hours of eloping together for [Scotland]44-scotland . The treachery , or the folly , of [[[my]1610-i cousin]3777-my cousin ’s maid]3778-my cousin ’s maid betrayed [us]3776-we . [I]1610-i was banished to [the house of [a relation far distant]3780-a relation far distant]3779-the house of a relation far distant , and [she]150-eliza was allowed no liberty , no society , no amusement , till [[my]1610-i father]2746-my father ’s point was gained . [I]1610-i had depended on [her]150-eliza fortitude too far , and the blow was a severe one — but had [her]150-eliza marriage been happy , so young as [I]1610-i then was , a few months must have reconciled [me]1610-i to it , or at least [I]1610-i should not have now to lament it . This however was not the case . [[My]1610-i brother]2962-my brother had no regard for [her]150-eliza ; [his]2962-my brother pleasures were not what they ought to have been , and from the first [he]2962-my brother treated [her]150-eliza unkindly . The consequence of this , upon a mind so young , so lively , so inexperienced as [Mrs. Brandon]169-mrs. brandon ’s , was but too natural . [She]150-eliza resigned [herself]150-eliza at first to all the misery of [her]150-eliza situation ; and happy had it been if [she]150-eliza had not lived to overcome those regrets which the remembrance of [me]1610-i occasioned . But can [we]3783-we wonder that , with [such a husband]3784-such a husband to provoke inconstancy , and without [a friend]1286-a friend to advise or restrain [her]150-eliza ( for [[my]1610-i father]2746-my father lived only a few months after [their]3783-we marriage , and [I]1610-i was with [[my]1610-i regiment]3787-my regiment in [the East Indies]17-the east indies ) [she]150-eliza should fall ? Had [I]1610-i remained in [England]14-england , perhaps — but [I]1610-i meant to promote the happiness of both by removing from [her]150-eliza for years , and for that purpose had procured [my]1610-i exchange . The shock which [her]150-eliza marriage had given [me]1610-i , ”[1610-i] [he]1610-i continued , in a voice of great agitation , “ was of trifling weight — was nothing to what [I]1610-i felt when [I]1610-i heard , about two years afterwards , of [her]150-eliza divorce . It was _ that _ which threw this gloom,—even now the recollection of what [I]1610-i suffered — ”[1610-i] [He]1610-i could say no more , and rising hastily walked for a few minutes about [the room]2842-the room . [Elinor]89-elinor , affected by [his]1610-i relation , and still more by [his]1610-i distress , could not speak . [He]1610-i saw [her]1610-i concern , and coming to [her]89-elinor , took [her]89-elinor hand , pressed it , and kissed it with grateful respect . A few minutes more of silent exertion enabled [him]1610-i to proceed with composure . “ It was nearly three years after this unhappy period before [I]1612-i returned to [England]14-england . [My]1612-i first care , when [I]1612-i _ did _ arrive , was of course to seek for [her]150-eliza ; but the search was as fruitless as it was melancholy . [I]1612-i could not trace [her]150-eliza beyond [[her]150-eliza first seducer]3788-her first seducer , and there was every reason to fear that [she]150-eliza had removed from [him]3788-her first seducer only to sink deeper in a life of sin . [Her]150-eliza legal allowance was not adequate to [her]150-eliza fortune , nor sufficient for [her]150-eliza comfortable maintenance , and [I]1612-i learnt from [[my]1612-i brother]2962-my brother that the power of receiving it had been made over some months before to [another person]3790-another person . [He]2962-my brother imagined , and calmly could [he]2962-my brother imagine it , that [her]150-eliza extravagance , and consequent distress , had obliged [her]150-eliza to dispose of it for some immediate relief . At last , however , and after [I]1612-i had been six months in [England]14-england , [I]1612-i _ did _ find [her]150-eliza . Regard for [a former servant of [my]1612-i own]3791-a former servant of my own , who had since fallen into misfortune , carried [me]1612-i to visit [him]3791-a former servant of my own in [a spunging - house]3792-a spunging - house , where [he]3791-a former servant of my own was confined for debt ; and there , in [the same house]3793-the same house , under a similar confinement , was [[my]1612-i unfortunate sister]3794-my unfortunate sister . So altered — so faded — worn down by acute suffering of every kind ! hardly could [I]1612-i believe the melancholy and sickly figure before [me]1612-i , to be the remains of [the lovely , blooming , healthful girl , on whom [I]1612-i had once doted]3795-the lovely , blooming , healthful girl , on whom i had once doted . What [I]1612-i endured in so beholding [her]150-eliza — but [I]1612-i have no right to wound [your]3796-your feelings by attempting to describe it — [I]1612-i have pained [you]3796-your too much already . That [she]150-eliza was , to all appearance , in the last stage of a consumption , was — yes , in such a situation it was [my]1612-i greatest comfort . Life could do nothing for [her]150-eliza , beyond giving time for a better preparation for death ; and that was given . [I]1612-i saw [her]150-eliza placed in [comfortable lodgings]3797-comfortable lodgings , and under [proper attendants]3798-proper attendants ; [I]1612-i visited [her]150-eliza every day during the rest of [her]150-eliza short life : [I]1612-i was with [her]150-eliza in [her]150-eliza last moments . ”[1612-i] Again [he]1612-i stopped to recover [himself]1612-i ; and [Elinor]89-elinor spoke [her]89-elinor feelings in an exclamation of tender concern , at the fate of [[his]1612-i unfortunate friend]1613-his unfortunate friend . “ [[Your]89-elinor sister]2815-your sister , [I]1612-i hope , can not be offended , ”[1612-i] said [he]1612-i , “ by the resemblance [I]1612-i have fancied between [her]150-eliza and [[my]1612-i poor disgraced relation]3800-my poor disgraced relation . [Their]3801-their fates , [their]3801-their fortunes , can not be the same ; and had the natural sweet disposition of the one been guarded by a firmer mind , or a happier marriage , [she]150-eliza might have been all that [you]89-elinor will live to see the other be . But to what does all this lead ? [I]1612-i seem to have been distressing [you]89-elinor for nothing . Ah ! [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood — a subject such as this — untouched for fourteen years — it is dangerous to handle it at all ! [I]1612-i _ will _ be more collected — more concise . [She]150-eliza left to [my]1612-i care [[her]150-eliza only child]3802-her only child , [a little girl]3803-a little girl , [the offspring of [her]150-eliza first guilty connection , who was then about three years old]3804-the offspring of her first guilty connection , who was then about three years old . [She]150-eliza loved [the child]1205-the child , and had always kept it with [her]150-eliza . It was a valued , a precious trust to [me]1612-i ; and gladly would [I]1612-i have discharged it in the strictest sense , by watching over [her]150-eliza education [myself]1612-i , had the nature of [our]3806-our situations allowed it ; but [I]1612-i had [no family]3807-no family , no [home]565-home ; and [[my]1612-i little Eliza]3809-my little eliza was therefore placed at [school]3326-school . [I]1612-i saw [her]150-eliza [there]354-there whenever [I]1612-i could , and after the death of [[my]1612-i brother]2962-my brother , ( which happened about five years ago , and which left to [me]1612-i the possession of [the family property]3813-the family property , ) [she]150-eliza visited [me]1612-i at [Delaford]22-delaford . [I]1612-i called [her]150-eliza [a distant relation]3814-a distant relation ; but [I]1612-i am well aware that [I]1612-i have in general been suspected of a much nearer connection with [her]150-eliza . It is now three years ago ( [she]150-eliza had just reached [her]150-eliza fourteenth year , ) that [I]1612-i removed [her]150-eliza from [school]3326-school , to place [her]150-eliza under the care of [a very respectable woman , residing in [Dorsetshire]45-dorsetshire , who had the charge of [four or five other girls of about the same time of life]3817-four or five other girls of about the same time of life]3816-a very respectable woman , residing in dorsetshire , who had the charge of four or five other girls of about the same time of life ; and for two years [I]1612-i had every reason to be pleased with [her]150-eliza situation . But last February , almost a twelvemonth back , [she]150-eliza suddenly disappeared . [I]1612-i had allowed [her]150-eliza , ( imprudently , as it has since turned out , ) at [her]150-eliza earnest desire , to go to [Bath]46-bath with [one of [[her]150-eliza young friends]3819-her young friends , who was attending [[her]150-eliza father]3820-her father [there]354-there for [his]3820-her father health]3818-one of her young friends , who was attending her father there for his health . [I]1612-i knew [him]3820-her father to be [a very good sort of man]3822-a very good sort of man , and [I]1612-i thought well of [[his]3820-her father daughter]3823-his daughter — better than [she]150-eliza deserved , for , with a most obstinate and ill - judged secrecy , [she]150-eliza would tell nothing , would give no clue , though [she]150-eliza certainly knew all . [He]3820-her father , [[her]150-eliza father]3820-her father , [a well - meaning , but not a quick - sighted man]3825-a well - meaning , but not a quick - sighted man , could really , [I]1612-i believe , give no information ; for [he]3820-her father had been generally confined to [the house]318-the house , while [the girls]2794-the girls were ranging over [the town]1334-the town and making what acquaintance [they]2794-the girls chose ; and [he]3820-her father tried to convince [me]1612-i , as thoroughly as [he]3820-her father was convinced [himself]3820-her father , of [[his]3820-her father daughter]3823-his daughter ’s being entirely unconcerned in the business . In short , [I]1612-i could learn nothing but that [she]150-eliza was gone ; all the rest , for eight long months , was left to conjecture . What [I]1612-i thought , what [I]1612-i feared , may be imagined ; and what [I]1612-i suffered too . ”[1612-i] “ Good heavens ! ”[89-elinor] cried [Elinor]89-elinor , “ could it be — could [Willoughby]107-willoughby ! ”[89-elinor] — “ The first news that reached [me]1614-i of [her]150-eliza , ”[1614-i] [he]1614-i continued , “ came in a letter from [herself]150-eliza , last October . It was forwarded to [me]1614-i from [Delaford]22-delaford , and [I]1614-i received it on the very morning of [our]3830-our intended party to [Whitwell]18-whitwell ; and this was the reason of [my]1614-i leaving [Barton]6-barton park so suddenly , which [I]1614-i am sure must at the time have appeared strange to every body , and which [I]1614-i believe gave offence to some . Little did [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby imagine , [I]1614-i suppose , when [his]107-willoughby looks censured [me]1614-i for incivility in breaking up the party , that [I]1614-i was called away to the relief of one whom [he]107-willoughby had made poor and miserable ; but _ had _ [he]107-willoughby known it , what would it have availed ? Would [he]107-willoughby have been less gay or less happy in the smiles of [[your]3831-you sister]2815-your sister ? No , [he]107-willoughby had already done that , which [no man who _ can _ feel for [another]3834-another]3833-no man who _ can _ feel for another would do . [He]107-willoughby had left [the girl whose youth and innocence [he]107-willoughby had seduced , in a situation of the utmost distress , with no creditable home , no help , [no friends]1541-no friends , ignorant of [his]107-willoughby address]3835-the girl whose youth and innocence he had seduced , in a situation of the utmost distress , with no creditable home , no help , no friends , ignorant of his address ! [He]107-willoughby had left [her]2815-your sister , promising to return ; [he]107-willoughby neither returned , nor wrote , nor relieved [her]2815-your sister . ”[1614-i] “ This is beyond every thing ! ”[89-elinor] exclaimed [Elinor]89-elinor . “ [His]107-willoughby character is now before [you]3831-you ; expensive , dissipated , and worse than both . Knowing all this , as [I]89-elinor have now known it many weeks , guess what [I]89-elinor must have felt on seeing [[your]3831-you sister]2815-your sister as fond of [him]107-willoughby as ever , and on being assured that [she]2815-your sister was to marry [him]107-willoughby : guess what [I]89-elinor must have felt for all [your]3831-you sakes .
