When [I]89-elinor came to [you]3831-you last week and found [you]3831-you alone , [I]89-elinor came determined to know the truth ; though irresolute what to do when it _ was _ known . [My]89-elinor behaviour must have seemed strange to [you]3831-you then ; but now [you]3831-you will comprehend it . To suffer [you]3831-you all to be so deceived ; to see [[your]3831-you sister]2815-your sister — but what could [I]89-elinor do ? [I]89-elinor had no hope of interfering with success ; and sometimes [I]89-elinor thought [[your]3831-you sister]2815-your sister ’s influence might yet reclaim [him]107-willoughby . But now , after such dishonorable usage , who can tell what were [his]107-willoughby designs on [her]2815-your sister . Whatever they may have been , however , [she]2815-your sister may now , and hereafter doubtless _ will _ turn with gratitude towards [her]2815-your sister own condition , when [she]2815-your sister compares it with that of [[my]89-elinor poor Eliza]3840-my poor eliza , when [she]2815-your sister considers the wretched and hopeless situation of [this poor girl]3841-this poor girl , and pictures [her]2815-your sister to [herself]2815-your sister , with an affection for [him]107-willoughby so strong , still as strong as [her]2815-your sister own , and with a mind tormented by self - reproach , which must attend [her]2815-your sister through life . Surely this comparison must have its use with [her]2815-your sister . [She]2815-your sister will feel [her]2815-your sister own sufferings to be nothing . [They]3842-they proceed from no misconduct , and can bring no disgrace . On the contrary , [every friend]3843-every friend must be made still more [[her]2815-your sister friend]1021-her friend by [them]3842-they . Concern for [her]2815-your sister unhappiness , and respect for [her]2815-your sister fortitude under it , must strengthen every attachment . Use [your]3845-you own discretion , however , in communicating to [her]2815-your sister what [I]89-elinor have told [you]3845-you . [You]3845-you must know best what will be its effect ; but had [I]89-elinor not seriously , and from [my]89-elinor heart believed it might be of service , might lessen [her]2815-your sister regrets , [I]89-elinor would not have suffered [myself]89-elinor to trouble [you]3845-you with this account of [[my]89-elinor family]3220-my family afflictions , with a recital which may seem to have been intended to raise [myself]89-elinor at the expense of [others]2961-others . ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor ’s thanks followed this speech with grateful earnestness ; attended too with the assurance of [her]89-elinor expecting material advantage to [Marianne]90-marianne , from the communication of what had passed . “ [I]89-elinor have been more pained , ”[89-elinor] said [she]89-elinor , “ by [her]2815-your sister endeavors to acquit [him]3848-him than by all the rest ; for it irritates [her]2815-your sister mind more than the most perfect conviction of [his]3848-him unworthiness can do . Now , though at first [she]2815-your sister will suffer much , [I]89-elinor am sure [she]2815-your sister will soon become easier . Have [you]1615-you , ”[89-elinor] [she]89-elinor continued , after a short silence , “ ever seen [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby since [you]1615-you left [him]3848-him at [Barton]8-barton ? ”[89-elinor] “ Yes , ”[1615-you] [he]1615-you replied gravely , “ once [I]1615-you have . One meeting was unavoidable . ”[1615-you] [Elinor]89-elinor , startled by [his]1615-you manner , looked at [him]1615-you anxiously , saying , “ What ? have [you]1615-you met [him]3848-him to — ”[89-elinor] “ [I]89-elinor could meet [him]3848-him no other way . [Eliza]150-eliza had confessed to [me]89-elinor , though most reluctantly , the name of [[her]150-eliza lover]3849-her lover ; and when [he]3848-him returned to [town]2984-town , which was within a fortnight after [myself]89-elinor , [we]3851-we met by appointment , [he]3848-him to defend , [I]89-elinor to punish [his]3848-him conduct . [We]3851-we returned unwounded , and the meeting , therefore , never got abroad . ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor sighed over the fancied necessity of this ; but to [a man]499-a man and [a soldier]1617-a soldier [she]89-elinor presumed not to censure it . “ Such , ”[104-colonel brandon] said [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon , after a pause , “ has been the unhappy resemblance between the fate of [mother]2803-mother and [daughter]3240-daughter ! and so imperfectly have [I]104-colonel brandon discharged [my]104-colonel brandon trust ! ”[104-colonel brandon] “ Is [she]150-eliza still in [town]2984-town ? ”[104-colonel brandon] “ No ; as soon as [she]150-eliza recovered from [her]150-eliza lying - in , for [I]104-colonel brandon found [her]150-eliza near [her]150-eliza delivery , [I]104-colonel brandon removed [her]150-eliza and [[her]150-eliza child]277-her child into [the country]612-the country , and there [she]150-eliza remains . ”[104-colonel brandon] Recollecting , soon afterwards , that [he]104-colonel brandon was probably dividing [Elinor]89-elinor from [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister , [he]104-colonel brandon put an end to [his]104-colonel brandon visit , receiving from [her]89-elinor again the same grateful acknowledgments , and leaving [her]89-elinor full of compassion and esteem for [him]104-colonel brandon . CHAPTER XXXII . When the particulars of this conversation were repeated by [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood to [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister , as they very soon were , the effect on [her]89-elinor was not entirely such as [the former]392-the former had hoped to see . Not that [Marianne]90-marianne appeared to distrust the truth of any part of it , for [she]90-marianne listened to it all with the most steady and submissive attention , made neither objection nor remark , attempted no vindication of [Willoughby]107-willoughby , and seemed to show by [her]90-marianne tears that [she]90-marianne felt it to be impossible . But though this behaviour assured [Elinor]89-elinor that the conviction of this guilt _ was _ carried [home]565-home to [her]89-elinor mind , though [she]89-elinor saw with satisfaction the effect of it , in [her]89-elinor no longer avoiding [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon when [he]104-colonel brandon called , in [her]89-elinor speaking to [him]104-colonel brandon , even voluntarily speaking , with a kind of compassionate respect , and though [she]89-elinor saw [her]89-elinor spirits less violently irritated than before , [she]89-elinor did not see [her]89-elinor less wretched . [Her]89-elinor mind did become settled , but it was settled in a gloomy dejection . [She]89-elinor felt the loss of [Willoughby]107-willoughby ’s character yet more heavily than [she]89-elinor had felt the loss of [his]107-willoughby heart ; [his]107-willoughby seduction and desertion of [Miss Williams]118-miss williams , the misery of [that poor girl]1622-that poor girl , and the doubt of what [his]107-willoughby designs might _ once _ have been on [herself]89-elinor , preyed altogether so much on [her]89-elinor spirits , that [she]89-elinor could not bring [herself]89-elinor to speak of what [she]89-elinor felt even to [Elinor]89-elinor ; and , brooding over [her]89-elinor sorrows in silence , gave more pain to [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister than could have been communicated by the most open and most frequent confession of [them]1624-them . To give the feelings or the language of [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood on receiving and answering [Elinor]89-elinor ’s letter would be only to give a repetition of what [[her]89-elinor daughters]294-her daughters had already felt and said ; of a disappointment hardly less painful than [Marianne]90-marianne ’s , and an indignation even greater than [Elinor]89-elinor ’s . Long letters from [her]89-elinor , quickly succeeding each other , arrived to tell all that [she]89-elinor suffered and thought ; to express [her]89-elinor anxious solicitude for [Marianne]90-marianne , and entreat [she]89-elinor would bear up with fortitude under this misfortune . Bad indeed must the nature of [Marianne]90-marianne ’s affliction be , when [[her]90-marianne mother]332-her mother could talk of fortitude ! mortifying and humiliating must be the origin of those regrets , which _ [she]332-her mother _ could wish [her]332-her mother not to indulge ! Against the interest of [her]89-elinor own individual comfort , [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood had determined that it would be better for [Marianne]90-marianne to be any where , at that time , than at [Barton]8-barton , where every thing within [her]89-elinor view would be bringing back the past in the strongest and most afflicting manner , by constantly placing [Willoughby]107-willoughby before [her]89-elinor , such as [she]89-elinor had always seen [him]107-willoughby [there]354-there . [She]88-mrs. dashwood recommended it to [[her]88-mrs. dashwood daughters]294-her daughters , therefore , by all means not to shorten [their]294-her daughters visit to [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ; the length of which , though never exactly fixed , had been expected by all to comprise at least five or six weeks . A variety of occupations , of objects , and of company , which could not be procured at [Barton]8-barton , would be inevitable there , and might yet , [she]88-mrs. dashwood hoped , cheat [Marianne]90-marianne , at times , into some interest beyond [herself]89-elinor , and even into some amusement , much as the ideas of both might now be spurned by [her]89-elinor . From all danger of seeing [Willoughby]107-willoughby again , [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother considered [her]89-elinor to be at least equally safe in [town]2984-town as in [the country]612-the country , since [his]107-willoughby acquaintance must now be dropped by [all who called [themselves]1632-all who called themselves her friends [[her]332-her mother friends]1633-her friends]1632-all who called themselves her friends . [Design]170-design could never bring [them]1632-all who called themselves her friends in [each other]338-each other ’s way : negligence could never leave [them]1632-all who called themselves her friends exposed to a surprise ; and chance had less in its favour in [the crowd of [London]24-london]1635-the crowd of london than even in [the retirement of [Barton]8-barton]1636-the retirement of barton , where it might force [him]107-willoughby before [her]332-her mother while paying that visit at [Allenham]12-allenham on [his]107-willoughby marriage , which [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood , from foreseeing at first as a probable event , had brought [herself]88-mrs. dashwood to expect as a certain one . [She]88-mrs. dashwood had yet another reason for wishing [[her]88-mrs. dashwood children]495-her children to remain where [they]495-her children were ; a letter from [[her]88-mrs. dashwood son - in - law]477-her son - in - law had told [her]88-mrs. dashwood that [he]107-willoughby and [[his]107-willoughby wife]280-his wife were to be in [town]2984-town before the middle of February , and [she]88-mrs. dashwood judged it right that [they]495-her children should sometimes see [[their]495-her children brother]329-their brother . [Marianne]90-marianne had promised to be guided by [[her]90-marianne mother]332-her mother ’s opinion , and [she]90-marianne submitted to it therefore without opposition , though it proved perfectly different from what [she]90-marianne wished and expected , though [she]90-marianne felt it to be entirely wrong , formed on mistaken grounds , and that by requiring [her]90-marianne longer continuance in [London]24-london it deprived [her]90-marianne of the only possible alleviation of [her]90-marianne wretchedness , the personal sympathy of [[her]90-marianne mother]332-her mother , and doomed [her]90-marianne to such society and such scenes as must prevent [her]90-marianne ever knowing a moment ’s rest . But it was a matter of great consolation to [her]90-marianne , that what brought evil to [herself]90-marianne would bring good to [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister ; and [Elinor]89-elinor , on the other hand , suspecting that it would not be in [her]89-elinor power to avoid [Edward]98-edward entirely , comforted [herself]89-elinor by thinking , that though [their]1645-they longer stay would therefore militate against [her]89-elinor own happiness , it would be better for [Marianne]90-marianne than an immediate return into [Devonshire]5-devonshire . [Her]89-elinor carefulness in guarding [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister from ever hearing [Willoughby]107-willoughby ’s name mentioned , was not thrown away . [Marianne]90-marianne , though without knowing it [herself]90-marianne , reaped all its advantage ; for neither [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , nor [Sir John]99-sir john , nor even [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer [herself]128-mrs. palmer , ever spoke of [him]99-sir john before [her]90-marianne . [Elinor]89-elinor wished that the same forbearance could have extended towards [herself]89-elinor , but that was impossible , and [she]89-elinor was obliged to listen day after day to the indignation of [them]1645-they all . [Sir John]99-sir john , could not have thought it possible . “ [A man of whom [he]99-sir john had always had such reason to think well]3857-a man of whom he had always had such reason to think well ! [Such a good - natured fellow]3858-such a good - natured fellow ! [He]99-sir john did not believe there was [a bolder rider]3859-a bolder rider in [England]14-england ! It was an unaccountable business . [He]99-sir john wished [him]99-sir john at the devil with all [his]99-sir john heart . [He]99-sir john would not speak another word to [him]99-sir john , meet [him]99-sir john where [he]99-sir john might , for all [the world]2778-the world ! No , not if it were to be by the side of [Barton covert]6-barton park , and [they]1645-they were kept watching for two hours together . [Such a scoundrel of a fellow]3861-such a scoundrel of a fellow ! such a deceitful dog ! It was only the last time [they]1645-they met that [he]99-sir john had offered [him]99-sir john one of [Folly]171-folly ’s puppies ! and this was the end of it ! ”[128-mrs. palmer] [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer , in [her]128-mrs. palmer way , was equally angry . “ [She]128-mrs. palmer was determined to drop [his]99-sir john acquaintance immediately , and [she]128-mrs. palmer was very thankful that [she]128-mrs. palmer had never been acquainted with [him]99-sir john at all . [She]128-mrs. palmer wished with all [her]128-mrs. palmer heart [Combe Magna]135-combe was not so near [Cleveland]32-cleveland ; but it did not signify , for it was a great deal too far off to visit ; [she]128-mrs. palmer hated [him]99-sir john so much that [she]128-mrs. palmer was resolved never to mention [his]99-sir john name again , and [she]128-mrs. palmer should tell [everybody]3862-everybody [she]128-mrs. palmer saw , how good - for - nothing [he]99-sir john was . ”[128-mrs. palmer] The rest of [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer ’s sympathy was shown in procuring all the particulars in [her]128-mrs. palmer power of the approaching marriage , and communicating them to [Elinor]89-elinor . [She]128-mrs. palmer could soon tell at what [[coachmaker]1647-coachmaker ’s [the new carriage]1649-the new carriage]1648-coachmaker ’s the new carriage was building , by what [painter Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby ’s portrait was drawn , and at what warehouse [Miss Grey]162-miss grey ’s clothes might be seen . The calm and polite unconcern of [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton on the occasion was a happy relief to [Elinor]89-elinor ’s spirits , oppressed as [they]1650-they often were by the clamorous kindness of [the others]539-the others . It was a great comfort to [her]100-lady middleton to be sure of exciting no interest in [_ one _ person]1652-_ one _ person at least among [[their]1653-their circle of [friends]3231-friends]1654-their circle of friends : a great comfort to know that there was _ one _ who would meet [her]100-lady middleton without feeling any curiosity after particulars , or any anxiety for [[her]100-lady middleton sister]336-her sister ’s health . Every qualification is raised at times , by the circumstances of the moment , to more than its real value ; and [she]100-lady middleton was sometimes worried down by officious condolence to rate good - breeding as more indispensable to comfort than good - nature . [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton expressed [her]100-lady middleton sense of the affair about once every day , or twice , if the subject occurred very often , by saying , “ It is very shocking , indeed ! ”[100-lady middleton] and by the means of [this continual though gentle vent]1657-this continual though gentle vent , was able not only to see [the Miss Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods from the first without the smallest emotion , but very soon to see [them]1653-their without recollecting a word of the matter ; and having thus supported the dignity of [her]100-lady middleton own sex , and spoken [her]100-lady middleton decided censure of what was wrong in the other , [she]100-lady middleton thought [herself]100-lady middleton at liberty to attend to the interest of [[her]100-lady middleton own assemblies]1658-her own assemblies , and therefore determined ( though rather against the opinion of [Sir John]99-sir john ) that as [Mrs. Willoughby]173-mrs. willoughby would at once be [a woman of elegance and fortune]1659-a woman of elegance and fortune , to leave [her]173-mrs. willoughby card with [her]173-mrs. willoughby as soon as [she]173-mrs. willoughby married . [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon ’s delicate , unobtrusive enquiries were never unwelcome to [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood . [He]104-colonel brandon had abundantly earned the privilege of intimate discussion of [[her]84-miss dashwood sister]336-her sister ’s disappointment , by the friendly zeal with which [he]104-colonel brandon had endeavoured to soften it , and [they]1661-they always conversed with confidence . [His]104-colonel brandon chief reward for the painful exertion of disclosing past sorrows and present humiliations , was given in the pitying eye with which [Marianne]90-marianne sometimes observed [him]104-colonel brandon , and the gentleness of [her]90-marianne voice whenever ( though it did not often happen ) [she]90-marianne was obliged , or could oblige [herself]90-marianne to speak to [him]104-colonel brandon . _ [These _]174-these _ assured [him]104-colonel brandon that [his]104-colonel brandon exertion had produced an increase of good - will towards [himself]104-colonel brandon , and _ these _ gave [Elinor]89-elinor hopes of its being farther augmented hereafter ; but [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , who knew nothing of all this , who knew only that [the Colonel]664-the colonel continued as grave as ever , and that [she]103-mrs. jennings could neither prevail on [him]104-colonel brandon to make the offer [himself]104-colonel brandon , nor commission [her]103-mrs. jennings to make it for [him]104-colonel brandon , began , at the end of two days , to think that , instead of Midsummer , [they]1661-they would not be married till Michaelmas , and by the end of a week that it would not be a match at all . The good understanding between [the Colonel]664-the colonel and [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood seemed rather to declare that the honours of the mulberry - tree , [the canal]1664-the canal , and [the yew arbour]1665-the yew arbour , would all be made over to _ [her]103-mrs. jennings ; _ and [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings had , for some time ceased to think at all of [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward . Early in February , within a fortnight from the receipt of [Willoughby]107-willoughby ’s letter , [Elinor]89-elinor had the painful office of informing [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister that [he]107-willoughby was married . [She]89-elinor had taken care to have the intelligence conveyed to [herself]89-elinor , as soon as it was known that the ceremony was over , as [she]89-elinor was desirous that [Marianne]90-marianne should not receive the first notice of it from the public papers , which [she]89-elinor saw [her]89-elinor eagerly examining every morning . [She]89-elinor received the news with resolute composure ; made no observation on it , and at first shed no tears ; but after a short time [they]1667-they would burst out , and for the rest of the day , [she]89-elinor was in a state hardly less pitiable than when [she]89-elinor first learnt to expect the event . [The Willoughbys]175-the willoughbys left [town]2984-town as soon as [they]175-the willoughbys were married ; and [Elinor]89-elinor now hoped , as there could be no danger of [her]89-elinor seeing [either of [them]175-the willoughbys]1669-either of them , to prevail on [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister , who had never yet left [the house]318-the house since the blow first fell , to go out again by degrees as [she]336-her sister had done before . About this time the two [Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles , lately arrived at [[[their]175-the willoughbys cousin]1672-their cousin ’s house]1673-their cousin ’s house in [Bartlett ’s Buildings]48-bartlett ’s buildings , [Holburn]49-holburn , presented [themselves]175-the willoughbys again before [[their]175-the willoughbys more grand relations]1674-their more grand relations in Conduit and [Berkeley Streets]50-berkeley streets ; and were welcomed by [them]175-the willoughbys all with great cordiality . [Elinor]89-elinor only was sorry to see [them]175-the willoughbys . [Their]175-the willoughbys presence always gave [her]89-elinor pain , and [she]89-elinor hardly knew how to make a very gracious return to the overpowering delight of [Lucy]138-lucy in finding [her]138-lucy _ still _ in [town]2984-town . “ [I]89-elinor should have been quite disappointed if [I]89-elinor had not found [you]138-lucy here _ still _ , ”[89-elinor] said [she]89-elinor repeatedly , with a strong emphasis on the word . “ But [I]89-elinor always thought [I]89-elinor _ should _ . [I]89-elinor was almost sure [you]138-lucy would not leave [London]24-london yet awhile ; though [you]138-lucy _ told _ [me]89-elinor , [you]138-lucy know , at [Barton]8-barton , that [you]138-lucy should not stay above a _ month _ . But [I]89-elinor thought , at the time , that [you]138-lucy would most likely change [your]138-lucy mind when it came to the point . It would have been such a great pity to have went away before [[your]138-lucy brother]3364-your brother and [sister]438-sister came . And now to be sure [you]138-lucy will be in no _ hurry _ to be gone . [I]89-elinor am amazingly glad [you]138-lucy did not keep to _ [your]138-lucy word _ . ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor perfectly understood [her]89-elinor , and was forced to use all [her]89-elinor self - command to make it appear that [she]89-elinor did _ not _ . “ Well , [[my]103-mrs. jennings dear]2750-my dear , ”[103-mrs. jennings] said [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , “ and how did [you]138-lucy travel ? ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ Not in the stage , [I]138-lucy assure [you]138-lucy , ”[138-lucy] replied [Miss Steele]138-lucy , with quick exultation ; “ [we]3866-we came post all the way , and had [a very smart beau]1240-a very smart beau to attend [us]3866-we . [Dr. Davies]176-dr. davies was coming to [town]2984-town , and so [we]3866-we thought [we]3866-we ’d join [him]176-dr. davies in a post - chaise ; and [he]176-dr. davies behaved very genteelly , and paid ten or twelve shillings more than [we]3866-we did . ”[138-lucy] “ Oh , oh ! ”[103-mrs. jennings] cried [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ; “ very pretty , indeed ! and [the Doctor]3869-the doctor is [a single man]249-a single man , [I]103-mrs. jennings warrant [you]138-lucy . ”[103-mrs. jennings] “ There now , ”[138-lucy] said [Miss Steele]138-lucy , affectedly simpering , “ [everybody]3862-everybody laughs at [me]138-lucy so about [the Doctor]3869-the doctor , and [I]138-lucy can not think why . [[My]138-lucy cousins]3333-my cousins say [they]3333-my cousins are sure [I]138-lucy have made a conquest ; but for [my]138-lucy part [I]138-lucy declare [I]138-lucy never think about [him]176-dr. davies from one hour ’s end to another . ‘ [Lord]3874-lord ! here comes [[your]138-lucy beau]3875-your beau , [Nancy]143-nancy , ’ [[my]138-lucy cousin]3777-my cousin said t’other day , when [she]3777-my cousin saw [him]3875-your beau crossing [the street]3565-the street to [the house]318-the house . [[My]138-lucy beau]3879-my beau , indeed ! said [I]138-lucy — [I]138-lucy can not think who [you]138-lucy mean . [The Doctor]3869-the doctor is [no beau of [mine]138-lucy]3881-no beau of mine . ”[138-lucy] “ Aye , aye , that is very pretty talking — but it wo n’t do — [the Doctor]3869-the doctor is [the man]502-the man , [I]1677-her cousin see . ”[1677-her cousin] “ No , indeed ! ”[1677-her cousin] replied [[her]1676-you cousin]1677-her cousin , with affected earnestness , “ and [I]1677-her cousin beg [you]1676-you will contradict it , if [you]1676-you ever hear it talked of . ”[1677-her cousin] [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings directly gave [her]1676-you the gratifying assurance that [she]1676-you certainly would _ not _ , and [Miss Steele]138-lucy was made completely happy . “ [I]138-lucy suppose [you]1676-you will go and stay with [[your]1676-you brother]3364-your brother and sister , [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood , when [they]3885-they come to [town]2984-town , ”[138-lucy] said [Lucy]138-lucy , returning , after a cessation of hostile hints , to the charge . “ No , [I]138-lucy do not think [we]3887-we shall . ”[138-lucy] “ Oh , yes , [I]89-elinor dare say [you]1676-you will . ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor would not humour [her]138-lucy by farther opposition . “ What a charming thing it is that [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood can spare [you]1676-you both for so long a time together ! ”[89-elinor] “ Long a time , indeed ! ”[103-mrs. jennings] interposed [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings . “ Why , [their]3885-they visit is but just begun ! ”[138-lucy] [Lucy]138-lucy was silenced . “ [I]138-lucy am sorry [we]3887-we can not see [[your]1676-you sister]2815-your sister , [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood , ”[138-lucy] said [Miss Steele]138-lucy . “ [I]138-lucy am sorry [she]2815-your sister is not well — ”[138-lucy] for [Marianne]90-marianne had left [the room]2842-the room on [their]1679-their arrival . “ [You]1676-you are very good . [[My]90-marianne sister]2818-my sister will be equally sorry to miss the pleasure of seeing [you]1676-you ; but [she]2815-your sister has been very much plagued lately with nervous head - aches , which make [her]2815-your sister unfit for company or conversation . ”[90-marianne] “ Oh , dear , that is a great pity ! but [such old friends as [Lucy]138-lucy and me!—I]3890-such old friends as lucy and me!—i think [she]2815-your sister might see _ [us]1679-their ; _ and [I]89-elinor am sure [we]1679-their would not speak a word . ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor , with great civility , declined the proposal . [[Her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister was perhaps laid down upon the bed , or in [her]336-her sister dressing gown , and therefore not able to come to [them]1679-their . “ Oh , if that ’s all , ”[138-lucy] cried [Miss Steele]138-lucy , “ [we]1679-their can just as well go and see _ [her]336-her sister _ . ”[138-lucy] [Elinor]89-elinor began to find this impertinence too much for [her]89-elinor temper ; but [she]89-elinor was saved the trouble of checking it , by [Lucy]138-lucy ’s sharp reprimand , which now , as on many occasions , though it did not give much sweetness to the manners of [one sister]1681-one sister , was of advantage in governing those of the other . CHAPTER XXXIII . After some opposition , [Marianne]90-marianne yielded to [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister ’s entreaties , and consented to go out with [her]90-marianne and [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings one morning for half an hour . [She]90-marianne expressly conditioned , however , for paying no visits , and would do no more than accompany [them]1679-their to [[Gray]177-gray ’s ’s in [Sackville Street]51-sackville street]1683-gray ’s in sackville street , where [Elinor]89-elinor was carrying on a negotiation for the exchange of a few old - fashioned jewels of [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother . When [they]1679-their stopped at the door , [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings recollected that there was [a lady at the other end of [the street]3565-the street on whom [she]103-mrs. jennings ought to call]1685-a lady at the other end of the street on whom she ought to call ; and as [she]103-mrs. jennings had no business at [Gray ’s]177-gray ’s , it was resolved , that while [[her]103-mrs. jennings young friends]3819-her young friends transacted [their]3819-her young friends ’s , [she]103-mrs. jennings should pay [her]103-mrs. jennings visit and return for [them]3819-her young friends . On ascending the stairs , [the Miss Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods found so many people before [them]1679-their in [the room]2842-the room , that there was [not a person at liberty]1689-not a person at liberty to tend to [their]1679-their orders ; and [they]1679-their were obliged to wait . All that could be done was , to sit down at that end of the counter which seemed to promise the quickest succession ; [one gentleman]1690-one gentleman only was standing there , and it is probable that [Elinor]89-elinor was not without hope of exciting [his]1690-one gentleman politeness to a quicker despatch . But the correctness of [his]1690-one gentleman eye , and the delicacy of [his]1690-one gentleman taste , proved to be beyond [his]1690-one gentleman politeness . [He]1690-one gentleman was giving orders for a toothpick - case for [himself]1690-one gentleman , and till its size , shape , and ornaments were determined , all of which , after examining and debating for a quarter of an hour over every toothpick - case in [the shop]3742-the shop , were finally arranged by [his]1690-one gentleman own inventive fancy , [he]1690-one gentleman had no leisure to bestow any other attention on [the two ladies]393-the two ladies , than what was comprised in three or four very broad stares ; a kind of notice which served to imprint on [Elinor]89-elinor the remembrance of [a person]1351-a person and face , of strong , natural , sterling insignificance , though adorned in the first style of fashion . [Marianne]90-marianne was spared from the troublesome feelings of contempt and resentment , on this impertinent examination of [their]1679-their features , and on the puppyism of [his]1690-one gentleman manner in deciding on all the different horrors of the different toothpick - cases presented to [his]1690-one gentleman inspection , by remaining unconscious of it all ; for [she]90-marianne was as well able to collect [her]90-marianne thoughts within [herself]90-marianne , and be as ignorant of what was passing around [her]90-marianne , in [[Mr. Gray]177-gray ’s ’s shop]1694-mr. gray ’s shop , as in [[her]90-marianne own bedroom]1695-her own bedroom . At last the affair was decided . The ivory , the gold , and the pearls , all received [their]1679-their appointment , and [the gentleman]722-the gentleman having named the last day on which [his]722-the gentleman existence could be continued without the possession of the toothpick - case , drew on [his]722-the gentleman gloves with leisurely care , and bestowing another glance on [the Miss Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods , but such a one as seemed rather to demand than express admiration , walked off with a happy air of real conceit and affected indifference . [Elinor]89-elinor lost no time in bringing [her]89-elinor business forward , was on the point of concluding it , when [another gentleman]1697-another gentleman presented [himself]1697-another gentleman at [her]89-elinor side . [She]89-elinor turned [her]89-elinor eyes towards [his]1697-another gentleman face , and found [him]1697-another gentleman with some surprise to be [[her]89-elinor brother]339-her brother . [Their]1699-we affection and pleasure in meeting was just enough to make a very creditable appearance in [[Mr. Gray]177-gray ’s ’s shop]1694-mr. gray ’s shop . [John Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood was really far from being sorry to see [[his]1697-another gentleman sisters]272-his sisters again ; it rather gave [them]272-his sisters satisfaction ; and [his]1697-another gentleman inquiries after [[their]272-his sisters mother]274-their mother were respectful and attentive . [Elinor]89-elinor found that [he]1697-another gentleman and [Fanny]93-fanny had been in [town]2984-town two days . “ [I]1697-another gentleman wished very much to call upon [you]89-elinor yesterday , ”[1697-another gentleman] said [he]1697-another gentleman , “ but it was impossible , for [we]1699-we were obliged to take [Harry]85-mr. dashwood to see the wild beasts at [Exeter Exchange]53-exeter exchange ; and [we]1699-we spent the rest of the day with [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward . [Harry]85-mr. dashwood was vastly pleased . _ This _ morning [I]1697-another gentleman had fully intended to call on [you]89-elinor , if [I]1697-another gentleman could possibly find a spare half hour , but one has always so much to do on first coming to [town]2984-town . [I]1697-another gentleman am come here to bespeak [Fanny]93-fanny a seal . But tomorrow [I]1697-another gentleman think [I]1697-another gentleman shall certainly be able to call in [Berkeley Street]40-berkeley street , and be introduced to [[your]89-elinor friend]3537-your friend [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings . [I]1697-another gentleman understand [she]103-mrs. jennings is [a woman of very good fortune]3893-a woman of very good fortune . And [the Middletons]102-the middletons too , [you]89-elinor must introduce [me]1697-another gentleman to _ [them]3894-they _ . As [[my]1697-another gentleman mother - in - law]3895-my mother - in - law ’s relations , [I]1697-another gentleman shall be happy to show [them]3894-they every respect . [They]3894-they are [excellent neighbours to [you]89-elinor in [the country]612-the country]3896-excellent neighbours to you in the country , [I]1697-another gentleman understand . ”[1697-another gentleman] “ Excellent indeed . [Their]3894-they attention to [our]3898-us comfort , [their]3894-they friendliness in every particular , is more than [I]89-elinor can express . ”[89-elinor] “ [I]89-elinor am extremely glad to hear it , upon [my]89-elinor word ; extremely glad indeed . But so it ought to be ; [they]3894-they are [people of large fortune]3899-people of large fortune , [they]3894-they are related to [you]89-elinor , and every civility and accommodation that can serve to make [your]89-elinor situation pleasant might be reasonably expected . And so [you]89-elinor are most comfortably settled in [[your]89-elinor little cottage]3900-your little cottage and want for nothing ! [Edward]98-edward brought [us]3898-us a most charming account of [the place]464-the place : the most complete thing of its kind , [he]339-her brother said , that ever was , and [you]3898-us all seemed to enjoy it beyond any thing . It was a great satisfaction to [us]3898-us to hear it , [I]89-elinor assure [you]3898-us . ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor did feel a little ashamed of [[her]89-elinor brother]339-her brother ; and was not sorry to be spared the necessity of answering [him]339-her brother , by the arrival of [[Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s servant]1705-mrs. jennings ’s servant , who came to tell [her]89-elinor that [[his]339-her brother mistress]1706-his mistress waited for [them]1707-them at the door . [Mr. Dashwood]85-mr. dashwood attended [them]1707-them down [stairs]933-stairs , was introduced to [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings at the door of [[her]103-mrs. jennings carriage]1709-her carriage , and repeating [his]339-her brother hope of being able to call on [them]1707-them the next day , took leave . [His]339-her brother visit was duly paid . [He]339-her brother came with a pretence at an apology from [[their]1707-them sister - in - law]1710-their sister - in - law , for not coming too ; “ but [she]1710-their sister - in - law was so much engaged with [[her]1710-their sister - in - law mother]332-her mother , that really [she]1710-their sister - in - law had no leisure for going any where . ”[339-her brother] [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , however , assured [him]339-her brother directly , that [she]103-mrs. jennings should not stand upon ceremony , for [they]1707-them were [all cousins]1167-all cousins , or something like it , and [she]103-mrs. jennings should certainly wait on [Mrs. John Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood very soon , and bring [[her]103-mrs. jennings sisters]334-her sisters to see [her]103-mrs. jennings . [His]339-her brother manners to _ [them]1707-them _ , though calm , were perfectly kind ; to [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , most attentively civil ; and on [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon ’s coming in soon after [himself]339-her brother , [he]339-her brother eyed [him]104-colonel brandon with a curiosity which seemed to say , that [he]339-her brother only wanted to know [him]104-colonel brandon to be rich , to be equally civil to _ [him]104-colonel brandon _ . After staying with [them]1707-them half an hour , [he]339-her brother asked [Elinor]89-elinor to walk with [him]339-her brother to [Conduit Street]41-conduit street , and introduce [him]339-her brother to [Sir John]99-sir john and [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton . The weather was remarkably fine , and [she]89-elinor readily consented . As soon as [they]1707-them were out of [the house]318-the house , [his]339-her brother enquiries began . “ Who is [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon ? Is [he]104-colonel brandon [a man of fortune]3903-a man of fortune ? ”[339-her brother] “ Yes ; [he]104-colonel brandon has very good property in [Dorsetshire]45-dorsetshire . ”[339-her brother] “ [I]1714-i am glad of it . [He]104-colonel brandon seems [a most gentlemanlike man]3904-a most gentlemanlike man ; and [I]1714-i think , [Elinor]89-elinor , [I]1714-i may congratulate [you]89-elinor on the prospect of a very respectable establishment in life . ”[1714-i] “ [Me]1714-i , [brother]3905-brother ! what do [you]1714-i mean ? ”[1714-i] “ [He]104-colonel brandon likes [you]89-elinor . [I]1714-i observed [him]104-colonel brandon narrowly , and am convinced of it . What is the amount of [his]104-colonel brandon fortune ? ”[1714-i] “ [I]1714-i believe about two thousand a year . ”[1714-i] “ Two thousand a - year ; ”[1714-i] and then working [himself]1714-i up to a pitch of enthusiastic generosity , [he]1714-i added , “ [Elinor]89-elinor , [I]1714-i wish with all [my]1714-i heart it were _ twice _ as much , for [your]89-elinor sake . ”[1714-i] “ Indeed [I]89-elinor believe [you]89-elinor , ”[89-elinor] replied [Elinor]89-elinor ; “ but [I]89-elinor am very sure that [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon has not the smallest wish of marrying _ [me]89-elinor _ . ”[89-elinor] “ [You]89-elinor are mistaken , [Elinor]89-elinor ; [you]89-elinor are very much mistaken . A very little trouble on [your]89-elinor side secures [him]104-colonel brandon . Perhaps just at present [he]104-colonel brandon may be undecided ; the smallness of [your]89-elinor fortune may make [him]104-colonel brandon hang back ; [[his]104-colonel brandon friends]2872-his friends may all advise [him]104-colonel brandon against it . But some of those little attentions and encouragements which [ladies]3907-ladies can so easily give will fix [him]104-colonel brandon , in spite of [himself]104-colonel brandon . And there can be no reason why [you]89-elinor should not try for [him]104-colonel brandon . It is not to be supposed that any prior attachment on [your]89-elinor side — in short , [you]89-elinor know as to an attachment of that kind , it is quite out of the question , the objections are insurmountable — [you]89-elinor have too much sense not to see all that . [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon must be [the man]502-the man ; and no civility shall be wanting on [my]1715-i part to make [him]1715-i pleased with [you]89-elinor and [[your]89-elinor family]3146-your family . It is a match that must give universal satisfaction . In short , it is a kind of thing that”—lowering[1715-i] [his]1715-i voice to an important whisper—“will be exceedingly welcome to _ all parties _ . ”[1715-i] Recollecting [himself]1715-i , however , [he]1715-i added , “ That is , [I]1715-i mean to say — [[your]89-elinor friends]3215-your friends are all truly anxious to see [you]89-elinor well settled ; [Fanny]93-fanny particularly , for [she]93-fanny has [your]89-elinor interest very much at heart , [I]1715-i assure [you]89-elinor . And [[her]93-fanny mother]332-her mother too , [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward , [a very good - natured woman]3912-a very good - natured woman , [I]1715-i am sure it would give [her]98-edward great pleasure ; [she]98-edward said as much the other day . ”[1715-i] [Elinor]89-elinor would not vouchsafe any answer . “ It would be something remarkable , now , ”[1715-i] [he]1715-i continued , “ something droll , if [Fanny]93-fanny should have [a brother]2813-a brother and [I]1715-i [a sister]3914-a sister settling at the same time . And yet it is not very unlikely . ”[1715-i] “ Is [Mr. Edward Ferrars]94-edward , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor , with resolution , “ going to be married ? ”[89-elinor] “ It is not actually settled , but there is such a thing in agitation . [He]94-edward has [a most excellent mother]3915-a most excellent mother . [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward , with the utmost liberality , will come forward , and settle on [him]94-edward a thousand a year , if the match takes place . [The lady]370-the lady is [the Hon . Miss Morton]178-miss morton , [only daughter of [the late Lord Morton]179-the late lord morton]3917-only daughter of the late lord morton , with thirty thousand pounds . A very desirable connection on both sides , and [I]1716-your have not a doubt of its taking place in time . A thousand a - year is a great deal for [a mother]600-a mother to give away , to make over for ever ; but [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward has a noble spirit . To give [you]3919-you another instance of [her]98-edward liberality:—The other day , as soon as [we]3920-we came to [town]2984-town , aware that money could not be very plenty with [us]3920-we just now , [she]98-edward put bank - notes into [Fanny]93-fanny ’s hands to the amount of two hundred pounds . And extremely acceptable it is , for [we]3920-we must live at a great expense while [we]3920-we are [here]2861-here . ”[1716-your] [He]1716-your paused for [her]1717-her assent and compassion ; and [she]1717-her forced [herself]1717-her to say , “ [Your]1716-your expenses both in [town]2984-town and [country]3924-country must certainly be considerable ; but [your]1716-your income is a large one . ”[1717-her] “ Not so large , [I]89-elinor dare say , as [many people]3201-many people suppose . [I]89-elinor do not mean to complain , however ; it is undoubtedly a comfortable one , and [I]89-elinor hope will in time be better . [The enclosure of [Norland Common]54-norland common]3926-the enclosure of norland common , now carrying on , is a most serious drain . And then [I]89-elinor have made a little purchase within this half year ; [East Kingham Farm]55-east kingham farm , [you]3927-you must remember [the place , where [old Gibson]180-old gibson used to live]3928-the place , where old gibson used to live . [The land]3929-the land was so very desirable for [me]89-elinor in every respect , so immediately adjoining [[my]89-elinor own property]3930-my own property , that [I]89-elinor felt it [my]89-elinor duty to buy it . [I]89-elinor could not have answered it to [my]89-elinor conscience to let it fall into any other hands . [A man]499-a man must pay for [his]499-a man convenience ; and it _ has _ cost [me]89-elinor a vast deal of money . ”[89-elinor] “ More than [you]89-elinor think it really and intrinsically worth . ”[1716-your] “ Why , [I]89-elinor hope not that . [I]89-elinor might have sold it again , the next day , for more than [I]89-elinor gave : but , with regard to the purchase - money , [I]89-elinor might have been very unfortunate indeed ; for the stocks were at that time so low , that if [I]89-elinor had not happened to have the necessary sum in [[my]89-elinor banker]3932-my banker ’s hands , [I]89-elinor must have sold out to very great loss . ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor could only smile . “ Other great and inevitable expenses too [we]3933-we have had on first coming to [Norland]3-norland . [[Our]3933-we respected father]3934-our respected father , as [you]89-elinor well know , bequeathed all the Stanhill effects that remained at [Norland]3-norland ( and very valuable they were ) to [[your]89-elinor mother]2781-your mother . Far be it from [me]89-elinor to repine at [his]3934-our respected father doing so ; [he]3934-our respected father had an undoubted right to dispose of [[his]3934-our respected father own property]3936-his own property as [he]3934-our respected father chose , but , in consequence of it , [we]3933-we have been obliged to make large purchases of linen , china , & c. to supply the place of what was taken away . [You]89-elinor may guess , after all these expenses , how very far [we]3933-we must be from being rich , and how acceptable [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward ’s kindness is . ”[89-elinor] “ Certainly , ”[89-elinor] said [Elinor]89-elinor ; “ and assisted by [her]98-edward liberality , [I]89-elinor hope [you]1718-you may yet live to be in easy circumstances . ”[89-elinor] “ Another year or two may do much towards it , ”[1718-you] [he]1718-you gravely replied ; “ but however there is still a great deal to be done . There is not a stone laid of [[Fanny]93-fanny ’s green - house]3937-fanny ’s green - house , and nothing but the plan of [the flower - garden]3938-the flower - garden marked out . ”[1718-you] “ Where is [the green - house]3939-the green - house to be ? ”[89-elinor] “ Upon the knoll behind [the house]318-the house . The old walnut trees are all come down to make room for [it]3939-the green - house . It will be a very fine object from [many parts of [the park]566-the park]3941-many parts of the park , and [the flower - garden]3938-the flower - garden will slope down just before [it]3939-the green - house , and be exceedingly pretty . [We]3944-we have cleared away all the old thorns that grew in patches over the brow . ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor kept [her]89-elinor concern and [her]89-elinor censure to [herself]89-elinor ; and was very thankful that [Marianne]90-marianne was not present , to share the provocation . Having now said enough to make [his]1718-you poverty clear , and to do away the necessity of buying a pair of ear - rings for [each of [[his]1718-you sisters]272-his sisters]1719-each of his sisters , in [his]1718-you next visit at [Gray ’s]177-gray ’s , [his]1718-you thoughts took a cheerfuller turn , and [he]1718-you began to congratulate [Elinor]89-elinor on having such [a friend]1286-a friend as [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings . “ [She]103-mrs. jennings seems [a most valuable woman]3945-a most valuable woman indeed . [[Her]103-mrs. jennings house]2805-her house , [her]103-mrs. jennings style of living , all bespeak an exceeding good income ; and it is an acquaintance that has not only been of great use to [you]3947-you hitherto , but in the end may prove materially advantageous . [Her]103-mrs. jennings inviting [you]3947-you to [town]2984-town is certainly a vast thing in [your]3947-you favour ; and indeed , it speaks altogether so great a regard for [you]3947-you , that in all probability when [she]103-mrs. jennings dies [you]3947-you will not be forgotten . [She]103-mrs. jennings must have a great deal to leave . ”[1718-you] “ Nothing at all , [I]1718-you should rather suppose ; for [she]103-mrs. jennings has only [her]103-mrs. jennings jointure , which will descend to [[her]103-mrs. jennings children]495-her children . ”[1718-you] “ But it is not to be imagined that [she]103-mrs. jennings lives up to [her]103-mrs. jennings income . [Few people of common prudence]3950-few people of common prudence will do _ that _ and whatever [she]103-mrs. jennings saves , [she]103-mrs. jennings will be able to dispose of . ”[1718-you] “ And do [you]1718-you not think it more likely that [she]103-mrs. jennings should leave it to [[her]103-mrs. jennings daughters]294-her daughters , than to [us]3952-us ? ”[1718-you] “ [[Her]103-mrs. jennings daughters]294-her daughters are both exceedingly well married , and therefore [I]1718-you can not perceive the necessity of [her]103-mrs. jennings remembering [them]294-her daughters farther . Whereas , in [my]1718-you opinion , by [her]103-mrs. jennings taking so much notice of [you]1718-you , and treating [you]1718-you in this kind of way , [she]103-mrs. jennings has given [you]1718-you a sort of claim on [her]103-mrs. jennings future consideration , which [a conscientious woman]3954-a conscientious woman would not disregard . Nothing can be kinder than [her]103-mrs. jennings behaviour ; and [she]103-mrs. jennings can hardly do all this , without being aware of the expectation it raises . ”[1718-you] “ But [she]103-mrs. jennings raises none in [those most concerned]3955-those most concerned . Indeed , [brother]3905-brother , [your]1718-you anxiety for [our]3957-our welfare and prosperity carries [you]1718-you too far . ”[1718-you] “ Why , to be sure , ”[1722-he] said [he]1722-he , seeming to recollect [himself]1722-he , “ [people]2770-people have little , have very little in [their]2770-people power . But , [[my]1722-he dear]2750-my dear [Elinor]89-elinor , what is the matter with [Marianne?—she]181-marianne?—she looks very unwell , has lost [her]181-marianne?—she colour , and is grown quite thin . [I]89-elinor remember [Fanny]93-fanny used to say that [she]93-fanny would marry sooner and better than [you]89-elinor did ; not but what [she]93-fanny is exceedingly fond of _ [you]89-elinor _ , but so it happened to strike [her]93-fanny . [Dorsetshire]45-dorsetshire ! [I]89-elinor know very little of [Dorsetshire]45-dorsetshire ; but , [[my]89-elinor dear]2750-my dear [Elinor]89-elinor , [I]89-elinor shall be exceedingly glad to know more of it ; and [I]89-elinor think [I]89-elinor can answer for [your]89-elinor having [Fanny]93-fanny and [myself]89-elinor among [the earliest and best pleased of [[your]89-elinor visitors]3965-your visitors]3964-the earliest and best pleased of your visitors . ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor tried very seriously to convince [him]1723-his that there was no likelihood of [her]89-elinor marrying [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon ; but it was an expectation of too much pleasure to [himself]1723-his to be relinquished , and [he]1723-his was really resolved on seeking an intimacy with [that gentleman]1724-that gentleman , and promoting the marriage by every possible attention . [He]1723-his had just compunction enough for having done nothing for [[his]1723-his sisters]272-his sisters [himself]1723-his , to be exceedingly anxious that [everybody else]1726-everybody else should do a great deal ; and an offer from [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon , or a legacy from [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , was the easiest means of atoning for [his]1723-his own neglect . [They]1727-they were lucky enough to find [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton at [home]565-home , and [Sir John]99-sir john came in before [their]1727-they visit ended . Abundance of civilities passed on all sides . [Sir John]99-sir john was ready to like [anybody]1729-anybody , and though [Mr. Dashwood]85-mr. dashwood did not seem to know much about horses , [he]85-mr. dashwood soon set [him]1723-his down as [a very good - natured fellow]1730-a very good - natured fellow : while [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton saw enough of fashion in [his]1723-his appearance to think [his]1723-his acquaintance worth having ; and [Mr. Dashwood]85-mr. dashwood went away delighted with both . “ [I]85-mr. dashwood shall have a charming account to carry to [Fanny]93-fanny , ”[85-mr. dashwood] said [he]85-mr. dashwood , as [he]85-mr. dashwood walked back with [[his]85-mr. dashwood sister]251-his sister . “ [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton is really [a most elegant woman]3966-a most elegant woman ! [Such a woman as [I]85-mr. dashwood am sure [Fanny]93-fanny]3967-such a woman as i am sure fanny will be glad to know . And [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings too , [an exceedingly well - behaved woman , though not so elegant as [[her]103-mrs. jennings daughter]404-her daughter]3968-an exceedingly well - behaved woman , though not so elegant as her daughter . [[Your]85-mr. dashwood sister]2815-your sister need not have any scruple even of visiting _ [her]103-mrs. jennings _ , which , to say the truth , has been a little the case , and very naturally ; for [we]3971-we only knew that [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings was [the widow of [a man who had got all [his]3973-a man who had got all his money in a low way money in a low way]3973-a man who had got all his money in a low way]3972-the widow of a man who had got all his money in a low way ; and [Fanny]93-fanny and [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward were both strongly prepossessed , that neither [she]103-mrs. jennings nor [[her]103-mrs. jennings daughters]294-her daughters were such kind of women as [Fanny]93-fanny would like to associate with . But now [I]85-mr. dashwood can carry [her]103-mrs. jennings a most satisfactory account of both . ”[85-mr. dashwood] CHAPTER XXXIV . [Mrs. John Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood had so much confidence in [[her]88-mrs. dashwood husband]319-her husband ’s judgment , that [she]88-mrs. dashwood waited the very next day both on [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings and [[her]103-mrs. jennings daughter]404-her daughter ; and [her]88-mrs. dashwood confidence was rewarded by finding even [the former]392-the former , even [the woman with whom [[her]88-mrs. dashwood sisters]334-her sisters were staying , by no means unworthy [her]88-mrs. dashwood notice]1735-the woman with whom her sisters were staying , by no means unworthy her notice ; and as for [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton , [she]88-mrs. dashwood found [her]100-lady middleton one of [the most charming women in [the world]2778-the world]1737-the most charming women in the world ! [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton was equally pleased with [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood . There was a kind of cold hearted selfishness on both sides , which mutually attracted [them]1739-them ; and [they]1739-them sympathised with [each other]338-each other in an insipid propriety of demeanor , and a general want of understanding . The same manners , however , which recommended [Mrs. John Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood to the good opinion of [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton did not suit the fancy of [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , and to _ [her]103-mrs. jennings _ [she]100-lady middleton appeared nothing more than [a little proud - looking woman of uncordial address]1741-a little proud - looking woman of uncordial address , who met [[[her]100-lady middleton husband]319-her husband ’s sisters]1743-her husband ’s sisters without any affection , and almost without having anything to say to [them]1743-her husband ’s sisters ; for of the quarter of an hour bestowed on [Berkeley Street]40-berkeley street , [she]100-lady middleton sat at least seven minutes and a half in silence . [Elinor]89-elinor wanted very much to know , though [she]89-elinor did not chuse to ask , whether [Edward]98-edward was then in [town]2984-town ; but nothing would have induced [Fanny]93-fanny voluntarily to mention [his]319-her husband name before [her]89-elinor , till able to tell [her]89-elinor that [his]319-her husband marriage with [Miss Morton]178-miss morton was resolved on , or till [[her]100-lady middleton husband]319-her husband ’s expectations on [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon were answered ; because [she]89-elinor believed [them]1746-they still so very much attached to [each other]338-each other , that [they]1746-they could not be too sedulously divided in word and deed on every occasion . The intelligence however , which _ [she]89-elinor _ would not give , soon flowed from another quarter . [Lucy]138-lucy came very shortly to claim [Elinor]89-elinor ’s compassion on being unable to see [Edward]98-edward , though [he]319-her husband had arrived in [town]2984-town with [Mr.]1749-mr. and [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood . [He]319-her husband dared not come to [[Bartlett]182-bartlett ’s Buildings]48-bartlett ’s buildings for fear of detection , and though [their]1746-they mutual impatience to meet , was not to be told , [they]1746-they could do nothing at present but write . [Edward]98-edward assured [them]1746-they [himself]98-edward of [his]319-her husband being in [town]2984-town , within a very short time , by twice calling in [Berkeley Street]40-berkeley street . Twice was [his]319-her husband card found on the table , when [they]1746-they returned from [their]1746-they morning ’s engagements . [Elinor]89-elinor was pleased that [he]319-her husband had called ; and still more pleased that [she]89-elinor had missed [him]319-her husband . [The Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods were so prodigiously delighted with [the Middletons]102-the middletons , that , though not much in the habit of giving anything , [they]1746-they determined to give [them]1751-them — a dinner ; and soon after [their]1746-they acquaintance began , invited [them]1751-them to dine in [Harley Street]56-harley street , where [they]1746-they had taken [a very good house]1752-a very good house for three months . [[Their]1746-they sisters]1753-their sisters and [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings were invited likewise , and [John Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood was careful to secure [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon , who , always glad to be where [the Miss Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods were , received [his]104-colonel brandon eager civilities with some surprise , but much more pleasure . [They]1746-they were to meet [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward ; but [Elinor]89-elinor could not learn whether [[her]89-elinor sons]443-her sons were to be of the party . The expectation of seeing [_]174-these _ [her]89-elinor _ , however , was enough to make [her]89-elinor interested in the engagement ; for though [she]89-elinor could now meet [[Edward]98-edward ’s mother]1253-edward ’s mother without that strong anxiety which had once promised to attend such an introduction , though [she]89-elinor could now see [her]89-elinor with perfect indifference as to [her]89-elinor opinion of [herself]89-elinor , [her]89-elinor desire of being in company with [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward , [her]89-elinor curiosity to know what [she]89-elinor was like , was as lively as ever . The interest with which [she]89-elinor thus anticipated the party , was soon afterwards increased , more powerfully than pleasantly , by [her]89-elinor hearing that [the Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles were also to be at it . So well had [they]1756-their recommended [themselves]1756-their to [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton , so agreeable had [their]1756-their assiduities made [them]1756-their to [her]89-elinor , that though [Lucy]138-lucy was certainly not so elegant , and [[her]138-lucy sister]336-her sister not even genteel , [she]89-elinor was as ready as [Sir John]99-sir john to ask [them]1756-their to spend a week or two in [Conduit Street]41-conduit street ; and it happened to be particularly convenient to [the Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles , as soon as [the Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods ’ invitation was known , that [their]1756-their visit should begin a few days before the party took place . [Their]1756-their claims to the notice of [Mrs. John Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood , as [the nieces of the gentleman who for many years had had the care of [[her]88-mrs. dashwood brother]339-her brother]1758-the nieces of the gentleman who for many years had had the care of her brother , might not have done much , however , towards procuring [them]1756-their seats at [her]88-mrs. dashwood table ; but as [[Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton ’s guests]1760-lady middleton ’s guests [they]1756-their must be welcome ; and [Lucy]138-lucy , who had long wanted to be personally known to [the family]303-the family , to have a nearer view of [their]303-the family characters and [her]138-lucy own difficulties , and to have an opportunity of endeavouring to please [them]303-the family , had seldom been happier in [her]138-lucy life , than [she]138-lucy was on receiving [Mrs. John Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood ’s card . On [Elinor]89-elinor its effect was very different . [She]89-elinor began immediately to determine , that [[Edward]98-edward who lived with [[his]339-her brother mother]270-his mother , must be asked as [[his]339-her brother mother]270-his mother was , to a party given by [[his]339-her brother sister]251-his sister]1762-edward who lived with his mother , must be asked as his mother was , to a party given by his sister ; and to see [him]339-her brother for the first time , after all that passed , in the company of [Lucy!—she]183-lucy!—she hardly knew how [she]89-elinor could bear it ! These apprehensions , perhaps , were not founded entirely on reason , and certainly not at all on truth . [They]303-the family were relieved however , not by [her]89-elinor own recollection , but by the good will of [Lucy]138-lucy , who believed [herself]138-lucy to be inflicting a severe disappointment when [she]138-lucy told [her]138-lucy that [Edward]98-edward certainly would not be in [Harley Street]56-harley street on Tuesday , and even hoped to be carrying the pain still farther by persuading [her]138-lucy that [he]339-her brother was kept away by the extreme affection for [herself]138-lucy , which [he]339-her brother could not conceal when [they]1766-they were together . The important Tuesday came that was to introduce [the two young ladies]1767-the two young ladies to [this formidable mother - in - law]1768-this formidable mother - in - law . “ Pity [me]138-lucy , dear [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood ! ”[138-lucy] said [Lucy]138-lucy , as [they]1766-they walked up the stairs together — for [the Middletons]102-the middletons arrived so directly after [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , that [they]1766-they all followed [the servant]818-the servant at the same time:—“there is nobody here but [you]84-miss dashwood , that can feel for [me]89-elinor . [I]89-elinor declare [I]89-elinor can hardly stand . [Good gracious]3975-good gracious ! In a moment [I]89-elinor shall see [the person that all [my]89-elinor happiness depends on — that is to be [[my]89-elinor mother]2771-my mother]3976-the person that all my happiness depends on — that is to be my mother ! ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor could have given [her]89-elinor immediate relief by suggesting the possibility of its being [[Miss Morton]178-miss morton ’s mother]1770-miss morton ’s mother , rather than [her]89-elinor own , whom [they]1766-they were about to behold ; but instead of doing that , [she]89-elinor assured [her]89-elinor , and with great sincerity , that [she]89-elinor did pity [her]89-elinor — to the utter amazement of [Lucy]138-lucy , who , though really uncomfortable [herself]138-lucy , hoped at least to be an object of irrepressible envy to [Elinor]89-elinor . [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward was [a little , thin woman]1771-a little , thin woman , upright , even to formality , in [her]98-edward figure , and serious , even to sourness , in [her]98-edward aspect . [Her]98-edward complexion was sallow ; and [her]98-edward features small , without beauty , and naturally without expression ; but a lucky contraction of the brow had rescued [her]98-edward countenance from the disgrace of insipidity , by giving it the strong characters of pride and ill nature . [She]98-edward was not [a woman of many words]1772-a woman of many words ; for , unlike [people in general]1773-people in general , [she]98-edward proportioned them to the number of [her]98-edward ideas ; and of the few syllables that did escape [her]98-edward , not one fell to the share of [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood , whom [she]98-edward eyed with the spirited determination of disliking [her]98-edward at all events . [Elinor]89-elinor could not _ now _ be made unhappy by this behaviour . A few months ago it would have hurt [her]138-lucy exceedingly ; but it was not in [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward ’ power to distress [her]138-lucy by it now ; and the difference of [her]138-lucy manners to [the Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles , a difference which seemed purposely made to humble [her]138-lucy more , only amused [her]138-lucy . [She]138-lucy could not but smile to see the graciousness of both [mother]2803-mother and [daughter]3240-daughter towards [the very person]1776-the very person — for [Lucy]138-lucy was particularly distinguished — whom of all others , had [they]1773-people in general known as much as [she]138-lucy did , [they]1773-people in general would have been most anxious to mortify ; while [she]138-lucy [herself]138-lucy , who had comparatively no power to wound [them]1773-people in general , sat pointedly slighted by both . But while [she]138-lucy smiled at a graciousness so misapplied , [she]138-lucy could not reflect on the mean - spirited folly from which it sprung , nor observe the studied attentions with which [the Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles courted its continuance , without thoroughly despising [them]1773-people in general all four . [Lucy]138-lucy was all exultation on being so honorably distinguished ; and [Miss Steele]138-lucy wanted only to be teazed about [Dr. Davies]176-dr. davies to be perfectly happy . The dinner was a grand one , [the servants]538-the servants were numerous , and every thing bespoke [the Mistress]1778-the mistress ’s inclination for show , and [the Master]1779-the master ’s ability to support [it]1780-it . In spite of the improvements and additions which were making to [the Norland estate]256-the norland estate , and in spite of [[its]256-the norland estate owner]1782-its owner having once been within some thousand pounds of being obliged to sell out at a loss , nothing gave any symptom of that indigence which [he]1782-its owner had tried to infer from it;—no poverty of any kind , except of conversation , appeared — but there , the deficiency was considerable . [John Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood had not much to say for [himself]88-mrs. dashwood that was worth hearing , and [[his]1782-its owner wife]280-his wife had still less . But there was no peculiar disgrace in this ; for it was very much the case with [the chief of [[their]1785-their visitors]691-their visitors , who almost [all laboured under one or other of these disqualifications for being agreeable — Want of sense , either natural or improved — want of elegance — want of spirits — or want of temper]1787-all laboured under one or other of these disqualifications for being agreeable — want of sense , either natural or improved — want of elegance — want of spirits — or want of temper]1784-the chief of their visitors , who almost all laboured under one or other of these disqualifications for being agreeable — want of sense , either natural or improved — want of elegance — want of spirits — or want of temper . When [the ladies]572-the ladies withdrew to [the drawing - room]1150-the drawing - room after dinner , this poverty was particularly evident , for [the gentlemen]1790-the gentlemen _ had _ supplied the discourse with some variety — the variety of politics , inclosing land , and breaking horses — but then it was all over ; and one subject only engaged [the ladies]572-the ladies till coffee came in , which was the comparative heights of [Harry Dashwood]85-mr. dashwood , and [[Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton ’s second son]1792-lady middleton ’s second son [William]139-william , who were nearly of the same age . Had [both the children]1793-both the children been [there]354-there , the affair might have been determined too easily by measuring [them]1793-both the children at once ; but as [Harry]85-mr. dashwood only was present , it was all conjectural assertion on both sides ; and [every body]581-every body had a right to be equally positive in [their]581-every body opinion , and to repeat it over and over again as often as [they]581-every body liked . [The parties]774-the parties stood thus : [The two mothers]1797-the two mothers , though each really convinced that [[her]1797-the two mothers own son]1798-her own son was [the tallest]1799-the tallest , politely decided in favour of [the other]772-the other . [The two grandmothers]1801-the two grandmothers , with not less partiality , but more sincerity , were equally earnest in support of [[their]1801-the two grandmothers own descendant]1802-their own descendant . [Lucy]138-lucy , who was hardly less anxious to please [one parent]1803-one parent than [the other]772-the other , thought [the boys]1805-the boys were both remarkably tall for [their]1805-the boys age , and could not conceive that there could be the smallest difference in [the world]2778-the world between [them]1805-the boys ; and [Miss Steele]138-lucy , with yet greater address gave it , as fast as [she]138-lucy could , in favour of each . [Elinor]89-elinor , having once delivered [her]89-elinor opinion on [William]139-william ’s side , by which [she]89-elinor offended [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward and [Fanny]93-fanny still more , did not see the necessity of enforcing it by any farther assertion ; and [Marianne]90-marianne , when called on for [hers]90-marianne , offended [them]1807-them all , by declaring that [she]90-marianne had no opinion to give , as [she]90-marianne had never thought about it . Before [her]89-elinor removing from [Norland]3-norland , [Elinor]89-elinor had painted a very pretty pair of screens for [[her]89-elinor sister - in - law]340-her sister - in - law , which being now just mounted and brought [home]565-home , ornamented [[her]89-elinor present drawing room]1810-her present drawing room ; and these screens , catching the eye of [John Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood on [his]1811-his following [the other gentlemen]1812-the other gentlemen into [the room]2842-the room , were officiously handed by [him]1811-his to [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon for [his]104-colonel brandon admiration . “ These are done by [[my]104-colonel brandon eldest sister]3978-my eldest sister , ”[104-colonel brandon] said [he]104-colonel brandon ; “ and [you]3978-my eldest sister , as [a man of taste]3979-a man of taste , will , [I]104-colonel brandon dare say , be pleased with them . [I]104-colonel brandon do not know whether [you]3978-my eldest sister have ever happened to see any of [her]89-elinor performances before , but [she]89-elinor is in general reckoned to draw extremely well . ”[104-colonel brandon] [The Colonel]664-the colonel , though disclaiming all pretensions to [connoisseurship]1815-connoisseurship , warmly admired the screens , as [he]104-colonel brandon would have done any thing painted by [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood ; and on the curiosity of [the others]539-the others being of course excited , [they]1817-they were handed round for general inspection . [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward , not aware of [their]1817-they being [Elinor]89-elinor ’s work , particularly requested to look at them ; and after [they]1817-they had received gratifying testimony of [Lady Middletons]102-the middletons ’s approbation , [Fanny]93-fanny presented them to [[her]93-fanny mother]332-her mother , considerately informing [her]332-her mother , at the same time , that they were done by [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood . “ Hum”—said[184-mrs. ferrars—“very pretty,”—and] [Mrs. Ferrars—“very pretty,”—and]184-mrs. ferrars—“very pretty,”—and[184-mrs. ferrars—“very pretty,”—and] without regarding them at all , returned them to [[her]98-edward daughter]404-her daughter . Perhaps [Fanny]93-fanny thought for a moment that [[her]93-fanny mother]332-her mother had been quite rude enough,—for , colouring a little , [she]93-fanny immediately said , “ [They]1817-they are very pretty , [ma’am]2974-ma’am — an’t [they]1817-they ? ”[93-fanny] But then again , the dread of having been too civil , too encouraging [herself]93-fanny , probably came over [her]93-fanny , for [she]93-fanny presently added , “ Do [you]3981-you not think they are something in [Miss Morton]178-miss morton ’s style of painting , [Ma’am?—_She]2974-ma’am does _ paint most delightfully!—How beautifully [her]178-miss morton last landscape is done ! ”[93-fanny] “ Beautifully indeed ! But _ [she]178-miss morton _ does every thing well . ”[90-marianne] [Marianne]90-marianne could not bear this.—She was already greatly displeased with [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward ; and such ill - timed praise of another , at [Elinor]89-elinor ’s expense , though [she]93-fanny had not any notion of what was principally meant by it , provoked [her]93-fanny immediately to say with warmth , “ This is admiration of a very particular kind!—what is [Miss Morton]178-miss morton to [us?—who]3982-us?—who knows , or who cares , for [her?—it]89-elinor is [Elinor]89-elinor of whom _ [we]3983-we _ think and speak . ”[93-fanny] And so saying , [she]93-fanny took the screens out of [[her]93-fanny sister - in - law]340-her sister - in - law ’s hands , to admire them [herself]93-fanny as they ought to be admired . [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward looked exceedingly angry , and drawing [herself]93-fanny up more stiffly than ever , pronounced in retort this bitter philippic , “ [Miss Morton]178-miss morton is [[Lord Morton]179-the late lord morton ’s daughter]3984-lord morton ’s daughter . ”[93-fanny] [Fanny]93-fanny looked very angry too , and [[her]93-fanny husband]319-her husband was all in a fright at [[his]319-her husband sister]251-his sister ’s audacity . [Elinor]89-elinor was much more hurt by [Marianne]90-marianne ’s warmth than [she]89-elinor had been by what produced it ; but [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon ’s eyes , as they were fixed on [Marianne]90-marianne , declared that [he]104-colonel brandon noticed only what was amiable in it , the affectionate heart which could not bear to see [a sister slighted in the smallest point]1824-a sister slighted in the smallest point . [Marianne]90-marianne ’s feelings did not stop here . The cold insolence of [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward ’s general behaviour to [[her]98-edward sister]336-her sister , seemed , to [her]98-edward , to foretell such difficulties and distresses to [Elinor]89-elinor , as [her]98-edward own wounded heart taught [her]98-edward to think of with horror ; and urged by a strong impulse of affectionate sensibility , [she]98-edward moved after a moment , to [[her]98-edward sister]336-her sister ’s chair , and putting one arm round [her]98-edward neck , and one cheek close to [hers]98-edward , said in a low , but eager , voice , “ Dear , [dear Elinor]89-elinor , do n’t mind [them]1827-them . Do n’t let [them]1827-them make _ [you]89-elinor _ unhappy . ”[98-edward] [She]98-edward could say no more ; [her]98-edward spirits were quite overcome , and hiding [her]98-edward face on [Elinor]89-elinor ’s shoulder , [she]98-edward burst into tears . Every body ’s attention was called , and almost every body was concerned.—Colonel [Brandon]104-colonel brandon rose up and went to [them]1827-them without knowing what [he]104-colonel brandon did.—Mrs . [Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , with a very intelligent “ Ah ! [poor dear]3675-poor dear , ”[103-mrs. jennings] immediately gave [her]98-edward [her]98-edward salts ; and [Sir John]99-sir john felt so desperately enraged against [the author of this nervous distress]1828-the author of this nervous distress , that [he]99-sir john instantly changed [his]99-sir john seat to one close by [Lucy Steele]138-lucy , and gave [her]98-edward , in a whisper , a brief account of the whole shocking affair . In a few minutes , however , [Marianne]90-marianne was recovered enough to put an end to the bustle , and sit down among [the rest]864-the rest ; though [her]90-marianne spirits retained the impression of what had passed , the whole evening . “ Poor [Marianne]90-marianne ! ”[339-her brother] said [[her]98-edward brother]339-her brother to [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon , in a low voice , as soon as [he]339-her brother could secure [his]339-her brother attention : “ [She]90-marianne has not such good health as [[her]90-marianne sister,—she]3986-her sister,—she is very nervous,—she has not [Elinor]89-elinor ’s constitution;—and [one]2761-one must allow that there is something very trying to [a young woman who _ has been _ a beauty in the loss of [her]90-marianne personal attractions]3988-a young woman who _ has been _ a beauty in the loss of her personal attractions . [You]3989-you would not think it perhaps , but [Marianne]90-marianne _ was _ remarkably handsome a few months ago ; quite as handsome as [Elinor]89-elinor . Now [you]3989-you see it is all gone . ”[339-her brother] CHAPTER XXXV . [Elinor]89-elinor ’s curiosity to see [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward was satisfied . [She]89-elinor had found in [her]89-elinor every thing that could tend to make a farther connection between [the families]1831-the families undesirable . [She]89-elinor had seen enough of [her]89-elinor pride , [her]89-elinor meanness , and [her]89-elinor determined prejudice against [herself]89-elinor , to comprehend all the difficulties that must have perplexed the engagement , and retarded the marriage , of [Edward]98-edward and [herself]89-elinor , had [he]1832-he been otherwise free ; and [she]89-elinor had seen almost enough to be thankful for [her]89-elinor _ own _ sake , that one greater obstacle preserved [her]89-elinor from suffering under any other of [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward ’s creation , preserved [her]89-elinor from all dependence upon [her]89-elinor caprice , or any solicitude for [her]89-elinor good opinion . Or at least , if [she]89-elinor did not bring [herself]89-elinor quite to rejoice in [Edward]98-edward ’s being fettered to [Lucy]138-lucy , [she]89-elinor determined , that had [Lucy]138-lucy been more amiable , [she]89-elinor _ ought _ to have rejoiced . [She]89-elinor wondered that [Lucy]138-lucy ’s spirits could be so very much elevated by the civility of [Mrs. Ferrars;—that]1833-mrs. ferrars;—that [her]89-elinor interest and [her]89-elinor vanity should so very much blind [her]89-elinor as to make the attention which seemed only paid [her]89-elinor because [she]89-elinor was _ not [Elinor]89-elinor _ , appear a compliment to [herself]89-elinor — or to allow [her]89-elinor to derive encouragement from a preference only given [her]89-elinor , because [her]89-elinor real situation was unknown . But that it was so , had not only been declared by [Lucy]138-lucy ’s eyes at the time , but was declared over again the next morning more openly , for at [her]89-elinor particular desire , [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton set [her]89-elinor down in [Berkeley Street]40-berkeley street on the chance of seeing [Elinor]89-elinor alone , to tell [her]89-elinor how happy [she]89-elinor was . The chance proved a lucky one , for a message from [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer soon after [she]89-elinor arrived , carried [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings away . “ [[My]138-lucy dear friend]3990-my dear friend , ”[138-lucy] cried [Lucy]138-lucy , as soon as [they]1834-they were by [themselves]1834-they , “ [I]138-lucy come to talk to [you]3990-my dear friend of [my]138-lucy happiness .
