Could anything be so flattering as [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward ’s way of treating [me]138-lucy yesterday ? So exceeding affable as [she]98-edward was ! [You]3990-my dear friend know how [I]138-lucy dreaded the thoughts of seeing [her]98-edward ; but the very moment [I]138-lucy was introduced , there was such an affability in [her]98-edward behaviour as really should seem to say , [she]98-edward had quite took a fancy to [me]138-lucy . Now was not it so ? [You]3990-my dear friend saw it all ; and was not [you]3990-my dear friend quite struck with it ? ”[138-lucy] “ [She]98-edward was certainly very civil to [you]3990-my dear friend . ”[89-elinor] “ Civil!—Did [you]3990-my dear friend see nothing but only civility?—I saw a vast deal more . Such kindness as fell to the share of [nobody but me!—No pride]3991-nobody but me!—no pride , no hauteur , and [[your]3990-my dear friend sister]2815-your sister just the same — all sweetness and affability ! ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor wished to talk of something else , but [Lucy]138-lucy still pressed [her]89-elinor to own that [she]89-elinor had reason for [her]89-elinor happiness ; and [Elinor]89-elinor was obliged to go on . “ Undoubtedly , if [they]3993-they had known [your]3990-my dear friend engagement , ”[89-elinor] said [she]89-elinor , “ nothing could be more flattering than [their]3993-they treatment of [you;—but]3994-you;—but as that was not the case — ”[89-elinor] “ [I]138-lucy guessed [you]3990-my dear friend would say so,”—replied[138-lucy] [Lucy]138-lucy quickly—“but there was no reason in [the world]2778-the world why [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward should seem to like [me]89-elinor , if [she]98-edward did not , and [her]98-edward liking [me]89-elinor is every thing . [You]3990-my dear friend sha n’t talk [me]89-elinor out of [my]89-elinor satisfaction . [I]89-elinor am sure it will all end well , and there will be no difficulties at all , to what [I]89-elinor used to think . [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward is [a charming woman]3996-a charming woman , and so is [[your]3990-my dear friend sister]2815-your sister . [They]3998-they are both [delightful women]3999-delightful women , indeed!—I wonder [I]89-elinor should never hear [you]3990-my dear friend say how agreeable [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood was ! ”[89-elinor] To this [Elinor]89-elinor had no answer to make , and did not attempt any . “ Are [you]3990-my dear friend ill , [Miss Dashwood?—you]185-miss dashwood?—you seem low — [you]3990-my dear friend do n’t speak;—sure [you]3990-my dear friend an’t well . ”[89-elinor] “ [I]138-lucy never was in better health . ”[138-lucy] “ [I]89-elinor am glad of it with all [my]89-elinor heart ; but really [you]3990-my dear friend did not look it . [I]89-elinor should be sorry to have _ [you]3990-my dear friend _ ill ; [you]3990-my dear friend , that have been the greatest comfort to [me]89-elinor in the world!—Heaven knows what [I]89-elinor should have done without [your]3990-my dear friend friendship . ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor tried to make a civil answer , though doubting [her]89-elinor own success . But it seemed to satisfy [Lucy]138-lucy , for [she]138-lucy directly replied , “ Indeed [I]138-lucy am perfectly convinced of [your]138-lucy regard for [me]138-lucy , and next to [Edward]98-edward ’s love , it is the greatest comfort [I]138-lucy have . [Poor Edward]147-edward ! But now there is one good thing , [we]4000-we shall be able to meet , and meet pretty often , for [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton ’s delighted with [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood , so [we]4000-we shall be a good deal in [Harley Street]56-harley street , [I]138-lucy dare say , and [Edward]147-edward spends half [his]147-edward time with [[his]147-edward sister]251-his sister — besides , [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton and [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward will visit now;—and [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward and [[your]138-lucy sister]2815-your sister were both so good to say more than once , [they]4003-they should always be glad to see [me]138-lucy . [They]4003-they are such charming women!—I am sure if ever [you]138-lucy tell [[your]138-lucy sister]2815-your sister what [I]138-lucy think of [her]2815-your sister , [you]138-lucy can not speak too high . ”[138-lucy] But [Elinor]89-elinor would not give [her]89-elinor any encouragement to hope that [she]89-elinor _ should _ tell [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister . [Lucy]138-lucy continued . “ [I]138-lucy am sure [I]138-lucy should have seen it in a moment , if [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward had took a dislike to [me]138-lucy . If [she]98-edward had only made [me]138-lucy a formal courtesy , for instance , without saying a word , and never after had took any notice of [me]138-lucy , and never looked at [me]138-lucy in a pleasant way — [you]138-lucy know what [I]138-lucy mean — if [I]138-lucy had been treated in that forbidding sort of way , [I]138-lucy should have gave it all up in despair . [I]138-lucy could not have stood it . For where [she]98-edward _ does _ dislike , [I]138-lucy know it is most violent . ”[138-lucy] [Elinor]89-elinor was prevented from making any reply to this civil triumph , by the door ’s being thrown open , [the servant]818-the servant ’s announcing [Mr. Ferrars]94-edward , and [Edward]94-edward ’s immediately walking in . It was a very awkward moment ; and the countenance of [each]1837-each showed that it was so . [They]1838-they all looked exceedingly foolish ; and [Edward]94-edward seemed to have as great an inclination to walk out of [the room]2842-the room again , as to advance farther into [it]2842-the room . The very circumstance , in its unpleasantest form , which [they]1838-they would each have been most anxious to avoid , had fallen on them.—They were not only all three together , but were together without the relief of [any other person]1477-any other person . [The ladies]572-the ladies recovered [themselves]572-the ladies first . It was not [Lucy]138-lucy ’s business to put [herself]138-lucy forward , and the appearance of secrecy must still be kept up . [She]89-elinor could therefore only _ look _ [her]89-elinor tenderness , and after slightly addressing [him]94-edward , said no more . But [Elinor]89-elinor had more to do ; and so anxious was [she]89-elinor , for [his]94-edward sake and [her]89-elinor own , to do it well , that [she]89-elinor forced [herself]89-elinor , after a moment ’s recollection , to welcome [him]94-edward , with a look and manner that were almost easy , and almost open ; and another struggle , another effort still improved [them]1842-them . [She]89-elinor would not allow the presence of [Lucy]138-lucy , nor the consciousness of some injustice towards [herself]89-elinor , to deter [her]89-elinor from saying that [she]89-elinor was happy to see [him]94-edward , and that [she]89-elinor had very much regretted being from [home]565-home , when [he]94-edward called before in [Berkeley Street]40-berkeley street . [She]89-elinor would not be frightened from paying [him]94-edward those attentions which , as [a friend and almost a relation]1844-a friend and almost a relation , were [his]94-edward due , by the observant eyes of [Lucy]138-lucy , though [she]89-elinor soon perceived [them]1845-them to be narrowly watching [her]89-elinor . [Her]89-elinor manners gave some re - assurance to [Edward]94-edward , and [he]94-edward had courage enough to sit down ; but [his]94-edward embarrassment still exceeded that of [the ladies]572-the ladies in a proportion , which the case rendered reasonable , though [his]94-edward sex might make it rare ; for [his]94-edward heart had not the indifference of [Lucy]138-lucy ’s , nor could [his]94-edward conscience have quite the ease of [Elinor]89-elinor ’s . [Lucy]138-lucy , with a demure and settled air , seemed determined to make no contribution to the comfort of [the others]539-the others , and would not say a word ; and almost every thing that _ was _ said , proceeded from [Elinor]89-elinor , who was obliged to volunteer all the information about [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother ’s health , [their]1849-their coming to [town]2984-town , & c. which [Edward]94-edward ought to have inquired about , but never did . [Her]89-elinor exertions did not stop here ; for [she]89-elinor soon afterwards felt [herself]89-elinor so heroically disposed as to determine , under pretence of fetching [Marianne]90-marianne , to leave [the others]539-the others by [themselves]539-the others ; and [she]89-elinor really did it , and _ that _ in the handsomest manner , for [she]89-elinor loitered away several minutes on [the landing - place]1852-the landing - place , with the most high - minded fortitude , before [she]89-elinor went to [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister . When that was once done , however , it was time for the raptures of [Edward]94-edward to cease ; for [Marianne]90-marianne ’s joy hurried [her]89-elinor into [the drawing - room]1150-the drawing - room immediately . [Her]89-elinor pleasure in seeing [him]94-edward was like every other of [her]89-elinor feelings , strong in itself , and strongly spoken . [She]89-elinor met [him]94-edward with a hand that would be taken , and a voice that expressed the affection of [a sister]3914-a sister . “ Dear [Edward]94-edward ! ”[89-elinor] [she]89-elinor cried , “ this is a moment of great happiness!—This would almost make amends for every thing ! ”[89-elinor] [Edward]94-edward tried to return [her]89-elinor kindness as it deserved , but before such witnesses [he]94-edward dared not say half what [he]94-edward really felt . Again [they]1856-they all sat down , and for a moment or two [all]1120-all were silent ; while [Marianne]90-marianne was looking with the most speaking tenderness , sometimes at [Edward]94-edward and sometimes at [Elinor]89-elinor , regretting only that [their]1856-they delight in each other should be checked by [Lucy]138-lucy ’s unwelcome presence . [Edward]94-edward was the first to speak , and it was to notice [Marianne]90-marianne ’s altered looks , and express [his]94-edward fear of [her]90-marianne not finding [London]24-london agree with [her]90-marianne . “ Oh , do n’t think of [me]89-elinor ! ”[89-elinor] [she]89-elinor replied with spirited earnestness , though [her]89-elinor eyes were filled with tears as [she]89-elinor spoke , “ do n’t think of _ [my]89-elinor _ health . [Elinor]89-elinor is well , [you]94-edward see . That must be enough for [us]1856-they both . ”[89-elinor] This remark was not calculated to make [Edward]94-edward or [Elinor]89-elinor more easy , nor to conciliate the good will of [Lucy]138-lucy , who looked up at [Marianne]90-marianne with no very benignant expression . “ Do [you]138-lucy like [London]24-london ? ”[94-edward] said [Edward]94-edward , willing to say any thing that might introduce another subject . “ Not at all . [I]89-elinor expected much pleasure in it , but [I]89-elinor have found none . The sight of [you]94-edward , [Edward]94-edward , is the only comfort it has afforded ; and thank [Heaven]186-heaven ! [you]94-edward are what [you]94-edward always were ! ”[89-elinor] [She]89-elinor paused — [no one]317-no one spoke . “ [I]89-elinor think , [Elinor]89-elinor , ”[89-elinor] [she]89-elinor presently added , “ [we]4005-we must employ [Edward]94-edward to take care of [us]4005-we in [our]4005-we return to [Barton]8-barton . In a week or two , [I]89-elinor suppose , [we]4005-we shall be going ; and , [I]89-elinor trust , [Edward]94-edward will not be very unwilling to accept the charge . ”[89-elinor] [Poor Edward]147-edward muttered something , but what it was , [nobody]2922-nobody knew , not even [himself]147-edward . But [Marianne]90-marianne , who saw [his]147-edward agitation , and could easily trace it to whatever cause best pleased [herself]90-marianne , was perfectly satisfied , and soon talked of something else . “ [We]4005-we spent such a day , [Edward]147-edward , in [Harley Street]56-harley street yesterday ! So dull , so wretchedly dull!—But [I]90-marianne have much to say to [you]147-edward on that head , which can not be said now . ”[90-marianne] And with this admirable discretion did [she]90-marianne defer the assurance of [her]90-marianne finding [[their]1860-their mutual relatives]1861-their mutual relatives more disagreeable than ever , and of [her]90-marianne being particularly disgusted with [[his]147-edward mother]270-his mother , till [they]1860-their were more in private . “ But why were [you]147-edward not there , [Edward?—Why]187-edward?—why did [you]147-edward not come ? ”[90-marianne] “ [I]90-marianne was engaged elsewhere . ”[90-marianne] “ Engaged ! But what was that , when [such friends]4006-such friends were to be met ? ”[90-marianne] “ Perhaps , [Miss Marianne]90-marianne , ”[138-lucy] cried [Lucy]138-lucy , eager to take some revenge on [her]90-marianne , “ [you]90-marianne think [young men]4007-young men never stand upon engagements , if [they]4007-young men have no mind to keep [them]4007-young men , little as well as great . ”[138-lucy] [Elinor]89-elinor was very angry , but [Marianne]90-marianne seemed entirely insensible of the sting ; for [she]90-marianne calmly replied , “ Not so , indeed ; for , seriously speaking , [I]90-marianne am very sure that conscience only kept [Edward]147-edward from [Harley Street]56-harley street . And [I]90-marianne really believe [he]147-edward _ has _ [the most delicate conscience in [the world]2778-the world]4008-the most delicate conscience in the world ; the most scrupulous in performing every engagement , however minute , and however it may make against [his]147-edward interest or pleasure . [He]147-edward is the most fearful of giving pain , of wounding expectation , and the most incapable of being selfish , of any body [I]90-marianne ever saw . [Edward]147-edward , it is so , and [I]90-marianne will say it . What ! are [you]147-edward never to hear [yourself]147-edward praised!—Then [you]147-edward must be [no friend of mine]4010-no friend of mine ; for those who will accept of [my]90-marianne love and esteem , must submit to [my]90-marianne open commendation . ”[90-marianne] The nature of [her]90-marianne commendation , in the present case , however , happened to be particularly ill - suited to the feelings of [two thirds of [[her]90-marianne auditors]1864-her auditors]1863-two thirds of her auditors , and was so very unexhilarating to [Edward]147-edward , that [he]147-edward very soon got up to go away . “ Going so soon ! ”[90-marianne] said [Marianne]90-marianne ; “ [[my]90-marianne dear]2750-my dear [Edward]147-edward , this must not be . ”[90-marianne] And drawing [him]147-edward a little aside , [she]90-marianne whispered [her]90-marianne persuasion that [Lucy]138-lucy could not stay much longer . But even this encouragement failed , for [he]147-edward would go ; and [Lucy]138-lucy , who would have outstaid [him]147-edward , had [his]147-edward visit lasted two hours , soon afterwards went away . “ What can bring [her]138-lucy [here]2861-here so often ? ”[90-marianne] said [Marianne]90-marianne , on [her]90-marianne leaving [them]1865-them . “ Could not [she]138-lucy see that [we]1865-them wanted [her]138-lucy gone!—how teazing to [Edward]147-edward ! ”[90-marianne] “ Why [so?—we]188-so?—we were all [[his]147-edward friends]2872-his friends , and [Lucy]138-lucy has been the longest known to [him]147-edward of any . It is but natural that [he]147-edward should like to see [her]138-lucy as well as [ourselves]1865-them . ”[90-marianne] [Marianne]90-marianne looked at [her]1866-her steadily , and said , “ [You]1866-her know , [Elinor]89-elinor , that this is a kind of talking which [I]90-marianne can not bear . If [you]89-elinor only hope to have [your]89-elinor assertion contradicted , as [I]90-marianne must suppose to be the case , [you]89-elinor ought to recollect that [I]90-marianne am [the last person in [the world]2778-the world]4014-the last person in the world to do it . [I]90-marianne can not descend to be tricked out of assurances , that are not really wanted . ”[90-marianne] [She]90-marianne then left [the room]2842-the room ; and [Elinor]89-elinor dared not follow [her]90-marianne to say more , for bound as [she]90-marianne was by [her]90-marianne promise of secrecy to [Lucy]138-lucy , [she]90-marianne could give no information that would convince [Marianne]90-marianne ; and painful as the consequences of [her]90-marianne still continuing in an error might be , [she]90-marianne was obliged to submit to it . All that [she]90-marianne could hope , was that [Edward]147-edward would not often expose [her]90-marianne or [himself]147-edward to the distress of hearing [Marianne]90-marianne ’s mistaken warmth , nor to the repetition of any other part of the pain that had attended [their]1868-their recent meeting — and this [she]90-marianne had every reason to expect . CHAPTER XXXVI . Within a few days after this meeting , the newspapers announced to [the world]2778-the world , that [the lady of [Thomas Palmer , Esq .]189-thomas]1870-the lady of thomas palmer , esq . was safely delivered of [a son and heir]1871-a son and heir ; a very interesting and satisfactory paragraph , at least to [all those intimate connections who knew it before]1872-all those intimate connections who knew it before . This event , highly important to [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s happiness , produced a temporary alteration in the disposal of [her]103-mrs. jennings time , and influenced , in a like degree , the engagements of [[her]103-mrs. jennings young friends]3819-her young friends ; for as [she]103-mrs. jennings wished to be as much as possible with [Charlotte]127-charlotte , [she]103-mrs. jennings went thither every morning as soon as [she]103-mrs. jennings was dressed , and did not return till late in the evening ; and [the Miss Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods , at the particular request of [the Middletons]102-the middletons , spent the whole of every day in [Conduit Street]41-conduit street . For [their]1868-their own comfort [they]1868-their would much rather have remained , at least all the morning , in [[Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s house]1874-mrs. jennings ’s house ; but it was not a thing to be urged against the wishes of [everybody]3862-everybody . [Their]1868-their hours were therefore made over to [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton and [the two Miss Steeles]1293-the two miss steeles , by whom [their]1868-their company , in fact was as little valued , as it was professedly sought . [They]1868-their had too much sense to be desirable companions to [the former]392-the former ; and by the latter [they]1868-their were considered with a jealous eye , as intruding on _ [their]1868-their _ ground , and sharing the kindness which [they]1868-their wanted to monopolize . Though nothing could be more polite than [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton ’s behaviour to [Elinor]89-elinor and [Marianne]90-marianne , [she]100-lady middleton did not really like [them]1868-their at all . Because [they]1868-their neither flattered [herself]100-lady middleton nor [[her]100-lady middleton children]495-her children , [she]100-lady middleton could not believe [them]1868-their good - natured ; and because [they]1868-their were fond of reading , [she]100-lady middleton fancied [them]1868-their satirical : perhaps without exactly knowing what it was to be satirical ; but _ that _ did not signify . It was censure in common use , and easily given . [Their]1868-their presence was a restraint both on [her]100-lady middleton and on [Lucy]138-lucy . It checked the idleness of one , and the business of the other . [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton was ashamed of doing nothing before [them]1868-their , and the flattery which [Lucy]138-lucy was proud to think of and administer at other times , [she]138-lucy feared [they]1868-their would despise [her]138-lucy for offering . [Miss Steele]138-lucy was the least discomposed of [the three]1879-the three , by [their]1868-their presence ; and it was in [their]1868-their power to reconcile [her]138-lucy to it entirely . Would either of [them]1879-the three only have given [her]138-lucy a full and minute account of the whole affair between [Marianne]90-marianne and [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby , [she]138-lucy would have thought [herself]138-lucy amply rewarded for the sacrifice of the best place by the fire after dinner , which [their]1868-their arrival occasioned . But this conciliation was not granted ; for though [she]138-lucy often threw out expressions of pity for [[her]138-lucy sister]336-her sister to [Elinor]89-elinor , and more than once dropt a reflection on the inconstancy of beaux before [Marianne]90-marianne , no effect was produced , but a look of indifference from [the former]392-the former , or of disgust in the latter . An effort even yet lighter might have made [her]138-lucy [[their]1868-their friend]1882-their friend . Would [they]1868-their only have laughed at [her]138-lucy about [the Doctor]3869-the doctor ! But so little were [they]1868-their , any more than the others , inclined to oblige [her]138-lucy , that if [Sir John]99-sir john dined from [home]565-home , [she]138-lucy might spend a whole day without hearing any other raillery on the subject , than what [she]138-lucy was kind enough to bestow on [herself]138-lucy . All these jealousies and discontents , however , were so totally unsuspected by [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , that [she]103-mrs. jennings thought it a delightful thing for [the girls]2794-the girls to be together ; and generally congratulated [[her]103-mrs. jennings young friends]3819-her young friends every night , on having escaped the company of [a stupid old woman]1887-a stupid old woman so long . [She]103-mrs. jennings joined [them]3819-her young friends sometimes at [[Sir John]99-sir john ’s]1888-sir john ’s , sometimes at [[her]103-mrs. jennings own house]1889-her own house ; but wherever it was , [she]103-mrs. jennings always came in excellent spirits , full of delight and importance , attributing [Charlotte]127-charlotte ’s well doing to [her]103-mrs. jennings own care , and ready to give so exact , so minute a detail of [her]103-mrs. jennings situation , as only [Miss Steele]138-lucy had curiosity enough to desire . One thing _ did _ disturb [her]103-mrs. jennings ; and of that [she]103-mrs. jennings made [her]103-mrs. jennings daily complaint . [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer maintained the common , but unfatherly opinion among [his]129-mr. palmer sex , of [all infants]1890-all infants being alike ; and though [she]103-mrs. jennings could plainly perceive , at different times , the most striking resemblance between [this baby]1891-this baby and [every one of [[his]129-mr. palmer relations]1231-his relations on both sides]1892-every one of his relations on both sides , there was no convincing [[his]129-mr. palmer father]290-his father of it ; no persuading [him]290-his father to believe that it was not exactly like [every other baby of the same age]1895-every other baby of the same age ; nor could [he]290-his father even be brought to acknowledge the simple proposition of [its]1891-this baby being [the finest child in [the world]2778-the world]1896-the finest child in the world . [I]0-i come now to the relation of a misfortune , which about this time befell [Mrs. John Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood . It so happened that while [[her]88-mrs. dashwood two sisters]1898-her two sisters with [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings were first calling on [her]88-mrs. dashwood in [Harley Street]56-harley street , [another of [her]88-mrs. dashwood acquaintance]1899-another of her acquaintance had dropt in — a circumstance in itself not apparently likely to produce evil to [her]88-mrs. dashwood . But while the imaginations of [other people]2834-other people will carry [them]2834-other people away to form wrong judgments of [our]1901-our conduct , and to decide on it by slight appearances , one ’s happiness must in some measure be always at the mercy of chance . In the present instance , [this last - arrived lady]1902-this last - arrived lady allowed [her]1902-this last - arrived lady fancy to so far outrun truth and probability , that on merely hearing the name of [the Miss Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods , and understanding [them]1898-her two sisters to be [[Mr. Dashwood]85-mr. dashwood ’s sisters]1903-mr. dashwood ’s sisters , [she]1902-this last - arrived lady immediately concluded [them]1898-her two sisters to be staying in [Harley Street]56-harley street ; and this misconstruction produced within a day or two afterwards , cards of invitation for [them]1898-her two sisters as well as for [[their]1898-her two sisters brother]329-their brother and [sister]438-sister , to a small musical party at [[her]1902-this last - arrived lady house]2805-her house . The consequence of which was , that [Mrs. John Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood was obliged to submit not only to the exceedingly great inconvenience of sending [[her]1902-this last - arrived lady carriage]1709-her carriage for [the Miss Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods , but , what was still worse , must be subject to all the unpleasantness of appearing to treat [them]1898-her two sisters with attention : and who could tell that [they]1898-her two sisters might not expect to go out with [her]1902-this last - arrived lady a second time ? The power of disappointing [them]1898-her two sisters , it was true , must always be [hers]1902-this last - arrived lady . But that was not enough ; for when [people]2770-people are determined on a mode of conduct which [they]2770-people know to be wrong , [they]2770-people feel injured by the expectation of any thing better from [them]2770-people . [Marianne]90-marianne had now been brought by degrees , so much into the habit of going out every day , that it was become a matter of indifference to [her]90-marianne , whether [she]90-marianne went or not : and [she]90-marianne prepared quietly and mechanically for every evening ’s engagement , though without expecting the smallest amusement from any , and very often without knowing , till the last moment , where it was to take [her]90-marianne . To [her]90-marianne dress and appearance [she]90-marianne was grown so perfectly indifferent , as not to bestow half the consideration on it , during the whole of [her]90-marianne toilet , which it received from [Miss Steele]138-lucy in the first five minutes of [their]1909-their being together , when it was finished . Nothing escaped _ [her]90-marianne _ minute observation and general curiosity ; [she]90-marianne saw every thing , and asked every thing ; was never easy till [she]90-marianne knew the price of every part of [Marianne]90-marianne ’s dress ; could have guessed the number of [her]90-marianne gowns altogether with better judgment than [Marianne]90-marianne [herself]90-marianne , and was not without hopes of finding out before [they]1909-their parted , how much [her]90-marianne washing cost per week , and how much [she]90-marianne had every year to spend upon [herself]90-marianne . The impertinence of these kind of scrutinies , moreover , was generally concluded with a compliment , which though meant as its douceur , was considered by [Marianne]90-marianne as the greatest impertinence of all ; for after undergoing an examination into the value and make of [her]90-marianne gown , the colour of [her]90-marianne shoes , and the arrangement of [her]90-marianne hair , [she]90-marianne was almost sure of being told that upon “ [her]90-marianne word [she]90-marianne looked vastly smart , and [she]90-marianne dared to say [she]90-marianne would make a great many conquests . ”[90-marianne] With such encouragement as this , was [she]90-marianne dismissed on the present occasion , to [[her]90-marianne brother]339-her brother ’s carriage ; which [they]1909-their were ready to enter five minutes after [it]1911-it stopped at the door , a punctuality not very agreeable to [[their]1909-their sister - in - law]1710-their sister - in - law , who had preceded [them]1909-their to [the house of [her]1710-their sister - in - law acquaintance]1913-the house of her acquaintance , and was there hoping for some delay on [their]1909-their part that might inconvenience either [herself]90-marianne or [[her]1710-their sister - in - law coachman]1914-her coachman . The events of this evening were not very remarkable . The party , like other musical parties , comprehended [a great many people who had real taste for the performance]1915-a great many people who had real taste for the performance , and [a great many more who had none at all]1916-a great many more who had none at all ; and [the performers]1917-the performers [themselves]1917-the performers were , as usual , in [their]1917-the performers own estimation , and that of [[their]1917-the performers immediate friends]1918-their immediate friends , [the first private performers in [England]14-england]1919-the first private performers in england . As [Elinor]89-elinor was neither musical , nor affecting to be so , [she]89-elinor made no scruple of turning [her]89-elinor eyes from the grand pianoforte , whenever it suited [her]89-elinor , and unrestrained even by the presence of a harp , and violoncello , would fix them at pleasure on any other object in [the room]2842-the room . In one of these excursive glances [she]89-elinor perceived among [a group of young men]1921-a group of young men , [the very [he]1922-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray ’s , who had given [them]1921-a group of young men a lecture on toothpick - cases at [Gray ’s]177-gray ’s]1922-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray ’s . [She]89-elinor perceived [him]1922-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray ’s soon afterwards looking at [herself]89-elinor , and speaking familiarly to [[her]89-elinor brother]339-her brother ; and had just determined to find out [his]1922-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray ’s name from [the latter]325-the latter , when [they]1925-they both came towards [her]89-elinor , and [Mr. Dashwood]85-mr. dashwood introduced [him]1922-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray ’s to [her]89-elinor as [Mr. Robert Ferrars]144-robert . [He]1922-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray ’s addressed [her]89-elinor with easy civility , and twisted [his]1922-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray ’s head into a bow which assured [her]89-elinor as plainly as words could have done , that [he]1922-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray ’s was exactly the coxcomb [she]89-elinor had heard [him]1922-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray ’s described to be by [Lucy]138-lucy . Happy had it been for [her]89-elinor , if [her]89-elinor regard for [Edward]147-edward had depended less on [his]1922-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray ’s own merit , than on the merit of [[his]1922-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray ’s nearest relations]1926-his nearest relations ! For then [[his]1922-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray ’s brother]3045-his brother ’s bow must have given the finishing stroke to what the ill - humour of [[his]1922-the very he , who had given them a lecture on toothpick - cases at gray ’s mother]270-his mother and [sister]438-sister would have begun . But while [she]89-elinor wondered at the difference of [the two young men]1930-the two young men , [she]89-elinor did not find that the emptiness and conceit of [the one]1931-the one , put [her]89-elinor out of all charity with the modesty and worth of the other . Why [they]1930-the two young men _ were _ different , [Robert]144-robert explained to [her]89-elinor [himself]144-robert in the course of a quarter of an hour ’s conversation ; for , talking of [[his]144-robert brother]3045-his brother , and lamenting the extreme _ gaucherie _ which [he]144-robert really believed kept [him]144-robert from mixing in proper society , [he]144-robert candidly and generously attributed it much less to any natural deficiency , than to the misfortune of a private education ; while [he]144-robert [himself]144-robert , though probably without any particular , any material superiority by nature , merely from the advantage of [a public school]1933-a public school , was as well fitted to mix in [the world]2778-the world as [any other man]1935-any other man . “ Upon [my]144-robert soul , ”[144-robert] [he]144-robert added , “ [I]144-robert believe it is nothing more ; and so [I]144-robert often tell [[my]144-robert mother]2771-my mother , when [she]2771-my mother is grieving about it . ‘ [[My]144-robert dear]2750-my dear [Madam]190-madam , ’ [I]144-robert always say to [her]190-madam , ‘ [you]190-madam must make [yourself]190-madam easy . The evil is now irremediable , and it has been entirely [your]190-madam own doing . Why would [you]190-madam be persuaded by [[my]144-robert uncle]3285-my uncle , [Sir Robert]191-sir robert , against [your]190-madam own judgment , to place [Edward]147-edward under private tuition , at the most critical time of [his]147-edward life ? If [you]190-madam had only sent [him]147-edward to [Westminster]58-westminster as well as [myself]144-robert , instead of sending [him]147-edward to [Mr. Pratt]145-mr. pratt ’s , all this would have been prevented . ’ This is the way in which [I]144-robert always consider the matter , and [[my]144-robert mother]2771-my mother is perfectly convinced of [her]2771-my mother error . ”[144-robert] [Elinor]89-elinor would not oppose [his]1936-i opinion , because , whatever might be [her]89-elinor general estimation of the advantage of [a public school]1933-a public school , [she]89-elinor could not think of [Edward]147-edward ’s abode in [[Mr. Pratt]145-mr. pratt ’s family]1938-mr. pratt ’s family , with any satisfaction . “ [You]4020-you reside in [Devonshire]5-devonshire , [I]1936-i think,”—was[1936-i] [his]1936-i next observation , “ in [a cottage near [Dawlish]59-dawlish]4021-a cottage near dawlish . ”[89-elinor] [Elinor]89-elinor set [him]1936-i right as to its situation ; and it seemed rather surprising to [him]1936-i that [anybody]1729-anybody could live in [Devonshire]5-devonshire , without living near [Dawlish]59-dawlish . [He]1936-i bestowed [his]1936-i hearty approbation however on [[their]1940-their species of [house]1942-house]1941-their species of house . “ For [my]1936-i own part , ”[1936-i] said [he]1936-i , “ [I]1936-i am excessively fond of [a cottage]453-a cottage ; there is always so much comfort , so much elegance about [them]453-a cottage . And [I]1936-i protest , if [I]1936-i had any money to spare , [I]1936-i should buy [a little land]4023-a little land and build one [myself]1936-i , within a short distance of [London]24-london , where [I]1936-i might drive [myself]1936-i down at any time , and collect [a few friends]3677-a few friends about [me]1936-i , and be happy . [I]1936-i advise every body who is going to build , to build [a cottage]453-a cottage . [[My]1936-i friend]4026-my friend [Lord Courtland]192-lord courtland came to [me]1936-i the other day on purpose to ask [my]1936-i advice , and laid before [me]1936-i three different plans of [Bonomi]193-bonomi ’s . [I]1936-i was to decide on the best of them . ‘ [[My]1936-i dear]2750-my dear [Courtland]192-lord courtland , ’ said [I]1936-i , immediately throwing [them]4028-them all into the fire , ‘ do not adopt either of [them]4028-them , but by all means build [a cottage]453-a cottage . ’ And that [I]1936-i fancy , will be the end of it . “[1936-i] [Some people]2959-some people imagine that there can be no accommodations , no space in [a cottage]453-a cottage ; but this is all a mistake . [I]0-i was last month at [my]0-i friend [Elliott]194-lady elliott ’s , near [Dartford]60-dartford . [Lady Elliott]194-lady elliott wished to give a dance . ‘ But how can it be done ? ’ said [she]194-lady elliott ; ‘ [[my]0-i dear]2750-my dear [Ferrars]144-robert , do tell [me]0-i how it is to be managed . There is [not a room in [this cottage that will hold]1947-this cottage that will hold [ten couple]1948-ten couple]1946-not a room in this cottage that will hold ten couple , and where can the supper be ? ’ _ [I]0-i _ immediately saw that there could be no difficulty in it , so [I]0-i said , ‘ [[My]0-i dear]2750-my dear [Lady Elliott]194-lady elliott , do not be uneasy . [The dining parlour]1950-the dining parlour will admit [eighteen couple]1951-eighteen couple with ease ; card - tables may be placed in [the drawing - room]1150-the drawing - room ; [the library]1953-the library may be open for tea and other refreshments ; and let the supper be set out in [the saloon]1954-the saloon . ’ [Lady Elliott]194-lady elliott was delighted with the thought . [We]1955-we measured [the dining - room]895-the dining - room , and found [it]895-the dining - room would hold exactly [eighteen couple]1951-eighteen couple , and the affair was arranged precisely after [my]0-i plan . So that , in fact , [you]1958-you see , if [people]2770-people do but know how to set about it , every comfort may be as well enjoyed in [a cottage]453-a cottage as in [the most spacious dwelling]1961-the most spacious dwelling . ” [Elinor]89-elinor agreed to it all , for [she]89-elinor did not think [he]4030-his deserved the compliment of rational opposition . As [John Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood had no more pleasure in music than [[his]4030-his eldest sister]4031-his eldest sister , [his]4030-his mind was equally at liberty to fix on any thing else ; and a thought struck [him]4030-his during the evening , which [he]4030-his communicated to [[his]4030-his wife]280-his wife , for [her]280-his wife approbation , when [they]4033-they got [home]565-home . The consideration of [Mrs. Dennison]195-mrs. dennison ’s mistake , in supposing [[his]4030-his sisters]272-his sisters [[their]272-his sisters guests]4036-their guests , had suggested the propriety of [their]4033-they being really invited to become such , while [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s engagements kept [her]103-mrs. jennings from [home]565-home . The expense would be nothing , the inconvenience not more ; and it was altogether an attention which the delicacy of [his]4030-his conscience pointed out to be requisite to its complete enfranchisement from [his]4030-his promise to [[his]4030-his father]290-his father . [Fanny]93-fanny was startled at the proposal . “[0-i] [I]0-i do not see how it can be done , ” said [she]0-i , “[0-i] without affronting [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton , for [they]1962-them spend every day with [her]100-lady middleton ; otherwise [I]0-i should be exceedingly glad to do it . [You]1963-you know [I]0-i am always ready to pay [them]1962-them any attention in [my]0-i power , as [my]0-i taking [them]1962-them out this evening shows . But [they]1962-them are [[Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton ’s visitors]1964-lady middleton ’s visitors . How can [I]0-i ask [them]1962-them away from [her]100-lady middleton ? ” [[Her]100-lady middleton husband]319-her husband , but with great humility , did not see the force of [her]100-lady middleton objection . “[0-i] [They]1962-them had already spent a week in this manner in [Conduit Street]41-conduit street , and [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton could not be displeased at [their]1962-them giving the same number of days to such near relations . ” [Fanny]93-fanny paused a moment , and then , with fresh vigor , said , “[2785-my love] [[My]0-i love]2785-my love , [I]0-i would ask [them]1962-them with all [my]0-i heart , if it was in [my]0-i power . But [I]0-i had just settled within [myself]0-i to ask [the Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles to spend a few days with [us]1966-us . [They]1962-them are very well behaved , [good kind of girls]1967-good kind of girls ; and [I]0-i think the attention is due to [them]1962-them , as [[their]1962-them uncle]1968-their uncle did so very well by [Edward]147-edward . [We]1966-us can ask [[your]2785-my love sisters]2753-your sisters some other year , [you]2785-my love know ; but [the Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles may not be in [town]2984-town any more . [I]0-i am sure [you]2785-my love will like [them]1962-them ; indeed , [you]2785-my love _ do _ like [them]1962-them , [you]2785-my love know , very much already , and so does [[my]0-i mother]2771-my mother ; and [they]1962-them are such favourites with [Harry]85-mr. dashwood ! ” [Mr. Dashwood]85-mr. dashwood was convinced . [He]85-mr. dashwood saw the necessity of inviting [the Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles immediately , and [his]85-mr. dashwood conscience was pacified by the resolution of inviting [[his]85-mr. dashwood sisters]272-his sisters another year ; at the same time , however , slyly suspecting that another year would make the invitation needless , by bringing [Elinor]89-elinor to [town]2984-town as [[Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon ’s wife]4042-colonel brandon ’s wife , and [Marianne]90-marianne as _ [[their]272-his sisters _ visitor]4043-their _ visitor . [Fanny]93-fanny , rejoicing in [her]93-fanny escape , and proud of the ready wit that had procured it , wrote the next morning to [Lucy]138-lucy , to request [her]93-fanny company and [[her]93-fanny sister]336-her sister ’s , for some days , in [Harley Street]56-harley street , as soon as [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton could spare [them]272-his sisters . This was enough to make [Lucy]138-lucy really and reasonably happy . [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood seemed actually working for [her]93-fanny , [herself]88-mrs. dashwood ; cherishing all [her]88-mrs. dashwood hopes , and promoting all [her]88-mrs. dashwood views ! Such an opportunity of being with [Edward]147-edward and [[his]147-edward family]564-his family was , above all things , the most material to [her]93-fanny interest , and such an invitation the most gratifying to [her]93-fanny feelings ! It was an advantage that could not be too gratefully acknowledged , nor too speedily made use of ; and the visit to [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton , which had not before had any precise limits , was instantly discovered to have been always meant to end in two days ’ time . When the note was shown to [Elinor]89-elinor , as it was within ten minutes after its arrival , it gave [her]89-elinor , for the first time , some share in the expectations of [Lucy]138-lucy ; for such a mark of uncommon kindness , vouchsafed on so short an acquaintance , seemed to declare that the good - will towards [her]93-fanny arose from something more than merely malice against [herself]93-fanny ; and might be brought , by time and address , to do every thing that [Lucy]138-lucy wished . [Her]138-lucy flattery had already subdued the pride of [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton , and made an entry into the close heart of [Mrs. John Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood ; and these were effects that laid open the probability of greater . [The Miss Steeles]137-the miss steeles removed to [Harley Street]56-harley street , and all that reached [Elinor]89-elinor of [their]4046-their influence there , strengthened [her]89-elinor expectation of the event . [Sir John]99-sir john , who called on [them]4046-their more than once , brought [home]565-home such accounts of the favour [they]4046-their were in , as must be universally striking . [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood had never been so much pleased with [any young women]4048-any young women in [her]88-mrs. dashwood life , as [she]88-mrs. dashwood was with [them]4048-any young women ; had given each of [them]4048-any young women a needle book made by [some emigrant]4049-some emigrant ; called [Lucy]138-lucy by [her]138-lucy Christian name ; and did not know whether [she]88-mrs. dashwood should ever be able to part with [them]4048-any young women . END OF THE SECOND VOLUME CHAPTER XXXVII . [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer was so well at the end of a fortnight , that [[her]128-mrs. palmer mother]332-her mother felt it no longer necessary to give up the whole of [her]128-mrs. palmer time to [her]128-mrs. palmer ; and , contenting [herself]128-mrs. palmer with visiting [her]128-mrs. palmer once or twice a day , returned from that period to [[her]128-mrs. palmer own home]4051-her own home , and [her]128-mrs. palmer own habits , in which [she]128-mrs. palmer found [the Miss Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods very ready to resume [their]4048-any young women former share . About the third or fourth morning after [their]4048-any young women being thus resettled in [Berkeley Street]40-berkeley street , [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , on returning from [her]128-mrs. palmer ordinary visit to [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer , entered [the drawing - room]1150-the drawing - room , where [Elinor]89-elinor was sitting by [herself]89-elinor , with an air of such hurrying importance as prepared [her]89-elinor to hear something wonderful ; and giving [her]89-elinor time only to form that idea , began directly to justify it , by saying , “[1972-lord] [Lord]1972-lord ! [[my]0-i dear]2750-my dear [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood ! have [you]84-miss dashwood heard the news ? ” “[84-miss dashwood] No , [ma’am]2974-ma’am . What is it ? ” “[2974-ma’am] Something so strange ! But [you]84-miss dashwood shall hear it all . When [I]0-i got to [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer ’s , [I]0-i found [Charlotte]127-charlotte quite in a fuss about [the child]1205-the child . [She]127-charlotte was sure it was very ill — it cried , and fretted , and was all over pimples . So [I]0-i looked at it directly , and , ‘ Lord ! [[my]0-i dear]2750-my dear , ’ says [I]0-i , ‘ it is nothing in [the world]2778-the world , but the red gum ; ’ and [nurse]1978-nurse said just the same . But [Charlotte]127-charlotte , [she]127-charlotte would not be satisfied , so [Mr. Donavan]196-mr. donavan was sent for ; and luckily [he]196-mr. donavan happened to just come in from [Harley Street]56-harley street , so [he]196-mr. donavan stepped over directly , and as soon as ever [he]196-mr. donavan saw [the child]1205-the child , [he]196-mr. donavan said just as [we]1980-we did , that it was nothing in [the world]2778-the world but the red gum , and then [Charlotte]127-charlotte was easy . And so , just as [he]196-mr. donavan was going away again , it came into [my]0-i head , [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i do not know how [I]0-i happened to think of it , but it came into [my]0-i head to ask [him]196-mr. donavan if there was any news . So upon that , [he]196-mr. donavan smirked , and simpered , and looked grave , and seemed to know something or other , and at last [he]196-mr. donavan said in a whisper , ‘ For fear any unpleasant report should reach [the young ladies under [your]0-i care]1982-the young ladies under your care as to [[their]1982-the young ladies under your care sister]1983-their sister ’s indisposition , [I]0-i think it advisable to say , that [I]0-i believe there is no great reason for alarm ; [I]0-i hope [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood will do very well . ’ ” “[88-mrs. dashwood] What ! is [Fanny]93-fanny ill ? ” “[0-i] That is exactly what [I]0-i said , [[my]0-i dear]2750-my dear . ‘ [Lord]1985-lord ! ’ says [I]0-i , ‘ is [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood ill ? ’ So then it all came out ; and the long and the short of the matter , by all [I]0-i can learn , seems to be this . [Mr. Edward Ferrars]94-edward , the very young man [I]0-i used to joke with [you]0-i about ( but however , as it turns out , [I]0-i am monstrous glad there was never any thing in it ) , [Mr. Edward Ferrars]94-edward , it seems , has been engaged above this twelvemonth to [[my]0-i cousin]3777-my cousin [Lucy!—There]197-lucy!—there ’s for [you]0-i , [[my]0-i dear]2750-my dear ! And not [a creature knowing a syllable of the matter]1988-a creature knowing a syllable of the matter , except [Nancy]143-nancy ! Could [you]0-i have believed such a thing possible ? There is no great wonder in [their]1989-them liking [one another]1089-one another ; but that matters should be brought so forward between [them]1989-them , and [nobody]2922-nobody suspect it ! _ That _ is strange ! [I]0-i never happened to see [them]1989-them together , or [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i should have found it out directly . Well , and so this was kept a great secret , for fear of [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward , and neither [she]98-edward nor [[your]0-i brother]3364-your brother or [sister]438-sister suspected a word of the matter : till this very morning , poor [Nancy]143-nancy , who , [you]0-i know , is [a well - meaning creature]1994-a well - meaning creature , but [no conjurer]1995-no conjurer , popt it all out . ‘ [Lord]1996-lord ! ’ thinks [she]143-nancy to [herself]143-nancy , ‘ [they]1989-them are all so fond of [Lucy]138-lucy , to be sure [they]1989-them will make no difficulty about it ; ’ and so , away [she]143-nancy went to [[your]0-i sister]2815-your sister , who was sitting all alone at [her]2815-your sister carpet - work , little suspecting what was to come — for [she]143-nancy had just been saying to [[your]0-i brother]3364-your brother , only five minutes before , that [she]143-nancy thought to make a match between [Edward]98-edward and [[some Lord]1999-some lord ’s daughter]2000-some lord ’s daughter or other , [I]0-i forget who . So [you]0-i may think what a blow it was to all [her]143-nancy vanity and pride . [She]143-nancy fell into violent hysterics immediately , with such screams as reached [[your]0-i brother]3364-your brother ’s ears , as [he]3364-your brother was sitting in [[his]3364-your brother own dressing - room]2002-his own dressing - room down [stairs]933-stairs , thinking about writing a letter to [[his]3364-your brother steward]2004-his steward in [the country]612-the country . So up [he]3364-your brother flew directly , and a terrible scene took place , for [Lucy]138-lucy was come to [them]2006-them by that time , little dreaming what was going on . [Poor soul]3649-poor soul ! [I]0-i pity _ [her]143-nancy _ . And [I]0-i must say , [I]0-i think [she]143-nancy was used very hardly ; for [[your]0-i sister]2815-your sister scolded like any fury , and soon drove [her]143-nancy into a fainting fit . [Nancy]143-nancy , [she]143-nancy fell upon [her]143-nancy knees , and cried bitterly ; and [[your]0-i brother]3364-your brother , [he]3364-your brother walked about [the room]2842-the room , and said [he]3364-your brother did not know what to do . [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood declared [they]2006-them should not stay a minute longer in [the house]318-the house , and [[your]0-i brother]3364-your brother was forced to go down upon _ [his]3364-your brother _ knees too , to persuade [her]88-mrs. dashwood to let [them]2006-them stay till [they]2006-them had packed up [their]2006-them clothes . _ Then _ [she]88-mrs. dashwood fell into hysterics again , and [he]3364-your brother was so frightened that [he]3364-your brother would send for [Mr. Donavan]196-mr. donavan , and [Mr. Donavan]196-mr. donavan found [the house]318-the house in all this uproar . [The carriage]1118-the carriage was at the door ready to take [[my]0-i poor cousins]2015-my poor cousins away , and [they]2015-my poor cousins were just stepping in as [he]3364-your brother came off ; poor [Lucy]138-lucy in such a condition , [he]3364-your brother says , [she]138-lucy could hardly walk ; and [Nancy]143-nancy , [she]143-nancy was almost as bad . [I]0-i declare , [I]0-i have no patience with [[your]2016-your sister]2815-your sister ; and [I]0-i hope , with all [my]0-i heart , it will be a match in spite of [her]2815-your sister . [Lord]2018-lord ! what a taking poor [Mr. Edward]94-edward will be in when [he]94-edward hears of it ! To have [his]94-edward love used so scornfully ! for [they]2015-my poor cousins say [he]94-edward is monstrous fond of [her]2815-your sister , as well [he]94-edward may . [I]0-i should not wonder , if [he]94-edward was to be in the greatest passion!—and [Mr. Donavan]196-mr. donavan thinks just the same . [He]94-edward and [I]0-i had a great deal of talk about it ; and the best of all is , that [he]94-edward is gone back again to [Harley Street]56-harley street , that [he]94-edward may be within call when [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward is told of it , for [she]2815-your sister was sent for as soon as ever [[my]0-i cousins]3333-my cousins left [the house]318-the house , for [[your]2021-your sister]2815-your sister was sure _ [she]2815-your sister _ would be in hysterics too ; and so [she]2815-your sister may , for what [I]0-i care . [I]0-i have no pity for either of [them]3333-my cousins . [I]0-i have no notion of [people]2770-people ’s making such a to - do about money and greatness . There is no reason on earth why [Mr. Edward]94-edward and [Lucy]138-lucy should not marry ; for [I]0-i am sure [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward may afford to do very well by [[her]98-edward son]1054-her son , and though [Lucy]138-lucy has next to nothing [herself]138-lucy , [she]138-lucy knows better than [any body]2025-any body how to make the most of every thing ; [I]0-i dare say , if [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward would only allow [him]94-edward five hundred a - year , [she]98-edward would make as good an appearance with it as [any body else]2930-any body else would with eight . [Lord]2027-lord ! how snug [they]3333-my cousins might live in [such another cottage]2028-such another cottage as [yours]2029-yours — or a little bigger — with [two maids]498-two maids , and [two men]2031-two men ; and [I]0-i believe [I]0-i could help [them]3333-my cousins to [a housemaid]2032-a housemaid , for [[my]0-i [Betty]150-eliza]2033-my betty has [a sister]3914-a sister out of place , that would fit [them]3333-my cousins exactly . ” Here [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ceased , and as [Elinor]89-elinor had had time enough to collect [her]89-elinor thoughts , [she]89-elinor was able to give such an answer , and make such observations , as the subject might naturally be supposed to produce . Happy to find that [she]89-elinor was not suspected of any extraordinary interest in it ; that [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ( as [she]89-elinor had of late often hoped might be the case ) had ceased to imagine [her]89-elinor at all attached to [Edward]98-edward ; and happy above all the rest , in the absence of [Marianne]90-marianne , [she]89-elinor felt very well able to speak of the affair without embarrassment , and to give [her]89-elinor judgment , as [she]89-elinor believed , with impartiality on the conduct of [every one concerned in it]4053-every one concerned in it . [She]89-elinor could hardly determine what [her]89-elinor own expectation of its event really was ; though [she]89-elinor earnestly tried to drive away the notion of its being possible to end otherwise at last , than in the marriage of [Edward]98-edward and [Lucy]138-lucy . What [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward would say and do , though there could not be a doubt of its nature , [she]89-elinor was anxious to hear ; and still more anxious to know how [Edward]98-edward would conduct [himself]98-edward . For _ [him]4054-him _ [she]89-elinor felt much compassion;—for [Lucy]138-lucy very little — and it cost [her]89-elinor some pains to procure that little;—for the rest of [the party]577-the party none at all . As [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings could talk on no other subject , [Elinor]89-elinor soon saw the necessity of preparing [Marianne]90-marianne for its discussion . No time was to be lost in undeceiving [her]89-elinor , in making [her]89-elinor acquainted with the real truth , and in endeavouring to bring [her]89-elinor to hear it talked of by [others]2961-others , without betraying that [she]89-elinor felt any uneasiness for [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister , or any resentment against [Edward]98-edward . [[Elinor]89-elinor ’s office]4058-elinor ’s office was a painful one.—She was going to remove what [she]89-elinor really believed to be [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister ’s chief consolation,—to give such particulars of [Edward]98-edward as [she]89-elinor feared would ruin [him]4060-him for ever in [her]89-elinor good opinion,-and to make [Marianne]90-marianne , by a resemblance in [their]4061-their situations , which to _ [her]89-elinor _ fancy would seem strong , feel all [her]89-elinor own disappointment over again . But unwelcome as such a task must be , it was necessary to be done , and [Elinor]89-elinor therefore hastened to perform it . [She]89-elinor was very far from wishing to dwell on [her]89-elinor own feelings , or to represent [herself]89-elinor as suffering much , any otherwise than as the self - command [she]89-elinor had practised since [her]89-elinor first knowledge of [Edward]98-edward ’s engagement , might suggest a hint of what was practicable to [Marianne]90-marianne . [Her]89-elinor narration was clear and simple ; and though it could not be given without emotion , it was not accompanied by violent agitation , nor impetuous grief . _ That _ belonged rather to [the hearer]4062-the hearer , for [Marianne]90-marianne listened with horror , and cried excessively . [Elinor]89-elinor was to be the comforter of others in [her]89-elinor own distresses , no less than in [theirs]4061-their ; and all the comfort that could be given by assurances of [her]89-elinor own composure of mind , and a very earnest vindication of [Edward]98-edward from every charge but of imprudence , was readily offered . But [Marianne]90-marianne for some time would give credit to neither . [Edward]98-edward seemed [a second Willoughby]107-willoughby ; and acknowledging as [Elinor]89-elinor did , that [she]89-elinor _ had _ loved [him]107-willoughby most sincerely , could [she]89-elinor feel less than [herself]89-elinor ! As for [Lucy Steele]138-lucy , [she]138-lucy considered [her]138-lucy so totally unamiable , so absolutely incapable of attaching [a sensible man]2933-a sensible man , that [she]138-lucy could not be persuaded at first to believe , and afterwards to pardon , any former affection of [Edward]98-edward for [her]138-lucy . [She]138-lucy would not even admit it to have been natural ; and [Elinor]89-elinor left [her]138-lucy to be convinced that it was so , by that which only could convince [her]138-lucy , a better knowledge of [mankind]4064-mankind . [Her]138-lucy first communication had reached no farther than to state the fact of the engagement , and the length of time it had [existed.—Marianne]198-existed.—marianne ’s feelings had then broken in , and put an end to all regularity of detail ; and for some time all that could be done was to soothe [her]138-lucy distress , lessen [her]138-lucy alarms , and combat [her]138-lucy resentment . The first question on [her]138-lucy side , which led to farther particulars , was , — “[2036-he] How long has this been known to [you]2035-you , [Elinor]89-elinor ? has [he]2036-he written to [you]2035-you ? ” “[2036-he] [I]0-i have known it these four months . When [Lucy]138-lucy first came to [Barton Park]6-barton park last November , [she]138-lucy told [me]0-i in confidence of [her]138-lucy engagement . ” At these words , [Marianne]90-marianne ’s eyes expressed the astonishment which [her]90-marianne lips could not utter . After a pause of wonder , [she]90-marianne exclaimed — “[138-lucy] Four months!—Have [you]2035-you known of this four months ? ” [Elinor]89-elinor confirmed it . “[2035-you] What ! while attending [me]0-i in all [my]0-i misery , has this been on [your]2035-you heart ? And [I]0-i have reproached [you]2035-you for being happy ! ” “[0-i] It was not fit that [you]2035-you should then know how much [I]0-i was [the reverse]2037-the reverse ! ” “[2037-the reverse] Four months ! ” cried [Marianne]90-marianne again . “[2037-the reverse] So calm ! so cheerful ! How have [you]2035-you been supported ? ” “[2035-you] By feeling that [I]0-i was doing [my]0-i duty.—My promise to [Lucy]138-lucy , obliged [me]0-i to be secret . [I]0-i owed it to [her]138-lucy , therefore , to avoid giving any hint of the truth ; and [I]0-i owed it to [[my]0-i family]3220-my family and [friends]3231-friends , not to create in [them]2040-them a solicitude about [me]0-i , which it could not be in [my]0-i power to satisfy . ” [Marianne]90-marianne seemed much struck . “[0-i] [I]0-i have very often wished to undeceive [yourself]2041-you and [[my]0-i mother]2771-my mother , ” added [Elinor]89-elinor ; “[0-i] and once or twice [I]0-i have attempted it;—but without betraying [my]0-i trust , [I]0-i never could have convinced [you]2041-you . ” “[0-i] Four months ! and yet [you]2041-you loved [him]2043-him ! ” “[2041-you] Yes . But [I]0-i did not love only [him]2043-him ; and while the comfort of [others]2961-others was dear to [me]0-i , [I]0-i was glad to spare [them]2961-others from knowing how much [I]0-i felt . Now , [I]0-i can think and speak of it with little emotion . [I]0-i would not have [you]2041-you suffer on [my]0-i account ; for [I]0-i assure [you]2041-you [I]0-i no longer suffer materially [myself]0-i . [I]0-i have many things to support [me]0-i . [I]0-i am not conscious of having provoked the disappointment by any imprudence of [my]0-i own , [I]0-i have borne it as much as possible without spreading it farther . [I]0-i acquit [Edward]98-edward of essential misconduct . [I]0-i wish [him]2045-he very happy ; and [I]0-i am so sure of [his]2045-he always doing [his]2045-he duty , that though now [he]2045-he may harbour some regret , in the end [he]2045-he must become so . [Lucy]138-lucy does not want sense , and that is the foundation on which every thing good may be built . And after all , [Marianne]90-marianne , after all that is bewitching in the idea of a single and constant attachment , and all that can be said of [one]2761-one ’s happiness depending entirely on [any particular person]2047-any particular person , it is not meant — it is not fit — it is not possible that it should be so . [Edward]98-edward will marry [Lucy]138-lucy ; [he]2045-he will marry [a woman superior in person]2048-a woman superior in person and understanding to half [her]2048-a woman superior in person sex ; and time and habit will teach [him]2045-he to forget that [he]2045-he ever thought [another superior to _ [her]2048-a woman superior in person _]2049-another superior to _ her _ . ” “[2050-you] If such is [your]2050-you way of thinking , ” said [Marianne]90-marianne , “[2050-you] if the loss of what is most valued is so easily to be made up by something else , [your]2050-you resolution , [your]2050-you self - command , are , perhaps , a little less to be wondered at.—They are brought more within [my]0-i comprehension . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i understand [you]2050-you . [You]2050-you do not suppose that [I]0-i have ever felt much . For four months , [Marianne]90-marianne , [I]0-i have had all this hanging on [my]0-i mind , without being at liberty to speak of it to [a single creature]2051-a single creature ; knowing that it would make [you]2050-you and [[my]0-i mother]2771-my mother most unhappy whenever it were explained to [you]2050-you , yet unable to prepare [you]2050-you for it in the least . It was told [me,—it]2053-me,—it was in a manner forced on [me]0-i by [the very person]1776-the very person [herself]1776-the very person , whose prior engagement ruined all [my]0-i prospects ; and told [me]0-i , as [I]0-i thought , with triumph . [This person]2055-this person ’s suspicions , therefore , [I]0-i have had to oppose , by endeavouring to appear indifferent where [I]0-i have been most deeply interested ; and it has not been only once ; [I]0-i have had [her]1776-the very person hopes and exultation to listen to again and again . [I]0-i have known [myself]0-i to be divided from [Edward]98-edward for ever , without hearing one circumstance that could make [me]0-i less desire the connection . Nothing has proved [him]2056-him unworthy ; nor has anything declared [him]2056-him indifferent to [me]0-i . [I]0-i have had to contend against the unkindness of [[his]2056-him sister]251-his sister , and the insolence of [[his]2056-him mother]270-his mother ; and have suffered the punishment of an attachment , without enjoying its advantages . And all this has been going on at a time , when , as [you]2059-you know too well , it has not been [my]0-i only unhappiness . If [you]2059-you can think [me]0-i capable of ever feeling , surely [you]2059-you may suppose that [I]0-i have suffered _ now _ . The composure of mind with which [I]0-i have brought [myself]0-i at present to consider the matter , the consolation that [I]0-i have been willing to admit , have been the effect of constant and painful exertion ; they did not spring up of themselves ; they did not occur to relieve [my]0-i spirits at first . No , [Marianne]90-marianne . _ Then _ , if [I]0-i had not been bound to silence , perhaps nothing could have kept [me]0-i entirely — not even what [I]0-i owed to [[my]0-i dearest friends]2060-my dearest friends — from openly showing that [I]0-i was _ very _ unhappy . ” [Marianne]90-marianne was quite subdued . “[0-i] Oh ! [Elinor]89-elinor , ” [she]0-i cried , “[89-elinor] [you]89-elinor have made [me]0-i hate [myself]0-i for ever.—How barbarous have [I]0-i been to [you!—you]89-elinor , who have been [my]0-i only comfort , who have borne with [me]0-i in all [my]0-i misery , who have seemed to be only suffering for me!—Is this [my]0-i gratitude?—Is this the only return [I]0-i can make you?—Because [your]89-elinor merit cries out upon [myself]0-i , [I]0-i have been trying to do it away . ” The tenderest caresses followed this confession . In such a frame of mind as [she]90-marianne was now in , [Elinor]89-elinor had no difficulty in obtaining from [her]90-marianne whatever promise [she]90-marianne required ; and at [her]90-marianne request , [Marianne]90-marianne engaged never to speak of the affair to [any one with the least appearance of bitterness]4065-any one with the least appearance of bitterness ; to meet [Lucy]138-lucy without betraying the smallest increase of dislike to [her]138-lucy ; and even to see [Edward]98-edward [himself]98-edward , if chance should bring [them]4066-them together , without any diminution of [her]90-marianne usual cordiality . These were great concessions ; but where [Marianne]90-marianne felt that [she]90-marianne had injured , no reparation could be too much for [her]90-marianne to make . [She]90-marianne performed [her]90-marianne promise of being discreet , to admiration.—She attended to all that [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings had to say upon the subject , with an unchanging complexion , dissented from [her]90-marianne in nothing , and was heard three times to say , “[0-i] Yes , [ma’am]2974-ma’am . ”—She listened to [her]103-mrs. jennings praise of [Lucy]138-lucy with only moving from one chair to another , and when [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings talked of [Edward]98-edward ’s affection , it cost [her]103-mrs. jennings only a spasm in [her]103-mrs. jennings throat.—Such advances towards heroism in [[her]103-mrs. jennings sister]336-her sister , made [Elinor]89-elinor feel equal to any thing [herself]89-elinor . The next morning brought a farther trial of it , in a visit from [[their]2063-their brother]329-their brother , who came with a most serious aspect to talk over the dreadful affair , and bring [them]2063-their news of [[his]329-their brother wife]280-his wife . “[0-i] [You]2062-he have heard , [I]0-i suppose , ” said [he]329-their brother with great solemnity , as soon as [he]329-their brother was seated , “[0-i] of the very shocking discovery that took place under [our]2063-their roof yesterday . ” [They]2063-their all looked [their]2063-their assent ; it seemed too awful a moment for speech . “[2062-he] [[Your]2062-he sister]2815-your sister , ” [he]329-their brother continued , “[2062-he] has suffered dreadfully . [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward too — in short it has been a scene of such complicated distress — but [I]0-i will hope that the storm may be weathered without [our]2063-their being any of [us]2063-their quite overcome . [Poor Fanny]93-fanny ! [she]93-fanny was in hysterics all yesterday . But [I]0-i would not alarm [you]2062-he too much . [Donavan]196-mr. donavan says there is nothing materially to be apprehended ; [her]93-fanny constitution is a good one , and [her]93-fanny resolution equal to any thing . [She]93-fanny has borne it all , with the fortitude of [an angel]2065-an angel ! [She]93-fanny says [she]93-fanny never shall think well of [anybody]1729-anybody again ; and [one]2761-one can not wonder at it , after being so deceived!—meeting with such ingratitude , where so much kindness had been shown , so much confidence had been placed ! It was quite out of the benevolence of [her]93-fanny heart , that [she]93-fanny had asked [these young women]2068-these young women to [[her]93-fanny house]2805-her house ; merely because [she]93-fanny thought [they]2068-these young women deserved some attention , were [harmless , well - behaved girls]2070-harmless , well - behaved girls , and would be [pleasant companions]2071-pleasant companions ; for otherwise [we]2072-we both wished very much to have invited [you]2062-he and [Marianne]90-marianne to be with [us]2072-we , while [[your]2062-he kind friend]2073-your kind friend there , was attending [[her]93-fanny daughter]404-her daughter . And now to be so rewarded ! ‘ [I]0-i wish , with all [my]0-i heart , ’ says [poor Fanny]93-fanny in [her]0-i affectionate way , ‘ that [we]2072-we had asked [[your]2062-he sisters]2753-your sisters instead of [them]2753-your sisters . ’ ” Here [he]2062-he stopped to be thanked ; which being done , [he]2062-he went on . “[0-i] What [poor Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward suffered , when first [Fanny]93-fanny broke it to [her]98-edward , is not to be described . While [she]93-fanny with the truest affection had been planning a most eligible connection for [him]2062-he , was it to be supposed that [he]2062-he could be all the time secretly engaged to [another person!—such]2076-another person!—such a suspicion could never have entered [her]93-fanny head ! If [she]93-fanny suspected _ any _ prepossession elsewhere , it could not be in _ that _ quarter . ‘ _ There _ , to be sure , ’ said [she]93-fanny , ‘ [I]0-i might have thought [myself]0-i safe . ’ [She]93-fanny was quite in an agony . [We]2072-we consulted together , however , as to what should be done , and at last [she]93-fanny determined to send for [Edward]98-edward . [He]2062-he came . But [I]0-i am sorry to relate what ensued . All that [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward could say to make [him]2062-he put an end to the engagement , assisted too as [you]2077-you may well suppose by [my]0-i arguments , and [Fanny]93-fanny ’s entreaties , was of no avail . Duty , affection , every thing was disregarded . [I]0-i never thought [Edward]98-edward so stubborn , so unfeeling before . [[His]2062-he mother]270-his mother explained to [him]2062-he [her]270-his mother liberal designs , in case of [his]2062-he marrying [Miss Morton]178-miss morton ; told [him]2062-he [she]270-his mother would settle on [him]2062-he the [Norfolk]61-norfolk estate , which , clear of land - tax , brings in a good thousand a - year ; offered even , when matters grew desperate , to make it twelve hundred ; and in opposition to this , if [he]2062-he still persisted in this low connection , represented to [him]2062-he the certain penury that must attend the match . [His]2062-he own two thousand pounds [she]270-his mother protested should be [his]2062-he all ; [she]270-his mother would never see [him]2062-he again ; and so far would [she]270-his mother be from affording [him]2062-he the smallest assistance , that if [he]2062-he were to enter into any profession with a view of better support , [she]270-his mother would do all in [her]270-his mother power to prevent [him]2062-he advancing in it . ” Here [Marianne]90-marianne , in an ecstasy of indignation , clapped [her]90-marianne hands together , and cried , “[270-his mother] [Gracious God]154-god ! can this be possible ! ” “[270-his mother] Well may [you]270-his mother wonder , [Marianne]90-marianne , ” replied [[her]90-marianne brother]339-her brother , “[270-his mother] at the obstinacy which could resist such arguments as these . [Your]90-marianne exclamation is very natural . ” [Marianne]90-marianne was going to retort , but [she]90-marianne remembered [her]90-marianne promises , and forbore . “[90-marianne] All this , however , ” [he]339-her brother continued , “[2062-he] was urged in vain . [Edward]98-edward said very little ; but what [he]2062-he did say , was in the most determined manner . Nothing should prevail on [him]2062-he to give up [his]2062-he engagement . [He]2062-he would stand to it , cost [him]2062-he what it might . ” “[2062-he] Then , ” cried [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings with blunt sincerity , no longer able to be silent , “[2062-he] [he]2062-he has acted like [an honest man]2079-an honest man ! [I]0-i beg [your]2080-you pardon , [Mr. Dashwood]85-mr. dashwood , but if [he]2062-he had done otherwise , [I]0-i should have thought [him]2062-he [a rascal]2081-a rascal . [I]0-i have some little concern in the business , as well as [yourself]2080-you , for [Lucy Steele]138-lucy is [[my]0-i cousin]3777-my cousin , and [I]0-i believe there is not [a better kind of girl in [the world]2778-the world]2083-a better kind of girl in the world , nor one who more deserves [a good husband]2085-a good husband . ” [John Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood was greatly astonished ; but [his]2062-he nature was calm , not open to provocation , and [he]2062-he never wished to offend [anybody]1729-anybody , especially [anybody of good fortune]4072-anybody of good fortune . [He]2062-he therefore replied , without any resentment , “[0-i] [I]0-i would by no means speak disrespectfully of any relation of [yours]2080-you , [madam]2086-madam . [Miss Lucy Steele]138-lucy is , [I]0-i dare say , [a very deserving young woman]2087-a very deserving young woman , but in the present case [you]2080-you know , the connection must be impossible . And to have entered into a secret engagement with [a young man under [[her]138-lucy uncle]3772-her uncle ’s care]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care , [the son of [a woman especially of such very large fortune]2091-a woman especially of such very large fortune as [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward]2090-the son of a woman especially of such very large fortune as mrs. ferrars , is perhaps , altogether a little extraordinary . In short , [I]0-i do not mean to reflect upon the behaviour of [any person whom [you]2080-you have a regard for]2092-any person whom you have a regard for , [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings . [We]2093-we all wish [her]98-edward extremely happy ; and [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward ’s conduct throughout the whole , has been such as [every conscientious , good mother]2094-every conscientious , good mother , in like circumstances , would adopt . It has been dignified and liberal . [Edward]98-edward has drawn [his]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care own lot , and [I]0-i fear it will be a bad one . ” [Marianne]90-marianne sighed out [her]90-marianne similar apprehension ; and [Elinor]89-elinor ’s heart wrung for the feelings of [Edward]98-edward , while braving [[his]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care mother]270-his mother ’s threats , for [a woman who could not reward [him]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care]4074-a woman who could not reward him . “[2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care] Well , [sir]2095-sir , ” said [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , “[2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care] and how did it end ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am sorry to say , [ma’am]2974-ma’am , in a most unhappy rupture:—Edward is dismissed for ever from [[his]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care mother]270-his mother ’s notice . [He]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care left [[her]270-his mother house]2805-her house yesterday , but where [he]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care is gone , or whether [he]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care is still in [town]2984-town , [I]0-i do not know ; for _ [we]2100-we _ of course can make no inquiry . ” “[2100-we] [Poor young man!—and]2101-poor young man!—and what is to become of [him]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care ? ” “[2101-poor young man!—and] What , indeed , [ma’am]2974-ma’am ! It is a melancholy consideration . Born to the prospect of such affluence ! [I]0-i can not conceive a situation more deplorable . The interest of two thousand pounds — how can [a man]499-a man live on it?—and when to that is added the recollection , that [he]499-a man might , but for [his]499-a man own folly , within three months have been in the receipt of two thousand , five hundred a - year ( for [Miss Morton]178-miss morton has thirty thousand pounds , ) [I]0-i can not picture to [myself]0-i a more wretched condition . [We]2100-we must all feel for [him]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care ; and the more so , because it is totally out of [our]2100-we power to assist [him]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care . ” “[2104-poor young man] [Poor young man]2104-poor young man ! ” cried [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , “[2104-poor young man] [I]0-i am sure [he]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care should be very welcome to bed and board at [[my]0-i house]2105-my house ; and so [I]0-i would tell [him]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care if [I]0-i could see [him]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care . It is not fit that [he]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care should be living about at [his]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care own charge now , at [lodgings]2106-lodgings and [taverns]2107-taverns . ” [Elinor]89-elinor ’s heart thanked [her]0-i for such kindness towards [Edward]98-edward , though [she]89-elinor could not forbear smiling at the form of it . “[2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care] If [he]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care would only have done as well by [himself]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care , ” said [John Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood , “[2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care] as all [[his]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care friends]2872-his friends were disposed to do by [him]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care , [he]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care might now have been in [his]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care proper situation , and would have wanted for nothing . But as it is , it must be out of [anybody]1729-anybody ’s power to assist [him]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care . And there is one thing more preparing against [him]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care , which must be worse than all — [[his]2088-a young man under her uncle ’s care mother]270-his mother has determined , with a very natural kind of spirit , to settle _ that _ estate upon [Robert]144-robert immediately , which might have been [Edward]98-edward ’s , on proper conditions . [I]0-i left [her]270-his mother this morning with [[her]270-his mother lawyer]2111-her lawyer , talking over the business . ” “[0-i] Well ! ” said [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , “[0-i] that is _ [her]270-his mother _ revenge . [Everybody]3862-everybody has a way of [their]3862-everybody own .
