But [I]0-i do n’t think [mine]0-i would be , to make [one son]265-one son independent , because another had plagued [me]0-i . ” [Marianne]90-marianne got up and walked about [the room]2842-the room . “[0-i] Can anything be more galling to the spirit of [a man]499-a man , ” continued [John]88-mrs. dashwood , “[499-a man] than to see [[his]499-a man younger brother]2115-his younger brother in possession of an estate which might have been [his]499-a man own ? [Poor Edward]147-edward ! [I]0-i feel for [him]147-edward sincerely . ” A few minutes more spent in the same kind of effusion , concluded [his]499-a man visit ; and with repeated assurances to [[his]499-a man sisters]272-his sisters that [he]499-a man really believed there was no material danger in [Fanny]93-fanny ’s indisposition , and that [they]272-his sisters need not therefore be very uneasy about it , [he]499-a man went away ; leaving [the three ladies]4077-the three ladies unanimous in [their]4077-the three ladies sentiments on the present occasion , as far at least as it regarded [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward ’s conduct , [the Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods ’ , and [Edward]98-edward ’s . [Marianne]90-marianne ’s indignation burst forth as soon as [he]499-a man quitted [the room]2842-the room ; and as [her]90-marianne vehemence made reserve impossible in [Elinor]89-elinor , and unnecessary in [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , [they]4077-the three ladies all joined in a very spirited critique upon the party . CHAPTER XXXVIII . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings was very warm in [her]103-mrs. jennings praise of [Edward]98-edward ’s conduct , but only [Elinor]89-elinor and [Marianne]90-marianne understood its true merit . _ [They]4077-the three ladies _ only knew how little [he]499-a man had had to tempt [him]499-a man to be disobedient , and how small was the consolation , beyond the consciousness of doing right , that could remain to [him]499-a man in the loss of [friends]3231-friends and fortune . [Elinor]89-elinor gloried in [his]499-a man integrity ; and [Marianne]90-marianne forgave all [his]499-a man offences in compassion for [his]499-a man punishment . But though confidence between [them]4077-the three ladies was , by this public discovery , restored to its proper state , it was not a subject on which [either of [them]4077-the three ladies]1669-either of them were fond of dwelling when alone . [Elinor]89-elinor avoided it upon principle , as tending to fix still more upon [her]89-elinor thoughts , by the too warm , too positive assurances of [Marianne]90-marianne , that belief of [Edward]98-edward ’s continued affection for [herself]89-elinor which [she]89-elinor rather wished to do away ; and [Marianne]90-marianne ’s courage soon failed [her]89-elinor , in trying to converse upon a topic which always left [her]89-elinor more dissatisfied with [herself]89-elinor than ever , by the comparison it necessarily produced between [Elinor]89-elinor ’s conduct and [her]89-elinor own . [She]89-elinor felt all the force of that comparison ; but not as [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister had hoped , to urge [her]89-elinor to exertion now ; [she]89-elinor felt it with all the pain of continual self - reproach , regretted most bitterly that [she]89-elinor had never exerted [herself]89-elinor before ; but it brought only the torture of penitence , without the hope of amendment . [Her]89-elinor mind was so much weakened that [she]89-elinor still fancied present exertion impossible , and therefore it only dispirited [her]89-elinor more . Nothing new was heard by [them]4082-them , for a day or two afterwards , of affairs in [Harley Street]56-harley street , or [[Bartlett]182-bartlett ’s Buildings]4083-bartlett ’s buildings . But though so much of the matter was known to [them]4082-them already , that [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings might have had enough to do in spreading that knowledge farther , without seeking after more , [she]89-elinor had resolved from the first to pay a visit of comfort and inquiry to [[her]89-elinor cousins]1200-her cousins as soon as [she]89-elinor could ; and nothing but the hindrance of [more visitors than usual]4085-more visitors than usual , had prevented [her]89-elinor going to [them]4082-them within that time . The third day succeeding [their]4082-them knowledge of the particulars , was so fine , so beautiful a Sunday as to draw many to [Kensington Gardens]62-kensington gardens , though it was only the second week in March . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings and [Elinor]89-elinor were of the number ; but [Marianne]90-marianne , who knew that [the Willoughbys]175-the willoughbys were again in [town]2984-town , and had a constant dread of meeting [them]175-the willoughbys , chose rather to stay at [home]565-home , than venture into so public a place . [An intimate acquaintance of [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings]4088-an intimate acquaintance of mrs. jennings joined [them]4082-them soon after [they]4082-them entered [the Gardens]4089-the gardens , and [Elinor]89-elinor was not sorry that by [her]89-elinor continuing with [them]175-the willoughbys , and engaging all [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s conversation , [she]89-elinor was [herself]89-elinor left to quiet reflection . [She]89-elinor saw nothing of [the Willoughbys]175-the willoughbys , nothing of [Edward]98-edward , and for some time nothing of [anybody who could by any chance whether grave or gay]4090-anybody who could by any chance whether grave or gay , be interesting to [her]89-elinor . But at last [she]89-elinor found [herself]89-elinor with some surprise , accosted by [Miss Steele]138-lucy , who , though looking rather shy , expressed great satisfaction in meeting [them]175-the willoughbys , and on receiving encouragement from the particular kindness of [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , left [her]138-lucy own party for a short time , to join [[their]175-the willoughbys ’s]4091-their ’s . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings immediately whispered to [Elinor]89-elinor , “[0-i] Get it all out of [her]2116-she , [[my]0-i dear]2750-my dear . [She]2116-she will tell [you]2750-my dear any thing if [you]2750-my dear ask . [You]2750-my dear see [I]0-i can not leave [Mrs. Clarke]199-mrs. clarke . ” It was lucky , however , for [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s curiosity and [Elinor]89-elinor ’s too , that [she]103-mrs. jennings would tell any thing _ without _ being asked ; for nothing would otherwise have been learnt . “[199-mrs. clarke] [I]0-i am so glad to meet [you]2750-my dear ; ” said [Miss Steele]138-lucy , taking [her]2750-my dear familiarly by the arm—“for[199-mrs. clarke] [I]0-i wanted to see [you]2750-my dear of all things in [the world]2778-the world . ” And then lowering [her]0-i voice , “[2750-my dear] [I]0-i suppose [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings has heard all about it . Is [she]2116-she angry ? ” “[2116-she] Not at all , [I]0-i believe , with [you]0-i . ” “[0-i] That is a good thing . And [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton , is _ [she]100-lady middleton _ angry ? ” “[100-lady middleton] [I]0-i can not suppose it possible that [she]100-lady middleton should be . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am monstrous glad of it . Good gracious ! [I]0-i have had such a time of it ! [I]0-i never saw [Lucy]138-lucy in such a rage in [my]0-i life . [She]138-lucy vowed at first [she]138-lucy would never trim [me]0-i up a new bonnet , nor do any thing else for [me]0-i again , so long as [she]138-lucy lived ; but now [she]138-lucy is quite come to , and [we]2119-we are as [good friends as ever]2120-good friends as ever . Look , [she]138-lucy made [me]0-i this bow to [my]0-i hat , and put in the feather last night . There now , _ [you]2121-you _ are going to laugh at [me]0-i too . But why should not [I]0-i wear pink ribbons ? [I]0-i do not care if it _ is _ [the Doctor]3869-the doctor ’s favourite colour . [I]0-i am sure , for [my]0-i part , [I]0-i should never have known [he]3869-the doctor _ did _ like it better than any other colour , if [he]3869-the doctor had not happened to say so . [[My]0-i cousins]3333-my cousins have been so plaguing [me]0-i ! [I]0-i declare sometimes [I]0-i do not know which way to look before [them]3333-my cousins . ” [She]0-i had wandered away to a subject on which [Elinor]89-elinor had nothing to say , and therefore soon judged it expedient to find [her]0-i way back again to the first . “[0-i] Well , but [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood , ” speaking triumphantly , “[2770-people] [people]2770-people may say what [they]2770-people chuse about [Mr. Ferrars]144-robert ’s declaring [he]144-robert would not have [Lucy]138-lucy , for it is no such thing [I]0-i can tell [you]84-miss dashwood ; and it is quite a shame for such ill - natured reports to be spread abroad . Whatever [Lucy]138-lucy might think about it [herself]138-lucy , [you]84-miss dashwood know , it was no business of [other people to set it down for certain]2125-other people to set it down for certain . ” “[138-lucy] [I]0-i never heard any thing of the kind hinted at before , [I]0-i assure [you]84-miss dashwood , ” said [Elinor]89-elinor . “[0-i] Oh , did not [you]84-miss dashwood ? But it _ was _ said , [I]0-i know , very well , and by more than one ; for [Miss Godby]200-miss godby told [Miss Sparks]201-miss sparks , that nobody in [their]2126-their senses could expect [Mr. Ferrars]144-robert to give up [a woman like [Miss Morton]178-miss morton]2127-a woman like miss morton , with thirty thousand pounds to [her]2127-a woman like miss morton fortune , for [Lucy Steele]138-lucy that had nothing at all ; and [I]0-i had it from [Miss Sparks]201-miss sparks [myself]0-i . And besides that , [[my]0-i cousin]3777-my cousin [Richard]202-richard said [himself]202-richard , that when it came to the point [he]202-richard was afraid [Mr. Ferrars]144-robert would be off ; and when [Edward]98-edward did not come near [us]2129-we for three days , [I]0-i could not tell what to think [myself]0-i ; and [I]0-i believe in [my]0-i heart [Lucy]138-lucy gave it up all for lost ; for [we]2129-we came away from [[your]2130-your brother]3364-your brother ’s Wednesday , and [we]2129-we saw nothing of [him]3364-your brother not all Thursday , Friday , and Saturday , and did not know what was become of [him]3364-your brother . Once [Lucy]138-lucy thought to write to [him]3364-your brother , but then [her]138-lucy spirits rose against that . However this morning [he]3364-your brother came just as [we]2129-we came [home]565-home from [church]2133-church ; and then it all came out , how [he]3364-your brother had been sent for Wednesday to [Harley Street]56-harley street , and been talked to by [[his]3364-your brother mother]270-his mother and all of [them]2135-them , and how [he]3364-your brother had declared before [them]2135-them all that [he]3364-your brother loved [nobody]2922-nobody but [Lucy]138-lucy , and [nobody]2922-nobody but [Lucy]138-lucy would [he]3364-your brother have . And how [he]3364-your brother had been so worried by what passed , that as soon as [he]3364-your brother had went away from [[[his]3364-your brother mother]270-his mother ’s house]2139-his mother ’s house , [he]3364-your brother had got upon [his]3364-your brother horse , and rid into [the country]612-the country , some where or other ; and how [he]3364-your brother had stayed about at [an inn]2141-an inn all Thursday and Friday , on purpose to get the better of it . And after thinking it all over and over again , [he]3364-your brother said , it seemed to [him]3364-your brother as if , now [he]3364-your brother had no fortune , and no nothing at all , it would be quite unkind to keep [her]138-lucy on to the engagement , because it must be for [her]138-lucy loss , for [he]3364-your brother had nothing but two thousand pounds , and no hope of any thing else ; and if [he]3364-your brother was to go into orders , as [he]3364-your brother had some thoughts , [he]3364-your brother could get nothing but a curacy , and how was [they]2142-they to live upon [that?—He]3364-your brother could not bear to think of [her]138-lucy doing no better , and so [he]3364-your brother begged , if [she]138-lucy had the least mind for it , to put an end to the matter directly , and leave [him]3364-your brother shift for [himself]3364-your brother . [I]0-i heard [him]3364-your brother say all this as plain as could possibly be . And it was entirely for _ [her]138-lucy _ sake , and upon _ [her]138-lucy _ account , that [he]3364-your brother said a word about being off , and not upon [his]3364-your brother own . [I]0-i will take [my]0-i oath [he]3364-your brother never dropt a syllable of being tired of [her]138-lucy , or of wishing to marry [Miss Morton]178-miss morton , or any thing like it . But , to be sure , [Lucy]138-lucy would not give ear to such kind of talking ; so [she]138-lucy told [him]3364-your brother directly ( with a great deal about sweet and love , [you]2143-you know , and all that — Oh , la ! one ca n’t repeat such kind of things [you]2143-you know)—she told [him]3364-your brother directly , [she]138-lucy had not the least mind in [the world]2778-the world to be off , for [she]138-lucy could live with [him]3364-your brother upon a trifle , and how little so ever [he]3364-your brother might have , [she]138-lucy should be very glad to have it all , [you]2143-you know , or something of the kind . So then [he]3364-your brother was monstrous happy , and talked on some time about what [they]2145-they should do , and [they]2145-they agreed [he]3364-your brother should take orders directly , and [they]2145-they must wait to be married till [he]3364-your brother got a living . And just then [I]0-i could not hear any more , for [[my]0-i cousin]3777-my cousin called from below to tell [me]0-i [Mrs. Richardson]203-mrs. richardson was come in [[her]203-mrs. richardson coach]2147-her coach , and would take one of [us]2148-us to [Kensington Gardens]62-kensington gardens ; so [I]0-i was forced to go into [the room]2842-the room and interrupt [them]2145-they , to ask [Lucy]138-lucy if [she]138-lucy would like to go , but [she]138-lucy did not care to leave [Edward]98-edward ; so [I]0-i just run up stairs and put on a pair of silk stockings and came off with [the Richardsons]204-the richardsons . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do not understand what [you]0-i mean by interrupting [them]2145-they , ” said [Elinor]89-elinor ; “[0-i] [you]0-i were all in [the same room]1235-the same room together , were not [you]0-i ? ” “[0-i] No , indeed , not [us]2148-us . [La]205-la ! [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood , do [you]0-i think [people]2770-people make love when [any body else]2930-any body else is by ? Oh , for shame!—To be sure [you]0-i must know better than that . ( Laughing affectedly.)—No , no ; [they]2145-they were shut up in [the drawing - room]1150-the drawing - room together , and all [I]0-i heard was only by listening at the door . ” “[0-i] How ! ” cried [Elinor]89-elinor ; “[0-i] have [you]0-i been repeating to [me]0-i what [you]0-i only learnt [yourself]0-i by listening at the door ? [I]0-i am sorry [I]0-i did not know it before ; for [I]0-i certainly would not have suffered [you]0-i to give [me]0-i particulars of a conversation which [you]0-i ought not to have known [yourself]0-i . How could [you]0-i behave so unfairly by [[your]0-i sister]2815-your sister ? ” “[0-i] Oh , la ! there is nothing in _ that _ . [I]0-i only stood at the door , and heard what [I]0-i could . And [I]0-i am sure [Lucy]138-lucy would have done just the same by [me]0-i ; for a year or two back , when [Martha Sharpe]206-martha sharpe and [I]0-i had so many secrets together , [she]138-lucy never made any bones of hiding in [a closet]2155-a closet , or behind a chimney - board , on purpose to hear what [we]2156-we said . ” [Elinor]89-elinor tried to talk of something else ; but [Miss Steele]138-lucy could not be kept beyond a couple of minutes , from what was uppermost in [her]138-lucy mind . “[98-edward] [Edward]98-edward talks of going to [Oxford]29-oxford soon , ” said [she]89-elinor ; “[98-edward] but now [he]2157-he is lodging at [No]63-no . — , [Pall Mall]43-pall mall . What [an ill - natured woman [[his]2157-he mother]270-his mother is]2158-an ill - natured woman his mother is , an’t [she]270-his mother ? And [[your]2160-your brother]3364-your brother and [sister]438-sister were not very kind ! However , [I]0-i sha n’t say anything against [them]2163-them to _ [you]2160-your ; _ and to be sure [they]2163-them did send [us]2164-us [home]565-home in [[their]2163-them own chariot]2166-their own chariot , which was more than [I]0-i looked for . And for [my]0-i part , [I]0-i was all in a fright for fear [[your]2160-your sister]2815-your sister should ask [us]2164-us for the huswifes [she]2815-your sister had gave [us]2164-us a day or two before ; but , however , nothing was said about [them]2163-them , and [I]0-i took care to keep [mine]0-i out of sight . [Edward]98-edward have got some business at [Oxford]29-oxford , [he]2168-he says ; so [he]2168-he must go [there]354-there for a time ; and after _ that _ , as soon as [he]2168-he can light upon [a Bishop]2170-a bishop , [he]2168-he will be ordained . [I]0-i wonder what curacy [he]2168-he will get ! Good gracious ! ( giggling as [she]0-i spoke ) [I]0-i ’d lay [my]0-i life [I]0-i know what [[my]0-i cousins]3333-my cousins will say , when [they]3333-my cousins hear of it . [They]3333-my cousins will tell [me]0-i [I]0-i should write to [the Doctor]3869-the doctor , to get [Edward]98-edward the curacy of [his]2168-he new living . [I]0-i know [they]3333-my cousins will ; but [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i would not do such a thing for all [the world]2778-the world . ‘ La ! ’ [I]0-i shall say directly , ‘ [I]0-i wonder how [you]2174-you could think of such a thing ? _ [I]0-i _ write to [the Doctor]3869-the doctor , indeed ! ’ ” “[0-i] Well , ” said [Elinor]89-elinor , “[0-i] it is a comfort to be prepared against the worst . [You]2174-you have got [your]2174-you answer ready . ” [Miss Steele]138-lucy was going to reply on the same subject , but the approach of [[her]138-lucy own party]4092-her own party made another more necessary . “[2174-you] Oh , la ! here come [the Richardsons]204-the richardsons . [I]0-i had a vast deal more to say to [you]2174-you , but [I]0-i must not stay away from [them]204-the richardsons not any longer . [I]0-i assure [you]2174-you [they]204-the richardsons are [very genteel people]2176-very genteel people . [He]2177-he makes a monstrous deal of money , and [they]204-the richardsons keep [[their]204-the richardsons own coach]2178-their own coach . [I]0-i have not time to speak to [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings about it [myself]0-i , but pray tell [her]103-mrs. jennings [I]0-i am quite happy to hear [she]103-mrs. jennings is not in anger against [us]2179-us , and [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton the same ; and if anything should happen to take [you]2174-you and [[your]2174-you sister]2815-your sister away , and [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings should want [company]1078-company , [I]0-i am sure [we]2179-us should be very glad to come and stay with [her]103-mrs. jennings for as long a time as [she]103-mrs. jennings likes . [I]0-i suppose [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton wo n’t ask [us]2179-us any more this bout . Good - by ; [I]0-i am sorry [Miss Marianne]90-marianne was not [here]2861-here . Remember [me]0-i kindly to [her]90-marianne . La ! if [you]2174-you have not got [your]2174-you spotted muslin on!—I wonder [you]2174-you was not afraid of its being torn . ” Such was [her]103-mrs. jennings parting concern ; for after this , [she]103-mrs. jennings had time only to pay [her]103-mrs. jennings farewell compliments to [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , before [her]103-mrs. jennings company was claimed by [Mrs. Richardson]203-mrs. richardson ; and [Elinor]89-elinor was left in possession of knowledge which might feed [her]103-mrs. jennings powers of reflection some time , though [she]103-mrs. jennings had learnt very little more than what had been already foreseen and foreplanned in [her]103-mrs. jennings own mind . [Edward]98-edward ’s marriage with [Lucy]138-lucy was as firmly determined on , and the time of its taking place remained as absolutely uncertain , as [she]103-mrs. jennings had concluded it would be;—every thing depended , exactly after [her]103-mrs. jennings expectation , on [his]4093-his getting that preferment , of which , at present , there seemed not the smallest chance . As soon as [they]4094-they returned to [the carriage]1118-the carriage , [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings was eager for information ; but as [Elinor]89-elinor wished to spread as little as possible intelligence that had in the first place been so unfairly obtained , [she]89-elinor confined [herself]89-elinor to the brief repetition of such simple particulars , as [she]89-elinor felt assured that [Lucy]138-lucy , for the sake of [her]138-lucy own consequence , would choose to have known . The continuance of [their]4094-they engagement , and the means that were able to be taken for promoting its end , was all [her]89-elinor communication ; and this produced from [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings the following natural remark . “[2174-you] Wait for [his]2183-his having a living!—ay , [we]2184-we all know how _ that _ will end:—they will wait a twelvemonth , and finding no good comes of it , will set down upon a curacy of fifty pounds a - year , with the interest of [his]2183-his two thousand pounds , and what little matter [Mr. Steele]207-mr. steele and [Mr. Pratt]145-mr. pratt can give [her]2185-her . Then [they]2186-they will have [a child]576-a child every year ! and [Lord]2188-lord help ’em ! how poor [they]2186-they will be ! [I]0-i must see what [I]0-i can give [them]2186-they towards furnishing [[their]2186-they house]1012-their house . [Two maids]498-two maids and [two men]2031-two men , indeed ! as [I]0-i talked of t ’ other day . No , no , [they]2186-they must get [a stout girl of all works]2192-a stout girl of all works . [[Betty]150-eliza ’s sister]2193-betty ’s sister would never do for [them]2186-they _ now _ . ” The next morning brought [Elinor]89-elinor a letter by the two - penny post from [Lucy]138-lucy [herself]138-lucy . It was as follows : “[182-bartlett] [[Bartlett]182-bartlett ’s Building]2194-bartlett ’s building , [March]208-march . “ [I]182-bartlett hope [[my]182-bartlett dear]2750-my dear [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood will excuse the liberty [I]182-bartlett take of writing to [her]84-miss dashwood ; but [I]182-bartlett know [your]2750-my dear friendship for [me]182-bartlett will make [you]2750-my dear pleased to hear such a good account of [myself]182-bartlett and [[my]182-bartlett dear]2750-my dear [Edward]98-edward , after all the troubles [we]4098-we have went through lately , therefore will make no more apologies , but proceed to say that , thank [God]154-god ! though [we]4098-we have suffered dreadfully , [we]4098-we are both quite well now , and as happy as [we]4098-we must always be in [one another]1089-one another ’s love . [We]4098-we have had great trials , and great persecutions , but however , at the same time , gratefully acknowledge [many friends]4100-many friends , [yourself]2750-my dear not the least among [them]4100-many friends , whose great kindness [I]182-bartlett shall always thankfully remember , as will [Edward]98-edward too , who [I]182-bartlett have told of it . [I]182-bartlett am sure [you]2750-my dear will be glad to hear , as likewise dear [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , [I]182-bartlett spent two happy hours with [him]2750-my dear yesterday afternoon , [he]2750-my dear would not hear of [our]4098-we parting , though earnestly did [I]182-bartlett , as [I]182-bartlett thought [my]182-bartlett duty required , urge [him]2750-my dear to it for prudence sake , and would have parted for ever on the spot , would [he]2750-my dear consent to it ; but [he]2750-my dear said it should never be , [he]2750-my dear did not regard [[his]2750-my dear mother]270-his mother ’s anger , while [he]2750-my dear could have [my]182-bartlett affections ; [our]4098-we prospects are not very bright , to be sure , but [we]4098-we must wait , and hope for the best ; [he]2750-my dear will be ordained shortly ; and should it ever be in [your]2750-my dear power to recommend [him]2750-my dear to any body that has a living to bestow , am very sure [you]2750-my dear will not forget [us]4098-we , and dear [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings too , trust [she]103-mrs. jennings will speak a good word for [us]4098-we to [Sir John]99-sir john , or [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer , or any friend that may be able to assist [us.—Poor]209-us.—poor [Anne]143-nancy was much to blame for what [she]143-nancy did , but [she]143-nancy did it for the best , so [I]182-bartlett say nothing ; hope [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings wo n’t think it too much trouble to give [us]4098-we a call , should [she]103-mrs. jennings come this way any morning , ’ twould be a great kindness , and [[my]182-bartlett cousins]3333-my cousins would be proud to know her.—My paper reminds [me]182-bartlett to conclude ; and begging to be most gratefully and respectfully remembered to [her]103-mrs. jennings , and to [Sir John]99-sir john , and [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton , and [the dear children]4103-the dear children , when [you]4104-you chance to see [them]4103-the dear children , and love to [Miss Marianne]90-marianne , “[182-bartlett] [I]0-i am , & c. ” As soon as [Elinor]89-elinor had finished it , [she]89-elinor performed what [she]89-elinor concluded to be [its writer]3596-its writer ’s real design , by placing it in the hands of [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , who read it aloud with many comments of satisfaction and praise . “[2195-she] Very well indeed!—how prettily [she]2195-she writes!—aye , that was quite proper to let [him]2196-him be off if [he]2196-him would . That was just like [Lucy]138-lucy . [Poor soul]3649-poor soul ! [I]0-i wish [I]0-i _ could _ get [him]2196-him a living , with all [my]0-i heart . [She]2195-she calls [me]0-i dear [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , [you]103-mrs. jennings see . [She]2195-she is [a good - hearted girl as ever lived]2198-a good - hearted girl as ever lived . Very well upon [my]0-i word . That sentence is very prettily turned . Yes , yes , [I]0-i will go and see [her]2195-she , sure enough . How attentive [she]2195-she is , to think of every body!—Thank [you]103-mrs. jennings , [[my]0-i dear]2750-my dear , for showing [it]2195-she [me]0-i . It is as pretty a letter as ever [I]0-i saw , and does [Lucy]138-lucy ’s head and heart great credit . ” CHAPTER XXXIX . [The Miss Dashwoods]92-the miss dashwoods had now been rather more than two months in [town]2984-town , and [Marianne]90-marianne ’s impatience to be gone increased every day . [She]90-marianne sighed for the air , the liberty , the quiet of [the country]612-the country ; and fancied that if [any place]4108-any place could give [her]90-marianne ease , [Barton]6-barton park must do it . [Elinor]89-elinor was hardly less anxious than [herself]89-elinor for [their]4109-them removal , and only so much less bent on its being effected immediately , as that [she]89-elinor was conscious of the difficulties of so long a journey , which [Marianne]90-marianne could not be brought to acknowledge . [She]89-elinor began , however , seriously to turn [her]89-elinor thoughts towards its accomplishment , and had already mentioned [their]4109-them wishes to [[their]4109-them kind hostess]4110-their kind hostess , who resisted [them]4109-them with all the eloquence of [her]4110-their kind hostess good - will , when a plan was suggested , which , though detaining [them]4109-them from [home]565-home yet a few weeks longer , appeared to [Elinor]89-elinor altogether much more eligible than any other . [The Palmers]126-the palmers were to remove to [Cleveland]32-cleveland about the end of March , for the Easter holidays ; and [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , with both [[her]103-mrs. jennings friends]1633-her friends , received a very warm invitation from [Charlotte]127-charlotte to go with [them]4109-them . This would not , in itself , have been sufficient for the delicacy of [Miss Dashwood;—but]210-miss dashwood;—but it was inforced with so much real politeness by [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer [himself]129-mr. palmer , as , joined to the very great amendment of [his]129-mr. palmer manners towards [them]4109-them since [[her]103-mrs. jennings sister]336-her sister had been known to be unhappy , induced [her]103-mrs. jennings to accept it with pleasure . When [she]103-mrs. jennings told [Marianne]90-marianne what [she]103-mrs. jennings had done , however , [her]90-marianne first reply was not very auspicious . “[138-lucy] [Cleveland!”—she]211-cleveland!”—she cried , with great agitation . “[89-elinor] No , [I]0-i can not go to [Cleveland]32-cleveland . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i forget , ” said [Elinor]89-elinor gently , “[0-i] that [its]32-cleveland situation is not — that it is not in the neighbourhood of — ” “[0-i] But it is in [Somersetshire.—I]64-somersetshire.—i can not go into [Somersetshire.—There]65-somersetshire.—there , where [I]0-i looked forward to going ... No , [Elinor]89-elinor , [you]0-i can not expect [me]0-i to go [there]354-there . ” [Elinor]89-elinor would not argue upon the propriety of overcoming such feelings;—she only endeavoured to counteract them by working on others;—represented it , therefore , as a measure which would fix the time of [her]89-elinor returning to [that dear mother]4114-that dear mother , whom [she]89-elinor so much wished to see , in a more eligible , more comfortable manner , than any other plan could do , and perhaps without any greater delay . From [Cleveland]32-cleveland , which was within [a few miles of [Bristol]66-bristol]4115-a few miles of bristol , the distance to [Barton]8-barton was not beyond one day , though a long day ’s journey ; and [[their]4116-their mother ’s servant]4117-their mother ’s servant might easily come [there]354-there to attend [them]4116-their down ; and as there could be no occasion of [their]4116-their staying above a week at [Cleveland]32-cleveland , [they]4116-their might now be at [home]565-home in little more than three weeks ’ time . As [Marianne]90-marianne ’s affection for [[her]90-marianne mother]332-her mother was sincere , it must triumph with little difficulty , over the imaginary evils [she]90-marianne had started . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings was so far from being weary of [[her]103-mrs. jennings guests]4121-her guests , that [she]103-mrs. jennings pressed [them]4121-her guests very earnestly to return with [her]103-mrs. jennings again from [Cleveland]32-cleveland . [Elinor]89-elinor was grateful for the attention , but it could not alter [her]89-elinor design ; and [[their]4116-their mother]274-their mother ’s concurrence being readily gained , every thing relative to [their]4116-their return was arranged as far as it could be;—and [Marianne]90-marianne found some relief in drawing up a statement of the hours that were yet to divide [her]90-marianne from [Barton]6-barton park . “[89-elinor] Ah ! [Colonel]104-colonel brandon , [I]0-i do not know what [you]104-colonel brandon and [I]0-i shall do without [the Miss Dashwoods;”—was Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s address to [him]104-colonel brandon when [he]104-colonel brandon first called on [her]90-marianne , after [their]2201-their leaving [her]90-marianne was settled—“for[2201-their] [they]2201-their are quite resolved upon going [home]565-home from [the Palmers;—and]212-the palmers;—and how forlorn [we]2201-their shall be , when [I]0-i come back!—Lord ! [we]2201-their shall sit and gape at [one another]1089-one another as dull as two cats . ” Perhaps [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings was in hopes , by this vigorous sketch of [their]2201-their future ennui , to provoke [him]104-colonel brandon to make that offer , which might give [himself]104-colonel brandon an escape from it ; and if so , [she]90-marianne had soon afterwards good reason to think [her]90-marianne object gained ; for , on [Elinor]89-elinor ’s moving to the window to take more expeditiously the dimensions of a print , which [she]89-elinor was going to copy for [[her]89-elinor friend]1021-her friend , [he]104-colonel brandon followed [her]89-elinor to it with a look of particular meaning , and conversed with [her]89-elinor there for several minutes . The effect of [his]104-colonel brandon discourse on [the lady]370-the lady too , could not escape [her]89-elinor observation , for though [she]89-elinor was too honorable to listen , and had even changed [her]89-elinor seat , on purpose that [she]89-elinor might _ not _ hear , to one close by the piano forte on which [Marianne]90-marianne was playing , [she]89-elinor could not keep [herself]89-elinor from seeing that [Elinor]89-elinor changed colour , attended with agitation , and was too intent on what [he]104-colonel brandon said to pursue [her]90-marianne employment . Still farther in confirmation of [her]90-marianne hopes , in the interval of [Marianne]90-marianne ’s turning from one lesson to another , some words of [the Colonel]664-the colonel ’s inevitably reached [her]90-marianne ear , in which [he]104-colonel brandon seemed to be apologising for the badness of [[his]104-colonel brandon house]515-his house . This set the matter beyond a doubt . [She]89-elinor wondered , indeed , at [his]104-colonel brandon thinking it necessary to do so ; but supposed it to be the proper etiquette . What [Elinor]89-elinor said in reply [she]89-elinor could not distinguish , but judged from the motion of [her]89-elinor lips , that [she]89-elinor did not think _ that _ any material objection ; and [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings commended [her]89-elinor in [her]89-elinor heart for being so honest . [They]4127-them then talked on for a few minutes longer without [her]89-elinor catching a syllable , when another lucky stop in [Marianne]90-marianne ’s performance brought [her]89-elinor these words in [the Colonel]104-colonel brandon ’s calm voice , — “[0-i] [I]0-i am afraid it can not take place very soon . ” Astonished and shocked at so unlover - like a speech , [she]89-elinor was almost ready to cry out , “[2204-lord] [Lord]2204-lord ! what should hinder it?”—but checking [her]89-elinor desire , confined [herself]89-elinor to this silent ejaculation . “[2204-lord] This is very strange!—sure [he]2205-he need not wait to be older . ” This delay on [the Colonel]664-the colonel ’s side , however , did not seem to offend or mortify [[his]664-the colonel fair companion]4129-his fair companion in the least , for on [their]4127-them breaking up the conference soon afterwards , and moving different ways , [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings very plainly heard [Elinor]89-elinor say , and with a voice which showed [her]89-elinor to feel what [she]89-elinor said , “[0-i] [I]0-i shall always think [myself]0-i very much obliged to [you]2205-he . ” [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings was delighted with [her]89-elinor gratitude , and only wondered that after hearing such a sentence , [the Colonel]664-the colonel should be able to take leave of [them]4127-them , as [he]664-the colonel immediately did , with the utmost _ sang - froid _ , and go away without making [her]89-elinor any reply ! [She]89-elinor had not thought [[her]89-elinor old friend]4131-her old friend could have made so indifferent [a suitor]4132-a suitor . What had really passed between [them]4127-them was to this effect . “[0-i] [I]0-i have heard , ” said [he]664-the colonel , with great compassion , “[0-i] of the injustice [[your]2206-your friend]3537-your friend [Mr. Ferrars]144-robert has suffered from [[his]144-robert family]564-his family ; for if [I]0-i understand the matter right , [he]144-robert has been entirely cast off by [them]564-his family for persevering in [his]144-robert engagement with [a very deserving young woman]2087-a very deserving young woman . Have [I]0-i been rightly informed ? Is it so ? ; ” [Elinor]89-elinor told [him]144-robert that it was . “[0-i] The cruelty , the impolitic cruelty , ” [he]144-robert replied , with great feeling , “[98-edward] of dividing , or attempting to divide , [two young people long attached to each other]2210-two young people long attached to each other , is terrible . [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward does not know what [she]98-edward may be doing — what [she]98-edward may drive [[her]98-edward son]1054-her son to . [I]0-i have seen [Mr. Ferrars]144-robert two or three times in [Harley Street]56-harley street , and am much pleased with [him]144-robert . [He]144-robert is not [a young man with whom one can be intimately acquainted in a short time]2212-a young man with whom one can be intimately acquainted in a short time , but [I]0-i have seen enough of [him]144-robert to wish [him]144-robert well for [his]144-robert own sake , and as [a friend of yours]2213-a friend of yours , [I]0-i wish it still more . [I]0-i understand that [he]144-robert intends to take orders . Will [you]2214-you be so good as to tell [him]144-robert that the living of [Delaford]22-delaford , now just vacant , as [I]0-i am informed by this day ’s post , is [his]144-robert , if [he]144-robert think it worth [his]144-robert acceptance ; but _ that _ , perhaps , so unfortunately circumstanced as [he]144-robert is now , it may be nonsense to appear to doubt ; [I]0-i only wish it were more valuable . [It]2215-it is [a rectory]2216-a rectory , but a small one ; [the late incumbent]2217-the late incumbent , [I]0-i believe , did not make more than 200 £ per annum , and though it is certainly capable of improvement , [I]0-i fear , not to such an amount as to afford [him]144-robert a very comfortable income . Such as it is , however , [my]0-i pleasure in presenting it to [him]144-robert , will be very great . Pray assure [him]144-robert of it . ” [Elinor]89-elinor ’s astonishment at this commission could hardly have been greater , had [the Colonel]664-the colonel been really making [her]89-elinor an offer of [his]664-the colonel hand . The preferment , which only two days before [she]89-elinor had considered as hopeless for [Edward]98-edward , was already provided to enable [him]144-robert to marry ; and _ [she]89-elinor _ , of [all people in [the world]2778-the world]4134-all people in the world , was fixed on to bestow it ! [Her]89-elinor emotion was such as [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings had attributed to a very different cause ; but whatever minor feelings less pure , less pleasing , might have a share in that emotion , [her]89-elinor esteem for the general benevolence , and [her]89-elinor gratitude for the particular friendship , which together prompted [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon to this act , were strongly felt , and warmly expressed . [She]89-elinor thanked [him]144-robert for it with all [her]89-elinor heart , spoke of [Edward]98-edward ’s principles and disposition with that praise which [she]89-elinor knew them to deserve ; and promised to undertake the commission with pleasure , if it were really [his]144-robert wish to put off so agreeable an office to another . But at the same time , [she]89-elinor could not help thinking that [no one]317-no one could so well perform it as [himself]144-robert . It was [an office in short , from which , unwilling to give [Edward]98-edward the pain of receiving an obligation from _ [her]89-elinor _]4137-an office in short , from which , unwilling to give edward the pain of receiving an obligation from _ her _ , [she]89-elinor would have been very glad to be spared [herself]89-elinor ; but [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon , on motives of equal delicacy , declining it likewise , still seemed so desirous of its being given through [her]89-elinor means , that [she]89-elinor would not on any account make farther opposition . [Edward]98-edward , [she]89-elinor believed , was still in [town]2984-town , and fortunately [she]89-elinor had heard [his]144-robert address from [Miss Steele]138-lucy . [She]89-elinor could undertake therefore to inform [him]144-robert of it , in the course of the day . After this had been settled , [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon began to talk of [his]104-colonel brandon own advantage in securing so respectable and agreeable [a neighbour]4139-a neighbour , and _ then _ it was that [he]104-colonel brandon mentioned with regret , that [the house]318-the house was small and indifferent ; an evil which [Elinor]89-elinor , as [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings had supposed [her]89-elinor to do , made very light of , at least as far as regarded [its]318-the house size . “[144-robert] The smallness of [the house]318-the house , ” said [she]0-i , “[144-robert] [I]0-i can not imagine any inconvenience to [them]2219-them , for it will be in proportion to [their]2219-them family and income . ” By which [the Colonel]664-the colonel was surprised to find that _ [she]0-i _ was considering [Mr. Ferrars]144-robert ’s marriage as the certain consequence of the presentation ; for [he]664-the colonel did not suppose it possible that [Delaford]22-delaford living could supply such an income , as anybody in [his]664-the colonel style of life would venture to settle on , and [he]664-the colonel said so . “[2220-this little rectory] [This little rectory]2220-this little rectory _ can _ do no more than make [Mr. Ferrars]144-robert comfortable as [a bachelor]2221-a bachelor ; it can not enable [him]144-robert to marry . [I]0-i am sorry to say that [my]0-i patronage ends with this ; and [my]0-i interest is hardly more extensive . If , however , by an unforeseen chance it should be in [my]0-i power to serve [him]144-robert farther , [I]0-i must think very differently of [him]144-robert from what [I]0-i now do , if [I]0-i am not as ready to be useful to [him]144-robert then as [I]0-i sincerely wish [I]0-i could be at present . What [I]0-i am now doing indeed , seems nothing at all , since it can advance [him]144-robert so little towards what must be [his]144-robert principal , [his]144-robert only object of happiness . [His]144-robert marriage must still be a distant good ; at least , [I]0-i am afraid it can not take place very soon . ” Such was the sentence which , when misunderstood , so justly offended the delicate feelings of [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ; but after this narration of what really passed between [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon and [Elinor]89-elinor , while [they]4142-they stood at the window , the gratitude expressed by [the latter]325-the latter on [their]4142-they parting , may perhaps appear in general , not less reasonably excited , nor less properly worded than if it had arisen from an offer of marriage . [CHAPTER XL]214-chapter xl . “[84-miss dashwood] Well , [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood , ” said [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , sagaciously smiling , as soon as [the gentleman]722-the gentleman had withdrawn , “[84-miss dashwood] [I]0-i do not ask [you]84-miss dashwood what [the Colonel]664-the colonel has been saying to [you]84-miss dashwood ; for though , upon [my]0-i honour , [I]0-i _ tried _ to keep out of hearing , [I]0-i could not help catching enough to understand [his]664-the colonel business . And [I]0-i assure [you]84-miss dashwood [I]0-i never was better pleased in [my]0-i life , and [I]0-i wish [you]84-miss dashwood joy of it with all [my]0-i heart . ” “[0-i] Thank [you]84-miss dashwood , [ma’am]2974-ma’am , ” said [Elinor]89-elinor . “[84-miss dashwood] It _ is _ a matter of great joy to [me]0-i ; and [I]0-i feel the goodness of [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon most sensibly . There are [not many men who would act as [he]104-colonel brandon has done]2224-not many men who would act as he has done . [Few people who have so compassionate a heart]2225-few people who have so compassionate a heart ! [I]0-i never was more astonished in [my]0-i life . ” “[1972-lord] [Lord]1972-lord ! [[my]0-i dear]2750-my dear , [you]84-miss dashwood are very modest . [I]0-i an’t the least astonished at it in [the world]2778-the world , for [I]0-i have often thought of late , there was nothing more likely to happen . ” “[84-miss dashwood] [You]84-miss dashwood judged from [your]84-miss dashwood knowledge of [the Colonel]664-the colonel ’s general benevolence ; but at least [you]84-miss dashwood could not foresee that the opportunity would so very soon occur . ” “[84-miss dashwood] Opportunity ! ” repeated [Mrs. Jennings—“Oh]215-mrs. jennings—“oh[84-miss dashwood] ! as to that , when [a man]499-a man has once made up [his]499-a man mind to such a thing , somehow or other [he]499-a man will soon find an opportunity . Well , [[my]0-i dear]2750-my dear , [I]0-i wish [you]84-miss dashwood joy of it again and again ; and if ever there was [a happy couple in [the world]2778-the world]2232-a happy couple in the world , [I]0-i think [I]0-i shall soon know where to look for [them]2232-a happy couple in the world . ” “[84-miss dashwood] [You]84-miss dashwood mean to go to [Delaford]22-delaford after [them]2232-a happy couple in the world [I]0-i suppose , ” said [Elinor]89-elinor , with a faint smile . “[0-i] Aye , [[my]0-i dear]2750-my dear , that [I]0-i do , indeed . And as to [the house]318-the house being a bad one , [I]0-i do not know what [the Colonel]664-the colonel would be at , for it is as good a one as ever [I]0-i saw . ” “[664-the colonel] [He]664-the colonel spoke of its being out of repair . ” “[664-the colonel] Well , and whose fault is that ? why do n’t [he]664-the colonel repair it?—who should do it but [himself]664-the colonel ? ” [They]2238-we were interrupted by [the servant]818-the servant ’s coming in to announce [the carriage]1118-the carriage being at the door ; and [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings immediately preparing to go , said , — “[664-the colonel] Well , [[my]0-i dear]2750-my dear , [I]0-i must be gone before [I]0-i have had half [my]0-i talk out . But , however , [we]2238-we may have it all over in the evening ; for [we]2238-we shall be quite alone . [I]0-i do not ask [you]2750-my dear to go with [me]0-i , for [I]0-i dare say [your]2750-my dear mind is too full of the matter to care for company ; and besides , [you]2750-my dear must long to tell [[your]2750-my dear sister]2815-your sister all about it . ” [Marianne]90-marianne had left [the room]2842-the room before the conversation began . “[2750-my dear] Certainly , [ma’am]2974-ma’am , [I]0-i shall tell [Marianne]90-marianne of it ; but [I]0-i shall not mention it at present to [any body else]2930-any body else . ” “[0-i] Oh ! very well , ” said [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings rather disappointed . “[0-i] Then [you]2974-ma’am would not have [me]0-i tell it to [Lucy]138-lucy , for [I]0-i think of going as far as [Holborn]67-holborn to - day . ” “[0-i] No , [ma’am]2974-ma’am , not even [Lucy]138-lucy if [you]2974-ma’am please . One day ’s delay will not be very material ; and till [I]0-i have written to [Mr. Ferrars]144-robert , [I]0-i think it ought not to be mentioned to any body else . [I]0-i shall do _ that _ directly . It is of importance that no time should be lost with [him]144-robert , for [he]144-robert will of course have much to do relative to [his]144-robert ordination . ” This speech at first puzzled [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings exceedingly . Why [Mr. Ferrars]144-robert was to have been written to about it in such a hurry , [she]103-mrs. jennings could not immediately comprehend . A few moments ’ reflection , however , produced a very happy idea , and [she]103-mrs. jennings exclaimed ; — “[2974-ma’am] Oh , ho!—I understand [you]2974-ma’am . [Mr. Ferrars]144-robert is to be [the man]502-the man . Well , so much the better for [him]144-robert . Ay , to be sure , [he]144-robert must be ordained in readiness ; and [I]0-i am very glad to find things are so forward between [you]2974-ma’am . But , [[my]0-i dear]2750-my dear , is not this rather out of character ? Should not [the Colonel]664-the colonel write [himself?—sure]2246-himself?—sure , [he]144-robert is [the proper person]2247-the proper person . ” [Elinor]89-elinor did not quite understand the beginning of [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s speech , neither did [she]89-elinor think it worth inquiring into ; and therefore only replied to its conclusion . “[144-robert] [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon is so delicate [a man]499-a man , that [he]104-colonel brandon rather wished [any one]659-any one to announce [his]104-colonel brandon intentions to [Mr. Ferrars]144-robert than [himself]104-colonel brandon . ” “[104-colonel brandon] And so _ [you]2974-ma’am _ are forced to do it . Well _ that _ is an odd kind of delicacy ! However , [I]0-i will not disturb [you]2974-ma’am ( seeing [her]2250-her preparing to write . ) [You]2974-ma’am know [your]2974-ma’am own concerns best . So goodby , [[my]0-i dear]2750-my dear . [I]0-i have not heard of any thing to please [me]0-i so well since [Charlotte]127-charlotte was brought to bed . ” And away [she]0-i went ; but returning again in a moment , “[0-i] [I]0-i have just been thinking of [[Betty]150-eliza ’s sister]2193-betty ’s sister , [[my]0-i dear]2750-my dear . [I]0-i should be very glad to get [her]2193-betty ’s sister so good [a mistress]2254-a mistress . But whether [she]2193-betty ’s sister would do for [[a lady]2255-a lady ’s maid]2256-a lady ’s maid , [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i ca n’t tell . [She]2193-betty ’s sister is [an excellent housemaid]2257-an excellent housemaid , and works very well at [her]2193-betty ’s sister needle . However , [you]2750-my dear will think of all that at [your]2750-my dear leisure . ” “[2750-my dear] Certainly , [ma’am]2974-ma’am , ” replied [Elinor]89-elinor , not hearing much of what [she]0-i said , and more anxious to be alone , than to be [mistress of the subject]4148-mistress of the subject . How [she]0-i should begin — how [she]0-i should express [herself]0-i in [her]0-i note to [Edward]98-edward , was now all [her]0-i concern . The particular circumstances between [them]4149-them made a difficulty of that which to [any other person]1477-any other person would have been the easiest thing in [the world]2778-the world ; but [she]0-i equally feared to say too much or too little , and sat deliberating over [her]0-i paper , with the pen in [her]0-i hand , till broken in on by the entrance of [Edward]98-edward [himself]98-edward . [He]2750-my dear had met [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings at the door in [her]103-mrs. jennings way to [the carriage]1118-the carriage , as [he]2750-my dear came to leave [his]2750-my dear farewell card ; and [she]103-mrs. jennings , after apologising for not returning [herself]103-mrs. jennings , had obliged [him]2750-my dear to enter , by saying that [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood was above , and wanted to speak with [him]2750-my dear on very particular business . [Elinor]89-elinor had just been congratulating [herself]89-elinor , in the midst of [her]89-elinor perplexity , that however difficult it might be to express [herself]89-elinor properly by letter , it was at least preferable to giving the information by word of mouth , when [[her]89-elinor visitor]4153-her visitor entered , to force [her]89-elinor upon this greatest exertion of all . [Her]89-elinor astonishment and confusion were very great on [his]2750-my dear so sudden appearance . [She]89-elinor had not seen [him]2750-my dear before since [his]2750-my dear engagement became public , and therefore not since [his]2750-my dear knowing [her]89-elinor to be acquainted with it ; which , with the consciousness of what [she]89-elinor had been thinking of , and what [she]89-elinor had to tell [him]2750-my dear , made [her]89-elinor feel particularly uncomfortable for some minutes . [He]2750-my dear too was much distressed ; and [they]4154-they sat down together in a most promising state of embarrassment.—Whether [he]2750-my dear had asked [her]103-mrs. jennings pardon for [his]2750-my dear intrusion on first coming into [the room]2842-the room , [he]2750-my dear could not recollect ; but determining to be on the safe side , [he]2750-my dear made [his]2750-my dear apology in form as soon as [he]2750-my dear could say any thing , after taking a chair . “[103-mrs. jennings] [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings told [me]0-i , ” said [he]2750-my dear , “[103-mrs. jennings] that [you]103-mrs. jennings wished to speak with [me]0-i , at least [I]0-i understood [her]103-mrs. jennings so — or [I]0-i certainly should not have intruded on [you]103-mrs. jennings in such a manner ; though at the same time , [I]0-i should have been extremely sorry to leave [London]24-london without seeing [you]103-mrs. jennings and [[your]103-mrs. jennings sister]2815-your sister ; especially as it will most likely be some time — it is not probable that [I]0-i should soon have the pleasure of meeting [you]103-mrs. jennings again . [I]0-i go to [Oxford]29-oxford tomorrow . ” “[103-mrs. jennings] [You]103-mrs. jennings would not have gone , however , ” said [Elinor]89-elinor , recovering [herself]89-elinor , and determined to get over what [she]89-elinor so much dreaded as soon as possible , “[103-mrs. jennings] without receiving [our]2260-our good wishes , even if [we]2260-our had not been able to give them in person . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings was quite right in what [she]103-mrs. jennings said . [I]0-i have something of consequence to inform [you]103-mrs. jennings of , which [I]0-i was on the point of communicating by paper . [I]0-i am charged with a most agreeable office ( breathing rather faster than usual as [she]103-mrs. jennings spoke . ) [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon , who was [here]2861-here only ten minutes ago , has desired [me]0-i to say , that understanding [you]103-mrs. jennings mean to take orders , [he]104-colonel brandon has great pleasure in offering [you]103-mrs. jennings the living of [Delaford]22-delaford now just vacant , and only wishes it were more valuable . Allow [me]0-i to congratulate [you]103-mrs. jennings on having so respectable and well - judging [a friend]1286-a friend , and to join in [his]104-colonel brandon wish that the living — it is about two hundred a - year — were much more considerable , and such as might better enable [you]103-mrs. jennings to — as might be more than a temporary accommodation to [yourself]103-mrs. jennings — such , in short , as might establish all [your]103-mrs. jennings views of happiness . ” What [Edward]98-edward felt , as [he]104-colonel brandon could not say it [himself]104-colonel brandon , it can not be expected that [any one else]785-any one else should say for [him]104-colonel brandon . [He]104-colonel brandon _ looked _ all the astonishment which such unexpected , such unthought - of information could not fail of exciting ; but [he]104-colonel brandon said only these two words , — “[104-colonel brandon] [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon ! ” “[104-colonel brandon] Yes , ” continued [Elinor]89-elinor , gathering more resolution , as some of the worst was over , “[104-colonel brandon] [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon means it as a testimony of [his]104-colonel brandon concern for what has lately passed — for the cruel situation in which the unjustifiable conduct of [[your]103-mrs. jennings family]3146-your family has placed [you]103-mrs. jennings — a concern which [I]0-i am sure [Marianne]90-marianne , [myself]0-i , and all [[your]103-mrs. jennings friends]3215-your friends , must share ; and likewise as a proof of [his]104-colonel brandon high esteem for [your]103-mrs. jennings general character , and [his]104-colonel brandon particular approbation of [your]103-mrs. jennings behaviour on the present occasion . ” “[104-colonel brandon] [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon give _ [me]0-i _ a living!—Can it be possible ? ” “[104-colonel brandon] The unkindness of [your]103-mrs. jennings own relations has made [you]103-mrs. jennings astonished to find friendship any where . ” “[104-colonel brandon] No , ” replied [he]104-colonel brandon , with sudden consciousness , “[104-colonel brandon] not to find it in _ [you]103-mrs. jennings ; _ for [I]0-i can not be ignorant that to [you]103-mrs. jennings , to [your]103-mrs. jennings goodness , [I]0-i owe it [all.—I]2265-all.—i feel it — [I]0-i would express it if [I]0-i could — but , as [you]103-mrs. jennings well know , [I]0-i am [no orator]2266-no orator . ” “[103-mrs. jennings] [You]103-mrs. jennings are very much mistaken . [I]0-i do assure [you]103-mrs. jennings that [you]103-mrs. jennings owe it entirely , at least almost entirely , to [your]103-mrs. jennings own merit , and [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon ’s discernment of it . [I]0-i have had no hand in it . [I]0-i did not even know , till [I]0-i understood [his]104-colonel brandon design , that the living was vacant ; nor had it ever occurred to [me]0-i that [he]104-colonel brandon might have had such a living in [his]104-colonel brandon gift . As [a friend of [mine]0-i]2267-a friend of mine , of [[my]0-i family]3220-my family , [he]104-colonel brandon may , perhaps — indeed [I]0-i know [he]104-colonel brandon _ has _ , still greater pleasure in bestowing it ; but , upon [my]0-i word , [you]103-mrs. jennings owe nothing to [my]0-i solicitation . ” Truth obliged [her]103-mrs. jennings to acknowledge some small share in the action , but [she]103-mrs. jennings was at the same time so unwilling to appear as [the benefactress of [Edward]98-edward]4157-the benefactress of edward , that [she]103-mrs. jennings acknowledged it with hesitation ; which probably contributed to fix that suspicion in [his]104-colonel brandon mind which had recently entered it . For a short time [he]104-colonel brandon sat deep in thought , after [Elinor]89-elinor had ceased to speak;—at last , and as if it were rather an effort , [he]104-colonel brandon said , “[104-colonel brandon] [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon seems [a man of great worth and respectability]2269-a man of great worth and respectability . [I]0-i have always heard [him]104-colonel brandon spoken of as such , and [[your]103-mrs. jennings brother]3364-your brother [I]0-i know esteems [him]104-colonel brandon highly . [He]104-colonel brandon is undoubtedly [a sensible man]2933-a sensible man , and in [his]104-colonel brandon manners perfectly [the gentleman]722-the gentleman . ” “[104-colonel brandon] Indeed , ” replied [Elinor]89-elinor , “[104-colonel brandon] [I]0-i believe that [you]103-mrs. jennings will find [him]104-colonel brandon , on farther acquaintance , all that [you]103-mrs. jennings have heard [him]104-colonel brandon to be , and as [you]103-mrs. jennings will be [such very near neighbours]2273-such very near neighbours ( for [I]0-i understand [the parsonage]2274-the parsonage is almost close to [the mansion - house]2275-the mansion - house , ) it is particularly important that [he]104-colonel brandon _ should _ be all this . ” [Edward]98-edward made no answer ; but when [she]0-i had turned away [her]0-i head , gave [her]0-i a look so serious , so earnest , so uncheerful , as seemed to say , that [he]104-colonel brandon might hereafter wish the distance between [the parsonage]2274-the parsonage and [the mansion - house]2275-the mansion - house much greater . “[104-colonel brandon] [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon , [I]0-i think , lodges in [St. James Street]68-st. james street , ” said [he]104-colonel brandon , soon afterwards , rising from [his]104-colonel brandon chair . [Elinor]89-elinor told [him]104-colonel brandon the number of [the house]318-the house . “[104-colonel brandon] [I]0-i must hurry away then , to give [him]104-colonel brandon those thanks which [you]104-colonel brandon will not allow [me]0-i to give _ [you]104-colonel brandon ; _ to assure [him]104-colonel brandon that [he]104-colonel brandon has made [me]0-i [a very —]2276-a very — [an exceedingly happy man]2277-an exceedingly happy man . ” [Elinor]89-elinor did not offer to detain [him]104-colonel brandon ; and [they]4161-they parted , with a very earnest assurance on _ [her]89-elinor _ side of [her]89-elinor unceasing good wishes for [his]104-colonel brandon happiness in every change of situation that might befall [him]104-colonel brandon ; on _ [his]104-colonel brandon _ , with rather an attempt to return the same good will , than the power of expressing it . “[104-colonel brandon] When [I]0-i see [him]104-colonel brandon again , ” said [Elinor]89-elinor to [herself]0-i , as the door shut [him]104-colonel brandon out , “[0-i] [I]0-i shall see [him]104-colonel brandon [the husband of [Lucy]138-lucy]2278-the husband of lucy . ” And with this pleasing anticipation , [she]0-i sat down to reconsider the past , recall the words and endeavour to comprehend all the feelings of [Edward]98-edward ; and , of course , to reflect on [her]0-i own with discontent . When [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings came [home]565-home , though [she]103-mrs. jennings returned from seeing [people whom [she]103-mrs. jennings had never seen before]4163-people whom she had never seen before , and of whom therefore [she]103-mrs. jennings must have a great deal to say , [her]103-mrs. jennings mind was so much more occupied by the important secret in [her]103-mrs. jennings possession , than by anything else , that [she]103-mrs. jennings reverted to it again as soon as [Elinor]89-elinor appeared . “[0-i] Well , [[my]0-i dear]2750-my dear , ” [she]0-i cried , “[0-i] [I]0-i sent [you]2750-my dear up [the young man]2280-the young man . Did not [I]0-i do right?—And [I]0-i suppose [you]2750-my dear had no great difficulty — [You]2750-my dear did not find [him]2280-the young man very unwilling to accept [your]2750-my dear proposal ? ” “[2750-my dear] No , [ma’am]2974-ma’am ; _ that _ was not very likely . ” “[2750-my dear] Well , and how soon will [he]2280-the young man be ready?—For it seems all to depend upon that . ” “[2974-ma’am] Really , ” said [Elinor]89-elinor , “[2974-ma’am] [I]0-i know so little of these kind of forms , that [I]0-i can hardly even conjecture as to the time , or the preparation necessary ; but [I]0-i suppose two or three months will complete [his]2280-the young man ordination . ” “[0-i] Two or three months ! ” cried [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ; “[2282-lord] [Lord]2282-lord ! [[my]0-i dear]2750-my dear , how calmly [you]2750-my dear talk of it ; and can [the Colonel]104-colonel brandon wait two or three months ! [Lord]2284-lord bless me!—I am sure it would put _ [me]0-i _ quite out of patience!—And though [one]2761-one would be very glad to do a kindness by [poor Mr. Ferrars]144-robert , [I]0-i do think it is not worth while to wait two or three months for [him]2280-the young man . Sure [somebody else]2286-somebody else might be found that would do as well ; [somebody that is in orders]2287-somebody that is in orders already . ” “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]2750-my dear [ma’am]2974-ma’am , ” said [Elinor]89-elinor , “[0-i] what can [you]2974-ma’am be thinking of ? Why , [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon ’s only object is to be of use to [Mr. Ferrars]144-robert . ” “[144-robert] Lord bless [you]2750-my dear , [[my]0-i dear]2750-my dear ! Sure [you]2750-my dear do not mean to persuade [me]0-i that [the Colonel]664-the colonel only marries [you]2750-my dear for the sake of giving ten guineas to [Mr. Ferrars]144-robert ! ” The deception could not continue after this ; and an explanation immediately took place , by which [both]2892-both gained considerable amusement for the moment , without any material loss of happiness to either , for [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings only exchanged one form of delight for another , and still without forfeiting [her]103-mrs. jennings expectation of the first . “[2750-my dear] Aye , aye , [the parsonage]2274-the parsonage is but a small one , ” said [she]0-i , after the first ebullition of surprise and satisfaction was over , “[2750-my dear] and very likely _ may _ be out of repair ; but to hear [a man]499-a man apologising , as [I]0-i thought , for [a house that to [my]0-i knowledge]2294-a house that to my knowledge has [five sitting rooms on the ground - floor]2295-five sitting rooms on the ground - floor , and [I]0-i think [the housekeeper]2994-the housekeeper told [me]0-i could make up fifteen beds ! and to [you]2750-my dear too , that had been used to live in [Barton cottage]3064-barton cottage ! It seems quite ridiculous . But , [[my]0-i dear]2750-my dear , [we]2299-we must touch up [the Colonel]664-the colonel to do some thing to [the parsonage]2274-the parsonage , and make it comfortable for [them]2302-them , before [Lucy]138-lucy goes to it . ” “[138-lucy] But [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon does not seem to have any idea of the living ’s being enough to allow [them]2302-them to marry . ” “[104-colonel brandon] [The Colonel]664-the colonel is a ninny , [[my]0-i dear]2750-my dear ; because [he]664-the colonel has two thousand a - year [himself]664-the colonel , [he]664-the colonel thinks that [nobody else]3589-nobody else can marry on less . Take [my]0-i word for it , that , if [I]0-i am alive , [I]0-i shall be paying a visit at [Delaford Parsonage]69-delaford parsonage before [Michaelmas]216-michaelmas ; and [I]0-i am sure [I]0-i sha n’t go if [Lucy]138-lucy an’t [there]354-there . ” [Elinor]89-elinor was quite of [her]0-i opinion , as to the probability of [their]2302-them not waiting for any thing more . CHAPTER XLI . [Edward]98-edward , having carried [his]664-the colonel thanks to [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon , proceeded with [his]664-the colonel happiness to [Lucy]138-lucy ; and such was the excess of it by the time [he]664-the colonel reached [[Bartlett]182-bartlett ’s Buildings]4083-bartlett ’s buildings , that [she]89-elinor was able to assure [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , who called on [her]89-elinor again the next day with [her]89-elinor congratulations , that [she]89-elinor had never seen [him]664-the colonel in such spirits before in [her]89-elinor life . [Her]89-elinor own happiness , and [her]89-elinor own spirits , were at least very certain ; and [she]89-elinor joined [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings most heartily in [her]89-elinor expectation of [their]4166-their being all comfortably together in [Delaford Parsonage]69-delaford parsonage before [Michaelmas]216-michaelmas . So far was [she]89-elinor , at the same time , from any backwardness to give [Elinor]89-elinor that credit which [Edward]98-edward _ would _ give [her]89-elinor , that [she]89-elinor spoke of [her]89-elinor friendship for [[them]4166-their both]4167-them both with the most grateful warmth , was ready to own all [their]4166-their obligation to [her]89-elinor , and openly declared that no exertion for [their]4166-their good on [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood ’s part , either present or future , would ever surprise [her]89-elinor , for [she]89-elinor believed [her]89-elinor capable of doing any thing in [the world]2778-the world for those [she]89-elinor really valued . As for [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon , [she]89-elinor was not only ready to worship [him]104-colonel brandon as [a saint]4169-a saint , but was moreover truly anxious that [he]104-colonel brandon should be treated as one in all worldly concerns ; anxious that [his]104-colonel brandon tithes should be raised to the utmost ; and secretly resolved to avail [herself]89-elinor , at [Delaford]22-delaford , as far as [she]89-elinor possibly could , of [[his]104-colonel brandon servants]3667-his servants , [[his]104-colonel brandon carriage]694-his carriage , [his]104-colonel brandon cows , and [his]104-colonel brandon poultry . It was now above a week since [John Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood had called in [Berkeley Street]40-berkeley street , and as since that time no notice had been taken by [them]4172-them of [[his]104-colonel brandon wife]280-his wife ’s indisposition , beyond one verbal enquiry , [Elinor]89-elinor began to feel it necessary to pay [her]89-elinor a visit.—This was an obligation , however , which not only opposed [her]89-elinor own inclination , but which had not the assistance of any encouragement from [[her]89-elinor companions]4174-her companions . [Marianne]90-marianne , not contented with absolutely refusing to go [herself]90-marianne , was very urgent to prevent [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister ’s going at all ; and [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , though [[her]103-mrs. jennings carriage]1709-her carriage was always at [Elinor]89-elinor ’s service , so very much disliked [Mrs. John Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood , that not even [her]89-elinor curiosity to see how [she]89-elinor looked after the late discovery , nor [her]89-elinor strong desire to affront [her]89-elinor by taking [Edward]98-edward ’s part , could overcome [her]89-elinor unwillingness to be in [her]89-elinor company again . The consequence was , that [Elinor]89-elinor set out by [herself]89-elinor to pay a visit , for which [no one]317-no one could really have less inclination , and to run the risk of a tête - à - tête with [a woman]816-a woman , whom neither of [the others]539-the others had so much reason to dislike . [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood was denied ; but before [the carriage]1118-the carriage could turn from [the house]318-the house , [[her]103-mrs. jennings husband]319-her husband accidentally came out . [He]319-her husband expressed great pleasure in meeting [Elinor]89-elinor , told [her]89-elinor that [he]319-her husband had been just going to call in [Berkeley Street]40-berkeley street , and , assuring [her]89-elinor that [Fanny]93-fanny would be very glad to see [her]89-elinor , invited [her]89-elinor to come in . [They]4183-they walked up stairs in to [the drawing - room.—Nobody]4184-the drawing - room.—nobody was there . “[138-lucy] [Fanny]93-fanny is in [[her]93-fanny own room]1394-her own room , [I]0-i suppose , ” said [he]4185-he : “[93-fanny] [I]0-i will go to [her]93-fanny presently , for [I]0-i am sure [she]93-fanny will not have the least objection in [the world]2778-the world to seeing _ [you]2309-you _ . Very far from it , indeed . _ Now _ especially there can not be — but however , [you]2309-you and [Marianne]90-marianne were always great favourites . Why would not [Marianne]90-marianne come ? ” [Elinor]89-elinor made what excuse [she]89-elinor could for [her]2309-you . “[0-i] [I]0-i am not sorry to see [you]2309-you alone , ” [he]217-colonel brandon’s replied , “[0-i] for [I]0-i have a good deal to say to [you]2309-you . This living of [Colonel Brandon’s]217-colonel brandon’s — can it be true?—has [he]217-colonel brandon’s really given it to [Edward?—I]218-edward?—i heard it yesterday by chance , and was coming to [you]2309-you on purpose to enquire farther about it . ” “[217-colonel brandon’s] It is perfectly true.—Colonel [Brandon]104-colonel brandon has given the living of [Delaford]22-delaford to [Edward]98-edward . ” “[104-colonel brandon] [Really!—Well]219-really!—well , this is very astonishing!—no relationship!—no connection between them!—and now that livings fetch such a price!—what was the value of this ? ” “[219-really!—well] About two hundred a year . ” “[219-really!—well] Very well — and for the next presentation to [a living of that value]2310-a living of that value — supposing [the late incumbent]2217-the late incumbent to have been old and sickly , and likely to vacate it soon — [he]2217-the late incumbent might have got [I]0-i dare say — fourteen hundred pounds . And how came [he]2217-the late incumbent not to have settled that matter before [this person]2055-this person ’s death ? _ Now _ , indeed it would be too late to sell it , but [a man of [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon]2313-a man of colonel brandon ’s sense ! [I]0-i wonder [he]2217-the late incumbent should be so improvident in a point of such common , such natural , concern ! Well , [I]0-i am convinced that there is a vast deal of inconsistency in [almost every human character]2314-almost every human character . [I]0-i suppose , however — on recollection — that the case may probably be _ this _ . [Edward]98-edward is only to hold the living till [the person to whom [the Colonel]664-the colonel has really sold the presentation]2315-the person to whom the colonel has really sold the presentation , is old enough to take it . Aye , aye , that is the fact , depend upon it . ” [Elinor]89-elinor contradicted it , however , very positively ; and by relating that [she]89-elinor had [herself]89-elinor been employed in conveying the offer from [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon to [Edward]98-edward , and , therefore , must understand the terms on which it was given , obliged [him]2217-the late incumbent to submit to [her]89-elinor authority . “[664-the colonel] It is truly astonishing!”—he cried , after hearing what [she]93-fanny said—“what[664-the colonel] could be [the Colonel]664-the colonel ’s motive ? ” “[664-the colonel] A very simple one — to be of use to [Mr. Ferrars]144-robert . ” “[144-robert] Well , well ; whatever [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon may be , [Edward]98-edward is a very lucky man.—You will not mention the matter to [Fanny]93-fanny , however , for though [I]0-i have broke it to [her]93-fanny , and [she]93-fanny bears it vastly well,—she will not like to hear it much talked of . ” [Elinor]89-elinor had some difficulty here to refrain from observing , that [she]89-elinor thought [Fanny]93-fanny might have borne with composure , an acquisition of wealth to [[her]93-fanny brother]339-her brother , by which neither [she]93-fanny nor [[her]93-fanny child]277-her child could be possibly impoverished . “[98-edward] [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward , ” added [he]339-her brother , lowering [his]339-her brother voice to the tone becoming so important a subject , “[98-edward] knows nothing about it at present , and [I]0-i believe it will be best to keep it entirely concealed from [her]93-fanny as long as may be . When the marriage takes place , [I]0-i fear [she]93-fanny must hear of it all . ” “[93-fanny] But why should such precaution be used ? Though it is not to be supposed that [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward can have the smallest satisfaction in knowing that [[her]98-edward son]1054-her son has money enough to live upon , for _ that _ must be quite out of the question ; yet why , upon [her]98-edward late behaviour , is [she]98-edward supposed to feel at all ? [She]98-edward has done with [[her]98-edward son,—she]2319-her son,—she cast [him]1054-her son off for ever , and has made [all those over whom [she]98-edward had any influence]2320-all those over whom she had any influence , cast [him]1054-her son off likewise . Surely , after doing so , [she]98-edward can not be imagined liable to any impression of sorrow or of joy on [his]1054-her son account : [she]98-edward can not be interested in any thing that befalls [him]1054-her son . [She]98-edward would not be so weak as to throw away the comfort of [a child]576-a child , and yet retain the anxiety of [a parent]1563-a parent ! ” “[89-elinor] Ah ! [Elinor]89-elinor , ” said [John]88-mrs. dashwood , “[89-elinor] [your]89-elinor reasoning is very good , but it is founded on ignorance of human nature . When [Edward]98-edward ’s unhappy match takes place , depend upon it [[his]1054-her son mother]270-his mother will feel as much as if [she]98-edward had never discarded [him]1054-her son ; and , therefore every circumstance that may accelerate that dreadful event , must be concealed from [her]98-edward as much as possible . [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward can never forget that [Edward]98-edward is [[her]98-edward son]1054-her son . ” “[89-elinor] [You]89-elinor surprise [me]0-i ; [I]0-i should think it must nearly have escaped [her]98-edward memory by _ this _ time . ” “[89-elinor] [You]89-elinor wrong [her]98-edward exceedingly . [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward is [one of the most affectionate mothers in [the world]2778-the world]2325-one of the most affectionate mothers in the world . ” [Elinor]89-elinor was silent . “[98-edward] [We]2327-we think _ now_,”—said [Mr. Dashwood]85-mr. dashwood , after a short pause , “[144-robert] of _ [Robert]144-robert ’s _ marrying [Miss Morton]178-miss morton . ” [Elinor]89-elinor , smiling at the grave and decisive importance of [[her]89-elinor brother]339-her brother ’s tone , calmly replied , — “[144-robert] [The lady]370-the lady , [I]0-i suppose , has no choice in the affair . ” “[370-the lady] Choice!—how do [you]89-elinor mean ? ” “[89-elinor] [I]0-i only mean that [I]0-i suppose , from [your]89-elinor manner of speaking , it must be the same to [Miss Morton]178-miss morton whether [she]178-miss morton marry [Edward]98-edward or [Robert]144-robert . ” “[0-i] Certainly , there can be no difference ; for [Robert]144-robert will now to all intents and purposes be considered as [the eldest son;—and]2329-the eldest son;—and as to any thing else , [they]2330-they are [both very agreeable young men]2331-both very agreeable young men : [I]0-i do not know that one is superior to the other . ” [Elinor]89-elinor said no more , and [John]88-mrs. dashwood was also for a short time silent.—His reflections ended thus . “[0-i] Of _ one _ thing , [[my]0-i dear sister]3621-my dear sister , ” kindly taking [her]89-elinor hand , and speaking in an awful whisper , “[0-i] [I]0-i may assure [you;—and]2333-you;—and [I]0-i _ will _ do it , because [I]0-i know it must gratify [you]3621-my dear sister . [I]0-i have good reason to think — indeed [I]0-i have it from the best authority , or [I]0-i should not repeat it , for otherwise it would be very wrong to say any thing about it,—but [I]0-i have it from the very best authority,—not that [I]0-i ever precisely heard [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward say it [herself]98-edward — but [[her]98-edward daughter]404-her daughter _ did _ , and [I]0-i have it from [her,—that]2335-her,—that in short , whatever objections there might be against a certain — a certain connection , [you]3621-my dear sister understand [me,—it]2336-me,—it would have been far preferable to [her,—it]2337-her,—it would not have given [her]98-edward half the vexation that _ this _ does . [I]0-i was exceedingly pleased to hear that [Mrs. Ferrars]98-edward considered it in that light ; a very gratifying circumstance [you]3621-my dear sister know to [us]2338-us all . ‘ It would have been beyond comparison , ’ [she]98-edward said , ‘ the least evil of the two , and [she]98-edward would be glad to compound _ now _ for nothing worse . ’ But however , all that is quite out of the question,—not to be thought of or mentioned — as to any attachment [you]3621-my dear sister know , it never could be : all that is gone by . But [I]0-i thought [I]0-i would just tell [you]3621-my dear sister of this , because [I]0-i knew how much it must please [you]3621-my dear sister . Not that [you]3621-my dear sister have any reason to regret , [[my]0-i dear]2750-my dear [Elinor]89-elinor . There is no doubt of [your]3621-my dear sister doing exceedingly well,—quite as well , or better , perhaps , all things considered . Has [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon been with [you]3621-my dear sister lately ? ” [Elinor]89-elinor had heard enough , if not to gratify [her]89-elinor vanity , and raise [her]89-elinor self - importance , to agitate [her]89-elinor nerves and fill [her]89-elinor mind;—and [she]89-elinor was therefore glad to be spared from the necessity of saying much in reply [herself]89-elinor , and from the danger of hearing any thing more from [[her]89-elinor brother]339-her brother , by the entrance of [Mr. Robert Ferrars]144-robert .
