After a few moments ’ chat , [John Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood , recollecting that [Fanny]93-fanny was yet uninformed of [[her]88-mrs. dashwood sister]336-her sister ’s being [there]354-there , quitted [the room]2842-the room in quest of [her]93-fanny ; and [Elinor]89-elinor was left to improve [her]89-elinor acquaintance with [Robert]144-robert , who , by the gay unconcern , the happy self - complacency of [his]144-robert manner while enjoying so unfair a division of [[his]144-robert mother]270-his mother ’s love and liberality , to the prejudice of [[his]144-robert banished brother]4194-his banished brother , earned only by [his]144-robert own dissipated course of life , and [that brother]4195-that brother ’s integrity , was confirming [her]89-elinor most unfavourable opinion of [his]144-robert head and heart . [They]4196-they had scarcely been two minutes by [themselves]4196-they , before [he]144-robert began to speak of [Edward]98-edward ; for [he]144-robert , too , had heard of the living , and was very inquisitive on the subject . [Elinor]89-elinor repeated the particulars of it , as [she]89-elinor had given them to [John]88-mrs. dashwood ; and their effect on [Robert]144-robert , though very different , was not less striking than it had been on _ [him]144-robert _ . [He]144-robert laughed most immoderately . The idea of [Edward]98-edward ’s being [a clergyman]4197-a clergyman , and living in [a small parsonage - house]4198-a small parsonage - house , diverted [him]144-robert beyond measure;—and when to that was added the fanciful imagery of [Edward]98-edward reading prayers in a white surplice , and publishing the banns of marriage between [John Smith]220-john smith and [Mary Brown]90-marianne , [he]144-robert could conceive nothing more ridiculous . [Elinor]89-elinor , while [she]89-elinor waited in silence and immovable gravity , the conclusion of such folly , could not restrain [her]89-elinor eyes from being fixed on [him]144-robert with a look that spoke all the contempt it excited . It was a look , however , very well bestowed , for it relieved [her]89-elinor own feelings , and gave no intelligence to [him]144-robert . [He]144-robert was recalled from wit to wisdom , not by any reproof of [hers]89-elinor , but by [his]144-robert own sensibility . “[104-colonel brandon] [We]2340-we may treat it as a joke , ” said [he]144-robert , at last , recovering from the affected laugh which had considerably lengthened out the genuine gaiety of the moment ; “[104-colonel brandon] but , upon [my]0-i soul , it is a most serious business . [Poor [Edward]98-edward]3437-poor edward ! [he]3437-poor edward is ruined for ever . [I]0-i am extremely sorry for it ; for [I]0-i know [him]3437-poor edward to be [a very good - hearted creature]2342-a very good - hearted creature ; as well - meaning a fellow perhaps , as any in [the world]2778-the world . [You]2344-you must not judge of [him]3437-poor edward , [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood , from _ [your]2344-you _ slight acquaintance . [Poor Edward]147-edward ! [His]147-edward manners are certainly not the happiest in nature . But [we]2340-we are not all born , [you]2344-you know , with the same powers,—the same address . [Poor fellow]3280-poor fellow ! to see [him]147-edward in [a circle of [strangers]3147-strangers]2346-a circle of strangers ! To be sure it was pitiable enough ; but upon [my]0-i soul , [I]0-i believe [he]147-edward has as good a heart as any in [the kingdom]2348-the kingdom ; and [I]0-i declare and protest to [you]2344-you [I]0-i never was so shocked in [my]0-i life , as when it all burst forth . [I]0-i could not believe it . [[My]0-i mother]2771-my mother was [the first person who told [me]0-i of it]2350-the first person who told me of it ; and [I]0-i , feeling [myself]0-i called on to act with resolution , immediately said to [her]2771-my mother , ‘ [[My]0-i dear madam]2987-my dear madam , [I]0-i do not know what [you]2771-my mother may intend to do on the occasion , but as for [myself]0-i , [I]0-i must say , that if [Edward]147-edward does marry [this young woman]2352-this young woman , _ [I]0-i _ never will see [him]147-edward again . ’ That was what [I]0-i said immediately . [I]0-i was most uncommonly shocked , indeed ! [Poor Edward]147-edward ! [he]147-edward has done for [himself]147-edward completely,—shut [himself]147-edward out for ever from all decent society ! But , as [I]0-i directly said to [[my]0-i mother]2771-my mother , [I]0-i am not in the least surprised at it ; from [his]147-edward style of education , it was always to be expected . [[My]0-i poor mother]2354-my poor mother was half frantic . ” “[2354-my poor mother] Have [you]0-i ever seen [the lady]370-the lady ? ” “[370-the lady] Yes ; once , while [she]370-the lady was staying in [this house]2807-this house , [I]0-i happened to drop in for ten minutes ; and [I]0-i saw quite enough of [her]370-the lady . [The merest awkward country girl , without style , or elegance , and almost without beauty]2357-the merest awkward country girl , without style , or elegance , and almost without beauty . [I]0-i remember [her]370-the lady perfectly . Just the kind of girl [I]0-i should suppose likely to captivate [poor Edward]147-edward . [I]0-i offered immediately , as soon as [[my]0-i mother]2771-my mother related the affair to [me]0-i , to talk to [him]147-edward [myself]0-i , and dissuade [him]147-edward from the match ; but it was too late _ then _ , [I]0-i found , to do any thing , for unluckily , [I]0-i was not in the way at first , and knew nothing of it till after the breach had taken place , when it was not for [me]0-i , [you]2359-you know , to interfere . But had [I]0-i been informed of it a few hours earlier , [I]0-i think it is most probable that something might have been hit on . [I]0-i certainly should have represented it to [Edward]147-edward in a very strong light . ‘ [[My]0-i dear fellow]2360-my dear fellow , ’ [I]0-i should have said , ‘ consider what [you]2360-my dear fellow are doing . [You]2360-my dear fellow are making a most disgraceful connection , and [such a one as [[your]2360-my dear fellow family]3146-your family]2361-such a one as your family are unanimous in disapproving . ’ [I]0-i can not help thinking , in short , that means might have been found . But now it is all too late . [He]147-edward must be starved , [you]2359-you know , that is certain ; absolutely starved . ” [He]147-edward had just settled this point with great composure , when the entrance of [Mrs. John Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood put an end to the subject . But though _ [she]88-mrs. dashwood _ never spoke of it out of [[her]88-mrs. dashwood own family]3569-her own family , [Elinor]89-elinor could see its influence on [her]88-mrs. dashwood mind , in the something like confusion of countenance with which [she]88-mrs. dashwood entered , and an attempt at cordiality in [her]88-mrs. dashwood behaviour to [herself]88-mrs. dashwood . [She]88-mrs. dashwood even proceeded so far as to be concerned to find that [Elinor]89-elinor and [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister were so soon to leave [town]2984-town , as [she]88-mrs. dashwood had hoped to see more of them;—an exertion in which [[her]89-elinor husband]319-her husband , who attended [her]89-elinor into [the room]2842-the room , and hung enamoured over [her]89-elinor accents , seemed to distinguish every thing that was most affectionate and graceful . CHAPTER XLII . One other short call in [Harley Street]56-harley street , in which [Elinor]89-elinor received [[her]89-elinor brother]339-her brother ’s congratulations on [their]4205-their travelling so far towards [Barton]8-barton without any expense , and on [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon ’s being to follow [them]4205-their to [Cleveland]32-cleveland in a day or two , completed the intercourse of [the brother and sisters]4206-the brother and sisters in town;—and a faint invitation from [Fanny]93-fanny , to come to [Norland]3-norland whenever it should happen to be in [their]4205-their way , which of all things was the most unlikely to occur , with a more warm , though less public , assurance , from [John]88-mrs. dashwood to [Elinor]89-elinor , of the promptitude with which [he]319-her husband should come to see [her]89-elinor at [Delaford]22-delaford , was all that foretold any meeting in [the country]612-the country . It amused [her]89-elinor to observe that all [[her]89-elinor friends]1633-her friends seemed determined to send [her]89-elinor to [[Delaford;—a]70-delaford;—a place , in which , of all others , [she]89-elinor would now least chuse to visit , or wish to reside]4209-delaford;—a place , in which , of all others , she would now least chuse to visit , or wish to reside ; for not only was [it]4209-delaford;—a place , in which , of all others , she would now least chuse to visit , or wish to reside considered as [[her]89-elinor future home]4210-her future home by [[her]89-elinor brother]339-her brother and [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , but even [Lucy]138-lucy , when [they]4212-they parted , gave [her]138-lucy a pressing invitation to visit [her]138-lucy [there]354-there . Very early in April , and tolerably early in the day , [the two parties from [Hanover Square]71-hanover square and [Berkeley Street]40-berkeley street]4214-the two parties from hanover square and berkeley street set out from [[their]4214-the two parties from hanover square and berkeley street respective homes]4215-their respective homes , to meet , by appointment , on [the road]976-the road . For the convenience of [Charlotte]127-charlotte and [[her]127-charlotte child]277-her child , [they]4214-the two parties from hanover square and berkeley street were to be more than two days on [their]4214-the two parties from hanover square and berkeley street journey , and [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer , travelling more expeditiously with [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon , was to join [them]4214-the two parties from hanover square and berkeley street at [Cleveland]32-cleveland soon after [their]4214-the two parties from hanover square and berkeley street arrival . [Marianne]90-marianne , few as had been [her]90-marianne hours of comfort in [London]24-london , and eager as [she]90-marianne had long been to quit [it]4218-it , could not , when it came to the point , bid adieu to [the house in which [she]90-marianne had for the last time enjoyed those hopes , and that confidence , in [Willoughby]107-willoughby]4219-the house in which she had for the last time enjoyed those hopes , and that confidence , in willoughby , which were now extinguished for ever , without great pain . Nor could [she]90-marianne leave [the place in which [Willoughby]107-willoughby]4220-the place in which willoughby remained , busy in new engagements , and new schemes , in which _ [she]90-marianne _ could have no share , without shedding many tears . [Elinor]89-elinor ’s satisfaction , at the moment of removal , was more positive . [She]90-marianne had no such object for [her]90-marianne lingering thoughts to fix on , [she]90-marianne left [no creature]4221-no creature behind , from whom it would give [her]90-marianne a moment ’s regret to be divided for ever , [she]90-marianne was pleased to be free [herself]90-marianne from the persecution of [Lucy]138-lucy ’s friendship , [she]90-marianne was grateful for bringing [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister away unseen by [Willoughby]107-willoughby since [his]107-willoughby marriage , and [she]90-marianne looked forward with hope to what a few months of tranquility at [Barton]8-barton might do towards restoring [Marianne]90-marianne ’s peace of mind , and confirming [her]90-marianne own . [Their]4223-their journey was safely performed . The second day brought [them]4223-their into the cherished , or [the prohibited , county of [Somerset]73-somerset]4224-the prohibited , county of somerset , for as such was it dwelt on by turns in [Marianne]90-marianne ’s imagination ; and in the forenoon of the third [they]4223-their drove up to [Cleveland]32-cleveland . [Cleveland]32-cleveland was [a spacious , modern - built house , situated on [a sloping lawn]4226-a sloping lawn]4225-a spacious , modern - built house , situated on a sloping lawn . [It]32-cleveland had [no park]4227-no park , but [the pleasure - grounds]4228-the pleasure - grounds were tolerably extensive ; and like [every other place of the same degree of importance]4229-every other place of the same degree of importance , [it]32-cleveland had [its]32-cleveland open shrubbery , and [closer wood walk]4230-closer wood walk , [a road of smooth gravel winding round [a plantation]4232-a plantation]4231-a road of smooth gravel winding round a plantation , led to the front , [the lawn]4233-the lawn was dotted over with timber , [the house]318-the house itself was under the guardianship of the fir , the mountain - ash , and the acacia , and a thick screen of them altogether , interspersed with tall Lombardy poplars , shut out [the offices]534-the offices . [Marianne]90-marianne entered [the house]318-the house with a heart swelling with emotion from the consciousness of being only eighty miles from [Barton]8-barton , and not thirty from [Combe Magna]35-combe magna ; and before [she]90-marianne had been five minutes within [its]318-the house walls , while [the others]539-the others were busily helping [Charlotte]127-charlotte to show [[her]127-charlotte child]277-her child to [the housekeeper]2994-the housekeeper , [she]90-marianne quitted it again , stealing away through the winding shrubberies , now just beginning to be in beauty , to gain a distant eminence ; where , from [its]318-the house Grecian temple , [her]90-marianne eye , wandering over [a wide tract of country to the south - east]4240-a wide tract of country to the south - east , could fondly rest on [the farthest ridge of hills in the horizon]4241-the farthest ridge of hills in the horizon , and fancy that from [[their]4241-the farthest ridge of hills in the horizon summits [Combe Magna]35-combe magna]4242-their summits combe magna might be seen . In such moments of precious , invaluable misery , [she]90-marianne rejoiced in tears of agony to be at [Cleveland]32-cleveland ; and as [she]90-marianne returned by a different circuit to [the house]318-the house , feeling all the happy privilege of country liberty , of wandering from place to place in free and luxurious solitude , [she]90-marianne resolved to spend almost every hour of every day while [she]90-marianne remained with [the Palmers]126-the palmers , in the indulgence of such solitary rambles . [She]90-marianne returned just in time to join [the others]539-the others as [they]539-the others quitted [the house]318-the house , on an excursion through [[its]318-the house more immediate premises]4246-its more immediate premises ; and the rest of the morning was easily whiled away , in lounging round [the kitchen garden]4247-the kitchen garden , examining the bloom upon [its]4247-the kitchen garden walls , and listening to [the gardener]4248-the gardener ’s lamentations upon blights , in dawdling through [the green - house]3939-the green - house , where the loss of [her]90-marianne favourite plants , unwarily exposed , and nipped by the lingering frost , raised the laughter of [Charlotte,—and]222-charlotte,—and in visiting [[her]90-marianne poultry - yard]4250-her poultry - yard , where , in the disappointed hopes of [[her]90-marianne dairy - maid]4251-her dairy - maid , by hens forsaking [their]4251-her dairy - maid nests , or being stolen by a fox , or in the rapid decrease of [a promising young brood]4252-a promising young brood , [she]90-marianne found fresh sources of merriment . The morning was fine and dry , and [Marianne]90-marianne , in [her]90-marianne plan of employment abroad , had not calculated for any change of weather during [their]539-the others stay at [Cleveland]32-cleveland . With great surprise therefore , did [she]90-marianne find [herself]90-marianne prevented by a settled rain from going out again after dinner . [She]90-marianne had depended on a twilight walk to [the Grecian temple]4253-the grecian temple , and perhaps all over [the grounds]857-the grounds , and an evening merely cold or damp would not have deterred [her]90-marianne from it ; but a heavy and settled rain even _ [she]90-marianne _ could not fancy dry or pleasant weather for walking . [Their]539-the others party was small , and the hours passed quietly away . [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer had [[her]128-mrs. palmer child]277-her child , and [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings [her]103-mrs. jennings carpet - work ; [they]539-the others talked of [the friends [they]539-the others had left behind]1404-the friends they had left behind , arranged [Lady Middleton]100-lady middleton ’s engagements , and wondered whether [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer and [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon would get farther than Reading that night . [Elinor]89-elinor , however little concerned in it , joined in [their]539-the others discourse ; and [Marianne]90-marianne , who had the knack of finding [her]90-marianne way in [every house]4257-every house to [the library]1953-the library , however it might be avoided by [the family]303-the family in general , soon procured [herself]90-marianne a book . Nothing was wanting on [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer ’s side that constant and friendly good humour could do , to make [them]539-the others feel [themselves]539-the others welcome . The openness and heartiness of [her]128-mrs. palmer manner more than atoned for that want of recollection and elegance which made [her]128-mrs. palmer often deficient in the forms of politeness ; [her]128-mrs. palmer kindness , recommended by so pretty a face , was engaging ; [her]128-mrs. palmer folly , though evident was not disgusting , because it was not conceited ; and [Elinor]89-elinor could have forgiven every thing but [her]128-mrs. palmer laugh . [The two gentlemen]4260-the two gentlemen arrived the next day to a very late dinner , affording a pleasant enlargement of the party , and a very welcome variety to [their]539-the others conversation , which a long morning of the same continued rain had reduced very low . [Elinor]89-elinor had seen so little of [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer , and in that little had seen so much variety in [his]129-mr. palmer address to [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister and [herself]89-elinor , that [she]89-elinor knew not what to expect to find [him]129-mr. palmer in [[his]129-mr. palmer own family]4262-his own family . [She]89-elinor found [him]129-mr. palmer , however , perfectly [the gentleman in [his]129-mr. palmer behaviour to all [[his]129-mr. palmer visitors]4264-his visitors , and only occasionally rude to [[his]129-mr. palmer wife]280-his wife and [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother]4263-the gentleman in his behaviour to all his visitors , and only occasionally rude to his wife and her mother ; [she]89-elinor found [him]129-mr. palmer very capable of being [a pleasant companion]4267-a pleasant companion , and only prevented from being so always , by too great an aptitude to fancy [himself]129-mr. palmer as much superior to [people in general]1773-people in general , as [he]129-mr. palmer must feel [himself]129-mr. palmer to be to [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings and [Charlotte]127-charlotte . For the rest of [his]129-mr. palmer character and habits , [they]4269-they were marked , as far as [Elinor]89-elinor could perceive , with no traits at all unusual in [his]129-mr. palmer sex and time of life . [He]129-mr. palmer was nice in [his]129-mr. palmer eating , uncertain in [his]129-mr. palmer hours ; fond of [[his]129-mr. palmer child]361-his child , though affecting to slight it ; and idled away the mornings at billiards , which ought to have been devoted to business . [She]89-elinor liked [him]129-mr. palmer , however , upon the whole , much better than [she]89-elinor had expected , and in [her]89-elinor heart was not sorry that [she]89-elinor could like [him]129-mr. palmer no more;—not sorry to be driven by the observation of [his]129-mr. palmer Epicurism , [his]129-mr. palmer selfishness , and [his]129-mr. palmer conceit , to rest with complacency on the remembrance of [Edward]147-edward ’s generous temper , simple taste , and diffident feelings . Of [Edward]147-edward , or at least of some of [his]129-mr. palmer concerns , [she]89-elinor now received intelligence from [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon , who had been into [Dorsetshire]45-dorsetshire lately ; and who , treating [her]89-elinor at once as [the disinterested friend of [Mr. Ferrars]144-robert]4271-the disinterested friend of mr. ferrars , and [the kind confidante of [himself]129-mr. palmer]4272-the kind confidante of himself , talked to [her]89-elinor a great deal of [the parsonage at [Delaford]22-delaford]4273-the parsonage at delaford , described its deficiencies , and told [her]89-elinor what [he]129-mr. palmer meant to do [himself]129-mr. palmer towards removing them.—His behaviour to [her]89-elinor in this , as well as in every other particular , [his]129-mr. palmer open pleasure in meeting [her]89-elinor after an absence of only ten days , [his]129-mr. palmer readiness to converse with [her]89-elinor , and [his]129-mr. palmer deference for [her]89-elinor opinion , might very well justify [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s persuasion of [his]129-mr. palmer attachment , and would have been enough , perhaps , had not [Elinor]89-elinor still , as from the first , believed [Marianne]90-marianne [[his]129-mr. palmer real favourite]4274-his real favourite , to make [her]89-elinor suspect it [herself]89-elinor . But as it was , such a notion had scarcely ever entered [her]89-elinor head , except by [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s suggestion ; and [she]89-elinor could not help believing [herself]89-elinor [the nicest observer of [the two;—she]4276-the two;—she]4275-the nicest observer of the two;—she watched [his]129-mr. palmer eyes , while [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings thought only of [his]129-mr. palmer behaviour;—and while [his]129-mr. palmer looks of anxious solicitude on [Marianne]90-marianne ’s feeling , in [her]90-marianne head and throat , the beginning of a heavy cold , because unexpressed by words , entirely escaped [the latter lady]4277-the latter lady ’s observation;—_she _ could discover in [them]4278-them the quick feelings , and needless alarm of [a lover]2821-a lover . Two delightful twilight walks on the third and fourth evenings of [her]90-marianne being [there]354-there , not merely on the dry gravel of the shrubbery , but all over [the grounds]857-the grounds , and especially in the most distant parts of [them]857-the grounds , where there was something more of wildness than in the rest , where the trees were the oldest , and the grass was the longest and wettest , had — assisted by the still greater imprudence of sitting in [her]90-marianne wet shoes and stockings — given [Marianne]90-marianne a cold so violent as , though for a day or two trifled with or denied , would force itself by increasing ailments on the concern of every body , and the notice of [herself]90-marianne . Prescriptions poured in from all quarters , and as usual , were all declined . Though heavy and feverish , with a pain in [her]90-marianne limbs , and a cough , and a sore throat , a good night ’s rest was to cure [her]90-marianne entirely ; and it was with difficulty that [Elinor]89-elinor prevailed on [her]90-marianne , when [she]90-marianne went to bed , to try one or two of the simplest of the remedies . CHAPTER XLIII . [Marianne]90-marianne got up the next morning at [her]90-marianne usual time ; to every inquiry replied that [she]90-marianne was better , and tried to prove [herself]90-marianne so , by engaging in [her]90-marianne accustomary employments . But a day spent in sitting shivering over the fire with a book in [her]90-marianne hand , which [she]90-marianne was unable to read , or in lying , weary and languid , on a sofa , did not speak much in favour of [her]90-marianne amendment ; and when , at last , [she]90-marianne went early to bed , more and more indisposed , [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon was only astonished at [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister ’s composure , who , though attending and nursing [her]90-marianne the whole day , against [Marianne]90-marianne ’s inclination , and forcing proper medicines on [her]90-marianne at night , trusted , like [Marianne]90-marianne , to the certainty and efficacy of sleep , and felt no real alarm . A very restless and feverish night , however , disappointed the expectation of both ; and when [Marianne]90-marianne , after persisting in rising , confessed [herself]90-marianne unable to sit up , and returned voluntarily to [her]90-marianne bed , [Elinor]89-elinor was very ready to adopt [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s advice , of sending for [[the Palmers]126-the palmers ’ apothecary]4283-the palmers ’ apothecary . [He]104-colonel brandon came , examined [[his]104-colonel brandon patient]4284-his patient , and though encouraging [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood to expect that a very few days would restore [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister to health , yet , by pronouncing [her]90-marianne disorder to have a putrid tendency , and allowing the word “[147-edward] infection ” to pass [his]104-colonel brandon lips , gave instant alarm to [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer , on [[her]128-mrs. palmer baby]4286-her baby ’s account . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , who had been inclined from the first to think [Marianne]90-marianne ’s complaint more serious than [Elinor]89-elinor , now looked very grave on [Mr. Harris]223-mr. harris ’s report , and confirming [Charlotte]127-charlotte ’s fears and caution , urged the necessity of [her]127-charlotte immediate removal with [[her]127-charlotte infant]4287-her infant ; and [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer , though treating [their]4288-their apprehensions as idle , found the anxiety and importunity of [[his]129-mr. palmer wife]280-his wife too great to be withstood . [Her]90-marianne departure , therefore , was fixed on ; and within an hour after [Mr. Harris]223-mr. harris ’s arrival , [she]90-marianne set off , with [[her]90-marianne little boy]4290-her little boy and [[his]4290-her little boy nurse]4291-his nurse , for [the house of a near relation of [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer ’s]4292-the house of a near relation of mr. palmer ’s , who lived a few miles on [the other side of [Bath]46-bath]4293-the other side of bath ; whither [[her]90-marianne husband]319-her husband promised , at [her]90-marianne earnest entreaty , to join [her]90-marianne in a day or two ; and whither [she]90-marianne was almost equally urgent with [[her]90-marianne mother]332-her mother to accompany [her]90-marianne . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , however , with a kindness of heart which made [Elinor]89-elinor really love [her]103-mrs. jennings , declared [her]90-marianne resolution of not stirring from [Cleveland]32-cleveland as long as [Marianne]90-marianne remained ill , and of endeavouring , by [her]90-marianne own attentive care , to supply to [her]90-marianne the place of [the mother [she]90-marianne had taken [her]90-marianne from]4296-the mother she had taken her from ; and [Elinor]89-elinor found [her]103-mrs. jennings on every occasion [a most willing and active helpmate]4297-a most willing and active helpmate , desirous to share in all [her]103-mrs. jennings fatigues , and often by [her]103-mrs. jennings better experience in nursing , of material use . [Poor Marianne]90-marianne , languid and low from the nature of [her]90-marianne malady , and feeling [herself]90-marianne universally ill , could no longer hope that tomorrow would find [her]90-marianne recovered ; and the idea of what tomorrow would have produced , but for this unlucky illness , made every ailment severe ; for on that day [they]4298-their were to have begun [their]4298-their journey [home]565-home ; and , attended the whole way by [a servant of [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings]4300-a servant of mrs. jennings , were to have taken [[their]4298-their mother]274-their mother by surprise on the following forenoon . The little [she]274-their mother said was all in lamentation of this inevitable delay ; though [Elinor]89-elinor tried to raise [her]89-elinor spirits , and make [her]89-elinor believe , as [she]89-elinor _ then _ really believed [herself]89-elinor , that it would be a very short one . The next day produced little or no alteration in the state of [the patient]4302-the patient ; [she]274-their mother certainly was not better , and , except that there was no amendment , did not appear worse . [[Their]4298-their party]1234-their party was now farther reduced ; for [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer , though very unwilling to go as well from real humanity and good - nature , as from a dislike of appearing to be frightened away by [[his]129-mr. palmer wife]280-his wife , was persuaded at last by [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon to perform [his]129-mr. palmer promise of following [her]280-his wife ; and while [he]129-mr. palmer was preparing to go , [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon [himself]104-colonel brandon , with a much greater exertion , began to talk of going likewise.—Here , however , the kindness of [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings interposed most acceptably ; for to send [the Colonel]664-the colonel away while [his]664-the colonel love was in so much uneasiness on [[her]103-mrs. jennings sister]336-her sister ’s account , would be to deprive [them]4298-their both , [she]103-mrs. jennings thought , of every comfort ; and therefore telling [him]664-the colonel at once that [his]664-the colonel stay at [Cleveland]32-cleveland was necessary to [herself]103-mrs. jennings , that [she]103-mrs. jennings should want [him]664-the colonel to play at piquet of an evening , while [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood was above with [[her]103-mrs. jennings sister]336-her sister , & c. [she]103-mrs. jennings urged [him]664-the colonel so strongly to remain , that [he]664-the colonel , who was gratifying the first wish of [his]664-the colonel own heart by a compliance , could not long even affect to demur ; especially as [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s entreaty was warmly seconded by [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer , who seemed to feel a relief to [himself]129-mr. palmer , in leaving behind [him]129-mr. palmer [a person so well able to assist or advise [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood in any emergence]4308-a person so well able to assist or advise miss dashwood in any emergence . [Marianne]90-marianne was , of course , kept in ignorance of all these arrangements . [She]90-marianne knew not that [she]90-marianne had been the means of sending [the owners of [Cleveland]32-cleveland]4309-the owners of cleveland away , in about seven days from the time of [their]4309-the owners of cleveland arrival . It gave [her]90-marianne no surprise that [she]90-marianne saw nothing of [Mrs. Palmer]128-mrs. palmer ; and as it gave [her]90-marianne likewise no concern , [she]90-marianne never mentioned [her]90-marianne name . Two days passed away from the time of [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer ’s departure , and [her]90-marianne situation continued , with little variation , the same . [Mr. Harris]223-mr. harris , who attended [her]90-marianne every day , still talked boldly of a speedy recovery , and [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood was equally sanguine ; but the expectation of [the others]539-the others was by no means so cheerful . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings had determined very early in the seizure that [Marianne]90-marianne would never get over it , and [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon , who was chiefly of use in listening to [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s forebodings , was not in a state of mind to resist [their]4309-the owners of cleveland influence . [He]129-mr. palmer tried to reason [himself]129-mr. palmer out of fears , which the different judgment of [the apothecary]4311-the apothecary seemed to render absurd ; but the many hours of each day in which [he]129-mr. palmer was left entirely alone , were but too favourable for the admission of every melancholy idea , and [he]129-mr. palmer could not expel from [his]129-mr. palmer mind the persuasion that [he]129-mr. palmer should see [Marianne]90-marianne no more . On the morning of the third day however , the gloomy anticipations of both were almost done away ; for when [Mr. Harris]223-mr. harris arrived , [he]223-mr. harris declared [[his]223-mr. harris patient]4284-his patient materially better . [Her]90-marianne pulse was much stronger , and every symptom more favourable than on the preceding visit . [Elinor]89-elinor , confirmed in every pleasant hope , was all cheerfulness ; rejoicing that in [her]89-elinor letters to [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother , [she]89-elinor had pursued [her]89-elinor own judgment rather than [[her]89-elinor friend]1021-her friend ’s , in making very light of the indisposition which delayed [them]4315-them at [Cleveland]32-cleveland ; and almost fixing on the time when [Marianne]90-marianne would be able to travel . But the day did not close so auspiciously as it began . Towards the evening [Marianne]90-marianne became ill again , growing more heavy , restless , and uncomfortable than before . [[Her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister , however , still sanguine , was willing to attribute the change to nothing more than the fatigue of having sat up to have [her]90-marianne bed made ; and carefully administering the cordials prescribed , saw [her]90-marianne , with satisfaction , sink at last into a slumber , from which [she]90-marianne expected the most beneficial effects . [Her]90-marianne sleep , though not so quiet as [Elinor]89-elinor wished to see it , lasted a considerable time ; and anxious to observe the result of it [herself]89-elinor , [she]89-elinor resolved to sit with [her]90-marianne during the whole of it . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , knowing nothing of any change in [the patient]4302-the patient , went unusually early to bed ; [[her]103-mrs. jennings maid]4318-her maid , who was one of [the principal nurses]4319-the principal nurses , was recreating [herself]4318-her maid in [[the housekeeper]2994-the housekeeper ’s room]4321-the housekeeper ’s room , and [Elinor]89-elinor remained alone with [Marianne]90-marianne . The repose of [the latter]325-the latter became more and more disturbed ; and [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister , who watched , with unremitting attention [her]90-marianne continual change of posture , and heard the frequent but inarticulate sounds of complaint which passed [her]90-marianne lips , was almost wishing to rouse [her]90-marianne from so painful a slumber , when [Marianne]90-marianne , suddenly awakened by some accidental noise in [the house]318-the house , started hastily up , and , with feverish wildness , cried out , — “[2826-mama] Is [mama]2826-mama coming ? ” “[2826-mama] Not yet , ” cried [the other]772-the other , concealing [her]0-i terror , and assisting [Marianne]90-marianne to lie down again , “[2826-mama] but [she]2826-mama will be here , [I]0-i hope , before it is long . It is a great way , [you]2364-you know , from hence to [Barton]8-barton . ” “[2364-you] But [she]2826-mama must not go round by [London]24-london , ” cried [Marianne]90-marianne , in the same hurried manner . “[2826-mama] [I]0-i shall never see [her]2826-mama , if [she]2826-mama goes by [London]24-london . ” [Elinor]89-elinor perceived with alarm that [she]90-marianne was not quite [herself]90-marianne , and , while attempting to soothe [her]90-marianne , eagerly felt [her]90-marianne pulse . It was lower and quicker than ever ! and [Marianne]90-marianne , still talking wildly of [mama]2826-mama , [her]90-marianne alarm increased so rapidly , as to determine [her]90-marianne on sending instantly for [Mr. Harris]223-mr. harris , and despatching [a messenger to [Barton]6-barton park for [[her]90-marianne mother]332-her mother]4327-a messenger to barton for her mother . To consult with [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon on the best means of effecting the latter , was a thought which immediately followed the resolution of its performance ; and as soon [she]90-marianne had rung up [the maid]4329-the maid to take [her]90-marianne place by [[her]90-marianne sister]336-her sister , [she]90-marianne hastened down to [the drawing - room]1150-the drawing - room , where [she]90-marianne knew [he]104-colonel brandon was generally to be found at a much later hour than the present . It was no time for hesitation . [Her]90-marianne fears and [her]90-marianne difficulties were immediately before [him]104-colonel brandon . [Her]90-marianne fears , [he]104-colonel brandon had no courage , no confidence to attempt the removal of:—he listened to [them]4332-them in silent despondence;—but [her]90-marianne difficulties were instantly obviated , for with a readiness that seemed to speak the occasion , and the service pre - arranged in [his]104-colonel brandon mind , [he]104-colonel brandon offered [himself]104-colonel brandon as [the messenger who should fetch [Mrs. Dashwood]88-mrs. dashwood]4333-the messenger who should fetch mrs. dashwood . [Elinor]89-elinor made no resistance that was not easily overcome . [She]89-elinor thanked [him]104-colonel brandon with brief , though fervent gratitude , and while [he]104-colonel brandon went to hurry off [[his]104-colonel brandon servant]995-his servant with a message to [Mr. Harris]223-mr. harris , and an order for post - horses directly , [she]89-elinor wrote a few lines to [[her]90-marianne mother]332-her mother . The comfort of [such a friend]4336-such a friend at that moment as [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon — or such a companion for [her]90-marianne mother,—how gratefully was it [felt!—a companion whose judgment would guide , whose attendance must relieve]4337-felt!—a companion whose judgment would guide , whose attendance must relieve , and whose friendship might soothe her!—as far as the shock of such a summons _ could _ be lessened to [her]90-marianne , [his]104-colonel brandon presence , [his]104-colonel brandon manners , [his]104-colonel brandon assistance , would lessen it . _ [He]104-colonel brandon _ , meanwhile , whatever [he]104-colonel brandon might feel , acted with all the firmness of a collected mind , made every necessary arrangement with the utmost despatch , and calculated with exactness the time in which [she]90-marianne might look for [his]104-colonel brandon return . Not a moment was lost in delay of any kind . [The horses]4338-the horses arrived , even before [they]4338-the horses were expected , and [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon only pressing [her]89-elinor hand with a look of solemnity , and a few words spoken too low to reach [her]89-elinor ear , hurried into [the carriage]1118-the carriage . It was then about twelve o’clock , and [she]89-elinor returned to [[[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister ’s apartment]4341-her sister ’s apartment to wait for the arrival of [the apothecary]4311-the apothecary , and to watch by [her]89-elinor the rest of the night . It was a night of almost equal suffering to both . Hour after hour passed away in sleepless pain and delirium on [Marianne]90-marianne ’s side , and in the most cruel anxiety on [[Elinor]89-elinor ’s]4343-elinor ’s , before [Mr. Harris]223-mr. harris appeared . [Her]89-elinor apprehensions once raised , paid by [their]4338-the horses excess for all [her]89-elinor former security ; and [the servant who sat up with [her]89-elinor , for [she]89-elinor would not allow [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings to be called , only tortured [her]89-elinor more , by hints of what [[her]89-elinor mistress]4345-her mistress had always thought]4344-the servant who sat up with her , for she would not allow mrs. jennings to be called , only tortured her more , by hints of what her mistress had always thought . [Marianne]90-marianne ’s ideas were still , at intervals , fixed incoherently on [[her]90-marianne mother]332-her mother , and whenever [she]90-marianne mentioned [her]90-marianne name , it gave a pang to the heart of poor [Elinor]89-elinor , who , reproaching [herself]89-elinor for having trifled with so many days of illness , and wretched for some immediate relief , fancied that all relief might soon be in vain , that every thing had been delayed too long , and pictured to [herself]89-elinor [[her]89-elinor suffering mother]4347-her suffering mother arriving too late to see [this darling child]4348-this darling child , or to see [her]89-elinor rational . [She]89-elinor was on the point of sending again for [Mr. Harris]223-mr. harris , or if _ [he]223-mr. harris _ could not come , for some other advice , when [the former]392-the former — but not till after five o’clock — arrived . [His]223-mr. harris opinion , however , made some little amends for [his]223-mr. harris delay , for though acknowledging a very unexpected and unpleasant alteration in [[his]223-mr. harris patient]4284-his patient , [he]223-mr. harris would not allow the danger to be material , and talked of the relief which a fresh mode of treatment must procure , with a confidence which , in a lesser degree , was communicated to [Elinor]89-elinor . [He]223-mr. harris promised to call again in the course of three or four hours , and left both [the patient]4302-the patient and [[her]4302-the patient anxious attendant]4352-her anxious attendant more composed than [he]223-mr. harris had found [them]4284-his patient . With strong concern , and with many reproaches for not being called to [their]4284-his patient aid , did [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings hear in the morning of what had passed . [Her]89-elinor former apprehensions , now with greater reason restored , left [her]89-elinor no doubt of the event ; and though trying to speak comfort to [Elinor]89-elinor , [her]89-elinor conviction of [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister ’s danger would not allow [her]89-elinor to offer the comfort of hope . [Her]89-elinor heart was really grieved . The rapid decay , the early death of [a girl so young]4354-a girl so young , so lovely as [Marianne]90-marianne , must have struck [a less interested person]4355-a less interested person with concern . On [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s compassion [she]89-elinor had other claims . [She]4302-the patient had been for three months [[her]4302-the patient companion]1256-her companion , was still under [her]4302-the patient care , and [she]4302-the patient was known to have been greatly injured , and long unhappy . The distress of [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister too , particularly a favourite , was before [her;—and]4358-her;—and as for [[their]4359-their mother]274-their mother , when [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings considered that [Marianne]90-marianne might probably be to _ [her]103-mrs. jennings _ what [Charlotte]127-charlotte was to [herself]127-charlotte , [her]103-mrs. jennings sympathy in _ [her]103-mrs. jennings _ sufferings was very sincere . [Mr. Harris]223-mr. harris was punctual in [his]223-mr. harris second visit;—but [he]223-mr. harris came to be disappointed in [his]223-mr. harris hopes of what the last would produce . [His]223-mr. harris medicines had failed;—the fever was unabated ; and [Marianne]90-marianne only more quiet — not more [herself]90-marianne — remained in a heavy stupor . [Elinor]89-elinor , catching all , and more than all , [his]223-mr. harris fears in a moment , proposed to call in further advice . But [he]223-mr. harris judged it unnecessary : [he]223-mr. harris had still something more to try , some more fresh application , of whose success [he]223-mr. harris was as confident as the last , and [his]223-mr. harris visit concluded with encouraging assurances which reached the ear , but could not enter the heart of [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood . [She]103-mrs. jennings was calm , except when [she]103-mrs. jennings thought of [[her]103-mrs. jennings mother]332-her mother ; but [she]103-mrs. jennings was almost hopeless ; and in this state [she]103-mrs. jennings continued till noon , scarcely stirring from [[her]103-mrs. jennings sister]336-her sister ’s bed , [her]103-mrs. jennings thoughts wandering from one image of grief , [one suffering friend]4363-one suffering friend to another , and [her]103-mrs. jennings spirits oppressed to the utmost by the conversation of [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , [who scrupled not to attribute the severity and danger of this attack]4364-who scrupled not to attribute the severity and danger of this attack to the many weeks of previous indisposition which [Marianne]90-marianne ’s disappointment had brought on . [Elinor]89-elinor felt all the reasonableness of the idea , and it gave fresh misery to [her]89-elinor reflections . About noon , however , [she]103-mrs. jennings began — but with a caution — a dread of disappointment which for some time kept [her]103-mrs. jennings silent , even to [[her]103-mrs. jennings friend]1021-her friend — to fancy , to hope [she]103-mrs. jennings could perceive a slight amendment in [[her]103-mrs. jennings sister]336-her sister ’s pulse;—she waited , watched , and examined it again and again;—and at last , with an agitation more difficult to bury under exterior calmness , than all [her]103-mrs. jennings foregoing distress , ventured to communicate [her]103-mrs. jennings hopes . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , though forced , on examination , to acknowledge a temporary revival , tried to keep [[her]103-mrs. jennings young friend]1556-her young friend from indulging a thought of its continuance;—and [Elinor]89-elinor , conning over every injunction of distrust , told [herself]89-elinor likewise not to hope . But it was too late . [Hope]225-hope had already entered ; and feeling all [its]225-hope anxious flutter , [she]89-elinor bent over [[her]103-mrs. jennings sister]336-her sister to watch — [she]89-elinor hardly knew for what . Half an hour passed away , and the favourable symptom yet blessed [her]89-elinor . [Others]2961-others even arose to confirm it . [Her]89-elinor breath , [her]89-elinor skin , [her]89-elinor lips , all flattered [Elinor]89-elinor with signs of amendment ; and [Marianne]90-marianne fixed [her]90-marianne eyes on [her]90-marianne with a rational , though languid , gaze . Anxiety and hope now oppressed [her]89-elinor in equal degrees , and left [her]89-elinor no moment of tranquillity till the arrival of [Mr. Harris]223-mr. harris at four o’clock;—when [his]223-mr. harris assurances , [his]223-mr. harris felicitations on a recovery in [[her]103-mrs. jennings sister]336-her sister even surpassing [his]223-mr. harris expectation , gave [her]89-elinor confidence , comfort , and tears of joy . [Marianne]90-marianne was in every respect materially better , and [he]223-mr. harris declared [her]90-marianne entirely out of danger . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings , perhaps satisfied with the partial justification of [her]89-elinor forebodings which had been found in [their]4371-their late alarm , allowed [herself]89-elinor to trust in [his]223-mr. harris judgment , and admitted , with unfeigned joy , and soon with unequivocal cheerfulness , the probability of an entire recovery . [Elinor]89-elinor could not be cheerful . [Her]89-elinor joy was of a different kind , and led to any thing rather than to gaiety . [Marianne]90-marianne restored to life , health , [friends]3231-friends , and to [[her]90-marianne doting mother]4373-her doting mother , was an idea to fill [her]89-elinor heart with sensations of exquisite comfort , and expand it in fervent gratitude;—but it led to no outward demonstrations of joy , no words , no smiles . All within [Elinor]89-elinor ’s breast was satisfaction , silent and strong . [She]103-mrs. jennings continued by the side of [[her]103-mrs. jennings sister]336-her sister , with little intermission the whole afternoon , calming every fear , satisfying every inquiry of [her]89-elinor enfeebled spirits , supplying every succour , and watching almost every look and every breath . The possibility of a relapse would of course , in some moments , occur to remind [her]103-mrs. jennings of what anxiety was — but when [she]103-mrs. jennings saw , on [her]103-mrs. jennings frequent and minute examination , that every symptom of recovery continued , and saw [Marianne]90-marianne at six o’clock sink into a quiet , steady , and to all appearance comfortable , sleep , [she]103-mrs. jennings silenced every doubt . The time was now drawing on , when [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon might be expected back . At ten o’clock , [she]103-mrs. jennings trusted , or at least not much later [[her]103-mrs. jennings mother]332-her mother would be relieved from the dreadful suspense in which [she]103-mrs. jennings must now be travelling towards [them]4376-them . [The Colonel]664-the colonel , too!—perhaps scarcely less an object of pity!—Oh!—how slow was the progress of time which yet kept [them]4376-them in ignorance ! At seven o’clock , leaving [Marianne]90-marianne still sweetly asleep , [she]103-mrs. jennings joined [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings in [the drawing - room]1150-the drawing - room to tea . Of breakfast [she]103-mrs. jennings had been kept by [her]103-mrs. jennings fears , and of dinner by [their]4376-them sudden reverse , from eating much;—and the present refreshment , therefore , with such feelings of content as [she]103-mrs. jennings brought to it , was particularly welcome . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings would have persuaded [her]103-mrs. jennings , at its conclusion , to take some rest before [[her]103-mrs. jennings mother]332-her mother ’s arrival , and allow _ [her]103-mrs. jennings _ to take [her]103-mrs. jennings place by [Marianne]90-marianne ; but [Elinor]89-elinor had no sense of fatigue , no capability of sleep at that moment about [her]89-elinor , and [she]89-elinor was not to be kept away from [[her]103-mrs. jennings sister]336-her sister an unnecessary instant . [Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings therefore attending [her]89-elinor up [stairs]933-stairs into [the sick chamber]4382-the sick chamber , to satisfy [herself]103-mrs. jennings that all continued right , left [her]89-elinor there again to [her]103-mrs. jennings charge and [her]103-mrs. jennings thoughts , and retired to [[her]89-elinor own room]1394-her own room to write letters and sleep . The night was cold and stormy . The wind roared round [the house]318-the house , and the rain beat against the windows ; but [Elinor]89-elinor , all happiness within , regarded it not . [Marianne]90-marianne slept through every blast ; and [the travellers]4385-the travellers — [they]4385-the travellers had a rich reward in store , for every present inconvenience . The clock struck eight . Had it been ten , [Elinor]89-elinor would have been convinced that at that moment [she]89-elinor heard [a carriage]3157-a carriage driving up to [the house]318-the house ; and so strong was the persuasion that [she]89-elinor _ did _ , in spite of the _ almost _ impossibility of [their]4388-their being already come , that [she]89-elinor moved into [the adjoining dressing - closet]4389-the adjoining dressing - closet and opened a window shutter , to be satisfied of the truth . [She]89-elinor instantly saw that [her]89-elinor ears had not deceived [her]89-elinor . The flaring lamps of [a carriage]3157-a carriage were immediately in view . By their uncertain light [she]89-elinor thought [she]89-elinor could discern it to be drawn by four horses ; and this , while it told the excess of [[her]89-elinor poor mother]4391-her poor mother ’s alarm , gave some explanation to such unexpected rapidity . Never in [her]89-elinor life had [Elinor]89-elinor found it so difficult to be calm , as at that moment . The knowledge of what [[her]89-elinor mother]332-her mother must be feeling as the carriage stopt at the door — of [her]89-elinor doubt — [her]89-elinor dread — perhaps [her]89-elinor despair!—and of what _ [she]89-elinor _ had to tell!—with such knowledge it was impossible to be calm . All that remained to be done was to be speedy ; and , therefore staying only till [she]89-elinor could leave [[Mrs. Jennings]103-mrs. jennings ’s maid]4393-mrs. jennings ’s maid with [[her]89-elinor sister]336-her sister , [she]89-elinor hurried down [stairs]933-stairs . The bustle in [the vestibule]4396-the vestibule , as [she]89-elinor passed along [an inner lobby]4397-an inner lobby , assured [her]89-elinor that [they]4398-they were already in [the house]318-the house . [She]89-elinor rushed to [the drawing - room,—she]4400-the drawing - room,—she entered it,—and saw only [Willoughby]107-willoughby . CHAPTER XLIV . [Elinor]89-elinor , starting back with a look of horror at the sight of [him]107-willoughby , obeyed the first impulse of [her]89-elinor heart in turning instantly to quit [the room]2842-the room , and [her]89-elinor hand was already on the lock , when its action was suspended by [his]107-willoughby hastily advancing , and saying , in a voice rather of command than supplication , “[84-miss dashwood] [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood , for half an hour — for ten minutes — [I]0-i entreat [you]0-i to stay . ” “[0-i] No , [sir]2095-sir , ” [she]0-i replied with firmness , “[2095-sir] [I]0-i shall _ not _ stay . [Your]2095-sir business can not be with _ [me]0-i _ . [The servants]538-the servants , [I]0-i suppose , forgot to tell [you]2095-sir that [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer was not in [the house]318-the house . ” “[538-the servants] Had [they]538-the servants told [me]0-i , ” [he]2095-sir cried with vehemence , “[538-the servants] that [Mr. Palmer]129-mr. palmer and all [his]129-mr. palmer relations were at the devil , it would not have turned [me]0-i from the door . [My]0-i business is with [you]0-i , and only [you]0-i . ” “[0-i] With [me!”—in]4402-me!”—in the utmost amazement—“well[0-i] , [sir,—be]2368-sir,—be quick — and if [you]0-i can — less violent . ” “[2368-sir,—be] Sit down , and [I]0-i will be both . ” [She]0-i hesitated ; [she]0-i knew not what to do . The possibility of [Colonel Brandon]104-colonel brandon ’s arriving and finding [her]0-i [there]354-there , came across [her]0-i . But [she]0-i had promised to hear [him]2095-sir , and [her]0-i curiosity no less than [her]0-i honor was engaged . After a moment ’s recollection , therefore , concluding that prudence required dispatch , and that [her]0-i acquiescence would best promote it , [she]0-i walked silently towards the table , and sat down . [He]2095-sir took the opposite chair , and for half a minute not a word was said by [either]4404-either . “[0-i] Pray be quick , sir,”—said [Elinor]89-elinor , impatiently;—“I[0-i] have no time to spare . ” [He]2095-sir was sitting in an attitude of deep meditation , and seemed not to hear [her]0-i . “[2815-your sister] [[Your]0-i sister]2815-your sister , ” said [he]2095-sir , with abruptness , a moment afterwards—“is[2815-your sister] out of danger . [I]0-i heard it from [the servant]818-the servant . [God]154-god be praised!—But is it true ? is it really true ? ” [Elinor]89-elinor would not speak . [He]2095-sir repeated the inquiry with yet greater eagerness . “[818-the servant] For [God]154-god ’s sake tell [me]0-i , is [she]2815-your sister out of danger , or is [she]2815-your sister not ? ” “[2815-your sister] [We]2371-we hope [she]2815-your sister is . ” [He]2095-sir rose up , and walked across [the room]2842-the room . “[2815-your sister] Had [I]0-i known as much half an hour ago;—but since [I]0-i _ am _ here , ” speaking with a forced vivacity as [he]2095-sir returned to [his]2095-sir seat,—“what[2815-your sister] does it signify ? For once , [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood — it will be the last time , perhaps — let [us]2371-we be cheerful together . [I]0-i am in a fine mood for gaiety . Tell [me]0-i honestly ” a deeper glow overspreading [his]2095-sir cheeks , “[84-miss dashwood] do [you]84-miss dashwood think [me]0-i most [a knave]2372-a knave or [a fool]2373-a fool ? ” [Elinor]89-elinor looked at [him]2095-sir with greater astonishment than ever . [She]89-elinor began to think that [he]2095-sir must be in liquor;—the strangeness of such a visit , and of such manners , seemed no otherwise intelligible ; and with this impression [she]0-i immediately rose , saying , “[84-miss dashwood] [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby , [I]0-i advise [you]107-willoughby at present to return to [Combe]135-combe . [I]0-i am not at leisure to remain with [you]107-willoughby longer . Whatever [your]107-willoughby business may be with [me]0-i , it will be better recollected and explained to - morrow . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i understand [you]84-miss dashwood , ” [he]2095-sir replied , with an expressive smile , and a voice perfectly calm ; “[84-miss dashwood] yes , [I]0-i am very drunk . A pint of porter with [my]0-i cold beef at [Marlborough]74-marlborough was enough to over - set [me]0-i . ” “[84-miss dashwood] At Marlborough!”—cried [Elinor]89-elinor , more and more at a loss to understand what [he]2095-sir would be at . “[84-miss dashwood] Yes,—I left [London]24-london this morning at eight o’clock , and the only ten minutes [I]0-i have spent out of [my]0-i chaise since that time procured [me]0-i a nuncheon at [Marlborough]74-marlborough . ” The steadiness of [his]2095-sir manner , and the intelligence of [his]2095-sir eye as [he]2095-sir spoke , convincing [Elinor]89-elinor , that whatever other unpardonable folly might bring [him]2095-sir to [Cleveland]32-cleveland , [he]2095-sir was not brought [there]354-there by intoxication , [she]0-i said , after a moment ’s recollection , “[107-willoughby] [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby , [you]107-willoughby _ ought _ to feel , and [I]0-i certainly _ do _ , that after what has passed , [your]107-willoughby coming [here]2861-here in this manner , and forcing [yourself]107-willoughby upon [my]0-i notice , requires a very particular excuse . What is it , that [you]107-willoughby mean by it ? ” “[107-willoughby] [I]0-i mean , ” said [he]107-willoughby , with serious energy , “[107-willoughby] if [I]0-i can , to make [you]0-i hate [me]0-i one degree less than [you]0-i do _ now _ . [I]0-i mean to offer some kind of explanation , some kind of apology , for the past ; to open [my]0-i whole heart to [you]0-i , and by convincing [you]0-i , that though [I]0-i have been always [a blockhead]2375-a blockhead , [I]0-i have not been always [a rascal]2081-a rascal , to obtain something like forgiveness from [Ma]226-ma — from [[your]0-i sister]2815-your sister . ” “[226-ma] Is this the real reason of [your]107-willoughby coming ? ” “[107-willoughby] Upon [my]0-i soul it is,”—was [his]107-willoughby answer , with a warmth which brought all the former Willoughby to [her]0-i remembrance , and in spite of [herself]0-i made [her]0-i think [him]107-willoughby sincere . “[107-willoughby] If that is all , [you]107-willoughby may be satisfied already ; for [Marianne]90-marianne _ does _ , [she]90-marianne has _ long _ forgiven [you]107-willoughby . ” “[90-marianne] Has [she]90-marianne ? ” [he]107-willoughby cried , in the same eager tone . “[90-marianne] Then [she]90-marianne has forgiven [me]0-i before [she]90-marianne ought to have done it . But [she]90-marianne shall forgive [me]0-i again , and on more reasonable grounds . _ Now _ will [you]107-willoughby listen to [me]0-i ? ” [Elinor]89-elinor bowed [her]89-elinor assent . “[107-willoughby] [I]0-i do not know , ” said [he]107-willoughby , after a pause of expectation on [her]89-elinor side , and thoughtfulness on [his]107-willoughby own , “[107-willoughby] how _ [you]107-willoughby _ may have accounted for [my]0-i behaviour to [[your]107-willoughby sister]2815-your sister , or what diabolical motive [you]107-willoughby may have imputed to [me]0-i . Perhaps [you]107-willoughby will hardly think the better of [me,—it]2379-me,—it is worth the trial however , and [you]107-willoughby shall hear every thing . When [I]0-i first became intimate in [[your]107-willoughby family]3146-your family , [I]0-i had no other intention , no other view in the acquaintance than to pass [my]0-i time pleasantly while [I]0-i was obliged to remain in [Devonshire]5-devonshire , more pleasantly than [I]0-i had ever done before . [[Your]107-willoughby sister]2815-your sister ’s lovely person and interesting manners could not but please [me]0-i ; and [her]2815-your sister behaviour to [me]0-i almost from the first , was of a kind — it is astonishing , when [I]0-i reflect on what it was , and what _ [she]2815-your sister _ was , that [my]0-i heart should have been so insensible ! But at first [I]0-i must confess , [my]0-i vanity only was elevated by it . Careless of [her]2815-your sister happiness , thinking only of [my]0-i own amusement , giving way to feelings which [I]0-i had always been too much in the habit of indulging , [I]0-i endeavoured , by every means in [my]0-i power , to make [myself]0-i pleasing to [her]2815-your sister , without any design of returning [her]2815-your sister affection . ” [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood , at this point , turning [her]84-miss dashwood eyes on [him]107-willoughby with the most angry contempt , stopped [him]107-willoughby , by saying , “[107-willoughby] It is hardly worth while , [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby , for [you]107-willoughby to relate , or for [me]0-i to listen any longer . Such a beginning as this can not be followed by any thing . Do not let [me]0-i be pained by hearing any thing more on the subject . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i insist on [you]0-i hearing the whole of it , ” [he]107-willoughby replied , “[0-i] [My]0-i fortune was never large , and [I]0-i had always been expensive , always in the habit of associating with [people of better income]2382-people of better income than [myself]0-i . Every year since [my]0-i coming of age , or even before , [I]0-i believe , had added to [my]0-i debts ; and though the death of [[my]0-i old cousin]2383-my old cousin , [Mrs. Smith]120-mrs. smith , was to set [me]0-i free ; yet that event being uncertain , and possibly far distant , it had been for some time [my]0-i intention to re - establish [my]0-i circumstances by marrying [a woman of fortune]2384-a woman of fortune . To attach [myself]0-i to [[your]0-i sister]2815-your sister , therefore , was not a thing to be thought of ; and with a meanness , selfishness , cruelty , which no indignant , no contemptuous look , even of [yours]0-i , [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood , can ever reprobate too [much,—I]0-i was acting in this manner , trying to engage [her]2815-your sister regard , without a thought of returning it . But one thing may be said for [me]0-i : even in that horrid state of selfish vanity , [I]0-i did not know the extent of the injury [I]0-i meditated , because [I]0-i did not _ then [_]2386-_ know what it was to love . But have [I]0-i ever known it ? Well may it be doubted ; for , had [I]0-i really loved , could [I]0-i have sacrificed [my]0-i feelings to vanity , to avarice ? or , what is more , could [I]0-i have sacrificed [hers]2815-your sister ? But [I]0-i have done it . To avoid a comparative poverty , which [her]2815-your sister affection and [[her]2815-your sister society]3519-her society would have deprived of all its horrors , [I]0-i have , by raising [myself]0-i to affluence , lost every thing that could make it a blessing . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i did then , ” said [Elinor]89-elinor , a little softened , “[0-i] believe [yourself]0-i at one time attached to [her]2815-your sister ? ” “[0-i] To have resisted such attractions , to have withstood such tenderness ! Is there [a man on earth who could have done it]2388-a man on earth who could have done it ? Yes , [I]0-i found [myself]0-i , by insensible degrees , sincerely fond of [her]2815-your sister ; and the happiest hours of [my]0-i life were what [I]0-i spent with [her]2815-your sister when [I]0-i felt [my]0-i intentions were strictly honourable , and [my]0-i feelings blameless . Even _ then _ , however , when fully determined on paying [my]0-i addresses to [her]2815-your sister , [I]0-i allowed [myself]0-i most improperly to put off , from day to day , the moment of doing it , from an unwillingness to enter into an engagement while [my]0-i circumstances were so greatly embarrassed . [I]0-i will not reason here — nor will [I]0-i stop for _ [you]2389-you _ to expatiate on the absurdity , and the worse than absurdity , of scrupling to engage [my]0-i faith where [my]0-i honour was already bound . The event has proved , that [I]0-i was [a cunning fool]2390-a cunning fool , providing with great circumspection for a possible opportunity of making [myself]0-i contemptible and wretched for ever . At last , however , [my]0-i resolution was taken , and [I]0-i had determined , as soon as [I]0-i could engage [her]2815-your sister alone , to justify the attentions [I]0-i had so invariably paid [her]2815-your sister , and openly assure [her]2815-your sister of an affection which [I]0-i had already taken such pains to display . But in the interim — in the interim of the very few hours that were to pass , before [I]0-i could have an opportunity of speaking with [her]2815-your sister in private — a circumstance occurred — an unlucky circumstance , to ruin all [my]0-i resolution , and with it all [my]0-i comfort . A discovery took place,”—here [he]2815-your sister hesitated and looked down . “[120-mrs. smith] [Mrs. Smith]120-mrs. smith had somehow or other been informed , [I]0-i imagine by [some distant relation , whose interest it was]2391-some distant relation , whose interest it was to deprive [me]0-i of [her]120-mrs. smith favour , of an affair , a connection — but [I]0-i need not explain [myself]0-i farther , ” [he]2815-your sister added , looking at [her]2815-your sister with an heightened colour and an enquiring eye,—“your[2815-your sister] particular intimacy — [you]2815-your sister have probably heard the whole story long ago . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i have , ” returned [Elinor]89-elinor , colouring likewise , and hardening [her]89-elinor heart anew against any compassion for [him]2815-your sister , “[0-i] [I]0-i have heard it all . And how [you]2815-your sister will explain away any part of [your]2815-your sister guilt in that dreadful business , [I]0-i confess is beyond [my]0-i comprehension . ” “[0-i] Remember , ” cried [Willoughby]107-willoughby , “[0-i] from whom [you]2815-your sister received the account . Could it be an impartial one ? [I]0-i acknowledge that [her]120-mrs. smith situation and [her]120-mrs. smith character ought to have been respected by [me]0-i . [I]0-i do not mean to justify [myself]0-i , but at the same time can not leave [you]2815-your sister to suppose that [I]0-i have nothing to urge — that because [she]120-mrs. smith was injured [she]120-mrs. smith was irreproachable , and because _ [I]0-i _ was [a libertine]2392-a libertine , _ [she]120-mrs. smith _ must be [a saint]4169-a saint . If the violence of [her]120-mrs. smith passions , the weakness of [her]120-mrs. smith understanding — [I]0-i do not mean , however , to defend [myself]0-i . [Her]120-mrs. smith affection for [me]0-i deserved better treatment , and [I]0-i often , with great self - reproach , recall the tenderness which , for a very short time , had the power of creating any return . [I]0-i wish — [I]0-i heartily wish it had never been . But [I]0-i have injured more than [herself]120-mrs. smith ; and [I]0-i have injured one , whose affection for [me]0-i ( may [I]0-i say it ? ) was scarcely less warm than [hers]120-mrs. smith ; and whose mind — Oh ! how infinitely superior ! ” “[2394-your] [Your]2394-your indifference , however , towards [that unfortunate girl]2395-that unfortunate girl — [I]0-i must say it , unpleasant to [me]0-i as the discussion of such a subject may well be — [your]2394-your indifference is no apology for [your]2394-your cruel neglect of [her]2395-that unfortunate girl . Do not think [yourself]2394-your excused by any weakness , any natural defect of understanding on [her]2395-that unfortunate girl side , in the wanton cruelty so evident on [yours]2394-your . [You]2394-your must have known , that while [you]2394-your were enjoying [yourself]2394-your in [Devonshire]5-devonshire pursuing fresh schemes , always gay , always happy , [she]2395-that unfortunate girl was reduced to the extremest indigence . ” “[2395-that unfortunate girl] But , upon [my]0-i soul , [I]0-i did _ not _ know it , ” [he]2095-sir warmly replied ; “[0-i] [I]0-i did not recollect that [I]0-i had omitted to give [her]2395-that unfortunate girl [my]0-i direction ; and common sense might have told [her]2395-that unfortunate girl how to find it out . ” “[2395-that unfortunate girl] Well , [sir]2095-sir , and what said [Mrs. Smith]120-mrs. smith ? ” “[120-mrs. smith] [She]2395-that unfortunate girl taxed [me]0-i with the offence at once , and [my]0-i confusion may be guessed . The purity of [her]2395-that unfortunate girl life , the formality of [her]2395-that unfortunate girl notions , [her]2395-that unfortunate girl ignorance of [the world]2778-the world — every thing was against [me]0-i . The matter itself [I]0-i could not deny , and vain was every endeavour to soften it . [She]2395-that unfortunate girl was previously disposed , [I]0-i believe , to doubt the morality of [my]0-i conduct in general , and was moreover discontented with the very little attention , the very little portion of [my]0-i time that [I]0-i had bestowed on [her]2395-that unfortunate girl , in [my]0-i present visit . In short , it ended in a total breach . By one measure [I]0-i might have saved [myself]0-i . In the height of [her]2395-that unfortunate girl morality , [good woman]2398-good woman ! [she]2395-that unfortunate girl offered to forgive the past , if [I]0-i would marry [Eliza]150-eliza . That could not be — and [I]0-i was formally dismissed from [her]2395-that unfortunate girl favour and [[her]2395-that unfortunate girl house]2805-her house . The night following this affair — [I]0-i was to go the next morning — was spent by [me]0-i in deliberating on what [my]0-i future conduct should be . The struggle was great — but it ended too soon . [My]0-i affection for [Marianne]90-marianne , [my]0-i thorough conviction of [her]90-marianne attachment to [me]0-i — it was all insufficient to outweigh that dread of poverty , or get the better of those false ideas of the necessity of riches , which [I]0-i was naturally inclined to feel , and expensive society had increased . [I]0-i had reason to believe [myself]0-i secure of [[my]0-i present wife]2400-my present wife , if [I]0-i chose to address [her]90-marianne , and [I]0-i persuaded [myself]0-i to think that nothing else in common prudence remained for [me]0-i to do . A heavy scene however awaited [me]0-i , before [I]0-i could leave [Devonshire;—I]75-devonshire;—i was engaged to dine with [you]2401-you on that very day ; some apology was therefore necessary for [my]0-i breaking this engagement . But whether [I]0-i should write this apology , or deliver it in person , was a point of long debate . To see [Marianne]90-marianne , [I]0-i felt , would be dreadful , and [I]0-i even doubted whether [I]0-i could see [her]90-marianne again , and keep to [my]0-i resolution . In that point , however , [I]0-i undervalued [my]0-i own magnanimity , as the event declared ; for [I]0-i went , [I]0-i saw [her]90-marianne , and saw [her]90-marianne miserable , and left [her]90-marianne miserable — and left [her]90-marianne hoping never to see [her]90-marianne again . ” “[0-i] Why did [you]0-i call , [Mr. Willoughby]107-willoughby ? ” said [Elinor]89-elinor , reproachfully ; “[0-i] a note would have answered every purpose . Why was it necessary to call ? ” “[0-i] It was necessary to [my]0-i own pride . [I]0-i could not bear to leave [the country]612-the country in a manner that might lead [you]0-i , or [the rest of [the neighbourhood]356-the neighbourhood]2403-the rest of the neighbourhood , to suspect any part of what had really passed between [Mrs. Smith]120-mrs. smith and [myself]0-i — and [I]0-i resolved therefore on calling at [the cottage]507-the cottage , in [my]0-i way to [Honiton]21-honiton . The sight of [[your]0-i dear sister]2406-your dear sister , however , was really dreadful ; and , to heighten the matter , [I]0-i found [her]90-marianne alone . [You]0-i were all gone [I]0-i do not know where . [I]0-i had left [her]90-marianne only the evening before , so fully , so firmly resolved within [my]0-i self on doing right ! A few hours were to have engaged [her]90-marianne to [me]0-i for ever ; and [I]0-i remember how happy , how gay were [my]0-i spirits , as [I]0-i walked from [the cottage]507-the cottage to [Allenham]12-allenham , satisfied with [myself]0-i , delighted with every body ! But in this , [our]2408-our last interview of friendship , [I]0-i approached [her]90-marianne with a sense of guilt that almost took from [me]0-i the power of dissembling . [Her]90-marianne sorrow , [her]90-marianne disappointment , [her]90-marianne deep regret , when [I]0-i told [her]90-marianne that [I]0-i was obliged to leave [Devonshire]5-devonshire so immediately — [I]0-i never shall forget it — united too with such reliance , such confidence in me!—Oh , [God!—what a hard - hearted rascal]2409-god!—what a hard - hearted rascal [I]0-i was ! ” [They]4407-they were both silent for a few moments . [Elinor]89-elinor first spoke . “[0-i] Did [you]0-i tell [her]90-marianne that [you]0-i should soon return ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do not know what [I]0-i told [her]90-marianne , ” [he]4408-he replied , impatiently ; “[0-i] less than was due to the past , beyond a doubt , and in all likelihood much more than was justified by the future . [I]0-i can not think of it.—It wo n’t do.—Then came [[your]2410-your dear mother]2411-your dear mother to torture [me]0-i farther , with all [her]90-marianne kindness and confidence . Thank Heaven ! it _ did _ torture [me]0-i . [I]0-i was miserable . [Miss Dashwood]84-miss dashwood , [you]2410-your can not have an idea of the comfort it gives [me]0-i to look back on [my]0-i own misery . [I]0-i owe such a grudge to [myself]0-i for the stupid , rascally folly of [my]0-i own heart , that all [my]0-i past sufferings under it are only triumph and exultation to [me]0-i now . Well , [I]0-i went , left all that [I]0-i loved , and went to those to whom , at best , [I]0-i was only indifferent . [My]0-i journey to [town]2984-town — travelling with [my]0-i own horses , and therefore so tediously — [no creature to speak to]2413-no creature to speak to — [my]0-i own reflections so cheerful — when [I]0-i looked forward every thing so inviting!—when [I]0-i looked back at [Barton]6-barton park , the picture so soothing!—oh , it was a blessed journey ! ” [He]2095-sir stopped . “[2095-sir] Well , [sir]2095-sir , ” said [Elinor]89-elinor , who , though pitying [him]2095-sir , grew impatient for [his]2095-sir departure , “[2095-sir] and this is all ? ” “[2095-sir] All!—no:—have [you]2095-sir forgot what passed in [town]2984-town ? That infamous letter ? Did [she]2416-she show it [you]2095-sir ? ” “[2416-she] Yes , [I]0-i saw every note that passed . ” “[2416-she] When the first of [hers]2416-she reached [me]0-i ( as it immediately did , for [I]0-i was in [town]2984-town the whole time , ) what [I]0-i felt is — in the common phrase , not to be expressed ; in a more simple one — perhaps too simple to raise any emotion — [my]0-i feelings were very , very painful.—Every line , every word was — in the hackneyed metaphor which [[their]2418-their dear writer]2419-their dear writer , were [she]2416-she here , would forbid — a dagger to [my]0-i heart . To know that [Marianne]90-marianne was in [town]2984-town was — in the same language — a thunderbolt.—Thunderbolts and daggers!—what a reproof would [she]2416-she have given [me!—her]2421-me!—her taste , [her]2416-she opinions — [I]0-i believe they are better known to [me]0-i than [my]0-i own,—and [I]0-i am sure [they]2422-they are dearer . ” [Elinor]89-elinor ’s heart , which had undergone many changes in the course of this extraordinary conversation , was now softened again;—yet [she]89-elinor felt it [her]89-elinor duty to check such ideas in [[her]89-elinor companion]1256-her companion as the last . “[0-i] This is not right , [Mr. Willoughby.—Remember]227-mr. willoughby.—remember that [you]227-mr. willoughby.—remember are married . Relate only what in [your]227-mr. willoughby.—remember conscience [you]227-mr. willoughby.—remember think necessary for [me]0-i to hear . ” “[90-marianne] [Marianne]90-marianne ’s note , by assuring [me]0-i that [I]0-i was still as dear to [her]90-marianne as in former days,—that in spite of the many , many weeks [we]2423-we had been separated , [she]90-marianne was as constant in [her]90-marianne own feelings , and as full of faith in the constancy of [mine]0-i as ever,—awakened all [my]0-i remorse . [I]0-i say awakened , because time and [London]24-london , business and dissipation , had in some measure quieted it , and [I]0-i had been growing [a fine hardened villain]2424-a fine hardened villain , fancying [myself]0-i indifferent to [her]90-marianne , and chusing to fancy that [she]90-marianne too must have become indifferent to [me]0-i ; talking to [myself]0-i of [our]2423-we past attachment as a mere idle , trifling business , shrugging up [my]0-i shoulders in proof of its being so , and silencing every reproach , overcoming every scruple , by secretly saying now and then , ‘ [I]0-i shall be heartily glad to hear [she]90-marianne is well married . ’ But this note made [me]0-i know [myself]0-i better . [I]0-i felt that [she]90-marianne was infinitely dearer to [me]0-i than [any other woman in [the world]2778-the world]2425-any other woman in the world , and that [I]0-i was using [her]90-marianne infamously . But every thing was then just settled between [Miss Grey]162-miss grey and [me]0-i . To retreat was impossible . All that [I]0-i had to do , was to avoid [you]2427-you both . [I]0-i sent no answer to [Marianne]90-marianne , intending by that to preserve [myself]0-i from [her]90-marianne farther notice ; and for some time [I]0-i was even determined not to call in [Berkeley Street;—but]76-berkeley street;—but at last , judging it wiser to affect the air of [a cool , common acquaintance]2428-a cool , common acquaintance than anything else , [I]0-i watched [you]2427-you all safely out of [the house]318-the house one morning , and left [my]0-i name . ” “[0-i] Watched [us]2430-us out of [the house]318-the house ! ” “[0-i] Even so . [You]2427-you would be surprised to hear how often [I]0-i watched [you]2427-you , how often [I]0-i was on the point of falling in with [you]2427-you . [I]0-i have entered many [a shop]2432-a shop to avoid [your]2427-you sight , as [the carriage]1118-the carriage drove by . Lodging as [I]0-i did in [Bond Street]39-bond street , there was hardly a day in which [I]0-i did not catch a glimpse of one or other of [you]2427-you ; and nothing but the most constant watchfulness on [my]0-i side , a most invariably prevailing desire to keep out of [your]2427-you sight , could have separated [us]2430-us so long . [I]0-i avoided [the Middletons]102-the middletons as much as possible , as well as [everybody else who was likely to prove [an acquaintance in common]2435-an acquaintance in common]2434-everybody else who was likely to prove an acquaintance in common .
